text: Very disappointing experience. The service was great,but the food was not the quality we expected. I orderded a Ceaser Salad that was a joke. My husband orderded a lettuce wedge salad that had a dressing that was extremely spicy hot and he normally likes spicy food. There was no indication on the menu that it would be spicy. Also we had steak tartare that was also too spicy. My main dish was chicken that was floating in a butter sauce that was also spicy. The sauce on the broccoli was poor.
This is my favorite restaurant of all time! I have never had a dinner this amazing before. They have the best filet mignon you will ever eat, well worth the cost!

Extremely tasty food, recommended.

Ambiance and elegant environment will set the stage for a lovely evening out.

I ordered venison; I believe there's a good chance deer will at sometime take out my car (and me?) on the highway - so I'm getting my payback against deer on the front end.

The service was what one should expect from the elite restaurants of the world.  A head waiter, who's been doing it all his life, supported by a contingent very qualified sous servers and bussers.

If you plan on splurging on a top-rate meal in Las Vegas, you won't be disappointed with Prime.

Dark dark dark restaurant. The food was good - the bread is freaking amazing, the mashed potatoes and asparagus are pretty standard, the Mac and cheese is all cheese, and the butternut squash soup is great.

Average at best and that's being generous.  Had the cold seafood appetizer.  It was OK but nothing special.  Flemings offering of the the same appetizer was superior.   My wife and I both ordered the Chilean sea bass.  It was bland and a little undercooked.  Nothing terrible but it could have been cooked a few minutes longer.  No big deal except my waiter did not come by once during the main course to ask us how our dinner was. He didn't even ask us how our meal was when asking us about desert.   Ordered the side dish of mac and cheese and it was so salty my eyes watered.

This place is truly amazing! My girlfriend and I went to Prime to celebrate my birthday and everything was nothing short of perfect! 
1.) The table was awesome! - They sat us right by the side of the Bellagio lake so we can watch the water show. 
2.) Service was impeccable! 
3.) Food was simply amazing! - I had the rib eye and my girlfriend had the fillet mignon with the fois gras. They were awesome! I would also recommend the green peas with mint - delicious! 
4.) The lava cake is irresistible! 

My only disappointment was that I ate too much for brunch at the Bellagio Buffet and I didn't save enough room to try the appetizer! I recommend Prime to anyone who loves steaks. I will definitely pay them another visit when I return to Vegas!

Ok I chose due to reviews-and husbands birthday. We've been to mastros in la, craft steak in Vegas and many other steakhouses. Prime is absolutely elegant, great service, great drinks, nice menu.  We started out at the bar so we could get a table with a view. We ordered a lemon drop very good.  Got a table overlooking fountains super. The restaurant really is elegant. 

They came out with some delicious bread, my favorite the pretzel bread.  We ordered each the filet for main, and truffle mashed and steamed asparagus. The potatoes were heaven so tasty. The steak although was nice size ordered it medium, both husband and I thought it was bland and not as tender as we expected for 62 dollars. It came with dipping sauces that were good but again the steak to us was bland. That's why the 3 stars. Overall I'd return but try a different steak. I really wanted to love this place it's just soo many steakhouses and we've had a better tasting steak.

I have procrastinated on writing a review for Prime, but I now find myself fantasizing about their macaroni and cheese and realize that it's time to revisit this.  

The beet salad I started with was good, but not particularly special when compared to the rest of my meal.  In hindsight I wish I would have saved this room for dessert. 

My filet was prepared perfectly and served with three sauces - this may just be the best steak I have ever eaten, and was only made more perfect by the sides we had.  The mac and cheese, gratin dauphinois, and grilled corn were all wonderful, and three months later I still get cravings for their mac and cheese.   

Our being quite focused on the conversation at hand, service was kept low-key yet flawless.  The restaurant was fairly quiet while we were there, and has quite a lovely ambiance.

Glad I wasn't looking forward to eating here, or else I would have been really disappointed. The decor, ambiance, and service was of course amazing (as in all the restaurants in the Bellagio), but the food (mainly the steak) was not on par. I had the ribeye wagyu steak and it was the worst I have ever had. It was strange, some of my pieces would be really dry and then other pieces would be overwhelmingly marbleized and fatty. I couldn't get a happy medium piece. The soy based sauce that came with it helped it a lot.

Other than that, the stone crab appetizer I had was very good and fresh. I didn't like the seared foie gras (I prefer the smooth spreadable kind, this was the lumpy really livery looking kind). I had a taste of the butternut squash soup which was excellent. The mushroom side was perfect, but the truffle mashed potatoes was lacking in truffle. For dessert I had the poached pear and the coconut souffle. The poached pear dessert seemed a little bland to me. The souffle was really good and it was nice to have a coconut variation of it. I don't think I will find my way here again (sticking with CUT next time).

www.anitaeat.com
The best steakhouse in town. Good staff. Great menu. Combines the best of an old school steakhouse feel with current steakhouse features. Great wine selection.

Alright, we are not hard to please. The service was way below average. Little things like forgetting water a couple of times, unfriendly interactions, etc. Had a hair in my tomato and burrata salad. Not a big deal just figured they would give me a new, hairless one... Nope the guy pondered at the table for a couple seconds debating if the hair was there or not. After deciding he took the salad back to the kitchen and came back with... An apology? Not a new one?? He asked if I wanted a different salad but if not a complementary dessert would be provided. Nice gesture.... Yeah except I already asked for dessert for my boyfriends birthday with a candle and writing on the plate when I made the reservation...that was forgotten too... The two stars are for the bone-in ribeye and the onion soup. Really bummed we spent a pretty penny and it left more to be desired. Took a doggy bag home for the ribeye and the only thing left in the box was the bone? Not coming back.

As far as Las Vegas goes this was good food, expensive, but good. If it were in Chicago I would have never came back to this restaurant again because it's way overpriced. But it's pretty and since most of the food I had in Vegas was god awful Prime was worth every penny I paid for it. Which for an appetizer, water, 2 cokes, 2 entrees and 2 sides was around $180 I believe.

This place is pricey, but I knew what I was in for and it's worth every penny!  In fact...it was a little cheaper than I expected!  The food was amazing; the waiter was wonderful and not pushy.  He made food recommendations and even gave us travel tips!  The restaurant  is beautiful and if you can, get a window with a view of the fountains!  I will definitely go back the next time I am in Vegas!

I dined here last night and it has to be one of the most amazing restaurants I have been to yet.  I was seated in a cozy corner that still over looked Lake Bellagio.  The staff were exceptional. I enjoyed a traditional steak and lobster meal but Prime takes it to another level! I was too stuffed to have desert but I here it is amazing. Dining here is a must.

Reported to be one of the top steak houses on the Strip.  Frankly, I was disappointed.   The quality of the steak was just Ok.  For $60+ dollars it needs to be better.  The side orders might be big enough for Two people each.   The service is good. They get 5 stars there. But the food is not worth what they charge.

This was one of the first celebrity chef steak houses in Las Vegas.
Jean-George Vongerichten created an environment that is distinctly unsteak house in decor. I have to give him credit for having the guts to avoid the testosterone atmospherics of the traditional steak house.

A great steak is a must at any restaurant that specializes in red meat.  Prime does not disappoint in that regard. What I like about Prime is that all the other dishes, appetizers, sides, desserts are all super.

Started w/ chilled seafood platter which will gladly be customized upon your request. We dropped the clams and muscles which increased the shrimp, stone crab, king crab, oysters and lobster. I had the dry aged 18 oz bone-in fillet which was cooked perfectly however was not hot when served (I don't risk spit service thus do not send anything back unless it is inedible ). For sides we ordered creamed spinach, truffle mashed potatoes, and onion rings. Desert was creme brulle and coffee which was awesome. Service was incredible, waiter was exceptional. 4 stars instead of 5 because of steak temperature.

Wow. Where is the 6-star button when you need it?

My girlfriend and I came here for our 1 year anniversary dinner. I made the reservation and then called a couple days ahead of time to request a window seat (we wanted to watch the Bellagio fountains while we ate). The man said he would try but he couldn't promise anything, so I wasn't expecting anything. But they had our window table for two all ready when we showed up!

If you are looking for a fantastic steak, amazing service and an impressive wine list, this is it. Everyone from the hostess to the wait staff to the bus boys were attentive and polite and made us feel very welcome. As a couple in their young 20s on a budget, we appreciated how welcoming they were. It was one of the most expensive meals I have ever payed for (and we picked one of the the lesser expensive "budget" bottles on the wine list) so we were looking to be pampered. The employees at Prime did not disappoint. The food was even better! I had the Boston lettuce salad, 18oz. bone-in ribeye. She had the caesar salad and the 8oz. filet mignon. We shared the garlic mashed potatoes and chile broccoli. I am not a huge fan of buttery mashed potatoes but this bowl was pretty incredible. For dessert we shared a special anniversary lava cake and vanilla ice cream. They spelled out "Happy Anniversary" on the plate in chocolate syrup, and it was on the house!

I wish I could remember the name of our waiter. I want to say it started with a J (Joseph, maybe?). Anyway, he's probably mid-40s, and I do remember that his nametag says he's from Costa Mesa, CA. Leave him a good tip because he deserves it.

Can't wait to go back.

One FYI (not really a complaint) -- they prefer the men to wear jackets, but they don't have a coat check.

I had reservations for 7PM.  I was promised a table overlooking the fountains.  My party and I arrived a little before 7 and the place was packed, the bar was overflowing with people.  I checked in with the hostess and was told it'll be a moment while they set up our table.  Ten minutes later she tells me that there are no tables available overlooking the fountains.  I said it fine, just seat us anywhere.  Finally, thirty minutes later we were finally seated at some cramped up table next to the restrooms.  How lovely. 

Service was slow.  Food was whatever.  My brother ordered the special surf and turf.  Lobster was way rubbery and dry.  His steak was alright.  I ordered the special kobe beef plate.  It had 3 oz of each rib eye, filet mignon, and boneless sirloin.  A total of 9 oz of kobe for $240.  It was the most expensive plate I ever ordered.  And sadly I wasn't really that impressed by the food.  I had ordered them medium and the filet was beyond well done.  Sigh.  I had nothing to say about our sides and starters.  The wine we ordered was the only good thing about the meal.  I usually am a big fan of dessert but I was so thrown off by the food that I had to skip dessert.  

For our party of four, our bill ran out to a little over $600.  Thank God it was comped by the hotel (thanks to my mom's love of the slot machines), otherwise I would have had to make a run for it. I suggest dining at Michael Mina or Picasso when at the Bellagio.  Prime Steakhouse is for old folks with limited taste and too much time and too much money on their hands.  I feel a little bad saying that, especially since it seems like so many other people on Yelp enjoyed this place.

Been here a good handful of time.  Rib eye never disappoints.  With the miso butter sauce you can't go wrong.  I do feel that the service is lacking.  They are so busy I feel the wait staff doesn't care cause they know the customers will be there.  Unfortunate.  I don't expect anything more than having my drink refilled and check on once or twice throughout the meal.  If I can't even get that...it is really a problem.

One of the best meals I have ever had.  

We were seated in the middle table at the window facing the Bellagio fountain for my birthday. For our appetizer we had the Ribbons of Tuna. OH MY GOD it was amazing. 

For the main course, we had the filet mignon with sides of spinach and truffle mashed potatoes. The filet came with the following sauces: peppercorn, soy-rice wine and bearnaise, all of which were carefully explained to us. 

Fantastic wine selection. I did not tell the waiter I was there for my birthday until the signed credit card receipt was returned. He immediately said "please...DO NOT LEAVE YET" and within a few short minutes I received a complimentary chocolate cake that was delicious. Extremely professional wait staff, great teamwork. 

Minor note: there is a photographer walking around taking photos. She was kind of cold and somewhat rude when we said we did not want out picture taken. However, we did understand that was her job. Also, it was kind of awkward but also VERY entertaining to hear all the coaching she gave the people at the next table: "Give that pretty lady a kiss!" FLASH "You are one lucky guy!" FLASH

I took my fiance here to celebrate the two of us getting engaged and was looking for a nice, romantic dinner.  Great atmosphere and view of the fountains!  Unfortunately, it took three tries to get my bone-in filet right. I asked for medium and got medium well-well. I sent it back and got my cut steak cooked longer until fully well. They obviously weren't listening to what I said. They re-did it again and got it right.  My fiance's peppercorn NY Strip was overcooked on the first try (ordered med. rare and received med. plus), as well.  It was sent back and replaced with a rare to medium rare steak (not perfect but acceptable).  Truffle mashed and crab mashed were great!  Steak had good flavor but I'm not sure if it was $70 quality, though. I've definitely had better steaks for half the price.  The ambiance and front row patio seating for the fountains made up for alot.

Service was below par for the level that you expect in a restaurant of this caliber.  Our waiter "forgot" about us several times.  He basically disappered from our table, only to be seen serving couples that arrived after us.  Like I mentioned before, the service was sub-par.

Great location with romantic views of the fountains but that can only take a restaurant so far.  The food and service must be kept at the same level.  The photographer that comes around and takes pictures, which will be available for purchase, did a great job.  She took some great shots and provided a great memory of a special dinner / trip.  The pictures were resonably priced, as well.

Next time, we'll try one of the many other high-end steakhouses in Vegas.

Loved the view and everyone is really nice.
I had the bone-in ribeye and it was very good. The Prime Car drink was awesome
The service and food were outstanding. Best view in town if you get a table by the fountain! Highly recommend!

This is my first Yelp so forgive me if I seem to ramble!

I decided to book a reservation at the Prime Steakhouse after reading the Yelp reviews (thanks guys). However my boyfriend and I left disappointed. 

I had made reservations over a MONTH in advance asking for a seat with a view of the Bellagio fountain show. I informed them that this was our first time to the Bellagio and we wanted to make it special. I was told that there were no guarantees but my request will be placed. 

We arrived promptly to be seated only to be told that the wait time for a window seat was 1 hour and 1/2 to two hours. Needless to say I was disappointed, especially after making reservations so far in advance. 

We were then seated at a larger table and then waited to be serviced. One of the servers handed us a wine menu (this menu is about 35 pages!). I drink wine but I am not a wine connoisseur (and either is my bf) and didn't know what wine would go with what. While I poured over the wine menu, seemingly overwhelmed our main waiter showed up; and boy was he something. He had this total, I-hate-my-job-this-is-my-last-shift type of attitude (you all know what I'm talking about). He didn't introduce himself he just asked if we wanted wine. I felt like we were being pushed to purchase a glass (or two) of wine and I said no, I'll go with another drink for right now. He didn't seem to like that and left the wine menu just in case we changed our minds. 

We both ordered the 8oz filet mignon, truffle mashed potatoes and mushrooms, and for an appetizer the bacon wrapped shrimp and that's when the server asked us AGAIN if we were going to get some wine. Look, I know that restaurants make the bulk of their revenue off of alcohol; I understand that, however my boyfriend and I did not appreciate being "prodded" to buy wine. What was more shocking to me (especially in such an upscale place) was that he never suggested a wine pairing to go with the meal we were having.

I also noticed that two of the servers were having a argument right near me. I couldn't help overhearing their snickering and was surprised that they would be having it out near customers. 

I will say that the filet mignon and truffle mashed potatoes were amazing (if you go you must try the truffle potatoes!!). So I will give them three stars. But the service overshadowed the food. I feel that if we are going to pay around 200 bucks for food then we should be treated accordingly.

Sadly, I'm not sure if we would go there again. If you do decide to go I hope that your experience was better than ours.

Location, location, location!  The famous Bellagio fountain is right in front :) 
but not to recommend sitting outside when it is windy...all the water from fountain will spray you! I ordered Crab cake, prime onion soup, bone stake and mushed potato.  
The stake is OK, nothing special. Mushed potato(creamy/smooth) was good though.

I want to eat here everyday! We had a great dining experience and enjoyed our meals. I had the ahi tuna and the boyfriend had the kobe steak. They have a nice wine list and I though the service was great!

This is the one of the best steakhouse choices in Las Vegas.  Nine at Palms has better ambiance - if you are more into people watching and scene than the food I would choose there.  The steak here is top quality - I shared the porterhouse, sampled someone else's kobe (which was amazing), and, luckily, did not have to pick up the check!  Definitely a more low key, quiet atmosphere........I sort of felt like going into a food coma after eating vs. hitting the clubs to party all night (this is Vegas, after all).  One highlight was the patio outside for dessert - you get a close up view of the water fountain show at Bellagio, which is a different experience than seeing it from the street.  This was fun - and would also be a cool first date thing to impress.

Holy Chihuahuas!

I've been in Filet Mignon heaven. 

The service?  Impeccable.
The sides? Everything was wonderful. Tender. Fresh. 
The bathroom?  Clean, fresh smelling and no water drops on the mirror!

We had Filet Mignon, squash soup, asparagus, potatoes, lovely fresh salad.  

To celebrate our special occasion we were given a chocolate rich cake concoction with vanilla ice cream.  We also ordered the creme brulee - nice and creamy,  no sandy texture or plastic aftertaste -- crisp on top - not soggy!  

It was pricey  - but that was expected  -- and it was worth every penny!  

Here is what gave the push to 5 stars from me.  Hardly anyone knows how to make a filet well done without giving  a disclaimer, then burning it to crisp, or keeping it pink/red inside.  It is a true and skillfull chef who is able to cook a filet well done without having to excuse it by adding a disclaimer or begging the patrons to have it be butterflied.

Will go there again. And again. And again.

* I just want to add that I was not allowed to each chocolate cake (I'm a dog, after all ) but those with me did - and they enjoyed!*

We'll they do it well here at prime, the restaurant is nice and if your lucky enough to get a view of the fountains even better.  Service was awesome, but i expect it to be at a place like this.  I started with the chilled seafood platter and it did not disappoint, my main was the dry bone-in ribeye  with mac and cheese side.  The steak was perfect, i found the mac and cheese a little bit on the bitter side, I'm used to a more sweet taste for my mac and cheese.  Overall, great place for a great dinner, expect great service and to be full by the end of your meal.

5 stars all the way. Beautiful elegant. Loved the experience. Food cooked perfectly.  Waiter was friendly, when I asked few extras question about dairy free desserts and a few more about the menu selections he answered every question. He did have to ask about the dairy free ice cream for the chocolate cake... 
 Knowledgeable friendly staff.. they also have a photographer going table to table asking if you want pictures. Not once was the conversation my dinner mate and I were having interrupted. At one point a bus boy or someone that hadn't approched us the entire time came to the table and gave me more water. The waiter was a little confused about it too and asked how our meal was and if we needed anything. Everything was great and look forward to going back.

Incredible restaurant...always excellent service - always incredible fare.  We have had dinner at Prime on every visit to Las Vegas in the last 10 years.  Prime is always top-notch, and our most recent trip for my husband's 40th birthday was no exception.  They went to great lengths to accomodate my husband's Celiac disease, even going so far as to prepare and bake gluten-free bread for the table as well as gluten free sauces and desserts.  We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the fountains immensely from that vantage. The steaks were fantastic - the sides to die for .... everything was absolutely top-notch.  Can't wait to visit again.

I got back from a fantastic meal at Prime two nights ago.

A few girlfriends and I were looking to try one of the fine dining restaurants in Vegas, and with so many to choose from, we decided on Prime given its location next to the Bellagio fountains and rave reviews on Yelp.

We started our evening at 8:30 and were a bit befuddled that we had to wait until 8:40 to be seated, despite having reservations and arriving a few minutes early.

This was a minor snag, as the decor and ambiance of Prime quickly trumped that.  Prime is located quite literally next to the Bellagio fountains. Even though we were not seated by the window, our party of four still had a great view. The dining room was dimly lit and featured gold accent moldings and beautiful sweeping windows.  This set the tone for a rich meal, complete with a large variety of wines, good menu variety, and more.

Having waited tables myself, I quickly asked our waiter for recommendations. As a general rule, I've always done this and it has served me WELL. Waiters want you to go home pleased (their tips depend on it), and they know what is popular.  Although they may not say outright if something is bad, they WILL tell you what is very good or perhaps make an alternate suggestion.  Our server began by saying everything was delicious (as you could expect in this type of restaurant), but did point out the menu highlights. Of the list he told us: the truffle mashed potato, the filet mignon steak, one of the steaks served w/ bone, scallop entree, and sole.

We were in the mood for a meal with some punch, so we started with the bacon wrapped shrimp (incredible! One of the highlights of this meal!), and crab cakes to share.

The bacon wrapped shrimp themselves were large and the order came with four shrimp. The bacon and green sauce it came with were lovely; the bacon itself was so hearty and smoky that I didn't think it was possible to have such great, varying flavors in a simple slice of bacon. The shrimp was tender.  Right on.

The crab cake was also excellent and was served atop a type of cabbage slaw and avocado.  Not overly "crabby", but great taste and a good size cake to share with maybe one other person.

We were having a hard time picking out wines, being as none in our group could be called a wine expert by any means.  Many a night of Franzia and Barefoot gulping means my pallet was no match for the variety and quality of wines Prime had to offer. Our waiter did a great being patient and recommending some of the cheaper California wines.  In the end, we went with a delicious California Pinot Noir bottle for $75.

Finally, our meal.  Three of us did the Peppercorn New York Steak, which came complete with caramelized red onion and three dipping sauces. The fourth in our party went with the Caramelized Scallops.  We completed this with the acclaimed truffle mashed potatoes (aaahhh-mazing!), creamed spinach, and asparagus.  The steaks were definitely on the spicy side given the peppercorn, but were not overbearing. Our wine, along with the sweetness of the onion and muted, sweeter dipping sauces made the amount of spice just right.  Out of the three sauces, the soy-rice wine stood out as the clear favorite, just as our waiter predicted.  The steak was fresh, cooked to a medium rare perfection, and delicious.  The peppercorn rub was mouth watering and spiced just right.

Amazingly, the scallop dish was the most memorable of the entrees. It was served in an amazing caramelized sauce that was so good I found myself mooching sauce to dip my bread in. (Sorry, Shayna.  I've done worse.) ;P This might be my next dish here.

The truffle mashed potatoes were also delicious, as was the creamed spinach.  Of the two sides, however, the truffle mash was definitely more appetizing. The potatoes were creamy, and literally melted in your mouth.  My mouth is watering just remembering them.

Since we were celebrating a birthday, our server was kind enough to bring out a delicious chocolate cake free of charge as we waited for our check.   Here, service was a bit slow, and we had to ask a busser for assistance on more than one occasion in order to make an 11:00 show. We quickly realized this was because our waiter was preparing the cake, but I also noticed he was assigned seating on the opposite side of the dining room. Having served myself, I know how bad it sucks to be serving a fine 3 course meal with tables in opposite directions, or simply having too many. This is a potential area for improvement, however, our waiter was very kind and patient with us as we took forever to order, so perhaps we also had a part in this.  I will admit, we took forever to order.

Overall, this was an exquisite meal and made for a wonderful night out for our friends. Be prepared to drop some cash here-with wine, sides, and appetizers, our meal came out to $125 a person, not including gratuity. I highly recommend Prime for any special occasion or a night on the town.  Well done.

Prime is an excellent choice for flavorful steaks like the dry aged bone in rib eye and their special for the night - bone in filet mignon. We had reservations at 8:30 and arrived 10 minutes early so we had a glass a wine at the bar as we waited for our table. The bartender seemed like he was having a bad night or maybe he was just a jerk, thank goodness we only waited a few minutes until our hostess advised us that our table was ready. Besides the wonderful steaks that were a bit charred to perfection and juicy pink on the inside, we really enjoyed the famous truffled mashed potatoes. We ordered a salad with enoki mushrooms to start off with and it was large enough to share. They have an extensive wine menu and the dim lighting gives the restaurant more of a romantic feel. I enjoyed my meal very much but may stick with Craftsteak and Cut in the future since they have much better service.

Foods are very good! The steak is melted in the mouth ! Love the mashed potato ! The waiter are good, they pay attentions to you as long as you're done your plate, they will come take it away. But one waiter is kind of look mean, others are very nice! Remember to make a reservation before you go

This is one of my favorite restaurants to visit while in Las Vegas.  It was so good that my husband and I went back another night for another delicious dinner.  I started my dinner off both nights with the Burrata and tomatoes which was absolutely delicious.  The porterhouse melted in your mouth.  The second night wasn't as good as the first night but was still a very good.  Our salads came out so quickly that we hardly had time to enjoy the bread basket, which by the way has some really good pretzel bread and a delicious raisin bread too.   I guess it was a slow night and the kitchen wasn't busy.  I'm not complaining since the food is so good here.   The waiters and bus boys are very efficient.  I'm not a big wine enthusiasts but my husband is and it is hard to find a bottle of wine for a reasonable price. 
They are there you just have to look hard for them.
Save room for desserts since they are yummy!

Great ambiance and great food.

I've been there twice now and enjoyed their food and service both times.  I recommend their steaks and the truffled mac and cheese/mashed potatoes.

The last time I went I got the filet mignon.  Two of my friends went with the Kobe NY strip (yes, the $300 variety).  I had a piece of each of theirs and it quite literally made my $50 filet taste and feel like a piece of beef jerky.
This place is awesome! Geat food and service went here for dinner with friends good times...

Beautiful Restaurant. Horrible Experience, very rude staff. If you want to be treated poorly, then this is the place to be. After waiting for an hour to be seated, we r told you have 7 minutes to look at the menu, always feel rushed and that your business does not matter. Stick to Olives in the future, much more friendly and does not ruin your special night out.

Wow, my filet was amazing, as were the three sauces they came with. The wait staff was great (except watch out of the up-sell which seemed to occur more than my last car purchase) and the view spectacular. All in all a wonderful experience.

Escape Vegas to an elegant tranquil and refined space in the Bellagio. If you're organised book early and request a table against the window with a view of the Fountains. Staff that understand what good old fashioned customer service is - and exceed it. The food is nothing short of exceptional. The best steak my wife and I have ever had, and we've eaten at a lot of great steak restaurants. Silky smooth truffle mash. YUM. Expensive yes, but with food, service and wine this good - you're in Vegas, so who cares??!!!

Excellent food, great ambiance and beautiful decor. Service was good. Sometimes I feel like the waiter is selling you to much but overall really good. I loved to not see people wearing sundresses and shorts to an elegant restaurant.

I've been to Prime several times, with different friends, for different occasions.  We don't stay at Bellagio, but always made the trip to Prime.  Had I been yelping when we first started going there, this would be a 5 star review.  2 times ago, 3 of us went, for my birthday, and noticed the decline in the food.  Still,the service, and having desert and coffee on the Terrace afterwards, with a front row view of the fabulous fountain show more than made up for it.  The last time (2011) when I called to make reservations, I stated that we would like coffee on the Terrace, after dinner.  I was told that you could now have your entire meal on the Terrace!  That was great news, except that you could not reserve a table there, but could take your chances.  Why??  I was calling 2 weeks ahead.  Ultimately, we were seated outdoors, as requested.  Our waiter, Luis, I think,  was RUDE and he and the mini waiters helping him, were slow and inefficient.  Our meals finally came, and my daughter's steak was wrong.  She ordered a medium rare, Kobe filet mignon, and was brought  a dried out, well done, New York.  The waiter was upset, and insisted that was what she had ordered.  The New York had never even been considered, and we told this idiot, when we placed our order, that we were anxious to compare the regular filet that I ordered, to the Kobe filet.  He said the kitchen would be "mad" if we sent it back.  We sent it back anyway. Pretty brave on our parts!  It took 1/2 hour to bring what she had actually ordered.  In the meantime, my meal, and our sides, were getting cold, so we ate from my plate.  Our bill was over $400, for 2 people.  I didn't want to raise hell, and spoil what was left of my daughter's birthday dinner, but did email the manger when I got home.  I gave her a detailed description of our experience.  As the manager, she should have appreciated  the polite, constructive and honest feedback.  Her email back said that she was sorry, and was looking into the matter.  She said she did not want to lose us as future guests to Prime, and would I please send my phone number so she could call and discuss the matter further.  I sent my phone number, and never heard from her, again.

Let me just say that, this is the best steakhouse in the country. We had the A5 Japanese Kobe it was out of this world. Everything about this place is just awesome. We will be back in April and I can't wait.

Keep up the good work...

Good food. All of our entrees (dry aged rib eye, seared scallops, and lamb) and sides (gratin, mac and cheese, onion rings, and sweet potatos) were great.

Service was awful! It was as if we had two waiters they just pulled offf the Strip who had never served anyone before. From the start, we had to ask for cocktails because we weren't asked if we wanted a drink. My water was never refilled the entire night! We were going to order dessert but it took them 30 min to come take our order so we just asked for the check. Then when we were trying to pay, again no attention, we were literally waving our check in the air to try and get someone's attention. 

If you can stand being ignored all night long, the food is relatively good. The 3 star rating is my average - Good rating for the food. Awful rating for the service.

We went to Prime on our first night in Vegas. We had eaten there before 2 years ago out on the patio. This time we made a reservation inside. You definitely need a reservation. We had a quaint table in a dining area near a large window so we could see some of the fountain. I started out with the Shrimp cocktail which was 4 large shrimp with cocktail sauce perfectly displayed on a bed of ice with lemon. They were delicious and a perfect appetizer. We both ordered the Caesar salad which was not only delicious but a nice sizable portion. I ordered the filet mignon which was superb and my companion got the dry aged bone in ribeye which he loved. We split the truffled mashed potatoes which were so creamy and delectable and a perfect portion to share. They did give us a nice bread basket with various bread including my favorite pretzel bread. We were too stuffed for dessert. The service was absolutely impeccable and friendly. Would definitely go back. Definitely pricey. Also, I might add there is a dress code which was not necessarily enforced.

Showed up at this nearly EMPTY restaurant shortly after six on 7/7/2016, without a reservation and was given a table in hot hot outside, not in direct viewing of the water, even though those tables were available (those tables are apparently for the "beautiful people" who had not yet arrived) practically immediately.  Was given the wine list and menu and our overbearing waiter wanted to get my wine order even before i was able to look at the menu or hear if they had any specials.  I asked if there were any wines on special as the wines on the list are over-pricey.  He said no and that i should consider wines by the glass or half bottles.  The 2012 Husic Estate Cabernet Sauvignon was listed at $65 per glass. Now, i don't know how much wine is in the glass, i suspect NOT MUCH, but since the bottle retails for less than $100 and the restaurant likely got the bottle for around $60, i'd say that was serious gouging.  Suffice it to say that the wait staff was so haughty, snooty, overbearing and money-grubbing, that we opted to JUST LEAVE and NOT get any of the overpriced items on the menus.  We went to Olives, also at Bellagio, and were taken care of by a wonderful Chris instead.

Was very disappointed with the meal at Prime - Being THE steakhouse at the Bellagio, I expected more.  The decor was pretty nice - has a nice view of the fountains, not as nice as the view from Picasso, but ok.  The filet mignon was cooked well, but the flavor was lacking especially from a steak that is supposed to be prime quality.  The sides were just ehh... the citrus glazed baby carrots ended up being large carrots cut up into little strips - not impressive.  The dungeness crabcake appetizer was also disappointing - being a little too fried and lacking in flavor - definitely not worth the price.  Also tried the diver scallops with sweet pea ravioli - the scallops were overcooked and the vinaigrette sauce was way too overpowering for the dish.  The service was also a bit lacking - not of the quality that one would expect when eating at a high end steak restaurant.  Overall, would not go back
Great food and drinks all around. The truffle here is a must try. Great selection of wines pair nice with the excellent choices of entrees. All orders where finessed to perfection.

We were staying at the Bellagio and heard good things about Prime, but overall left a little disappointed.  The food was good, but not worth the almost $300 we spent on our meal (for 2 people).   The service was decent and the restaurant was pretty, but like many Vegas restaurants, I felt like they were trying too hard to set an upscale ambiance.  I should say that I don't eat steak so I am probably not the best judge of a steakhouse, but my husband ordered the filet and thought that it was just ok.  The wine list was great, but again, very expensive

I ordered:
The shrimp cocktail: 4 shrimp, really good cocktail sauce, but it cost $22
Boston lettuce salad: really interesting combination of herbs, avocado, and lettuce with a tasty dressing, probably the best thing I tasted
Slow baked salmon: Really good piece of salmon and cooked perfectly
Creamed spinach: classic and good
Mashed potatoes: very buttery and addictive

This is one of the best steakhouses we have been to in sometime. Sat outside on terrace which overlooks Bellagio fountains, food was fantastic, and service was even better.

Highly recommend if you are in Vegas looking for a great dining experience.

This place is completely worth the 5 stars.  I booked Prime for my husband's 30th birthday and it was definitely the right choice.  We were able to sit on the terrace after waiting a few extra minutes in the bar which is worth the wait as the terrace is so near the fountains you're practically in them.  We had the soup and sushi starter, the aged ribeye and scallops for main with a side of mac n cheese and we're too full to manage dessert.  The food was great, particularly my husband's steak which he said was the best he'd ever tasted (and believe me he's had plenty to compare).  The steak came with a range of sauces which was a really nice touch.  The only thing that could have made the meal better was that the staff hadn't read the note on my booking to recognise my husband's birthday.  Three other guests on the terrace were celebrating birthdays and the restaurant made a point of acknowledging this but didn't with us, a bit disappointing but certainly not enough to damage the experience!

So,if you are thinking of eating here but haven't gone to any one of the other acclaimed steakhouses in Las Vegas, I'd highly recommend you go elsewhere.  This place was a disappointment from beginning to end for us.

First thing you need to know is that if you look at the menu, the only place the word prime shows up is in the title.  The steaks are not prime.  And they definitely do not taste like prime steaks.  They may have prime steaks on the menu, but unless it specifically says it is, it ain't.  

Secondly, the service here sucks.  No sugar coating here.  I don't want people to make the same mistake I made and eat here when there is definitely much better in this town.  Go elsewhere for good service, or at least average service.

Well, hopefully I've dissuaded you.  If not, or if you just like reading about poor dinners like watching a car accident, read on.  

We ordered the crabcakes.  And this is where the problems started.  We dutifully split it in half as usual, I began eating and noted it was good, then I bit into a crab shell.  Wow, that hasn't happened to me at any decent restaurant and I've had my share of crabcakes.  Disappointed but willing to overlook this, I bit into another piece of shell.  I'm paying a pretty decent sum for a crabcake that isn't remarkable in any way, and I'm biting into shells?  Unbelievable.

Next up, the salads.  Except we didn't order salads.  They were for the table next to us.  With some horror I realized that our steaks and another table's salads were on the sam f-ing cart, but they served their salad first!  I don't think they do that kind of thing at a Black Angus, much less a restaurant that claims to be a top steakhouse.  Horrified but willing to ignore the two insults already suffered, we got our steaks and sides after a bit of a pause.  

My steak was ok.  18 oz bone-in ribeye.  The sauces weren't special but I'm not much of a sauce guy.  However, if you are going to pride yourself on your sauces, it should generate some interest from me.  Sides were decent.  Truffled mash potatoes were creamy, creamed spinach was what I expected.  I didn't much enjoy the bread though.  I got a pretzel roll that was extremely salty.  

And then the final insult.  We finished our steaks, and waited a long time for our waiter to come back, but we didn't see him again.  The second cleaned up and brought us out the dessert menu, but that took quite some time.  At this point I hadn't seen our waiter in so long I assumed he actually left.  I thought that was incredibly rude to do that without turning the table over to someone.  Why are we ordering dessert still?  I wanted to give this place a chance to right the wrongs.  After ordering the crepe suzette (17 layers!), we waited a long time for our dessert.  A real long time.  And after finishing what I thought was a good dessert, we waited a long time for our check.  At this point our waiter returned!  We hadn't seen him since we ordered.  Apparently he had been taking care of another table.  He didn't tell us this, which would have alleviated a lot of the insult I felt by this time.  He cleared our dessert and we wanted no more of this restaurant.  It took a full 15 minutes for him to bring us our checks.  By this point we were angry.  We got here at about 6:45, and it was now 9:15.  So we spent an equal amount of time being seated, ordering and eating as we did waiting on our dessert and paying our check.  I won't be back here when there is so much better in town.

One of the best meals I had on the strip. Unbelievable service (thanks Russell!). The mac and cheese is a must. Great wine suggestion and the steaks was out of this world. Beautiful setting and we weren't even outside. 

If you're looking for a high end steakhouse with a classic setting and old school service give this place your business. Call for reservations. I found open table didn't have many options but I got in when I called.

Very elegant atmosphere, steakhouse dining at its finest with prime steak, seafood and lamb accompanied by fabulous sauces, sides and meticulously selected wines. Breathtaking view on the fountains of Bellagio from window tables. I savored a Porterhouse.

The atmosphere is top notch.  My husband and I ordered the seafood sampler appetizer. It was good. The tomato with burata cheese salad was good. We had a peppercorn New York strip. Overcooked. No flavor. The  Sauces couldn't doctor it up. A $68 steak shouldn't need sauces. The Brussels sprouts were mushy. Service was good. They offered to replace the steak but at that point - the moment was gone. Gave us a complimentary dessert but didn't make up for the disappointing meal.

I've almost finished my "tour" of Vegas' top-rated steakhouses and I'm putting Prime at #2. It's flawless. My friend's porterhouse was insanely juicy and tasty, while my lamb was similarly delicious.

The food cannot be faulted and is on a par with my current #1, CUT, but I prefer CUT because it's more laid-back: Prime is formal. If you're not wearing a jacket you might feel a little under-dressed.

Finally made it out here for dinner and loved it! It was so much fun to watch the watershow up close every fifteen minutes. (Starting at 8pm). We sat outside (8:30pm in July) and it was a bit too hot. Next time for sure we're sitting inside.

We got the gulf shrimp wrapped in bacon appetizer. It was just okay - wasn't blown away like I thought I would be after reading all the reviews. I think maybe it was a little overcooked since my shrimp wasn't as succulent as I would have thought it to be and the bacon was a tad dry.

Steaks, however, were really good. We got the filet mignon and the porterhouse. Filet was soo soft, melted in your mouth. Porterhouse was equally as amazing. I actually preferred the steak without any of the sauces. 

For sides, we got the broccoli and mashed potatoes. Both were good. Nothing too interesting about the broccoli (how exciting can broccoli really be now), but the mashed potatoes were good. I can only imagine how good the truffle mashed potatoes are...next time! 

Overall, food and scenery made for a great meal.

One of the Best Restaurants that I have ever been too.

So my girlfriend and I went to Vegas to celebrate our 2 year anniversary and I wanted to book a nice dinner with a nice view of the Bellagio Fountains. I eventually decided to make an online reservation at Prime with a request to have a table with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. 

So we get to the restaurant and noticed some available outside seating and it turned out that one of those seats outside right next to the water was ours! 

So my girlfriend had the filet mignon and I had the 18oz bone-in prime rib. We decided to share the sides which were buttered mushrooms, creamed spinach, and garlic mashed potatoes along with some red wine. Let me tell you, the meal was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. The steak was cooked perfectly and the sides accompanied the meal well. The view of the fountains was so picturesque and there were speakers that played the music of the fountain show. It was a magical night.

I think what made this night mostly memorable were the little things that made you feel like you were high-class. The host and server greeted us "Happy Anniversary". They even brought out a little lava flow cake for dessert with the words "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate syrup. They even had a professional photographer who took photos of us which we eventually bought 2 of them as souvenirs for our night.

The only thing of note is that this restaurant is not for the budget-conscious. A dinner for 2 can easily set you back a $200+ if you go all-out, but my girlfriend and I don't go out to eat at restaurants all the time and this was a special occasion so I didn't really flinch twice at the prices. We got what we paid for.

Great restaurant! Amazing steak. Highly-recommended for a romantic night! Will definitely go back again!

This place is first class all the way. If you go, be sure to make reservations and come early to make sure you score on a lake side table to watch the fountain show. It is absolutely incredible! Our Waiter was an older gentleman and was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu. We didn't get any wine, but had a couple of cocktails (cosmos) that were literally the best I've ever had (think of that perfect shaved layer of ice on top). 
Went here for Thanksgiving dinner - my brother had the turkey dinner complete with stuffing and sweet mashed potatoes. I didn't try his because mine was so good I didn't want to waste any bite of fullness on someone else's food. The older heavier watier was looking more and more attractive as I ate my beef. I actually thought as I was eating that if someone cooked for me like this on a regular basis I would do anything for them including marrying them! HOLY GOD this is GOOD FOOD!!!!!!!!! 

I had the beef from Australia - the fillet. And the sauces that went with it were out of this world! (Peppercorn, and 2 others that were creamy). 
For the appetizer, we had the chilled seafood platter - lobster, king crab claw, mussels, clams, oysters, shrimp, lump crab meat - all ready to eat! No peeling or cracking involved! It was also amazing! The total bill for the 2 of us was 300. Not bad at all for what we got. I highly recommend this place.

In Bellagion, near shops, downstairs next to Picasso. 
-Men need to wear jackets as indicated but they won't say anything if you don't. 
-Nice views of the Fountains, steaks were cooked very well as they cut up pieces as serve you. Sides were also good. Had to skip dessert cause the meal was a good size and was going to Mystere and Tao afterwards. 
-Lady comes by to take very good pics but its at a very good price for her
-Met Carolos Santana 
-Overall good experience

I made a reservation for my daughters birthday. Requested a good table and we were seated in the back of the restaurant. There were available tables by the windows. We ordered filet and sea bass. The sea bass was not good. The filet was ok, but we've had many better steaks. The gnocchi was delicious. Our service was not up to par for a restaurant with these prices.  We won't go back.

This is one of the most beautiful rooms in Las Vegas and one of my favorite restaurants, so when my best friend asked where I wanted to go for my birthday, Prime was my pick.

We requested one of the tables for two up against the windows overlooking the fountains and I was kind of surprised that the place was packed on a Wednesday night. Even the outside patio was full. Fortunately, I do have a casino host to take care of things like this.

In any case, the food and service are just superb here. Just my opinion, but once you are at a place that is using the best ingredients and knows what to do with them, the rest is just what kind of ambience you are looking for and other very subjective things. We wanted to talk and have a laid back evening without blasting music and a low douche factor.

We were served an amuse of salmon on cucumber, which was a fabulous start. I had the tomato and burrata salad, which was perfection. It's amazing that something so simple like a perfectly ripe tomato can taste so wonderful, although most of the time I'm just used to whatever passes for a tomato in CA.  My friend had the seared foie and said it was in her top 5.

For our entrees, I chose the surf and turf special- lobster tail and a filet that was at least 3 inches thick with a tablespoon of lemon spaetzle, while my friend had the peppercorn New York. Both were cooked medium rare as asked. Two plates of heaven.

The sauces are really standouts here. I could have had a glass of the soy/ rice wine. It was perfect with my lobster and the filet. 

For sides, we had fingerling potatoes, cream corn and tempura onion rings. Only the onion rings didn't hit it out of the park- they were just OK.

As you would expect, the service was friendly but professional and I really did appreciate the server mentioning the price of the specials. The surf and turf was $118 (hey, it was my birthday!), but it can be awkward in a group or business dinner if someone has to ask. I've been burned a couple of times.

For dessert, they sent out a trio of lemon tart, vanilla bean ice cream and a chocolate mini-cake. Yum!

While Prime is one of the more expensive steak houses in Las Vegas, it is certainly a great pick for a special occasion or when you just feel like treating yourself to a lovely evening.

We were staying at the Bellagio and a customer requested steak. Looking at Yelp reviews, Prime was THE place.  Wait staff was accommodating.  Filet was average - nothing special.  Truffle mash potatoes and creamed corn were about the same thin consistency.  Customer even asked which was the corn and which was the potatoes! Although I will expense this meal, I'm sure there are better meals to be had at a better price, even in Vegas.

Awesome!
I was going to dock this place 1 star for the prices but then i realized they were pretty consistent with every other steakhouse I've eaten in.  

I went with a group 7 and we unanimously decided that this steakhouse was amongst the best we've dined in-not one complaint.  My lamb chops, although not medium well as i requested, was very tender and flavorful.  The broccoli rob that accompanied the lamb was good but a bit more bitter than i was anticipating.  Fries were great.

What sets this steakhouse apart from the rest was the ambiance.  The windows of the place looked right out on to the bellagio lake; we got great views of the water show all throughout the meal...nice little touch.  

Service was outstanding; our waiter was polite, professional and attentive.

Like i said, a standard 3 course meal with drink and tip will cost well over $100pp so be prepared for that.

Bottom line-highly recommended, particularly if you're not on a budget.
The beet salad is a must have! Looking for a special meal? You will find it here. Not the usual casino fare. Fine dining at its best. Pricey but worth it!

We dined here on New Year's Day 2008 and it was a great way to kick off the new year.  This is probably one of the more elegant restaurants that you'll find in Las Vegas.  Our waiter, whose name escapes me, was from Lancaster, PA was very friendly and very helpful.  He suggested a Cable-Car martini for my wife and the drink did not disappoint.  To this day I think this is her favorite drink.  We started things off with a crab cake which was very tasty.  For dinner my wife ordered the Filet and I ordered the Porterhouse along with some mashed potatoes and some creamed spinach.  The steak was of course cooked to perfection and the accompaniment of sauces, while weren't needed for such a fine steak, certainly were also very good.

Our bill was over $200 with tip, but this was one of the most memorable meals that my wife and I have ever had.  Every bite of food was perfect and we can't wait to go back.

Best steak house in Vegas in every way. Bone-in ribeye and new york steaks were just perfectly done. I must mention their excellent and extensive wine list. A bit pricey, but absolutely worth it. We had a table by the lake and it was surprisingly spectacular.

I love steakhouses and I had high expectations for the food and service and my party and I experienced mixed results.

First the service.  It was cordial but totally lacking in enthusiasm and warmth.  The waiter was talking super fast and it felt like he couldn't get rid of our table fast enough because we didn't order some $500 bottle of wine.  Only one person drinks in our party of 5 so what can I do?  Asking for water was also annoying - Sparkling or still?  Still.  Bottled?  No, tap is delicious thank you very much.  (then look of disappointment on the waiter's face).

The beef tartar & carpaccio and the tomato mozarella appetizers were good but not amazing.  I've had equally good at other restaurants.

We all ordered steaks and the most disappointing was the filet mignon.  It was very tender but it had ZERO beef taste and it was overcooked even when I asked for medium rare.  The best was the Kansas grass-fed rib-eye.  The porterhouse was good but again, not amazing.  I've had better steaks at restaurants that are half the price of this place.  Heck, even the reserve aged steaks at Vons are better than the filet mignon here.

The dessert selection was boring.  We shared the profiteroles and a cheesecake.  Not impressed.

Also, one odd thing - the bread they serve is cold.  I prefer warm/toasted bread with my dinner.

I guess this place isn't bad if your meal is comped by the casino or if you're on an expense account.

Best steak ever!  Came with Japanese peppers that were a culinary delight - never had anything like it.  Crab mashed potatoes were good but not worth the extra money compared to regular.  

Went on a busy night with no reservation and took patio seating which had terrific views of the water.  Did get a little mist when the fountains went off but views were worth it.  

No decent wines under $100 so if you are a wine enthusiast be prepared.  Service was excellent.

The Prime Steakhouse is an elegant restaurant tucked away within the confines of the Bellagio Hotel. Unlike the other steakhouses located on the strip, the Prime is one of those classy restaurant that caters to the sophisticated diner with high expectations in service and the quality of the food. Reservations are strongly recommended and an evening in this restaurant will set you back a minimum of $250 for two people. 

Overview: I have visited at this restaurant a total of 3 times in the past several months and I was never once disappointed. The service is outstanding and they will generally try to work with the customer to provide the best possible dining experience. One of the Prime's main selling point is that they feature dry aged beef that has been aged for over 30 days for the best possible flavor. They also have a varied selection of wines to compliment your dinner. 

PROS: An enjoyable and sophisticated atmosphere, excellent staff, and quality cuts of beef. 

CONS: The restaurant has a dress code posted requiring dinner jackets for men. However, that dress code is loosely enforced. I have seen some guests come in with a dress shirt and jeans. 

Restaurant Class: Lower-Upper 

Food: (4 out of 5 stars) The steaks are well prepared and cooked to order. And the dry aged ribeye do not disappoint. Any steak you order in this restaurant will be a quality cut of beef. The side dishes were also surprisingly good. They are also large enough to be shared. The only negative thing I noticed about the steaks was that it was a bit on the salty side for my palliate. But that can be easily remedied by ordering your steak with less salt or unsalted. 

Atmosphere: (4 out of 5 stars) If you are celebrating a special occasion or just want to have a romantic dinner, this restaurant is definitely for you. The atmosphere is relaxing yet vibrant enough to keep your attention; and the mood is sophisticated, yet subtle enough to have a little fun. Lastly, you can never go wrong with a window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains. 

Cleanliness: (4.5 out of 5 stars) The entire dining room is kept virtually spotless and comfortable. The tables are cleaned frequently with fresh linens and table cloths. 

Service: (4 out of 5 stars) The staffs are all absolute professionals. They know their jobs and they know what the customer expects out of them. In fact, they are so detailed oriented that they will give the gentlemen wearing a dark suit a black linen instead of a white one. 

Restroom Facilities: (3.5 out of 5 stars) Despite this restaurant's location, it does have it's own facilities. And like the dinning room, the restrooms are kept relatively clean and well stocked. Additionally, the men's room also comes with complimentary amenities like lotion or hair cell.

The patio dining was spectacular. You are treated to a semi-private viewing of the legendary Bellagio fountain every half hour while you dine. 

The food was spectacular, albeit expensive. The filet was thick and cooked impeccably. Although it was well seasoned and stood on its own, you are provided three seperate sauces (Bernaise, peppercorn and a ginger/soy) to enhace it if you so choose.

The service was helpful and professional as expected. It was a bit of a dissapointment however to be told of an intriguing truffle (flown in that day from Australia) risotto special and then being informed 5 minutes later that it had sold out.

The patio dining is what pushed this experience over the top and made it worth the considerable expense of about $150pp with tip and drinks.

I like a good steak.  This restaurant had decent meat, but they chose to mask it quite heavily with sauces and/or crusts.  If it a quality meat, it should stand on its own.  Sauces and crusts are good, but only a small quantity.  There was just too much.
The service seemed good for the other patrons, but not for us.  We were the youngest in the restaurant, or at least the youngest looking, and that is what probably led to our lack of service.  That being said, I was dressed as nice if not better than most with a classic suit and tie.  Passing busboys were of more service than our waiter, who took our order and gave us our check.  I am a decent tipper of at least 20% for average service, so this guy judged us and spent more time with older customers.  Oh well, why dissappoint him with a generous tip.  I did, however, let the manager know that I wanted the tip money to go to the busboys because they did our waiters job.  He offered me a complimentary meal, but I declined.  Why should I have to deal with high prices AND no service.  There are other better steakhouses that I will review shortly that are head over heels better than Prime.
Filet mignon and service was excellent!!

Ordered an 80 dollar dry aged bone in rib eye and they forgot to season it! I hate sending food back and on this occasion made the mistake of doing so. The excuse was that charring 'cooked off' all the seasoning (not how charring works) rather than just admitting they forgot to season it - it's not a big deal people make mistakes. They brought me another steak and way overcorrected, this time it was completely briny.

What's worse is that they kept telling me to try the multitude of sauces they brought out, which I did try - they weren't that special. To me an expensive steak (unless it's a filet mignon or chateaubriand which don't have much flavor on their own) should stand on its own.
Very sophisticated food and service.  I highly recommend the filet and lobster.

The steak was severely under cooked. My steak was slightly more cooked than my guests so I ended cutting off cooked pieces from the edges to share with my guest because the waiter did not come to check on our food within a reasonable amount of time. 
We had wanted to do something a little nicer than the typical Ruth Chris or Morton's so we chose Prime in hopes it would be at a much higher standard.  It definitely was not! 
 I feel short changed with the whole experience, not just because it was pricey but because it did not end up being the special dining experience we though it would be. The service was poor and the waiter displayed an arrogant and condescending attitude during the service, which I found interesting coming from a waiter. 

When I made the reservation I had requested seating either by the window or in a booth/table combo. Neither one of these requests were accommodated.

 I was staying in a suite so we had requested that the under cooked steak be boxed we requested that the salmon that was ordered not to be boxed as the fish might spoil the steak and had also explained that the lobster had been entirely eaten which was clear to see . We had figured we could cook it thoroughly ourselves and have it later as a snack. When the steak was boxed it contained the waste and scraps from the lobster tail that was entirely eaten. It seemed like it was some sort of insult for requesting togo boxes. We threw the steak out. 

The cost of dinner for two was $400.00. I would definitely say Prime did not live up to expectations. 

Without sounding entirely negative the lobster was decent but not exemplary and the restaurant's decorations were beautiful and opulent.

I absolutely love it here. I come for dinner every couple months. Sitting along the windows is the absolute best. The Bellagio fountain show is directly in front and is so beautiful. Everything on the menu is so good, you won't be disappointed with anything you order. I always start with the shrimp cocktail. The horseradish is super hot and I can't get enough of it. Hits the spot that it hurts so good!! The pretzel bread is to die for, every time I want to just take a basket to go!! For my entree I get the dover sol, I'm not a red meat fan. So many sides are amazing. The mushroom, broccoli, cream corn all perfect to share. Make sure you save room because the desserts are delicious. While the service is impeccable by the entire staff, Sandy is even better. Overall if you haven't experienced a dinner at Prime don't wait any longer to go! The next special occasion book a reservation and experience a dinner you will never forget. Venture out, cheers!

Heard about this restaurant before but never tried, well on a whim my family and I made reservations and boy we had a fabulous dinner!  Things to know: this place is not cheap! Be prepared to spend a pretty penny for a fabulous meal (keep in mind this is the Vegas strip!) that said the service was superb; so for me worth the higher price point! Our waiter was extremely attentive and knowledgeable! What an awesome delight! The decor was traditional, elegant high end steakhouse design....very classy!  I would highly recommend this restaurant and can't wait to go back!!!!

The best steak we've ever had. Our party ordered the dry aged ribeye, porterhouse, and filet minon. So delicious! It is pricey, but worth every penny. Our bill came out to $340ish before tip. In addition to the steaks, we ordered the mushrooms, mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese, French onion soup and another side I just can't remember. The mac and cheese wasn't my taste, as it had gouda and Sharp cheddar, a little too strong. The French onion soup was huge and the best I've had. I would return solely for the purpose of ordering the French onion soup. Definitely ask for a table inside and by a window so that you can view the bellagio water show while eating dinner. There is an outdoor eating area, but it's not as nice as the decor indoors.

We had a weeknight dinner and the experience was wonderful.  The outdoor seating was cozy with a grand view of the fountain show.  The staff attended to our table frequently and were able to accommodate all our drink and meal requests.  We enjoyed some martinis and started off with some of the best oysters I've ever head.  I don't recall the name, but they were from New Brunswick and were amazing.  Our salad had fresh tomatoes and cheese we really enjoyed and our bone-in rib eye was cooked perfectly.  We were not rushed at all, and actually our waiter asked us in the beginning if we were in a hurry to catch a show so he could let the kitchen know.  I recommend Prime to anyone looking for a classy date night.

I was in Vegas for my birthday back in January and decided to treat myself to a nice dinner. Well my money was well spent, I ordered the Rib eye with some veggies on the side. Probably one of the best steaks I've had my entire life. No joke, so yummy and full of flavor. They brought out a nice cake ball for my bday and that was yummy too. We were seated out in the patio and even though it was a cold January rainy night we stayed warm with the heat lamps and saw the beautiful water show from our seats. Would certainly go back for another special occasion dinner or if I'm in town without my kids.

What a great romantic dinner.  Service was impeccable throughout, felt like we had 2 waiters taking care of any need from drinks to ordering. Food was delicious!  Salads are big enough to share with a blue cheese dressing that felt homemade.  My wife's filet was cooked a perfect medium rare.  She thoroughly enjoyed the 3 side sauces that come with all steaks.  I had the peppercorn steak which was awesome.  A ton of flavor and tasted like a char on the outside but warm and moist on the inside. The sides were also delicious and plentiful.  Truffle mashed is a must have while the Brussels sprouts were also good.  Great wine selection but best part was the availability of wine by the glass.  Although common at most steak houses their list had some great choices.  We had the 2008 silver oak which nice and smooth.  We were so full that dessert was not an option. However to put the cherry on top they brought out a chocolate souffl with ice cream on a beautifully prepared plate. I had forgotten that I included my wife's birthday on the reservation.  Overall this dinner was perfect.  Yes this is not a cheap meal but you definitely get your money's worth!

Excellent service and presentation. Spectacular view. Wine list mostly a rip off although there are a few pearls hidden.
Steak is mediocre and should be better from such a gorgeous high end restaurant (steaks tasted like choice not Prime in my opinion ). Not as good as last time I was here about 1 1/2 years ago.

The worst part of the meal was my steak, which for me, is a problem at a steakhouse. It was very bland and under seasoned. I should have known it would be a problem when they brought out three sauces to add to the steak. The sides were also bland and just ok. I guess i was expecting amazing but instead got ok. Won't be back for the food. The service and ambiance were much better than the food.

My wife and I dined at Prime a couple weeks ago. She had a beef filet cooked perfectly to her liking. I am a vegetarian, and they had wonderful offerings for me, including a vegetarian tasting menu. Prime not only offers a separate vegetarian menu, they also have vegan and gluten-free menus.  Do not shy away from Prime if you are a vegetarian. They have thoughtful, creative, seasonally driven selections - you will not be limited to broccoli and rice, or a salad. Think of it, if you have a group of six, or eight, chances are someone in the group will want some sort of alternate menu and Prime can take care of you. As a vegetarian, Prime is among my favorite restaurants along with with Michael Mina at the Bellagio and several of the restaurants at Wynn/Encore, including SW, which have vegan selections. Of course, atmosphere and service at Prime is exquisite. Corkage at Prime is $50 - of course, wines you bring must not be on their list. I highly recommend Prime for steak lovers and vegetarians.

Three stars because the steak was so over salted I couldn't eat it.

Beautiful, opulent decor.  Service good, not great. Waiters seemed busy, didn't check in about main course, was difficult to keep my water glass full.

Appetizers were excellent - tuna ribbons was delicious, loved the ginger/chili/soy/whatever marinade, french onion soup among the best I've had with a subtle flavor and good blend of cheese, crab salad was pretty good.

Got the dry aged bone in rib steak and the soy garlic strip steak, both cooked medium. Quality of the meat was excellent, and temperature was perfect. Soy garlic strip was a little salty (but within expectations for an Asian marinade). Rib steak was so salty I couldn't eat it. Left over more than half. First time that has ever happened to me in a steak place. 

Split the chocolate cake dessert which was excellent.

This may have just been a fluke (judging by other positive reviews), but I won't go back. For the price (300+ for two people), the meal should be perfect.

Had a great day at the tables, so my friends and I decided to hit up Prime. Wow...is all I have to say.

I highly recommend the bacon wrapped shrimp, the truffle mashed potatoes and the porterhouse. The BEST mashed potatoes I've ever had.

When they say the steak has been aged for so many days as they say what does that exactly mean? Because my husband got SICK! So maybe they are not aging their steaks in the sun? Letting them spoil a little to get more of a flavor? We went to Las Vegas for my 30th birthday and I was reading reviews of this place and I thought why not try it. I have heard both positive and negative and being in the Bellagio hotel you would think that it would be great! I had the filet, garlic potatoes and mushrooms that we both shared. And my husband had some other cut. (cant remember exactly what) But obvioulsy it wasnt too good considering that early Saturday morning he was in the bathroom and it was not pretty! Basically our entire trip was ruined from this so called wonderful steakhouse. NEVER again will I come back to this place. It obviously was food poistening. So thank you Prime Steakhouse for ruining my 30th birthday weekend. You did a great job of it.

Great ambiance, even greater food! highly recommend the peppered tuna steak! (Ask the waiter for their house "steak sauce"!). Great butternut squash and the tuna strip appetizer was awesome as well. 

Not cheap, but worth the experience.

Over priced, over wrought, over hyped, and under performing.  The food is OK but nothing to brag about.  Everything on the menu outperforms the meat.  

There are a great number of places that I would go first to fulfill my protein desires.

For an equal, if not better, view of the fountains go to Picasso!

So embarrassed and disappointed. This was our 5th time coming for the caviar and steak along with a pricey bottle of wine. My husband wanted to surprise me and we even waited until a 9pm reservation in much anticipation of the high quality food we were expecting for the very high priced food. We had to wait 20 more minutes after our reservation time so you know we were starving ! 
We ordered a delicious glass of champagne while waiting for the $195 caviar. When it came I had goosebumps and my mouth was watering , I took me first bite to find that it was borderline spoiled. It has a very very fishy taste with a stagnant water flavor. I didn't want to say anything to my Husband and embarrass him so I have him a bite. He almost spit it out. The manager Anna came to the table and said " hi I'm the manager , what's going on over here at this table ? We were like hmmm should we even bother explaining .. we did and her reply was well it's surely not spoiled and I'm sorry you don't like it. We decided to focus on the gorgeous ambiance and looked forward to our salads and porterhouse steak $130, while we drank our $300 bottle of wine. The salad arrived and I went through the first 3 bites trying to decide why my salad tasted like sour vomit. I'm sorry for that word but that's really what it tasted like. Of course I did order the wedge with blue cheese (which I order in every steakhouse ) I came to the conclusion it was spoiled blue cheese. Again I didn't want to complain to my husband so I gave him a bite. He immediately said Igggg that tastes terrible ! Then he got upset and told the very nice waiter the issue. Again the manager came and her only response was it's NOT spoiled. We said. Ok just take it away please. Then the porterhouse arrived. The very nice server sliced it for us and presented it. I was more then starved at this point. I took my first bite of the filet cut. It was good. I took my second bite , good. I took a bite of the strip side and it was nothing more than chewey and tasteless.  I tried 3 more bites. Once again I didn't want to complain. At this point I felt so bad for my Husband who was going to spend over $700 for this. So I have him a bite. He spit it out. We never said anything about this as there was no use. They did bring us a delicious dessert tray for the bad caviar experience and didn't charge for the rotten salad. 
In the end , very romantic place. Great service. Poor quality food and terrible management. We won't be back.

Service was very slow. Waited an hour for surf, turf and salmon. We almost left. Note:It was not crowded at all.

Food was ok, quality/taste did NOT match price. Ruth Chris does a better job. Hotel staff hyped the place up, don't believe their hype.

Pictures taken table side where great, the photographer was awesome, staff was nice. We won't be back, better places to eat than this. View of the fountains didn't make a difference.

I had dinner tonight at 7pm with my family(3 people)when the brunette hostess was very friendly to take us to our table . The service and food was great when we spent around $800.00 bucks with wine, caviar, Main course and dessert. Everything was perfect who came for first time at Prime. Normally we are frequently client at SW at Wynn. However, the reason I'm giving 3 stars is because after our dinner finished around 8:30pm, I asked the blonde hostess if my family and I could go to outside to take a picture and she was rude and said we couldn't. She said that if I wanted to take a picture, I should have asked before dinner. More training to care the customers....

The Tomahawk for two was just the best steak I have ever had!  Drinks are expertly mixed, they sought out the rye I wanted for my Manhattan. Service was impeccable, as you would expect for the price you are paying. But, you don't go to Prime for a bargain, you go for the quality and the experience. It has great ambiance and though you can be all dolled up, it is not stuffy or snooty in the least. 

If you've got the money to indulge (you're already at the Bellagio after all), this is a must dine at place when you're in Vegas. Can not wait to go back an eat here again.

i've been a fan of jean george restaurants for quite some time. My favs are Cafe Martinique and Dune in the Bahamas.  I've been to Prime a few times and each time I come away with a feeling that the staff really loves their job.  I usually get my usual - filet w/a lobster tail, french fries and usually whatever the waiter suggests for an appetizer.  Make sure to arrange for a reservation in advance - its a small restaurant and they sell out.  If you are staying at a suite in Bellagio - use their VIP service to try to get you a last minute reservation.  P.S. The bartenders have a terrific sense of humor.

My fianc and I ate here for dinner 3/31/15.  We were in town for the Nightclub & Bar convention and celebrating my finance's birthday.  The meal and service did not disappoint!  

Our waiter, Rob, had worked at Prime since it opened 17 years ago!  Soft-spoken, not pushy or intrusive yet he was helpful and informative, as well as super nice, Rob was a seasoned veteran in the service industry and we benefited.
