All of the additional staff assisting, bringing out wine, entrees and filling our glasses etc., were wonderful as well.

To start, I ordered the Market Tomatoes and my fianc ordered the Baby Iceberg lettuce salad.  We told Rob we would be sharing and he offered to split them for us.  We took him up on that and we were so glad we did!  Perfect portions and no scooping or reaching over the table.

For dinner, I ordered the Peppercorn New York Steak.  Seriously one of the best New York steaks I've ever had.  I highly recommend it!  It has a bit of a spicy kick to it because of the peppercorn which I loved.  My fianc had the Dry Aged Bone-In Rib-eye.  It was delicious too.  For sides we ordered the Brussels Sprouts with bacon and pears.  Not the best I've had but they were very good.  (I read another review on here that said they had potatoes in with them, unless they changed their recipe, those weren't potatoes, they were pears.)  And we got the Gratin potatoes...crispy, cheesy potato goodness.

It really was a spectacular meal with wonderful service.
Had my steak Meduim well.. the steak melted in my mouth. amazing food and also amazing service!!

I'm so torn on this place. The food - dang good...really really dang nabit good. Service - forget about it. I have to say that the manager and sommalier took care of us at the end when they realized how much of a jerk our server was but it really did leave a bitter taste in my mouth.

3 of us went to this place instead of our usual tried and true Delmonico's at the Venitian. First thing we did was assess our budget. Looking at all the numbers, we figured we could spend just about $500 on our meal. We decided to go food heavy and budget on the wine (well, for this place that meant $100 for wine). 

Our server came by and I told him that we were on a wine budget and that we only had about $100 to spend and asked for some suggestions:

me: '...can I find some good dry, full bodied reds for about $100?'
jerk: 'If you look HARD enough'

I'm all, are you for real right now? Then he starts going down the wine list (which is huge and pretty darn impressive) and picking out all the ones that are $100 just based on price. So I tell him that I read numbers really well and that what I want is a suggestion.

Then we start ordering and my friend asks if they have lobster tail for the table to share. Jerk says they have small and large sizes even though it's not on the menu and then says he'll be back with the prices. Comes back pretty quickly and says, 'the large is $168 so you guys will probably want to small one if you really want one'. My buddy is pretty pissed at this point and just based on that comment he orders the large. Jerk doesn't let it go and tries to convince my friend to order the small saying stuff like, 'it's better for you to order the small one'. At this point we are all pretty pissed, but it's been over a year since I've seen my friends so we try to brush it off.

The sommalier suggests a VERY nice silver oak for like $108 that turns out to be a really good wine so we're kicking back and enjoying our wine and the appetizers that came out super fast. The crab cakes were very good as well as the stuffed mushrooms. Everything cooked well with great flavors.

The steaks were also on the money. I'm partial to bone-in ribeyes and this one was really really good. Rare-plus is the way to go if you want to full juicy flavor of this bad boy.

I slow down after eating almost half the steak and start wondering where the lobster tail is... I wave down Jerk and and ask him when the lobster is coming and he runs off and comes back and tells me 10 minutes. So I start digging into him why it would take so long and find out the he never put in the order. What's worse, he tried to blame it on my buddy, saying that we weren't sure if we really wanted to order or not and that's when I had enough and went off on the guy. I can be an a$$ at times and this called for all my a$$ness to come out, especially since I was fueled w/ Patron and Silver Oak. I chewed him out and asked for the manager.

Manager finally comes and she apologizes and all that stuff but at that point we were seriously fed up. I mean, I went on a rampage, brought up the service, asked if they were racist, asked if they didn't serve young people, you name it, I accused it. 

The only thing that kept us from leaving was that the food was so dang good. I couldn't leave my perfectly cooked bone-in rib. It just didn't seem right. I'm sorry.

We ended up getting the lobster tail right away (delicious), ordered another side (on top of 3 others we ordered) and got 3 desserts. Molten cake - awesome, some italian cookie thingy with icecream in the middle - awesome, creme brulee - good. 

At the end I figured we completely blew our budget but the manager came by with the bill and it was far less than about 1/3 of what we should have paid. I think they comped everything but our steaks and appetizers. 

Was it worth the price? Not sure. Was it good? Heck yeah. Would I go back? Only if my friend pays again.

Took my man for his 33rd birthday dinner and this place did not disappoint. I made a last min reservation by phone 4 hrs before going but only because it was a Monday night and we didn't expect it to be too busy. The place closed at 10pm that night and I was able to get a reservation for 2 at 9:30pm, the hostess had mentioned that they were actually busy for a Monday night. The moment you step foot into the restaurant the light is a lot dimmer, and to the right is the restaurant Bar top with about 8-10 stools and to the left the hostess stand. The restaurant decor was fancy with lots of paintings on the walls and pretty blue ceiling to floor curtains that are pinned to the walls. Once we were seated the waiter came to the table with menus and gave us a few recommendations. My bf ordered the bone in ribeye and I ordered filet mignon, they were absolutely delicious! Cooked perfectly on the outside but yet juicy and tender on the inside. Neither were overly seasoned! For our sides we ordered the Mac and cheese, gooey and creamy and has to be one of the best I've had, and the creamed spinach. The creamed spinach wasn't amazing, was a little bland but ok since it was a healthier choice. They do start you off with sourdough and raisin bread with butter in the beginning and both were delicious! We each got a cocktail, one steak each and two sides to share and the bill came out to 220.00 without tip. It was well worth it and more importantly, worth it to see my boyfriend satisfied. We would definitely come here again!

If you're looking for authentic fine dining, look no further. Dress up. The Filet Mignon is the closest thing to perfect. Excellent presentation that lives up to its elegance. Probably one of the best, if not the best steak restaurants in Vegas. Just GO! You can't go wrong.
The food was excellent. The lines were long,  but well worth the wait. Everything I ate was delicious.
Excellent service coupled with amazing food. I had surf & turf; best ever. So much flavor,no need to dip the lobster in butter. 5 stars plus

Recently visited Las Vegas and spent some time at the Bellagio. My wife and I made reservations at Prime and had incredible service. Yes, it's pricey, but you know what the price is justified with the environment, service, food quality, and experience. I value customer service and quality above all else and these are the types of restaurants we have no problem spending money on.

Top 3 steaks I've ever ever had.  Frankly, its been a few days since, and I'm still thinking about it.
I ordered the New York ($56 i believe).  It was cooked to perfection.  They bring 4 different sauces (made by the chef) for the meal, but none are needed.  The steak tastes like heaven, seriously, no other description. I was full 2/3s of the way into the steak but still had to finish.  It was too good to take home.
Service is first class.  I've been to plenty of nice restaurants, and this one has some of the best service i've ever had. 
Just an unbelievable dinner.  Rarely do I get that combination of fast, courteous, and knowledgeable service along with possibly the best steak I've ever had.

We went for a company dinner and all of us ordered different cuts. There have been occasions where one of the steak weren't cooked properly but all 5 of our steaks were cooked medium-well when we all asked for medium-rare. 

For such a high end and pricier place than other better steakhouses (SW, Gordon Ramsey, Craftsteak) I wouldn't expect something like this. Our waiter said that's once you cut closer to the bone it'll be med-rare but we cut the med-well steak to show him but he didn't really offer anything to compensate us. The sides were all really salty and the desserts were nothing special.

If you want a good meal go to Gordon Ramsey or Craftsteak.

Slow service and my table was ignored.  Ive been to other fine dining restaurants even in Bellagio (such as Picasso and Jasmine) (other places such as Delmonico, Craft Steak House, etc) that provided great to amazing service.  I never felt so ignored at a steak house before.  Other places they are attentive and ready to assist, not this place.  I kept having to flag people down.

The food was decent, I ordered a tomato salad and seabass instead of a filet.  I felt for a tomato salad it was really lacking on the tomatoes.  It seemed like 1 1/2 small round tomatoes.  Could I at least get the other half of the second tomato for that price? Fresh cheese and the seabass's sauce was tasty.  Would I go back even if it had better service the next time around? No.

Hostess very polite. Waiter Russell extremely professional/polite. Busser did his job but didn't look like he wanted to be there. Overall good service.
Food - 6 oz filet mignon with blue cheese (just know that blue cheese topping is an extra $10). It was a nice cut, very tender and the sear was good too. I ordered these potato fingerlings. My wife called them high class french fries. Overall, excellent food.
Ambiance - old school decor, 40's style furniture and design overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Appropriately dimmed for dinner.
We (and many others) were dressed appropriately for this fine dining experience; however, I noticed (although a sign says "No shorts"), there were some guests looking like they just came from the pool. I guess they're more lenient during the summer. Idk.
I'd like to say that I'll be back, but I'm not baller status and there are too many restaurants in Vegas that I want to check out. So maybe, we'll see. Nonetheless, I had a nice experience.
Outstanding filet mignon.  Absolutely delicious Dover soul. The only thing we did not enjoy was the crab cake which was overfried and reminded me of a Mrs Paul's fishstick.

I eat out 14 times a week, all over the U.S. I think it's time to start giving honest feedback; helping others make informed dining decisions. 

Table for 2:

+Extremely upscale decor
+Very romantic
+Steak was good, but over cooked. 
+Lobsters for app
+Great wine list
+Expect a very large bill for your elite steakhouse experience. 
+Get a table on the patio, overlooking the Bellagio fountains. 

Overall Grade: 92% out of 100%
I would highly recommend this restaurant.

I am rating this place with a 5 stars ONLY because we requested a table with a view of the fountains and they delivered on it, even though they seemed very busy! Our table had to be one of the best in the restaurant, as it was very private with a perfect view of the fountain show. 

Service was great, not too pushy, but they were always there when you needed them! Food was 4 stars. My fillet Mignon was perfect....I ate the whole thing and I'm not a steak eater, but I'm not going to be that person that goes to the steak house to order something other than steak! Sides are pretty big, and I remember ordering a side that resembled baby food, like maybe sweet potatoes, but the baby food version! Wine was delicious as well! They knew it was our 1-yr. anniversary, so they surprised us with a cute lil delicious desert that said "Happy Anniversary"! 

I love it when restaurants pay attention to detail and deliver. That is how it should always be especially when you are shelling out $$$ for one meal! 

P.S. after your meal request to have your dessert or some drinks out on the patio. We did that because we heard you could, but for whatever reason they said there were no seats available at the time even though there were...oh well!

The service is excellent. Very attentive and you never had to wait long if you needed something. The salads, appetizers, and dessert was all very good. We ordered a Cesar salad, beet salad and the tomato salad. They were all very fresh and I would recommend each, especially the beet one. One person in our group also had the foie gras. It melted in your mouth and I would also recommend if that is your thing. And then there was dessert. This was my favorite part. We had chocolate cake and lemon meringue pie. Those were seeone the best desserts I've ever tatsed. The decor was also so beautiful and it made you feel like you traveled back in time. You are able to see the fountains also, which is a plus. 

Now to the negatives. I took away two stars because each entree and sides fell short. Our table had the ribeye, fillets, and the sea bass. They were all underseasoned. For the price, I would expect something flavorful and tender. It was just bland a little tough. The sea bass was really disappointing. I saw a picture online of it and thought it looked beautiful but the tomatoes we're sour and the fish had no flavor and was very oily. We had asparagus, mushrooms and the tempura fried onions. They were all bland too. 

Overall I would come back for the atmosphere and desserts.

Pros: 
steak is perfect 
Fountains
Atmosphere 

Cons: 
Condescending waiters
Failure to take drink orders 
Overpriced- go to carnevino's at palazzo for a better meal at a better price

My husband and I decided to treat ourselves to a pricey dinner for our 10th anniversary. A first for us! We were seated, and based on the service, we were so impressed, and resolved to do this more often. However, after we ate our food, we quickly changed our mind! For the price, our meal was DEFINITELY not worth it! I would have rather taken the money spent and put it toward the couch I've been wanting for like a year...there's only a little resentment here ;)

I would give a 5+ on service, but food, really just average, and no where near worth the price.

Our filet mignon was made to perfection - medium rare. The wine selection was perfect. The whole dinner and experience was amazing! The espresso at the end was very good. I didn't pay, but I'm assuming it was quite on the pricier side. Would definitely recommend for a special occasion or for a night out.
Excellent powerhouse steak but we did wait over an hour for food

Could not have been a better and more perfect wedding anniversary celebration.
Came in from LA and spend hours researching the BEST dining location for ambience, food and service.  Wow, so many choices.  Settled on Prime and hoped for the best.
Chris, a matre d at Prime, was instrumental in helping assure us of a window side table. Class act...thank you Chris.
Pedro, with the caring and on the spot support from Natalio made sure our evening was memorable. 
The food was second to none and included what we felt was THE highlight dish, that being the Short Rib. The Rib Eye was ok but a little tough, appetizers choices were a great Cesar, awesome carpaccio with steak tartar.
The only let down was the sommelier who gave us a bit of cold shoulder, probably due to the fact we brought a very special 25 year old bottle of wine. We gladly paid the $50 corkage fee to enjoy our special keepsake, but would have loved to enjoy the same courtesy and caring service provided by Natalio and Perdo....Thank you gentlemen. 
Will DEFINITELY be back when next in L V.

Prime Steak House is one our favorite restaurants in Vegas.   My wife and I had wonderful experience.  
Service is very attentive and the attendants kept the beverages flowing.   The Lobster and the Center Cut was Delicious.  The price was commensurate with dinner.

This place is amazing!  Great views of the fountains, wonderful service, and most of all,  perfect food.  The aged bone-in ribeye was delicious, and the truffled mashed potatoes were to die for.  The three sauces provided tasted so good with the steak, especially the soy-miso sauce.  This place is expensive, but worth getting dressed up for!

The best place to eat in Vegas!  No doubts!  

Took my wife to Prime for her birthday off a recommendation and the experience couldn't have been better.  A la carte style restaurant which can get a little expensive but absolutely worth the price.  Can't beat watching the fountains from inside the restaurant.  You'll want to make reservations...and early.  We decided late and had to make reservations for 5:30.  This was easily the BEST meal my wife or I have ever eaten, period!  If I could give it more stars, I would.  

We'll definitely be back when we are in Vegas again.

mobile review
Wonderful, delicious, perfect, fabulous. Expensive but very much worth it. 
I believe this is the best fine dining experience in Vegas. The caviar service was perfect, our waiter was a sweetheart, the steaks were perfect, the truffle mashed potatoes and potato gratin were delicious. The coconut souffl was also perfect. Our lovely waiter even brought our family a complementary dessert!  ( we were celebrating ) Oh and the location is perfect too! The only bad thing one must prepare for is the cold, unwelcoming hostesses. But once you get past them-it's wonderful!

Nice ambience with good steak.  Beer tartare with carpaccio was delicious.  Dessert drinks are overpriced but good. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly. The soy miso accompaniment sauce is my favorite !

Excellent service. This place has great views  of the Bellagio fountains, makes for an beautiful romantic setting. The dry-aged rib eye is amazing :) If your ordering wine the Ferrari-Carano Merlot is tasty.

We were staying at the Bellagio and I was bound and determined to have dinner as close to the fountains as I could.  The Prime was the prime place just for that.  (no pun intended : ),  The patio was closed due to the chill in the air. So,  we were seated right next to a window where the water was no less than 5' away.  From the very second we stepped into the Prime up to paying the check...it was an absolutely stunning evening.  The service was impeccable, classy and just what I was taught how it should be.  I ordered the beet salad and it was so good.  There were roasted beets on top of yogurt, no doubt.  LOVED the combination and never had thought of putting those 2 foods together.  My husband ordered the french onion soup which he said was the best he's ever had!  We both ordered the 16 oz. rib eye, med. rare!  The steaks were served still hot and perfectly cooked to our liking.  They put 3 different sauces on the table but, the steak was so good that a sauce just wouldn't do it justice.  Not a sauce person much anyway.  We had a side of the mushrooms and chickpea fries.  Excellent!  And all the time we were delicately devouring our dinner, the fountains entertained us over and over.  

This is a restaurant that will be revisited over and over by us.  It's pricey and I guess one has to pay for the view, as well.  But, such a lovely indulgence!

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary dinner last Saturday. First off, the place is very busy so making a reservation in advance is a must! We were lucky to get in as the guest service manager at the hotel we were at (Encore) worked his magic to get us a table in such short notice. 

Prime is truly fine dining at its best, everything from the food to the ambiance was amazing. We both had the filet mignon, I had the 10 oz. and he had the 12 oz. For sides we ordered the mac & cheese, truffle mash potatoes and the chili broccoli....the truffle mash was heaven!! 

After dinner they even brought us out a desert with "Happy Anniversary" written on the plate with chocolate (compliments of the restaurant!) Needless to say, the staff went above and beyond to make our dinner extra special. This is a great place for a romantic dinner for sure, 5 stars!

Another wonderful dinner at Prime Steakhouse in the Bellagio!  I highly recommend the Wagyu beef sampler... 3 ozs NY Strip, 3 ozs Filet mignon, 3 ozs ribeye.  Also, John Burke, the sommelier, does a nice job of matching your wine preferences to your meal.  Thanks Prime!

This restaurant is incredible! We made a Friday night reservation a month in advance and requested a patio table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. I knew it was a long shot but I figured it couldn't hurt to request it. When we arrived they did have a patio table for us and it was an amazing experience. They start you off with a bread basket that has this delicious pretzel bread. It is so good! We had the bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer and they were fantastic. But the best part of my meal was the truffle mashed potatoes! Best mashed potatoes of my life hands down! They were out of this world! I also got the New York Steak and it was very good. The service was wonderful and the view from the patio watching the fountain show was something I will never forget. Can't wait to come back on our next trip to Vegas!

I went to Vegas last weekend and found out my parents were going to be there as well and decided to mooch of them for an evening. Starving college student ya know? Well fortunately for me my parents and their friends were going to the Bellagio to eat at Prime and then see the show "O" which is amazing by the way! 

First of all, this restaurant oozes high class and high expectations. I enjoyed the ambiance and loved how you can view the water fountain show while enjoying your intense meal! 
Despite the fact that everyone at my table ordered the filet, I decided to go with the braised short ribs. 
Eh, they were okay, but my mom's filet was to die for. Thats why I only gave 4 stars. My meal was good but not as orgasmic as my expectations and but my momma's was perfect.
Dessert was fantastic. I got the chocolate cake! 
If you an afford it, GO!

We just held our wedding reception at Prime on the private patio overlooking the fountains.  What an amazing experience.  EVERY single guest was in awe of how amazing the experience was and two of our friends even said it was in the top 3 of all weddings they've been to and that  they want their daughter to have her reception there when she gets married.

Rebecca and April (the events Managers with whom we worked for months leading up the event) were on top of everything.  Like any couple right before our wedding we were nervous and worried about everything being perfect.  Rebecca met us on site the day before and she guaranteed everything would be perfect.  She delivered on that guarantee.  The food was amazing, flowers beautiful and our wedding cake was so delicious -- the wait staff could not be beat by any other I have ever experienced.  They catered to our every whim and that of our guests with no hesitation.  

The Bellagio fountain show kept our guests in awe every 15 minutes right behind us.  It was like having front row seats to one of Vegas' best shows every quarter hour.  Best part was the value we got for the price we paid -- was so fair especially for such an elegant experience.

I am a tough critic as a corporate executive for an international company that hosts dinner events monthly, I am very picky about venues and quality.  I would never hesitate about referring family and friends to Rebecca and April.  I didn't expect it, but Rebecca was onsite when we arrived -- she greeted us at the door and was the first to congratulate us.  She wanted to make sure everything was set up -- not one detail was missed and we had given them a lot of little touches we wanted personally added for our guests.

If you read my reviews I have a soft spot for steakhouses. I wanted to give Prime 4 stars but I think 3 - 3 1/2 is about right.

The restaurant itself is beautiful and the ambience is perfect in that it is not loud at all.

My friend and I both had the Bone-In Rib Eye, 18 oz - $58. A bit pricey. It was good, we both said a B-B+. Not amazing. We went for that cut as it was wet-aged and we are not fans of dry aged which they had 2 of on the menu.

The Mac and Cheese was amazing, full of Gouda goodness. We had crispy potatoes which is a twice baked potato covered in cheese and bacon. It's a glorified potato skin. Avoid it.

The bread selection was nothing special.

I had the warm chocolate cake, a molten lava chocolate creation with a tiny scoop of vanilla bean. Average.

We escaped for under $200 as we had no alcohol. I'd go back there but certainly recommend CUT, Mastros and Morels before Prime.

Last night, we enjoyed our fifth Restaurant Week meal. We had ($50.11) dinner at Prime. It was less stuffy than I imagined. It's odd, though, jackets are preferred for men but they have no coat check. Anyhow, it's a nice dining room with fountain views. We noshed on the bread basket filled with a variety of sour dough, pretzel and raisin walnut.

First Course
Tomato Gazpacho; Summer Flavors, Marcona Almonds & Olive Oil and Bacon Wrapped Shrimp; Passion Mustard & Cumin Scented Honey

Second Course
Filet Medallions; Sweet Corn, Crispy Spaetzle & Fiore Sardo Cheese

Third Course
Warm Valrhona Chocolate Cake; Vanilla Ice Cream and Summer Berries; Strawberry Gele & Marsala Cream

The gazpacho must have been a blend of tomatoes and watermelon. It would make the perfect smoothie. Still, it was a refreshing treat with fun surprises of raspberries, strawberries, peppers, and marcona almonds. The shrimp were properly cooked and the bacon was nice and crisp. The flavor was a unique blend of sweet and smokey.

The filet was cooked to perfect and it sliced like butter. It was fantastic on its own, but coupled with the shallot sauce? Wow. We agreed the Bearnaise and au pouvoir hindered the already fabulous flavor of the steak. The spaetzle was light and tasty with the sweetness from the corn.

Dessert were tasty, but they were the weakest links of the meal. Properly executed but both just lacked pizazz. Service was attentive throughout the meal. Prior to Restaurant Week, we had never dined in a Jean-Georges Vongerichten restaurant. We've been missing out. Both Prime and Jean-Georges were highly enjoyable.

Look, Prime is a high-end Steakhouse in the Bellagio - that's right, the Bellagio not Circus Circus, Excalibur or any other lower rent hotel.  So you can expect a pricey meal.  But here you really get what you pay for.  Steak was excellent (had the Peppercorn New York Steak, mid-rare).  Cooked to perfection and the service was impeccable.  Wine selection follows the theme of being pricey, but the server had good pairing recommendations that tied the meal together nicely.  Our table shared a few sides (asparagus, broccoli, and the mashed potatoes) all of which were excellent.  If you are in the market for a $100-$120 per person Steakhouse meal in Las Vegas, then I would highly recommend Prime.  I would definitely return on my next visit, unless the casino gods dictate that I take a more thrifty approach.

Love this place! Great atmosphere great views of the fountain. .  And though this is a steak house,  we both had the Ahi Tuna and it was cooked perfectly to a melt in your mouth perfection. .

Will return and try the sea bass, it looked amazing!

This was a very disappointing experience comparing to other steakhouse we've been to in Vegas. I made reservations to this steakhouse for our anniversary this pass weekend with a couple of friends. We were expecting to have an amazing dinner with our friends especially for the money we were going to spend. Steak was not juicy or flavorful not even cooked with any care for flavor (salt or pepper) I guess that's why they give you three different steak sauces. Anyone knows that a good cooked steak will never need to add sauce to make it taste good. What made this worst was a twelve dollar coke. I'm pretty sure with the food price they could afford free refills. They might want to check with Outback on how to cook a better steak. Yes Outback taste better then this steakhouse. I'm sorry to our friends who had to experience this with us. 

For those who need a GREAT steakhouse I strongly recommend Charlie Palmer at the Four Seasons or Strip Steak at the Mandalay Bay.

I didn't have to pay, so the 5-star rating doesn't reflect prices. The filet mignon was tasty and super tender, sides were awesome, and so was the key lime pie (on the smaller side, but that's ok, I was already full). Good cocktails, and nice ambiance, with a friendly staff.

I had the most perfect table right by the windows, overlooking the fountains. I ordered a filet (medium-rare) and my friend ordered the same, but medium. Both steaks were cooked perfectly. They came with 3 sauces and i don't know which one i loved the best. They were ALL good. For sides we got the broccoli with cheese, jalapeno, and mint and a side of mashed potatoes. Both delicious. I had the bread pudding for dessert, which i thought had too much over powering sauce. My friend had the cheescake with berries and it was amazing. The atmosphere is beautiful and elegant, the service was phenominal. I really enjoyed this place and everything about it.

This place is a very good dining experience. The greeters, waiters, managers and chefs are all on point. It has to be good to be in Vegas, and even better to be in the Bellagio. The steaks are super well aged meats and always cooked to perfection. I have eaten here 10-12 times and ordered something different each time. It has always been great. They have a huge seafood platter served as an appetizer. Its HUGE and has oysters, mussels, large prawns, lobster, and some other fish varieties. It serves the whole table as an appetizer from 2 to 10 people and is incredible.

Highly recomment you stay away from the buffets for one night and check Prime out.

My husband and i went to Vegas for our honeymoon, and when we travel, we love to eat. This was THE best steak we had in town. We got there a little earlier then our reservation so we were able to change it to seat outside, front row seat to the water show, and perfect romantic night! We loved the food, and the scenery! The service outside on the patio could use some improvement but overall we were very satisfied!

We celebrated a birthday dinner during our stay at Bellagio.  Service was excellent.  Usually we order the dry-aged ribeye but decided to try the A5 wagyu ribeye.  It's expensive at $45 per ounce but definitely worth splurging.  We started with the seared foie gras, and the perky toe crab salad.  And then had a 9 ounce wagyu ribeye.  Perfectly cooked medium rare and lightly seasoned. It was accompanied by 3 sauces but didn't need anything as the wagyu beef was flavorful and tender

- Call ahead at least a day or two (for a weeknight) prob a week or two for weekends
- Ask for a lake view
- Dress code: no shorts, nice jeans ok, collared shirts
-Estimate for two people with 4 alcoholic drinks $260
-The bigger the party the further away they seat u from the windows.
- And DON'T stuff your self with bread (i know, I know it's my weakness too)

I called to make my reservations and said it was my B-day ( i lied.) I just REALLY wanted a nice table with a lake view. And it totally worked. My BF and i got the coolest lil booth facing the lake. I don't really care for meat. But Holy @#$%! The Filet Mignon was SOOOOO good and the Yukon mashed potatoes and creamed spinach purrrrfecto!. 
I even got a comp'd dessert (which I'm ok with cuz i lost big at the table at the Bellagio.)   The service was as classy as it gets. Dare i say this was the best meal i've ever had.  Meow.
beautiful restaurant, request outdoor seating when it is nice,  food was good, not great, service varies, sometimes it is great, last time was very average.

This should be a 4.5 stars, not quite a five, but pretty darn close. This was the best meal we had our last trip to Vegas. There was 6 or us and we sampled a wide variety from the menu. The wine list was excellent, at Vegas prices, but a very good selection, we enjoyed a couple of bottles that were well presented. I enjoyed a Delmonico steak that was as good as I have had anywhere, melt in your mouth excellent, someone else had the duck which I sampled and it was also done perfectly. Those that had room for dessert were also pleased. 
It was an excellent meal, the service was the only reason I did not give a 5 star. Our waiter was a little overwhelmed with all of his tables. The food came out at a perfect temperature, but was a little slow between courses. We also had to wait a while to order. The table he was taking care of before us had 8 people and it seemed that each person needed to discuss their order in detail with multiple questions, most were answered to the previous person at the table, IE: what salad dressings , how much pink does med well have , can I super size my fries..... really, it must have taken 15 minutes for them to order, the waiter was exhausted afterwards and we were starving. .. For a restaurant of this caliber, the wait manager should have stepped in and taken our order, it was obvious we were starving and he was dying at the next table.

The service was very professional.
The Food - fantastic.  We shared a special seafood platter.  Crab, shrimp, oysters, lobster, and stone crab.  
I had the rib eye.  It was very good and the sides were great too.  Simple, prime, and light seasoning.  
I loved sitting near the windows watching the water show.
One of the finest dining experiences I've ever had.

Experience was great except for the hostess and her huge attitude.  Made reservations more than a week in advance.  Arrived about 15 minutes early and were seated in the kitchen doorway.  When asked to be moved (lots of empty tables) we were told those were for reservations.  Pointed out we had a reservation and we were moved to a nice table.  Waiter and his staff were wonderful.  Appetizers - shrimp and salmon sushi were excellent.  Butternut squash soup amazing.  And the dinner - we had salmon, filet and ny steak were all amazing.  Side dishes excellent.  I am knocking this review from a five star to four star solely because of the extreme attitude of the hostess.  Visited many steakhouses of this caliber and never had a hostess with that attitude.

We had Thanksgiving  dinner here.Outstanding ambience.Impeccable  service with waitstaff.... Fancy place so dress accordingly.I had reservations which we switched due to a conflict in schedule...somehow despite being on phone with them they didn't have our new reservation, but according  to  hostess "luckily could seat us".
Started off with bottled water, $9 a bottle  actually. Followed by $19 cocktails. Followed by a cold bread basket with 3 types of bread.Cold bread is a pet peeve of mine especially  at a higher end restaurant. Nobody likes cold bread on a cold night especially. 
Husband order huge porterhouse steak $73  ,and it came under done and had to go back.He ordered medium,it came very rare.Neighboring table sent back to rare steak as well that they had ordered medium. For these prices that's unacceptable. ...guess chef was having an off night.Fingerling potatoes were good and steak was good when it came back properly cooked.Peppercorn sauce was our pick of the three sauces offered. 
I ordered the turkey dinner special since it was turkey day after all. In retrospect the waiter really wasnt trying to sell.the special.I should have heeded this.To my surprise what came was 3 slices of what looked like Jennie  O turkey loaf,(it was tough to cut with a steak knife!)on top of a meager amount of mashed potatoes(  I think it was baby food )with a huge glop of canned  cranberry sauce ,a square of dark meat confit and a square of stuffing(the best tasting part of entire dish),reminiscent of McDonald's  fried hashbrown squares,awful Brussel sprouts ,drizzled with a tiny amount of gravy.Im not sure where the best turkey dinner was in Las Vegas on Thanksgiving  day 2015,but Prime takes the cake for one of the worst  I've ever had.I did not finish.
Skipped dessert   we were weary of loud  pretentious annoying neighbor blathering with his neighbors  about world politics, his world travels,terrorism,Donald Trump  and Hillary Clinton, and left feeling disappointed, had planned this dinner for 3 months and expected excellence,only 3 stars due to service and ambience.

This place surpassed my expections. Not only did they have our table ready when we arrived 15 mins early but the service was excellent.

Everything we ordered was top notch except the lobster bisque it was a bit too salty for me.

We ordered the signature seafood appetizer which was delicious. And we all got the surf and turf special.  We got a side of truffle mashed potatos (EXCELLENT) and creamed spinach. We didn't go to crazy when it came to desserts because we were so full but we did try the trio of sorbets.

I highly recommend it best meal I've ever had in vegas

This place is so over rated. I really wanted to love it and I really tried because I was taken there as part of a large group and our host had the greatest intention in taking us all there. I had the salmon dinner and it was dripping in butter, like there must have been an entire stick dropped on it during preparation. News flash: people that order salmon are usually health conscious individuals that are trying to make a lean and healthy choice, not usually want a stick of butter dropped on in prep. I will say that I ordered the hot chocolate/lava cake with vanilla ice cream and it was amazing! However the coffee that I ordered to go with it was absolutely awful. So they have a long way to go before they put all the puzzle pieces together and live up to the 5 star reputation that they strive for.

My wife and I went to the Prime Steakhouse restaurant last Friday to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary.   When we made the reservation weeks prior we requested a window table overlooking the fountains.  When we arrived we were told none were available.  When a window table near us did come available we asked if we could move there and were told NO by the manager.

The waiters, we had two that were sharing duty, one named Scott the other we can't recall,  never offered us a wine menu or asked us what type of wines we liked.  We had to request a menu and make our own guess which might be a good wine with our food.  My wife ordered the fillet mignon and I had ordered the salmon with sides of asparagus and truffled mash potatoes.   The steak was good but not cooked the way my wife requested.  Neither waiter ever asked us how the food was of if we wanted anything else.  They seem to spend most of their time chatting with other tables and ignoring us.  

They did have a very nice lady named Grace who took our pictures which we purchased afterwards.

At the end of the meal the waiter did bring us a nice plate with some chocolate for our anniversary at no cost.  That was nice.

Overall the food was good but the service was mediocre at best.   We expected much better service for such a high priced restaurant.  We didn't feel very welcomed there.  We always stay a the Bellagio Hotel when we visit Las Vegas, but will not be going back to the Prime Steakhouse restaurant.

FYI - The night before we went to eat dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant across the street and were able to get a window table overlooking the Las Vegas strip and Bellagio fountains.  The food there was excellent with excellent service.  I would highly recommend that restaurant.

We started with the bacon wrapped shrimp. Can't go wrong with that and the sauce was perfectly paired with it. Most amazing and delicious filet!! Tender, moist and the flavor was perfect. The au gratin potatoes were creamy and filled with cheese and onions. The asparagus cooked to perfection and not smothered in butter which is preferred. Mushrooms were seasoned to perfection and not overly greasy either. Nothing like a perfect dinner while watching the fountains outside. The service was excellent and they were readily available without being annoying.

My husband and I went here for dinner after our wedding and were so impressed! we started with the shrimp cocktail, and the shrimp were massive! The cocktail sauce was on the spicy side, but still so delish. We both fell in love with the crispy fingerling potatoes...they were incredible, made with a bacon-onion marmalade and just SO GOOD. we both ordered the filet mignon as our main dish and they were cooked to perfection. I order mine medium rare and let me tell you, it was fabulous. the sauces the steaks come with were all tasty, but our favorite was the soy-rice wine sauce. it was unreal. I can't say enough good things about this place. the food was to die for, the service was fantastic, ambiance was incredible...I could not recommend this place more!

inside the Bellagio Hotel  is The best restaurant in America ! ..
 Sea food platter for a table of 10....get your scuba gear ready and dive...I've never seen a presentation like that,..totally awsome. The Steak & Garlic mashed potatos, wine selection to die for, ....  The Art Deco decour  is out of this world,  phenomenal service, everything is just extraordinary...I wish I lived next door.

This terrific restaurant is in the Bellagio in Las Vegas, and is outstanding. It's not cheap, but not outrageous either. The service and food are top notch and if you like steaks, this is the place. The fish is also to die for. Everything about this place is wonderful.

The food. The atmosphere. The service. The best in Vegas!!! The bacon wrapped shrimp are amazing. Had the ribeye with Mac n cheese and cauliflower. My husband had the scallops. Everything was delicious. Loved the 3 sauces for my ribeye. I couldn't stop eating it. This is my new favorite place in Vegas!
service and food was awesome but here is the catch, any steak more than $30 tastes the same. (no matter if it is aged, organic etc ...) and basically you pay extra for service and the name ;)

This place was amazing. I took my girlfriend here for out 2 year anniversary and she loved it. I had made reservations months in advance in hopes of the patio dinning area which I got. The servers was great and friendly.  The food fantastic I had the salmon, she had the lobster tail and we shared the bacon potatoes.  The view of the fountain was amazing. Highly recommend going.

This is a long one so I'll sum it up for the skimmers: terrible service, pretentious atmosphere, as expected steakhouse food (if you want an incorrectly cooked steak), about $150/person with a drink, app and steak...spend your money elsewhere. 

I so wanted to love this place! That was however most definitely NOT the case. We started the experience by having a manager approach my brother and ask him to roll down his pants. My brother is a fashion stylist and was in Gucci and looked great, meanwhile guys in Levi's and kids in ripped jeans are walking by, no problem. But ok, fine, we get it....dress code is dress code. You would think said manager would later stop by to check on us given how he started the experience...he did not, strike 2. We just got back from a trip to Napa so we brought our own bottle of wine, we called ahead and found out the corking fee was $50...steep, but fine. When we sat down the waiter aggressively told us that the corking fee was $50, three times! As if we were stupid or he'd convince us to buy his overpriced wine? Strike 3. Our salads came and they were good, the Caesar was a typical steakhouse Caesar but the wedge was really good. Delicious blue cheese dressing. Now they were starting to redeem themselves, a little. After the salad course it took a good 30 minutes before our steaks came out. That is way too much time between courses in my opinion. When my rib eye came out it was over cooked. I order medium rare and it was at least medium plus bordering on well done. I told the waiter (new guy, maybe second in command?) that my steak was over cooked. He aggressively questioned me. Told me I needed to cut it in the middle to be sure, so I did and it was. He held it up, shined a light on it and was like, no this is our medium rare and that's what you ordered. He was so condescending and rude it was ridiculous! Finally my brother told him to take it back and cook it properly. They brought it out again and this time it was rare. I ate it because I just wanted to get out of there. Oh and during the wait, while my entire family was enjoying their meal, did said manager or waiter #1 come ask me if I needed anything or apologize? Nope. In fact, waiter #1 didn't even check on us at all after our steaks came out, he came back at the end to ask if we wanted dessert which we of course passed on. Overall, the food was fine, but not worth the inflated prices and terrible, condescending service. We will never return and will be spreading the word. If you're up for a pretentious place with staff that think they're better than you, then go ahead and drop $150/head here. If not, go elsewhere. In fact, I was at Fix, Bellagio's cheaper steakhouse and had a much better experience. My date's (a chef) steak was over cooked there and they handled it flawlessly. They took it back immediately and the manager came to check on us and bright him a scotch. My recommendation - spend your money elsewhere.

We ate at Prime when we were vacationing with family. The food was good but probably not worth 70$ for the steak or 40$ for chicken. 
However it was great to dine and have views of the Bellagio fountains 
We were celebrating two birthdays and it was very nice that both people received a special dessert.
Soooooo good the steak was top quality!!!!! filet.mignon amazing!! service was nice as well as the view great water show while you eat!

I took my dad here for a belated birthday on June 21.  The tables are situated so they are not side by side which makes you feel like you have room and some conversation privacy.  
Our waiters (yes we had a two!) treated us very well.  We had the tomato and burrata salad, fresh oysters, 10 oz. fillets, broccoli and cheddar side and mushrooms side.  All were excellent.  I loved the attention we received, the ambiance, the food and the general vibe in this restaurant.  It is a VERY classy and old-school restaurant.  You can spend a large amount of money here but it definitely feels worth it.    

I booked the reservation through the Bellagio and mentioned that it was a birthday dinner.  The servers gave my dad a beautiful complimentary dessert at the end of our meal.  It is so nice to spend time at an establishment that makes you feel special and valued.

My dad is hard to please and yet he made the comment that the dinner was the highlight of the trip (more so than Nobu, the Brooks and Dunn concert or GR Steak).  He also said the fillet was the best he's ever had....and he's had ALOT of steaks in his life.  It made me so happy to know that I was treating him to a dinner that he truly loved and will remember forever.

I will absolutely be back.

Lauren C's review of Prime described her waiter as a "Jeeves Wannabe," and she couldn't have been more correct.  And when I told the Sommelier I was taking the Level 2 exam after passing Level 1, but that I wasn't a "real" sommelier at the time, he practically scoffed.  The correct response is: "Good luck!"  I told the same thing to the Sommelier at Gary Danko last week, and he gave me his business card and asked how he could help.  THAT is how you treat a customer!

Being a top-service-rated restaurant, even if it's super-high-end, means having servers that are professional, and knowledgable, but also cool and who act like "real people" at the same time  Example:  Go to Gary Danko.  It's a high end establishment, but people are just cool.  No snootiness, and they have a natural flow to how they interact, with a sense of humor as well.  Perhaps I was at Prime on an off-night, but other reviews have confirmed the same attitude.

To Bellagio's credit, however, I must say that my experience at Picasso two years ago was unbelievable, and the service at Picasso blew me away.  Furthermore, the wine pairing at Picasso was one of the best I've encountered in my life.

My Prime experience was overall a good one, saved by the bartender (I had a glass of wine at the bar before dinner, he picked one blind and I guessed it), and the unbelievable bone-in filet.  There was a little too much "rub" on the filet, as I'm a pureist with my steaks (like to have several bare bites before I go to sauces).  That said, I did try the four homemade sauces, which are pretty incredible:  bernaise, soy reduction, a mustard sauce, and peppercorn.  The bone-in filet is ginormous, and is an amazing cut of meat.  At $60, it's probably the best bargain on the menu, because a cut of that quality and size is very rare.

Wine list is great, although they only have one Rioja; which shouldn't be the case with a list of that size.

This was my second time at Prime and I was really looking forward to the same wonderful experience I had the first time a few years back. 

To start with, this was a Monday night at about 9:00pm. My wife and I took our 2 friends there after bragging about our last experience. We did not have reservations but we were easily seated, unfortunately in the very back part of the restaurant as far away from the fountain as can be. The evening began pleasantly enough with our drink order from the bar. My wife ordered a very dirty martini and absolutely loved it. Our friend ordered a Lemon Drop and unfortunately it tasted more like syrup than anything else. She refused to send it back and made the best of it. After placing our complete order we asked the waiters assistant if we could have some bread (like we noticed the other tables were having almost immediately after being seated, not us) and the response was a bit stiff with "I'll be there as soon as I can." We were eventually served some delicious sourdough bread and pretzel bread. The bread was delicious and we made quick work of it. As it was taking a while for our food to be prepared (no complaint here as good food should take some time) we asked the waiters assistant if we could have some more of the pretzel bread. His response this time was "we are out of pretzel bread because it is so late, that is also why you didn't get any raisin bread." Let me state that 9:00pm in Las Vegas is not late. I am also not sure what the point was to tell us what we didn't get. My wife then asked for more sourdough and his response was "Are you sure? You have a lot of food coming." After making it clear that we would still like to have the bread it was brought out without any further comment. We took it with a grain of salt and let it go.

The rest of the entrees were eventually brought out and the food was fabulous. Paying a premium at a nice restaurant is a treat for most people, like us. We absolutely do not mind doing it but when the experience falls short, then it makes it so not worth it. As much as I enjoy the food at Prime, I feel that this may have been my last visit there. I will happily try one of the many other Steakhouses with excellent Yelp reviews the next time I am in Vegas.
steak wasn't terrible, but at about $150+ per person with an automatic gratuity, the service was terrible.  Drink refills were slow.  We felt ignored while there.

wow!! I have never had kobe beef before, it is hand down the best i've ever had.  Filet mignon kobe is great here.  25 bucks and ounce for a 10 ounce steak dosen't get any better.  prime has really good food, they used to have a potato grating which was layered potatoes and is no longer on the menu.  they replaced it with a layered cheese pototo which i dont reccommend getting.  Head chef if you read this, bring back the gratin is it awesome

It was fine.

Foie gras, wedge-ish salad, brussel sprouts.  It was all fine.  Bartender was nice.  Ambience was OK.  Not sure what I was expecting but it wasn't a "wow".
The salad was OK at best.  My apologies, Prime... you seem like you might deserve better than that.  I will go back some day and re-evaluate.

Simply excellent. Great food. Great service. Great decor. In this restaurant, you're able to watch the famous Bellagio water show while enjoying an 18oz dry aged bone-in ribeye. 

Bottom line, if you want a great steak and a great steakhouse experience while on the strip, check this place out.

Never been to Vegas until now.  Did a Top 10 search on Best Steakhouses of Las Vegas and PRIME was on all the lists.  So off we go for a dinner out with the guys.  Total of seven of us & with tax/tip added onto our bill (without any alcoholic drinks, but with 4 sodas) the total came up to $830.  Was it worth it?  Read on.

The food was the BEST!  All of our steaks were cooked to "almost" perfection.  I say almost because for a few of us, we ordered our steaks medium and we got medium rare.  No big deal & I can only imagine how hard it is to get a steak to be that perfectly cooked between med.rare and medium so no deduction in rating for that.

Our orders ranged from Filet Mignon (with bone attached) cuts to the traditional Rib Eye.  Sides included cream corn, caesar salad, stuffed potato, crispy potatoes, truffle mashed potatoes and onion soup.  ALL of it was superbly made.  We cannot say enough about the cream corn and truffle mashed potatoes.  The food was impeccable and the service was top notch.  One of the guys on the table has dogs so we asked for the bones to be placed in a box after our meal.  The server did one better and scooped more bones from the kitchen (that they were going to discard anyways) and packed it along with ours.  Totally cool....the dogs will be eating in heaven I tell you.

Word of warning though.....the extra condiments for your stuffed potato (sour cream, chives, bacon, cheese) are ala carte.  The water served to your table is priced per bottle.  Yup, water is not free.  And soda refills are also not free.  The soda refill charge was no real surprise to me....but the charge for the water & the condiments for the stuffed potato were, so consider yourself warned.  :)

All in all, the dinner was excellent and the restaurant is a great place to impress that special lady in your life.  The food is prepared top-notch and the service is second to none.  Will we ever go there again?  That is a definite YES.....though I might not drink so much water next time.  :)

The food was delicious.  The service was good. The restaurant was quaint and we had a nice view out of our window. The prices are high but it's to be expected here. The sauces for the steak were yummy. I was so happy to have my leftovers as a late night snack.

Okay, Prime has the best steaks in town. We go there every Christmas, making a reservation early so we can be seated by the window and watch the "Dancing Fountains." Beyond the steaks, virtually everything on the menu is enticing and the service impeccable.

Now, if we can only ban fanny packs and T shirts in hotels like the Bellagio itself, it would be great (okay, not a part of the restaurant review, more of a social comment).

My company exhibits at a tradeshow at the Bellagio each year and we always have a group dinner one or two nights at Prime. The food is amazing and the service is great. We usually start out with the seafood sampler platter which is a jaw dropping mound of ice with lobster, crab, shrimp, oysters, etc.   I'm not a big red meat eater so I usually get seafood, although a couple times I've ordered a steak. Everything has always been delicious and the service is great.

They have a private room that seats 12 in the back which has been perfect for our group dinners. If you are staying at the Bellagio you have to try this place out. Especially if you can expense dinner. ;o)

Ok first of all, this review isn't based on the quality of food, but on the experience I had with my friends and my girlfriend. 
      My girlfriend, our friends and I, had made reservations for tonight, about a month ago, at 8 pm (7/1/16) for my girlfriend's birthday. We came for dinner and were told that we would have to wait an hour to be seated outside as we requested, which was fine because we really wanted to see the view for our dinner. So we waited a little over an hour and were finally seated at 9:08 The server was polite and very professional when taking our orders. And the wait began.
       So after waiting an hour to be seated, we had waited for over an hour with still no food. And let me remind you that this dinner was to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. So we were all hungry and anxious, waiting for our food and my girlfriend is getting upset. Our server who was very polite and apologetic, had to repeatedly go and check on our food. 
       After about an hour with no food except bread and water our server had came back to apologize another time and had told us that the manager would come speak to us about the horrendous wait time for our food. The so called "manager" came to our table to apologize. I had to give her a piece of mind to give her a sense of what we were going through. Waiting an hour to be seated and another hour with NO FOOD! And on my girlfriend's birthday too..  This "manager" INTERUPTS me MIDSENTENCE to explain to me why we had to wait an hour to be seated. I understand why it took so long to be seated, that's fine. I just wanted her understand how we felt having to wait for so long. But to interrupt me after I had to wait AN HOUR without FOOD, to give me the same "your food will be right out" response and excuses as to why the food was taking so long. I had told her that this was unacceptable and she tells me in this disrespectful tone "What do you want me to do? Cancel the order? Bring out more bread?" 
        First of all, if you have to ask the guest what you want her to do, then you should not be the manager.
        Second, are you implying that you want me to cancel the order? Are you challenging me that I won't? The amount of disrespect was appalling. Why? Because we were a younger group of guest in their early 20s? That's another thing I noticed. This establishment seems to favor guests of an older crowd and seems to treat younger guests like children.  I felt like she was belittling me for voicing my opinion against this terrible experience. 
           Third, please don't offer me more bread when I've been waiting a whole hour for real food. It made me feel as though it would take even longer for the food to come out. 
            We ended up leaving the restaurant without eating dinner. Mainly because of how that manager was speaking to me. If this "manager" knew how to talk to a distraught guest, we would have given them our business. But this manager's disrespectful tone was the last straw. 
             I'm sure the food would have been delicious if it had gotten to us in time. I felt bad for our servers for being embarrassed do to a kitchen error. They were respectful and kind, but the manager was disrespectful despite her apologizing. 
             It's not the mistakes, but how they are corrected that matters. And this "manager" never learned that lesson.

Incredibly disappointing very expensive meal. The room is beautiful but the service was poor and food mediocre.  The waiter never checked back on the cooking level of our steaks which were over cooked. And never asked if we wanted a second glass of wine. We were really looking forward to this meal having eaten there previously and thought it was phenomenal so very disappointed.

My wife and I recently dined at Prime and were both very impressed.  I made a reservation the same day and since the restaurant overlooks the Bellagio Fountains, requested a seat with a view.  Given the last minute reservations I doubted my request would be granted but sure enough, we had front row seats to the show.  

The waitstaff was extremely professional and courteous.  They knew their menu and wine choices and made our experience extremely enjoyable.  The food was tremendous and the sides were mouth watering.  It was a bit pricey but that's what you can expect from a Vegas steak house.  I'd certainly visit again next time we are in Vegas.

Been here three times now and I'm going to stop taking my dumb pills and stop going. First time was at CES 2013 and the second two times were at CES 2014. Never again.

The people are super nice and the service is exemplary. Decor is top notch. But I don't go to a steakhouse for service and decor. I go there for steak. Please go ahead and mistreat me but if you're going to charge me $85 for a ribeye it better be the best darn ribeye I've ever had. It needs to be at the level of J&G in Phoenix or Prime 112 in Miami for these kinds of prices. Probably even at the level of Peter Lugers (sp?) in NYC. Well it's not even close. Though I'll leave out good ol' Ruth's Chris since it's pretty hard to beat a steak that's drenched in sizzling butter. Both of the last two times I was at Prime, the ribeye was meh - gristle-y and a little on the chewy side. Totally not what I would expect from a $60-70 aged, prime ribeye. Had a piece of my neighbor's filet and it was a little better. Still rather flavorless to be honest. The sides are microscopic - they have no shame charging $14 for amounts to 4-5 Brussel sprouts. Definitely NOT sharable among 2-3 people as they say their sides are.

Given their level of service and the decor, it would just be wrong to give them a 1-star. But the food quality really just isn't there and I definitely will not go back.

Goes to show that Pavlovian principles only apply to dogs. But no really, next CES, I am not subjecting anyone to Prime.

Went here for my boyfriends birthday dinner. As soon as we walked in, we were seated right away. I loved the way that the place looked and the service was outstanding! I asked where the restroom was, and our waiter walked me directly to it, even opening the door for me. When I came back my napkin was neatly folded on the table.They really cater to you and make you feel special.

The reason why I only gave this 3 stars is because my boyfriend (who was the birthday boy) ordered the porterhouse and wanted it medium. He started to eat it and when he got towards the center, it was clearly rare. He continued to just eat the edges, but he barely put a dent in it. He stated that he didn't want to complain, but he was not happy at all that he couldn't even eat his steak. We brought it up to the waiter, which offered to bring out another one. My boyfriend declined since he had a little bit of it, and was not about to try to start eating another one. 

With that said, I loved the food. Pricey, but I was prepared to spend $$$$. I wish that my boyfriend could have enjoyed it more but they made up for it. He got a free dessert and he loved everything else, but his porterhouse. Again the service was great, sort of a long wait in between courses, but you have the fountain to watch.

Prime Steakhouse was amazing! Yes Woohoo! As good as it gets!

The service was impeccable. That coming from me is pretty big, since I think I go out more to test establishments on their customer services more than the food.

The ambiance was breathtaking, you cant beat having a romantic dinner with your husband as the Bellagio fountains shoot off synchronized with music next to you...in Vegas.

The food. THE FOOD! My husband says his steak was the BEST steak he's ever had in his life. Now that's a bold statement since we've eaten at some great steakhouses.

The lobster I had melted, as in melted in my mouth. The butter that it came with was perfect. I know its just melted butter but it was the best pair with the lobster. 

Writing this review is making my mouth water just remembering the smell, the taste, the juices, the delicious wine I had.

Most definitely check this place out. Make sure to reserve a table with fountain view.

I went there for my birthday with my partner and sister.  The waiter kept referring to us as "Sir".  My sister felt offended after 2 "sirs".  Then the assistant waiter comes over and says sir again.  I used that opportunity to tell her my sister is present and she was getting offended and annoyed.  Instead of appologizing she makes an inappropriate casual yet pointed joke with sarcasm.  We were all shocked by her behavior and later i asked the waiter that we get an apology for her response.  She came over and apologized.  I can't believe a Jean Georges' restaurant would have such bad training.  It unfortunately ruined the evening.  The food is good, the price is high, but the service was far from up to par.  We will not go there again.

I wanted to love this place. The dining room has an old school elegance and the outside views are spectacular. I was sadly disappointed, largely due to service issues. Despite having a reservation, we had to wait an additional 15-20 minutes to get seated. Wait staff were walking around the room but rarely stopped by without being flagged. Our waiter lacked any kind of warmth and was quite gruff when I commented that the small sample of wine he poured was too dry for my taste and requested something different. I could understand if this occurred after opening a bottle but this was a tiny pour from a wine they sell by the glass. His demeanor was condescending and rude. The food itself was very good: the oysters, bacon-wrapped shrimp, pea soup, and wagyu were all hits with the table. When your party of 4 is paying roughly $200 per person, however, both the food and service need to be on point. Sadly, this restaurant only delivered on the former.

Drop-dead gorgeous view (if you sit on the patio). My husband and I had reservations right at 5 when the opened (as we had a show at 7) and we asked for patio seating. So incredibly worth it. The Bellagio fountains went, it was a beautiful night, they waiters were extremely accommodation, and the food - oh the food. While you will certainly pay top dollar, its worth it. The filet is melt in your mouth happiness. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to splurge for the night before a nice show.

Decor: 
Top notch - fancy french, very clean & classy

Service: 
A serious professional wait staff.  I have a rule: if the waiter is older than my dad the food is going to be awesome!  They also sat us window seat to have an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain show.

Food: 
WOW!  This is what I would envision as a last meal type of place!  Yes, really it was that good. 

Price:
Be ready to drop 300.00 for a really nice meal for two people.

Wow. People who know me know I don't just hand out 5 stars. But this place was fantastic. The steak was without a doubt the best I have ever had in my life. Perfect in every way. My boyfriend comes here every time he goes to Vegas and reports they never have had an off day. I order the 8-oz fillet and asparagus and mashed potatoes. The potatoes were very creamy and the asparagus was asparagus. Really just speedbumps on my fantastic steak journey. Additionally they give you 4 sauces to have with your steak and I couldn't decide which was more delicious or if I just wanted to taste the fantastic steak on its own. Wow. Really. I am not a foodie but every bite I wanted to stop and savor. 

The steak was so good I almost forgot the mention the appetizers. I had salmon sashimi that was extremely fresh delicious fish. I thought the sauce was a bit much. But it was a great price for great cuts of fish. Plentiful and expertly presented. My boyfriend got the crab cake and it was a single cake for $24. The taste was smooth and creamy, but for 1 cake I was a little disappointed for him and stuck to my salmon sashimi.

For the restaurant it is nice but not overly so. No pretentious feeling and a nice cozy place for a date. Decor is pleasant and chairs very comfortable. The wait staff was nice  and attentive but not disruptive.

Was hoping to give this restaurant 4-5 stars being it was Jean-Georges restaurant in Las Vegas.    Dined here with a group of 5 for our last evening in November, looking forward to a memorable A+ dining experience.  Our concierge at another hotel had recommended this restaurant (among others) when we asked for the best steak house in LV.  The indoor atmosphere was luxurious, overlooking the famous Bellagio fountain with a spectacular view.  It was tastefully decorated and the service top notch, unfortunately the dishes we ordered were not. Be prepared, the wine list is extensive, and expensive, but expected of a restaurant of this caliber.  I, and several others, decided to try the Caesar Salad as a starter.  We were stunned such a mediocre salad could be served at such an acclaimed restaurant.  The tired & limp romaine lettuce was thinly chopped with what looked like small store bought croutons, no joke.  The croutons didn't even look house made.  There was no shaved Parmesan or Pandano, just grated cheese throughout.  The taste was lack luster store bought, no wow factor at all.  We all agreed we could find this salad in just about any super market deli, very disappointing. Next, I ordered the peppered New York steak, medium rare, as my second dish.  The steak was over seared on the crust making it very difficult to cut through, like cutting a piece of leather, leaving the steak to be tough and chewy.  I've had much better steak elsewhere for less.  Other diners in our group had similar dishes with less than top notch results.  We were on a show schedule and didn't have time to send back any dishes, so we stuck with what we had.  This dining experience left us thinking that maybe signature restaurants ride too much on the coat tails of outdated reputations, using location and aesthetics to make up for the quality of food served, seemingly over rated.  Not sure if I would spend big bucks to eat here again when there are so many other great restaurants in Las Vegas.
Overpriced for basic food service. Generally expect more from the wait staff over guests

Celebrated my birthday here MLK weekend along with a group of friends and we were very satisfied!  The service was top notch. The food was delicious.  Started with the beet salad as an appetizer and shared the porterhouse -  which we were told was a 22oz cut.  Had my steak medium and the size was perfect for two people. There was 3 different sauces for the steak that you can try but the steak was good enough on its own even without the sauces.  We also shared sides of the cauliflower and steamed asparagus which was also very good. We were seated close to the window and had a great view of the fountains. 

We had our pictures taken by the photographer and it turned out to be pretty nice. We paid for our pictures and gave her a tip.  She was sweet and professional.  

Highly recommend.

So good! The food was excellent and the staff was great. We had the bacon wrapped shrimp, crispy salmon sushi, filet mignon, and the truffle mashed potatoes. Everything was delicious! Without a doubt, the best steak we've ever had. 

The restaurant is beautiful and elegant with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. It is definitely pricey, but worth every penny. Not only are the food and wines great, but the servers offer exceptional customer service. It is the perfect place for celebrating special occasions or just a nice night out in Vegas!

My friend and I had dinner here on Halloween night, 10/31/14.  We arrived without reservations!  Of course they are recommended, but we had chosen another venue and changed our minds at the last minute.  The hostess was very nice and accommodating and asked us to wait in the bar for approximately 15 minutes while a table was being readied.  That was great with us.  At the bar we enjoyed a mixed drink each.  Drinks here are about $15 pp.  We were promptly seated near the windows and had a cozy table for two.  The view onto the Strip and the Fountains of Bellagio are fantastic.  Prime is definitely an upscale venue.  We had one primary waiter and two others who assisted.  The menu is a la carte and comprehensive.  I selected the Squash Soup ($15) and it is poured into your bowl at the table.  She selected the baby Iceberg Salad ($18).  There is nothing baby about the salad; it's huge.  You will be full after eating it.  We shared and both were delicious.  For the main course we ordered the 18 oz Ribeye ($64) - just one - and I asked the waiter to split it at the table.  It was more than enough for two.  We also had the roasted Asparagus ($14), the Mushrooms (($16) and Mac and Cheese ($12).  That was too much and I told the waiter it probably was.  All of it was delicious!  The total, without tip, was $164, and that included one more mixed drink for me.

Actually, I thought the venue, service and experience overall was excellent, responsive and courteous.  The prime Ribeye was good, but not the best I've had.  I would rate it 3.5 stars, although it was cooked properly, by the time it was served, it was a bit cool.  I like a steak hot.  This was not.  I did not complain -- it was fine, just not hot.  By the time I had eaten the last morsel, it was definitely cold.  If you like rare, this is perfect for you.  

I agree with the other reviewers that this is a beautiful restaurant overlooking the fountains.  During the weekend, the fountains are active every 15 minutes, so this is quite a show while you dine.  Very romantic.

We had some money to spend with the Food & Dining Credit at the Bellagio, so we opted for the Prime Steakhouse for beau's birthday dinner. We got to sit front row at the Bellagio Fountains! Unfortunately it was too hot outside, otherwise we might have enjoyed the accompanying music also.

The first bite of everything was super delicious, in fact, I was assured that I had made the right decision on the location. It certainly had a lot of accolades on the website, highly acclaimed and even won 2014 Open Table's award. Bravo! It was love at first bite, and then, sadly, towards the end and 5 glasses of water later, not so much.

The steak was carted in with three signature sauces. I was rather glad they didn't make you choose on the spot and instead, left three small gravy boats for you to try them. Unfortunately the steak was just fine on its own, and the sauce wasn't entirely necessary. Though conclusively we decided that if you need sauce on a steak then something else entirely is prohibiting your experience...

The lamb chops were so divine at first bite, but through it all, about 40% ended up being lamb fat instead of lamb chops, and well, it just couldn't justify the amount spent on the entree. The sauce was overly salted, and thus ended up drinking 5 glasses by the conclusion of the evening. Pretty strange considering there were only three chops.

The sides however were less disappointing, I absolutely loved (and subsequently murdered) the entire ramekin of truffle mash. I highly recommend this even though the entrees themselves seemed lacking. The peas were also divine. A bit cheating with the bacon, but well put together. It was, however, a tad hard to eat due to the different shapes of peas...

Well, besides the truffle mash potatoes, the birthday dessert was divine. They had just made the lava cake and it was perfectly rich without being too sweet. The ice cream was a prefect touch. Very tasty.

Top items: Service, Truffle Mash, Free Dessert.

Needless to say, won't be back. Sure, maybe we ordered the wrong items, but just so you know, a restaurant shouldn't make bad items choices on the menu. Haha.
One of the nicer restaurants you'll find in Vegas or maybe anywhere. Seafood tower appetizer was terrific. Aged rib eye very good.

We booked this restaurant way in advance to make sure that we got our reservation. Party of 6 fountain view. One couple celebrating their Honeymoon and the other two couples were celebrating birthdays. We got the perfect seats. However, when it came to the food, it was not what it's hyped up to be and exceedingly expensive for the taste. I had the 10oz filet Oscar. My hubby had the dry bone in rib eye Oscar. Now, we have had both of the dishes in many other restaurants. We consider ourselves foodies. Oscar is always crab with hollandaise and usually asparagus. Therefore, it's nice and saucy. This however was crab and breading. They said it has hollandaise but it was dry. The fact that you pay $30 something for it was not worth it. The steak was not as tender as I normally get it butterflied and very well done. Many will say like a hockey puck but that's how I eat it. I ALWAYS order it this way and it still comes out tender at Council Oaks, Ruth Chris's, Bern's. Morton's and Fleming's. However, not here. It was an experience but a very expensive experience.  Not nearly worth the quality of the food. The best thing we're the mushrooms. These were DELICIOUS. When we normally get mushrooms, it's just cooked in a sauce. These were in a buttery sauce and they were different kinds of mushrooms. They were quite tasty. At the end, it really wasn't worth the $250 plus that we paid.

PS- I got the Almond Brle to go because I was sooo stuffed since I've have bariatric surgery (the sleeve). I did not feel well at all after eating it. I had to throw half of it away and felt nauseous the rest of the night. It has nothing to do with the surgery because I can eat sugar with the sleeve.

This is definitely an expense account dinner.   We had a group of 8 people and the total bill with tip was $930.  Our server was very knowledgeable, albeit slightly arrogant.  The filet mignon was outstanding but the signature sauce they serve with it is TO DIE FOR.  The wine list is top notch.  The only thing I can complain about is they use wheeled carts to deliver food and they sometimes bumped into my chair.  I wasn't going to make a scene but it was a little bit annoying trying to take a sip of wine or a bite of steak and getting a little jolt.  They should move the tables a few inches if the cart cannot fit!  The decor is classic blues and golds and the view to the outside fountains is a nice touch.
We truly enjoy what We ate. I can easily say that this is one of the best meals I've had in Las Vegas so far. Everything was a 10 out of 10 and we enjoyed every bite!

Considering that this is a fine dining restaurant, I felt disappointed by the service and quality. The service was sub-par, as the hostess let the door actually hit me and walked onward to the table, and we had to constantly wait to seek and ask for a waiter to refill our water. As for the food, for the first time, I did not want to completely devour a steak, and I LOVE steak. However, I do have to say their lamb is quite delectable. Despite the good lamb, I will have to say this is not a first-choice restaurant in Vegas for me.

This is an exceptional eatery with an amazing atmosphere and fantastic service.  You haven't had a real steak until you've had an A5 certified piece of meat from Prime!  

Dined here on a Sat night, no reservation and sat at the bar.  Best choice to make.  Found a seat in no time.  Make sure you sit at the bar that Dave is serving at, you'll be in capable hands with the best choices and some very interesting surprises.  I came to learn Dave has been there for over 16 years and has quite a bit of interesting stories and history of Las Vegas.  Just ask about his famous deck of cards!
