From drinks to dessert you will find it hard to fault anything this establishment has to offer.

Our steaks were over cooked and dry, ordered medium rare received medium well. I'm sure this place does have great steaks but on this day they weren't. Very disappointed I'm only giving a 3 star rating because the waiter took our complaint to heart and offered to correct it. However we politely refused his offer and made the best of it.

I was so excited to have a memorable dining experience with amazing food, great service, and an incredible view, but Prime only managed to come through with the view.  

I ordered the bone in ribeye, $75 for an overcooked, forgettable steak.  I ordered it rare and it came out between medium rare and medium, NOT an issue one should have in a restaurant of this caliber.  It did come out with three sauces, two of which I enjoyed, but honestly, with a $75 steak, I don't feel like I should have to dip it in sauce to get some flavor. The steak was pretty bland.

I ordered the carrot cake for dessert. It was absolutely beautifully presented, but I was disappointed that it tasted a lot more like a pineapple cake than a carrot cake. I understand trying to put your own spin on things, but I feel like it lost the essence of what a carrot cake was.

The service was definitely subpar. It took them about 20 minutes after we were seated to even take our order and our drink glasses were regularly empty. Nobody really checked on us to see how our food was, either.

The restaurant is beautiful in the view of the fountains is gorgeous if you happen to be in one of the spots that has a few of them, which we were, but just watch The Fountains outside and you'll probably have just as good of a Time. Super disappointed in this dining experience.
Great food, great service, and great staff, made the evening very enjoyable and memorable. Beautiful view overlooking the lake at Bellagio.

Love this place! Definitely worth it to get there early and request a table with a view of the fountains. I had a filet mignon that was cooked perfectly rare as well as the foie gras with lychee pure. Absolutely delicious and you can't beat the ambiance!   The service was wonderful as well.

As a vegetarian, this restaurant is all wrong for me. However I came here for dinner w/ 4 others and didn't pay a dime of the bill so I was fine with it. The others (rest were non-vegetarians) seemed to enjoy their food and our waiter was excellent. The place was quite nice and we had a great view of the famous Bellagio watershow so I was entertained as well as enjoying the several side dishes/appetizers that I ordered (obviously couldn't order the steak) and washed it all down with decent wine.
One of the Steakhouses in Las Vegas.  What makes this place special is the White Waiter Service.  Truly amazing dining experience

Excellent service and excellent steaks.  High quality by the glass wine menu.  I am surprised at all the poor reviews.  Glad we did not encounter any problems.  

Our reservation was on a Sunday at 5pm as we had a show to catch.  We were the first ones seated and had a very attentive wait staff.  No problems.

Each member of the party thought their steaks were one of the best that they have had.  Two of us had 18oz bone in ribeyes and two had 8oz filet mignon.  Steaks were amazing on their own and the various sauces were interesting.

One odd finding is that the broccoli was spicy at two different steak houses in Vegas.

It's a steak house, with gorgeous decor, great food, and top notch service. What's not to love?

The space is beautiful, perfect for a date night. Also, during the day, you can dine on their patio, which over looks the fountains.

Service is exceptional. We split the foie gras and the bone-in Rib-eye, both of which were perfectly plated and didn't look like a split. The Rib-eye was cut for us, at our table, because, that's what civilized steak houses do.

Though the Rib-eye was delicious, the foie gras was the star of our dinner. I could literally have eaten four more plates of it. It was to die for. I still dream about that foie gras. Needless to say, if you're at all a fan of foie gras, ORDER IT!

Food: 5
Ambience: 5
Service: 5
Value: 5

THE BEST STEAK I have ever had. BY FAR. The steaks are perfectly cooked here EVERY time I go. They give you three sauces to eat your steak with. At first I though it was odd that they were serving three different sauces with steak but it really caters to each individuals taste buds and is a brilliant idea. The restaurant ambience is perfections with their drapes, curtains, and dim lighting. Most importantly the view from the restaurant is breathtaking because you can see and enjoy the bellagio fountain show up close while you're eating. The sides here and everything they serve is cooked to perfection. I go back every year now, whenever I got to Vegas!

I had the 18 oz bone-in rib eye steak.  There was a choice between the Bellagio buffet or this steak restaurant.  Wanted to save this place for a special moment, but the wait at the buffet was 45mins.  Hunger was a factor and there was a big price to pay for it as well.  The decor like the previous person mentioned is phenomenal.  A look out the window has you looking out to the lake / water show.  

The steak was pretty good, but I still have to compare that Ruth's Chris is still better, even though they are a chain.  Although I usually order the New York steak at Ruth's Chris.

Apparently they revamped the restroom to allow for more than on individual.

Expensive even for Vegas? Maybe.   We enjoyed a very expensive meal here ($80-$100) per person without drinks included.   The ambiance was very comfortable and we liked the semi private rooms with curtains separating them.    We had four tables in our area.  We were far from the fountain, and I imagine sitting on the patio or near the fountain windows would be an awesome experience!   Our waiter was good, attentive, not overly friendly but helpful.  I had the tuna and it was cooked perfectly, however the puffed rice crust on the tuna was odd and I didn't enjoy that combination.  The Caesar salad was a unique flavor, hot and spicy.  Others in our group enjoyed the fillet and the rib eye which they reported were cooked correctly and large portions, which was nice given the price of over $80 for each, really?  The sides were good, smallish, and expensive at $12-14 each.    It was a nice meal, nice location, but $$$$$

WOW!! This was our second time coming to Prime and we loved it just as we did the first time. I took my step-daughter, her fianc, my cousin and my step-daughters soon to be mother in-law to celebrate my step-daughters upcoming wedding. We all enjoyed every minute of it. The food was outstanding! We were able to get a seat out on the patio and what a view! The wait staff were wonderful and they even brought out a special dessert for the soon to be married couple! We will be back in Vegas this November and would love to take my husband, son and my other two step-kids. I know they would enjoy it just as we did.

After trying so many steakhouses, Prime is only mediocre. The atmosphere to Prime is really romantic and has a good feel to it. It makes you feel like a classy person when you're in Prime and that goes for the price of your food as well. For the price and the taste of your food, you can probably get better steakhouses(Craft or SW ). 

I did quite enjoy having the sauces on the side which give it a nice little spin to it. However, I only end up using one and we never got one of the 4 sauces( the miso-mustard). I was a big fan of the soy-rice wine sauce which was a winner for me(I believe there was garlic in it) Moving on, the steak was good quality but it didn't exactly differ too much from other steak houses(including Mastro where I get Porterhouse as well) for a more inexpensive price than I would rather go back to Mastros. On a side note, what did win for me in Prime was their sides. Their sides were one of the better sides that I've had(way better than SW) in my opinion. The mac and cheese which was layer with lot of truffle(yay) was quite awesome and so was the mash potatoes. 

Oh the service was wonderful and they didn't charge us for a bottle of wine that we brought(usually it would be $50 so be warned)...probably because our bottle of wine was too cheap for them :p. Whatever the case, I like that they didn't charge for us it. The dessert were okay. 

You can give it a try when you are in Vegas but the winner for steakhouses for me is definitely Craft. I do highly recommend bring a girl to a date here since it is quite the place as you can even see the bellagio's water show which was a +.

My favorite place to dine in Vegas!! The food is beyond delicious and the service is amazing!! The friendly staff make all the difference. Thomas was so kind and patient as we were a large party, truly went out of his way to make sure we were well taken care of. The restaurant is also designed so beautifully. You can see the water show and enjoy your delicious food if you choose to sit by the window. I would highly recommend this place if you are ever in Vegas!!

We've been here a number of times and the food is great.(hence the extra star) Service tonight was horrible. Waiter took a very long time to take our drink order and then even longer to take our food order. I had to ask him to take our salad plates after he let them sit for at least 15 minutes after we were finished. When our guest asked if he could have a pretzel role put in his to go bag, he said "we don't have anymore, unless you want me to go look thru the trash." He was rude and offensive. We will not be back. I was too appalled spend any extra time waiting to speak with management, as we had guests with us for business.

If management cares:
Check # 9083228
Server: team # 15
Table 26

We ordered the salmon sushi appetizer; it was delicious! My wife ordered scallops and I ordered dry aged bone-in ribeye. My wife likes the appetizer better than her food. I ordered the steak cooked medium +, but it was cooked  medium well, which took away from the flavor. The truffle mash potato and creme spinach were excellent. The service was very good.
It was our 10th anniversary. I asked for a patio or a window seat but they wouldn't guarantee or arrange anything. I found out that they rented the patio for a private event the day we showed up so I wasn't happy about that, but my wife had fun so overall 4 stars.

Husband and I were celebrating our anniversary at Prime. The food was spectacular and the views of the fountains were incredible.  The waiters were helpful when we asked for wine and food recommendations.  Food I would recommend; prime rib, truffle mashers, mac & cheese, Caesar salad.

Manage your expectations when you make a reservation here--Prime is an expensive steakhouse with a high-end menu.  My wife made reservations for a birthday dinner here, and it was a great experience with a personal view of the Bellagio fountains.Their dry-rub rib eye was cooked perfectly, and we will definitely be back with friends and family for special occasions.

BY FAR THE BEST STEAK HOUSE EVER!!!!!!

and Beau is an awesome server. I wont go for 6 months and this guy remembers exactly hat I want to eat!

:) love this place would eat here every time I was in Vegas if I had the $$$

We went to celebrate my friend's birthday last week. I'm telling you, the filet was amazing! He got the boned in rib eye, also phenomenal! We ordered the mashed potatoes as our side, not that original, I know, but it was creamy buttery deliciousness! The service was impeccable. Seriously, no complaints at all. Go and enjoy this gem!

We have dined at Prime a couple of times, and it has never disappointed. The food is always incredible; the service flawless. Our last visit we shared a caprese salad, porterhouse, and creamed spinach. We topped our meal with an amazing bottle of wine. The location is just... sexy, and special. Definitely a great place to visit in Vegas.

I mean, I guess you have to get dressed up and all fancy-schmancy every once in awhile, right?  My quota for 2017 was met with Prime.  While taking our semi-annual trip to Vegas and staying at our normal stomping grounds, the Bellagio, we made reservations for Prime for our Christmas Eve dinner.  I really want to come back when it's warmer so we can sit outside RIGHTNEXT to the fountains and enjoy a breathtaking view with our meal.

Like most upscale restaurants, you need to bring your own flashlight...or in the 21st century, as our table neighbors did, take out your phone and turn its flashlight on to see the menu.

Located below the Bellagio (just take the escalators down) past HYDE towards the shops.  You'll immediately be met by the hostess who will take your name.  There's a corridor that has benches that leads to the bathrooms for people to wait.  Behind the hostess are the double doors that lead to the outdoor seating next to the fountains.

If you so choose, you can walk right into the restaurant and the bar is immediately to your right.  Yay for bars because they were playing the football game my stepdad and I were betting on.  Whoda thunk that this schwanky restaurant would be playing fooseball on the boob tube?

Thankfully, being raised all over the world, I am accustomed to certain dining etiquette...and thankfully so.  At restaurants like these, my heart aches for those who have no idea what they're doing.  Some quick studies:

please do not wear denim
please do not wear tennis shoes or flip flops
please, gentlemen, at least wear a collared or button-up shirt with slacks
please, ladies, wear at least a nice blouse and a nice skirt or slacks
allow your host to push your chair in for you
allow your server to place your napkin in your lap
be prepared to have your server remove certain glasses if you won't be having wine/coffee
like you see in the movies/on TV, use your utensils from the outside in

The food was stellar, while amazingly expensive (Vegas).  Our server was well-mannered and civil.  I always feel, though, that employees of restaurants like these look down on us "regular folk".  I tried to pay it no mind.

Regardless, the food was delicious, the service was good, and it was an overall pleasing experience.  Will I be back?  Not if it's my decision, but if someone else in my party wants to dine here, sure.

This is one of the Best Steakhouses I have ever been to.  I had the aged ribeye and tried the in bone File minion which was beyond words, They were both excellent.  The ambiance is also good so I definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a great steak...

We always visit Prime when we come to the Bellagio, and it never fails to disappoint. We visited in January and had the opportunity to sit outside. It was such a meal to remember, seeing the fountains from such a beautiful angle with just a few other tables. 

The filet, potato sides, creamed spinach and shrimp cocktail never disappoint. We also enjoy the foie gras and shellfish platter for appetizers. Yes, it's pricey, but well worth it!

Went there on a Thursday. Party of 5. Service was top notch. We had 2 filets and 3 rib eyes. All were very bland. They bring sauce for the meat which is needed. Most high end steak houses salt and season their meet. Here it was very blah. Even the sauce didn't help. Sad because it's a nice place. Look for another steak house if you like flavorful meat.

My boyfriend and I went here for a romantic dinner out. We live in Vegas and like to try different restaurants here in town. We sat onthe patio and the view and ambience was amazing. The service was very good and the waters were curteous and on it. I was not impressed with the food. It was "ok" at best. We had dinner at smith and wolensky and it was much better than here at prime.  My boyfriend had the ribeye it was ok but nothing spectacular. I had the sea bass and once again it was ok. They said the sides would be family style but they weren't. The scalloped potatoes was barely enough for one and the onion rings were cold. The glass of wine I had was a Riesling wine and about choked when I saw it was $19 and it wasn't that great neither. For the amount of money the food is not worth it. The atmosphere perfection....food not so much. We won't be back.

I have eaten here about 8 times and I can safely say this is the best steakhouse that I have been to. I have also eaten at the neighboring Picasso which is great but doesn't come close to Prime(unless you are talking about the art on the wall). While not cheap (and not meant to be), Prime is flawless in terms of food, atmosphere, service, and has a comprehensive wine list and knowledgable sommeliers.
While I am not a fan of ordering massive seafood platters where the restaurant gets huge margins on serving you a couple meager crustaceans on a heaping bowl of ice, I must say Prime's shrimp cocktail and Florida stone crab (when in season) are as good as it gets. Their accompanying sauces are also phenomenal.
The steaks are nothing short of perfect. I usually go with a small 8 oz. filet which is cooked rare plus and is very dense yet tender and consistent throughout. Their steak sauces are unparalleled. My personal favorite is the soy rice wine sauce... simply amazing. Their sides are solid - I keep it simple with mashed potatoes and asparagus.
I have read some reviews of Mastro's in Bevelry Hills which gets 4-5 stars per review. I have eaten @ Mastro's twice and was not excited by my meal either time. In my opinion I would eat @ Prime any day over Mastro's and I could not recommend a finer steakhouse in Vegas.

It's been four years since my last review of Prime. I'm saddened to say that it has lost a star. I said it was a classy restaurant in my last review. It has lost some of its class. It use to be a quiet, intimate atmosphere. It now has a hectic feel to it. The background noise is terrible. But to the dinner. We love the chilled seafood platter. It is still good but the crab legs were soggy and size of the platter has decreased by a third, with an increase in price. 
My wife had the Australian lobster. It was cooked perfectly and was delicious. I had the dry aged bone in ribeye. I always order it med+. It arrived undercooked. I did not send it back but probably should have. The sides have always been excellent. We split the steamed asparagus and mashed potatoes. Still excellent. Prime is still one of our favorites and I'm sure we'll be back. It's just sad to see an old friend decline in quality.

This place is amazing. :)  I had asked the conceirge for a restaurant recommendation when I was planning my Vegas trip and they had recommended this venue.  It was a totaly splurge for my boyfriend's birthday and to compliment the dining experience, I had tickets to Cirque du Soleil's "O" after dinner.

The restaurant is hidden, and is the only restaurant at the Bellagio that does not have signage for the restaurant facing the Bellagio pool.  We had to ask hotel staff how to locate the restaurant, as to there not being any signage for the restaurant inside the Bellagio as well.

The restaurant is an experience for all the senses.  The decor is beautiful and I had requested a window seat for my dinner reservation.  You are able to enjoy the Bellagio fountain while dining.  

Service is impeccable.  We had a very knowledgeable and gregarious waiter.  It was definitely worth the splurge.  The total bill came out to be over $300 dollars including wine.

We had both ordered filet mignon (I opted for filet mignon with foie gras) and a side of tempura, a side of truffle mashed potatoes, and a side of creamed spinach.  (I can't seem to recall our starters nor dessert.)

It was a great experience and we can't wait to return to Prime.

We went here last night for dinner. This place is the essence of fine dining, so dress the part and definitely be prepared to spend some money. We chose this place based on the fact that it had great reviews and it had outdoor patio seating right on Bellagio lake, so we could be RIGHT in front of the fountain show. 
We went there around 7:15 and were seated almost immediately. First we stopped by the bar to get ourselves two dirty gin martinis. They offer blue cheese olives which is a HUGE plus in my book. However, the martinis for $17 each and not blowing my mind is what disappointed me. But hey, that's why I always order extra olive juice on the side. We were seated right next to fence leading out into the water of the lake. We had about 2-3 people taking care of us. All of them were very attentive and useful for helping us decide what to order. 
For an appetizer we got the steak tartar and carpaccio with an aioli sauce. HOLY MOLY was this orgasmic in my mouth. Extremely fresh and decadent! A must order! For dinner I got the sea bass. My boyfriend got the rare filet mignon (on the bone!! Something I've never seen before) and a side of mashed/whipped potatoes. The portion sizes were EXTREMELY generous, which made the prices (around $80-90 for the filet and $44 for the sea bass) worth it. The filet came with some sauces that I wasn't really a fan of for steak purposes, but I could definitely see them being great with other kinds of food. However, nothing could compare to the merlot reduction sauce we had at mon ami Gabi the night before. The mash potatoes were out of this world, and I'm not particularly a mashed potato fan. Dessert was surprise birthday treat. Some lava brownie with ice cream and a fudge decorated concoction with "happy birthday" and a candle. Very tasteful but couldn't be finished after our exquisite dinner. 
Throughout the meal we were amazed by the spectacular fountain show. At times we could actually feel the water mist. Just like the night before, the Vegas sunset during an outdoor dinner is beautiful. We watched the sky light dimmer down as the surrounding building lights slowly light up. However, I must say that if you end up dining indoors, you won't be disappointed. The decor is made of deep and light blues. It's quite magnificent. 
All of the staff are professional and eager to please. You can tell by looking at the menu and tasting the food that chef has put A LOT of thought into the menu and likely makes a great effort to use he finest and freshest ingredients. Our main server, Paul or Kevin I want to say, was extremely useful and refreshingly honest in helping us decide what to order. He didn't try to push us into buying the most expensive items or getting more than we wanted. Also, I want to say thank you to the gentleman who actually walked me to the bathroom and opened the door for me, so I wasn't wondering around like a lost puppy, HAHA! 
The only reason I don't give this place a full five stars is because of the prices. Although the portions are quite generous, I've experienced other amazing quality food and service at other steakhouses in other expensive cities like New York and DC, and haven't seen prices THIS high. However, Prime is an indulgence nonetheless, and there's no doubt in my mind that you won't walk away extremely happy with your experience there. 
Overall,  I'm a very pleased customer. Last but not least, if you're an M Life member like me, just give them your M life member card when you get your check, and you'll be able to add points to your M life account...so your expensive indulgence will probably benefit towards a comp later :)
ENJOY!

My husband and I vacationed in Las Vegas for our honeymoon. We made reservations at Prime and couldn't wait to dine at an acclaimed restaurant. While the service we received was excellent and the view on the patio was incredible, the food was subpar. I ordered a medium rare New York Strip. Steak that is cooked beyond medium rare should be a crime. Any decent steakhouse should recognize that. When I received my entree, it looked decent, but once I cut into it I realized it was terribly overcooked. There wasn't a hint of pink throughout the whole cut. It was dry and, quite honestly, a huge waste of money. 

Additionally, during one of the fountain shows, an employee of the restaurant stood at the table in front of us through the entire show (and well after). He appeared to be catching up with the group after years of not seeing each other. Regardless of the subject of their conversation, it put a damper on our experience.

I wanted to love this place. However, based on my experience, it appears to be very overrated. Save yourself the trouble - there are countless other places to watch the fountain show and get a better meal in Vegas.

My friend and I got the bone in steak along with some side broccoli mushroom Mac n cheese.  I order mine medium and my friends medium rare.  My meat of course came out meaty while my friends was chewy with tendons kind of like it was gamey.  Service was knowledgable.  Had a problem with my friend's bone in steak and talked to the manager about it.  It was my friend's birthday too as well so we made the best of it.

I can't have enough praise for this place. The service was impeccable. The food was memorable. The place is not cheap, but it was worth every penny. I can't wait for the opportunity to come back again. The mashed potatoes is a must. The filet mignon is tender and perfectly done. Nothing else to say! Can't wait to come back and do it again.

Single dining. Sat at the Bar. Great, quick service and full attention. I'd come back anytime. The salad, soup and steak were Top Notch! Plus, the steak came with three house prepared sauces. Service was A+. Ambiance A+ with views of the Bellagio Fountain Show!

My fiancee and I have been to Prime maybe 6 times in the last 2 years and have always enjoyed it. I would say they have all been 5 star experiences and very close to SW, which is my favorite steakhouse on the strip. However, we came on Sunday and had a far worse experience, which I don't think is acceptable even 1 out of 100 times for a $200 meal. We asked to be seated outside and was sat at a table that had quite a bit of tree/brush/dirt on it. I thought this was extremely strange that the host (or servers) wouldn't have a crumber and sit people and clean tables. Secondly, we don't drink. I've never felt pressured here previously by previous waiters, and I definitely never felt like I had diminished service. However, I felt from the beginning that our server, who's name I don't recall, had a different opinion of us as soon as we said we didn't want any wine. He came by and asked on 3 different occasions, when we were never considering wine and had just said no. My fiancee is gluten free and had asked for gluten free bread, which I believe they normally make or toast fresh when asked for it. However, she had to ask 3 times. The bread never came out, which was asked of the 2 different servers we had. No explanation. There was a couple behind us that had a similar poor experience. They were pretty vocal about their disappointment as they had ordered a starter and a bottle of wine. However, their steak came out 5 minutes before the appetizer or bottle of wine. They were pretty vocal when the appetizer and bottle finally came out and the servers really didn't say anything. It was very strange. Then last but not least, we received our check and we had 2 glasses of wine on our bill. It was probably just a mistake, but come on. Look at the bill before you bring it over to me.

Just a very disappointing experience for us, and that's ultimately really what you're paying for at a place like this.

I proposed here, and the staff was totally willing to help in any way, and made the evening unforgettable. Beautiful experience, and absolutely incredible food. Worth the price, because the experience is priceless. Pork chop and chicken are terrific.

A friend and I decided to venture to Las Vegas to celebrate our birthday's.  I didn't initially have high expectations on experiencing awesome dining but the minute we walked into Prime the service was excellent.  I can't remember everything we ordered due to the early start in intoxication, everything was so fresh and simply melted in my mouth, I can't stop dreaming about the best mashed potatoes that I've ever had in my entire LIFE!  When dining at Prime you must try the truffle mashed potatoes, they are to die for...!

Don't be impressed with the decor, the location, the menu and the prices. When you go to a high-end steak house, you want a great steak, right? So let's keep it real, shall we? 

Our food wasn't bad but it was definitely overpriced.  I guess when I order a steak medium-well I expect it to be slightly pink, not totally gray through and through and on the tough side.  The macaroni and cheese was so sharply cheesy I honestly could not eat it.  The truffle mashed potatoes were too truffly (I didn't think that was possible until Prime). The bread basket was excellent though. 

The bar is very small so if you have to wait for a table you're pretty much standing in the foyer. 

The hosting staff has an impeccable system for knowing who is next to be seated, what time your reservation is and "remembering" your name. This impressed me a great deal.  

The waitstaff was good but a bit stuffy.  

The room was nicely appointed and appealingly quiet except for a large party that had three very young children with them (all certainly under 5 years old who spent a great deal of time crying and unhappy - why bring children to a restaurant like this?).    

With so many options in Las Vegas, I certainly wouldn't choose to dine here again.

8/29/13
First night in Vegas, my brother in- law wanted me to try this restaurant the place itself is a little dark to the point they had to use a flashlight to look at my  steak.(which we will get to) So lets get right to the steaks. I ordered the bone in rib eye, which is one of my favorites. i ordered mine medium rare. The first steak was well done. The manager was standing behind me watching me cut it several times and finally asked is something was wrong, so i told him it was overcooked and he brought me out a new steak. Great I thought, then the second one was raw that's where the flashlight came and he looked at it. He brought it back for a refire and guess what this time it was microwaved. A microwave steak for $58 and with a name like prime I could buy a better steak in a grocery store.In between all the steaks I had to ask for another drink which the waiter never brought till I was done eating. I sent it back cause it was sitting there so long there wasn't any ice left in it. the manager took my microwave steak off the bill big deal it still cost me $300, what a waste when there so many good restaurants in Vegas

4.7 stars.

Superb staff, discreet and alert. One of the best staff anywhere. We were originally mis-booked at 2 separate tables, but when our party raised this with the hostess, she re-arranged house seating to accommodate our party within  5 minutes - seamless service at its best.

Best steak in Vegas - enjoyed this steak over Smith & Wollensky's and Capital Grille. 

Seamless service throughout entire meal - party of 15 was attended to by a team of servers without interruption. Members enjoyed their meal at varying pace within the party, while service remained completely unobtrusive yet attentive. One of the best dining staff I've ever experienced.

Gorgeous, opulent decor. Luxe floor-to-ceiling drapery, larger-than-life floral arrangements.

I'm giving Prime 5 stars, even though I was very disappointed at first...

Either Prime or Bellagio restaurant reservations somehow lost my reservation I made for my anniversary night. I called that night to inform them we'd be 15-20 mins late, that's when I found out they weren't expecting us. So of course, they already gave away the window seats I requested. It was an understatement to say I was upset. I made these reservations weeks ago...

However, when we arrived, the prime windows seat for 2 people were taken, but there was one still left, and they sat us there. Even though for some reason, the traditional water show did not go off, we were delighted to get the table with the view.

Dinner was phenomenal. From the rib eye to the chocolate cake at the end, it was great. The restaurant is beautiful. Our server, Beau, was attentive, efficient, and friendly, ending our dinner with a complimentary dessert to congratulate us on our anniversary. 

A definitely must...
Thank you, Prime Steakhouse staff!

This was the full experience; high quality food and service in a great atmosphere. If the weather is nice make sure to ask to be sat on the patio where you can watch the water show with Bellagio fountains. Pricy, but worth it for a special occasion!

Not impressed.  While the food was delicious, the waitstaff was below par.  Our waiters were also serving a group of ten as well as another good size table and a table of two.  They were more concerned with the larger tables, which of course they get an automatic gratuity.   They stopped by the smaller tables just twice.  A buser filled our waters repeatedly but trying to get any other drinks was pretty much well pointless.  The atmosphere is beautiful and romantic but most tables do not have a view of the fountains which is a shame. They also seem to rush out the smaller tables as well.  We were done under an hour.  Not much time to sit and enjoy, seemed more of eat and get out.  It could have been our waitstaff but I just was not impressed.

Amazing meal. Hefty price.... But when in Vegas...
The steak was tender, cooked to perfection, service was timed perfectly. The wine? Fantastic! As a bonus, we bumped into mike Tyson, who was also dining there. If iron mike eats there, it's got to be good, right?

A group of friends and I went to Prime on Saturday night and while it was ok in many respects, it was really disappointing for the price.  I am from LA and used to high-priced dining, but this place was unbelievable.  They did not have any affordable wines on the menu, and the prices for steak were unbelievable.  $65 for a filet that arrived well over-cooked and very bland.  The wines were very overpriced, and the side dishes were pedestrian and incredibly expensive.  

I have been to many of the Bellagio restaurants, and expect it to be expensive, but the others are much better than Prime.  Even though Picasso and Cirque are expensive, they are great.  Prime was average in terms of the food, decor, and service, but incredibly expensive.  I would avoid it.

Wanted to like this place more than I did. The decor is spectacular and the view of the fountains is great if you can get a table by the window. I had the peppercorn New York striploin and my friend had the rib eye. Both steaks were cooked very well and tasted good, however the cuts could've been better. The rib eye was very fatty and my New York was a little on the tough side. They were still very good steaks just for the price I expected a little more. The sides we had were good as well (mushrooms, broccoli and truffle mashed potatoes) but again, not as spectacular as I hoped. The service was very attentive but everyone there seemed to be on autopilot. Almost like they were paid to take care of your every need yet stay invisible. But maybe that's what the crowd they cater to is looking for. All in all not a bad place but for the price I would head to Heritage Steak at the Mirage instead.

After hearing s lot of great things, decided to come here for dinner during my last trip. The setting is beautiful, and we decided to have a table outside, right on the bellagio (prepare to get a little wet).  

In our party, we ordered the dry rub rib eye, tuna steak, sea bass and a few sides. The steaks were very mediocre at best. The tuna tasted overcooked and lacked any distinct flavors. I didn't have a chance to try the Seabass, however it received a more positive feedback. The truffle mash was excellent. 

Overall the experience was disappointing. At this price point, there are plenty of better options in vegas.

Totally not worth the price.  Typical filet - nothing special.  Creamed spinach and potatoes au gratin - nothing special.  Service - terrible.  OK, to be fair, OUR server was terrible.  We were seated and it took him 20 minutes to come take our order.  And by then a table of 15 was being seated in a private room near us, and our waiter disappeared at that point.  I guess he realized that better service to a table of 15 would bring him a bigger tip than from  a table for two.  What a joke.  So, while we waited for our meal, we watched as the private party's order of drinks and then appetizers arrived first.  We finally got our steaks, and after our meal we waited for 10 minutes before our waiter showed up again - at which time we decided to skip dessert and just get the bill.

We ate at prime almost a year ago, and I forgot to leave a review. Very large portions, very accommodating and awesome staff, and one of the best meals we've ever eaten in our lives. It was pricey, but definitely was a big part of our amazing Las Vegas experience.
This place is very overrated. I don't mind paying for good food but the food here is mediocre at best. The service and the view is amazing but the steaks did not meet my expectations.  Sad

We ate at Prime for a party of four last Thursday. Let me say, I eat at a lot of steakhouses, and this was one of the first where I really had some sticker shock looking at the menu. Easily most expensive steakhouse menu I've seen.

That said, to some extent, you get what you pay for here. The service is EXCELLENT and the ambiance is perfectly upscale. The food is top of the line. Tuna Tartare and Bone-in Filet were both standouts. 

All around, outstanding dining experience.

One thing NOT in short supply in Vegas is Steakhouses! And Prime is up there with Ni9e, SW and The Palm. But, nobody has the view like Prime has. It is one level below the main floor looking right onto the lake and the fountain show. Pretty damn exciting. Single guys should bring a date here. 

I however, was on a business dinner that turned not too friendly, but that did not detract from the food. I had the smaller fillet, Medium Rare, some dauphinoise potatoes that were very good and the usual wine accompaniment. Service was outstanding. Nobody intruded when I was taking to task a supplier, and when things lightened up they came around doing what wait staff do. 

Atmosphere outstanding. The steaks were very Prime and it was a great eating experience. Forgot to ask if they had a blender. Maybe next time!

This is also a place you will want to take your time with--again if you are with someone

What a meal, what a restaurant! Great service, great food. Ordered a NY strip, truffle mashed potatoes and steamed asparagus. Steak was prepared to perfection, truffle mash were to die for and asparagus was perfectly al dente. My date ordered the lamp chops and loved them. Beware,  the order was huge- with 3 "Fred Flintstone" sized chops, again, perfectly prepared. I had been to the restaurant many times over the years and its is as nice a dining experience now as it was 15 years ago when it first opened. On a scale of 1-10, its an "11." Highly recommend.

View of the fountains priceless, weather priceless, food - just ok, service - barely ok.  Will not return. We eat out and travel a lot. I thought this would be the perfect combination of excellent service, food and ambiance. Instead it felt like an overpriced Disney experience. Jean George should take his name right off this one. The first bottle  of wine we ordered was out of stock, no big deal. We ordered another bottle, someone who appeared to be  the Somm came over, opened the wine, barely looked at us, poured and walked away.  Weird and awkward is how I would describe that experience.  I ordered the special , surf and turf.  It was a lobster tail that arrived sitting on grilled chili peppers and a filet.  There was no mention of surprise chili peppers with the lobster tail, and my boyfriend is allergic so I removed them and sent them back and kept the lobster.  The filet was blue inside, not the medium rare I ordered, so we sent that back. It came back a little closer to medium rare. The sides were overly salted and almost inedible. They took the fillet off of our bill but charged us for the lobster tail. As we were getting ready to leave the server reached  over to shake my hand and spilled my wine, he ran away and never came back. Which is what you should do as well. Go to Hyde instead. It's a great bar that overlooks the fountains, don't waste your money at Prime. We wasted  almost $500.00.

My colleagues and I went here to celebrate the end of a successful conference and this was the perfect place to do that at. We could all agree it was a delicious dining experience!

Our group started with the seafood tower as an appetizer and we were all going ga-ga over it. The crab legs, lobster, shrimp, and oysters were all fantastic. FYI, you can choose how many people you want to order it for because it does come with a ton of seafood. For example, our group size was 12 people but we only ordered the seafood platter for 5 and it was still enough for all of us. 

My favorite dish of the entire night was surprisingly the Market Tomatoes which contained burrata cheese, arugula, balsamic vinegar & basil. This was truly heavenly. I've already been craving it multiple times. 

For my entree, a colleague and I shared the Dry Aged Bone-In Ribeye. This was wonderful and cooked to perfection - ordered medium. 

Dessert was also delectable, order the donuts or bread pudding. You won't be disappointed. Wow, now I'm wanting to relive that meal over again. Go enjoy it for yourself!

10 years ago, I had a perfectly scrumptious dinner here.  I wanted a repeat on Dec. 16, 2015.  Didn't happen.  The steak I ordered to be pink inside, not runny red, turned out to be red in the WHOLE middle of the filet mignon.  I had to eat only the outside edges of the steak.  Even the $14 baked potato was not baked to complete softness.  Come on!!  Everything is overpriced, of course, as is expected in a tourist town, but please make the steak to order and bake your darn potatoes long enough.  Gee.  The servers were nice, but could have come by the table more often.  The restaurant was gracious enough to provide a special request I had made in advance for my disabled sister and I do thank them for that.

If you can get over the prices, the steaks are absolutely fantastic. The Dry Aged Ribeye is probably the best restaurant steak I've ever eaten in my life. Service was attentive, but our server actually argued with us a bit over whether or not there was lactose in one of the dishes. He brought out an ingredient list to prove his point. Bad form. Thankfully, the food overpowered the service... when steaks are that good, the service isn't enough to take away from my 5-star rating.

I have had the pleasure of eating at Prime several times and each time it just gets better.
The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and fast.  
The food is outstanding!  I have never had steak like Prime's before, nor have I ever been able to find anything that comes close.
My last visit I had the Coconut Souffle after it was suggested by a friend.  I'm someone who doesn't like coconut, but this was one of the best desserts I have ever had.
The prices are high, but it is totally worth it.  I am more then happy to put in the extra overtime at work just so I can go to Prime when I'm in Vegas.
went their sat nite with 11 people. Steak was tasteless. Food was just fare. overpriced. servive was good though but unfortunately you cannot eat service. Never go back. We stayed at ballagio though.

Prime is the perfect spot for a nice quiet romantic dinner for two.  It was great views of the lake and fountains.  It is across the street from the Eiffel Tower at the Paris Hotel so that added to the amazing g view.  Now having said that, a group of four were seated at a table next to my husband and I.  They were drunk and loud in the otherwise quiet restaurant.  They ruined the atmosphere, especially when one of the women apologized to her husband (for the entire restaurant to hear) for having her monthly flow during their Vegas trip.  Not something no one wanted or needed to know!  The service was excellent along with the food.  The steaks are cooked perfectly and the dipping sauces for the steak are a must try.  Make sure you dress up when visiting there is a dress code and the restaurant is very high class.

From front to back, floor to ceiling, Prime Steakhouse exudes sophistication.  Their wait staff are top echelon professionals who can actually educate patrons about the items featured in the menu.  We tried the dungeness crab cakes, bone-in rib eye, filet mignon, roasted wild mushrooms, creamed spinach, and lobster, and they were all beautifully prepared.

During dinner we noticed that they were preparing a small private banquet room that was situated close to our table. We jokingly asked one of our 3 servers if George Clooney was on the way. Our server wasn't sure, but he mentioned that he had waited on Mr. Clooney twice before.  Sweet!
Had free comp $$ To spend. Took 3 people and we all thought average at best. Steak not seasoned and took 10 minutes to refill a coke.

Okay, I have to say my food was very good, although my husband's steak was way over cooked. The reason for the two stars ultimately comes down to the service. I was so beyond unimpressed with our service, after we ordered our original drinks and food we were never checked in on, and were never once asked, in the two hours we were there, if we wanted another drink. We were also celebrating our anniversary which we included in the notes for our reservation. While they did bring us chocolates to help us celebrate, our waitor may have well as thrown them on our table, he said congratulations and walked away. Ultimately there are way too many great steak restaurants in Vegas to eat here get unimpressive service, we certainly wouldn't recommend anyone to go here based on the service we received and don't plan to go back.

I love steakhouses, steak, and different kinds of steak. What I love about Prime by Jean Georges, is that's its consistently good, which isn't the case with a lot of steakhouses. The service is always top notch, the dining room has a classy steakhouse feel to it, and it overlooks the beautiful Bellegio fountains. I tend to stick to the Rib Eye but the Fillet is also excellent and tender, and you can't really fo wrong with any of the starters. Been there many times and will continue to do so whenever I'm staying at the Bellagio. Never had a bad meal there.

I went to Prime for the first time. It was good but maybe I was biased  because  we had Delmonico Steakhouse  the night before.  
The service was definitely  lacking. They would come by then just dissapear and would have to  constantly  wave them  down. While the bone in ribeye  was tasty it was smaller and about 20 % more expensive  than  Delmonico.  
They  definitely  know how to prepare  a steak.  I would  just expect  the service to reflect  the prices they command .

Not up to par with Vegas standards.  Dining room is accented with blues and ivories against espresso colored wood.  Magnificent, but it did not hide the lack of bells and whistles in the meal.  The filet was less than spectacular, and the plate was barren.  You have to pay for your sides, I expect them to throw me a few spears of asparagus when I'm paying $50 for a slab of meat!  The crusted sea bass was a firmer texture, more like tuna or halibut.  I was impressed by the customer service and the austere presence of the dining room, but I certainly was not counting the days till I was coming back to this restaurant.  The fact that Las Vegas Life magazine named Prime the best steakhouse still won't bring me back here.

Everything was awesome except for the one thing we came for - the steak.  I am not sure what happened but the bone in rib eye was way over salted.  They took it back but the second piece of meat the brought out was way undersalted and not a quality cut.  Service and oysters awesome
The dry aged ribeye was fantastic, we also has the steamed shrimp salad.

Good lord!!! We order sooo much food, we had to take some of it home!!! 

Came here for a friends birthday celebration and we sat at a nice table with a great view of the strip and Bellagio fountains. Started off with drinks of course. I ordered the Prime Car which is made of Zaya rum (my favorite rum!!!) and orange Curaao served up with a sugar rim. It was fabulous, right up my alley, so much that I had a couple more. If you order the perfect gin and tonic, which is tangurey, tonic, cucumber and mint... Be aware that this is served in a wine glass, up with the bottle of fever-tree tonic on the side. This way it will not be watered down. 

We had two seafood platters amongst the 7 of us... And we demolished these! It had crab, lobster, oysters, mussels, clams and shrimp! Also came with a few trays of sauces. 

I ordered French onion soup, which came out to the table earlier than I expected, but was also taste worthy. 

Here comes the steak!!!! Amazing!!! I had the bone in ribeye and there were plenty of filets around the table. A steak is amazing if it doesn't need any additives... And although this needed no additives I just had to try the three sauces they offered on the table. The peppercorns had some spice too them and was my favorite! I had a couple bites of the sea bass too, and although it was good, it wasn't nearly as good as Noodles (restaurant also in Bellagio). 

Creamy spinach was a weird flavor to me. Shiitake mushrooms had ALL the flavor.  

We ordered blow job shots but really wanted Cinnamon Toast Crunch shots. I advise them to get Rum Chatta at the bar, it's becoming too popular now not to have it. 


We had a cake ordered at Jean Phillipe do we didn't order from the Prime dessert menu. 

Staff was very attentive; pulling out chairs to sit and collecting our belongings that fell on the floor. I really appreciated all their help. Would definitely come back!

Messed up our reservation that was made over month in advance. The lobster tail was below average, looked like something from outback instead of a top notch steak house. The lamb gave my home boy the runs and the truffle mash was just okay. Overall the wait staff was good.

Had my 30th birthday dinner here last week.. and it was absolutely a once in a lifetime night. The food is literally the most amazing thing we have ever tasted. There is nothing that beats the 12oz fillet, the truffle mashed potatoes, and the mushrooms. The Cesar salad and onion soup are perfect ways to start your meal.. and of course, for the big finale, the lava cake with Happy 30th Birthday written in chocolate ! Pricey... and I do mean.. PRICEY.. but worth it more than you know !! The window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains was well worth it. What an amazing, unforgettable night !

So disappointed. We arrived at 8:28 for an 8:30 reservation and were told "you're a few minutes early, they're working on your table, go inside and make yourselves comfortable." We went to the bar and had a phenomenal Old Fashioned that the very courteous bartender made for us. Then about 30 minutes went by, and many patrons had been seated while we were still waiting. The bartender, looking out for us, went to the hostess stand to ask about our status. When he came back, he told us that they gave him no information. At that point, we were done. As we left, we let the hostess know that we were going elsewhere. Here's the thing...and we aren't like this at all, but...it was my birthday dinner and we are guests of the Bellagio and staying in a premium suite. Completely unacceptable to have this level of service and unapologetic response when we express concern. Especially when we're suite guests in your hotel. We were looking forward to dropping $400 or so on your expensive dinner, however, we don't tolerate poor service in Vegas. There are too many other excellent choices.

Good food and very cool decor.  Seating was comfy.  The restaurant was dimly lit, which I like, but might be an issue for some diners.  Definitely a place where "pretty people" go to eat/ be seen.  We had a reservation and had to wait for 10-15 minutes, but nothing major.

I cannot give 5 stars because it was not the best steak that I ever had.  For a $62 filet, I was expecting a bigger serving than 10 ounces, but it was very good and cooked properly.  Another member of my party was disappointed in the cooking of his steak, which was ordered rare, but he still ate it and said it was good.  Meat quality wasn't the best and didn't seem to be as good as my favorite Chicago steak joints.

Our server was professional and knew his stuff, even after being questioned on random food details by the foodie member of my party.  He wasn't in our face, but was very attentive and also sent over a free desert for my friends birthday.....no singing thank God!

Would never tell anyone not to go there, but there might be better steak places in Vegas.  Because it's in the Bellagio and has a view of the fountains, can be considered a destination restaurant.

Took my boyfriend here for his birthday after googling best steakhouse in Las Vegas. He ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp for his appetizer and I had the salmon sushi, both where delicious. I went on to order the salmon for my main course and my boyfriend had a steak, we decided to share a side of spinach. We ended the night with dessert and my boyfriend got a free birthday dessert. We paid $270 for our meal that night. The service was amazing, everyone was very nice and attentive. The reason why I am giving it four stars is because the food did not wow me for the price. The salmon was not very tasty and the steak was not well seasoned. The only thing that I loved was the view, which I am guessing is what you are paying for when you go here. Other than that I don't think it's really worth the price. I've had tastier food in Vegas for cheaper (Try Lago).

Before anything, let me just say that this restaurant is expensive, so don't go here unless you're ready to pay top dollar for a fancy meal. It's a very classy place and while there is no jacket required, you really should plan to dress appropriately.

As you might expect, it has wonderful ambiance and upper echelon service. The steaks are aged well and cooked to perfection. If you want surf and turf, you may have to ask for it because it's not on the menu. Usually the server will inform you though that they do offer it and quote you a price. 

My buddy and I had a fantastic meal here and would definitely go back. I got a kick out of the waiter's reaction when I asked for ketchup to go with my fries. He said half jokingly, "Here we don't call it ketchup; we call it "sauce internationale." I thought that was hilarious.

Last time I came in it was with my wife and 2 friends and had the most unpleasant service I have ever experienced in my life to the point that I think it was done on purpose. We came in just before dinner, right after they opened and after walking the strip so we weren't in suits and jackets but we were still served. I feel like the waiter probably thought "These guys wont tip" or something so didn't really serve our table like he should have. Food was good, but the waiter was bad and it was the ONLY time in my entire life where I did NOT tip the waiter a decent tip because I felt he wasn't deserving of it. As we were leaving the same waiter ran up to us to offer the small tip we left in tip claiming 'we forgot our change.' I politely told him that he can keep it and walked out.

Also, we were not acting obnoxious or loud or being a problem to any one so there was no reason to act the way like he did towards us.  We were not even drinking alcohol - in fact one of my complaints is that I enjoyed a nice juicy steak with just a cup of ice that I had to chew since I drank my water before the steak arrived and the waiter was asked 3x to refill my glass.

I didn't bother on telling one there because I felt like that him and the host were talking about us so I felt like there wasn't anyone to complain to. After leaving, I choose never to stop in again and I probably wont.  

The food is worth a 4.5 star review itself because I actually did enjoy the dinner but after being served that bad, I thought a 2 star review was deserving enough.  Food was excellent but service was bad.

5 Stars for feeling like a fancy lady! I found this place by happy accident while cruising for a good spot to enjoy a cocktail and the famous Bellagio Fountain. While my vodka tonic was a little pricey, it IS Vegas and the sexy, elegant surroundings more than made up for it. The server was extremely friendly and the fountain view was good (I would have had THE view if I'd opted to enjoy dinner on the terrace). Make reservations if you're going for a meal: every table was full and they were booked for the night.

I love, love love this restaurant!  We have been coming to Las Vegas for years & we always make it a to go place every time we come here!  The food will be awesome, service excellent. If you sit on the patio, you have a front row seat of the fountain show!  I have posted pictures of our meal, loved every bite!

I reserved this place for my husband and I wedding dinner. We wanted something special and they sure did make us feel like it! All evening we were getting congratulated and well-wished by the staff. My husband had the dry-aged bone-in ribeye, and said it was one of the best he's ever had (and I agree), he also had a loaded baked potato, wow, and the side sauces were great ! ; I had the mushroom crusted salmon and mac n cheese (YUM)  - all very delicious. And big servings too- I had to save some for later. The restaurant was all around beautiful with a classy ambience mood to it. While we didn't have a full on view of the fountains, it was still all very pretty. We both really enjoyed our dinner. They even gave us a dessert that really made us go awe! 
THANK YOU Prime staff for a night we'll never forget!

Found this to be one of the highest ranked steak houses in Vegas through my 'Zagat' 2007 book.

I started off with their Foie Gras and thought it was above average but not exceptional.

I ordered the Porterhouse medium-medium well and it came with a trio of sauces for dipping. I was not impressed with the steak, again I would say above average at most. I did like the soy based dipping sauce but it almost overpowered the natural flavor of the steak. So with that said, I could of used practically any meat and dipped it into that sauce and it would probably taste the same. I didn't care much for the other sauces including the bearnaise. (bearnaise, usually is my preferred sauce with a steak)

On the other hand, their Truffle Mash Potatoes.. I must say is impeccable! The texture was on point and the amount of actual truffles (not truffle oil) is right on the money. I'd take this over the steak!

As far as the decor, I must say this place is very upscale. Try getting a window seat, its got a great view of the water/fountains.
best in all categories

Dude! By far one of the best restaurant experiences.  Food was amazing.  Oysters, bacon wrapped shrimp, bone in ribeye, lobster tail, dessert.   Wasn't disappointed.  Service was top notch. We sat on the outdoor patio.  10 stars.

This place was very expensive and is not for everyone. The prices are so high they could be easily mistaken for the calories for each meal. The food was ok if the place was more moderately priced. My French Onion soup was a whopping $19 and I have had better at Apple Bees. First of all I did not choose this place a college did so for that reason I was obligated to go here. Staff was on top of it although lacked the personality that should exist when working in this type of food service industry since technically they are earning  big tips due to the ridiculously priced items on the menu.

This was by far the best meal I've ever had in Vegas. It's super high-class and really doesn't cater to kids at all. They sat us outside where we had a perfect view of he fountain going off. It was completely romantic and made for an unforgettable night.

My husband and I each got a Caesar salad, shared an aged rib-eye, shared a 6 oz lobster tail and got the Mac n cheese as our side. We ordered the Mac and salad thinking that the portions would be small but that wasn't the case at all. The salad was huge and we had so much food that we couldn't finish the Mac. I'll be back for sure. Loved it.

Filet & lobster tail are mine and my fiance's go-to date night meal, and we've enjoyed some great steaks and seafood from Virginia Beach to Florida to Aruba, and I can say with complete confidence that Prime's food was the absolute BEST we've ever eaten.

My filet was impeccable: the most tender price of meat I've ever tasted and cooked to perfection. Same goes for the butter-poached lobster tail. My wallet is thankful we only visit once a year, but if you're in the mood to indulge and have a keen palate for steaks and shellfish, the meal is worth every penny (even better than Cut's pricey wagyu over at the Palazzo).

Did I mention the Bellagio's fabulous Dancing Fountains? The view on the patio can't be beat.

I've eaten here three times.

Twice with the same person, once with a friend of out of time.  When I informed the hostess that it was my friend's first time in the Bellagio and her first meal in vegas, she went out of her way to get us a table next to the glass windows overlooking Lake Bellagio and the dancing fountains.

The interior of this place is gorgeous.  Silver meets blue meets creme.  Gorgeous, unusual color scheme.  Intimate lighting.  

The first time I went I was a vegetarian who still enjoyed seafood, so I had seafood, flown in that morning from Alaska.  The seafood sampler I had for an appetizer was varied and fresh!

The New York Peppercorn Strip Steak I've had the last two times rocks -  The seasoning is well done and the steak is moist.  

Our waiter also rattled off all the ingredients in the sauces as well as brought all of them out so there was no having to pick and choose.  

My partner in crime, a connoisseur who literally travels the country/world in search of quality steak, considers this one of his favorites simply for that reason.  

And yes, the truffle mashed potatoes are indeed yummy.

We had a lovely evening at Prime. We were seated at the window with a fabulous view of the fountains. The room is beautiful and elegant.

Our servers, Walter and Carlos were friendly and attentive. We started with yummy cocktails and a bacon-wrapped shrimp appetizer. For dinner, I had the filet and hubby had the peppercorn-crusted New York strip, both were tasty, although mine was a tad overcooked for a medium rare plus. For sides, we had the mashed potato and asparagus. We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and we were surprised with a special dessert.

It was certainly a lovely evening and a delicious meal, but I wouldn't go back for dinner, perhaps a drink at the bar -- there are Vegas steak houses that are just as good (food and dcor) and a much better value. But we are glad to have had a special occasion at Prime for a splurge.
EXCELLENT dining experience, food was cooked superbly, staff very attentive I would definitely recommend this restaurant!!!!!!!!!! If your going to Las Vegas you MUST have dinner here!!!

came here for a special dinner this past Saturday. I made reservations a few days in advance for a table for two at 7pm in front of the fountains. 


The day of , i came in two hours earlier before going to the spa to show my noir card as the person who took my reservation suggested to ensure the fountain view. They said no guarantees but they will try..


At 7 we came in and had to wait an additional 20 minutes. No big deal. 

Our waiter was a bit awkward. He seemed to be in character of an over anxious server in a semi mocking way. Almost like Geoffrey from fresh prince of bel air. I also noticed he didnt speak like that to any of the other tables he served, his tone of voice and personality completely changed. But he remained in this character for our table. When he approached us he didn't introduce himself or ask how we were. Just asked if we were ready to order drinks from out of nowhere. 


We ordered the aged rib eye, short ribs, shrimp cocktail , and truffle mashed potatoes. 

The short ribs were so soft and tender. It was probably the stand out if the dishes we ordered. The shrimp cocktail came with four shrimps that were basically the size of baby lobsters i felt. Very meaty and enjoyable. 

The aged rib eye was good but left me wanting for a bit more. When i bit into it i couldnt help but think this was a somewhat mediocre steak. The three sauces it came with were fun, but i was slightly disappointed in the steak itself. 

The truffle mashed potatoes were good but very whipped, borderline runny; maybe more than what I'm used to. But the truffle flavor was definitely there. 

 We sat smack in the front of the fountains in the inside of the restaurant. During winter months it can be a bit cold. All in all im glad i tried this place out. However , i think one time is enough for me.

OMG, it was delicious! If you are looking for a fab steak in Vegas, look no further.

I dined on the patio, which is a total must - AMAZING view of the Bellagio fountains.

The staff were superb. Very friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive.

The bacon wrapped shrimp were huge and oh-so-delicious! The caesar salad was a bit unique in that it had mustard greens. Tasty dressing to boot. The filet mignon was huge! Perfectly cooked and super tender. And it came with sides of sauces. I have a serious love for bernaise and the bernaise here most definitely did not disappoint. Go with the bernaise! Lather it on your steak! And for sides, I had the mushrooms and truffle potatoes. The truffle potatoes were positively divine. Creamy and delicious. And the mushrooms were a fabulous compliment to the steak. I had zero room for dessert, but the desserts looked delicious.

I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience here. Prime is truly a top notch experience. A total Vegas must-do.

Its a pleasure to give out 5 stars. Everything was perfect. The service was outstanding. Very good sommelier, not over bearing strong knowledge. The waiter was great in a new york style. Very good opinions on everything. His advice was solid.
The foie gras was cooked perfect. The warm shrip salad is not to be missed. Our waiter insisted we share one. Thank you.
The steaks were cooked to perfection. The sides were fantastic. Cream spinich was made with cream. The steak sauces were excellent,thought yhe meat didnt need anything.
Every waiter and server was great. The decor was classic vegas steak house. I cant wait to go back.

Atmosphere and staff are phenomenal! Friendly and attentive. We sat outside and got an awesome view of the Fountains of Bellagio. Luckily it wasn't too hot and so happy we got that opportunity. It was prefect for our party of four. I ordered the roasted baby beets and it was amazing. As far as everything else -The scallops and lamb chops were good. Steaks were delicious and were on point (as they should for being a steakhouse). Yukon gold pured potatoes and Mac and cheese were yummy. 

Overall - loved this place from start to finish.

What an amazing experience. My boyfriend and I came here for a romantic night out during our Vegas getaway. We reserved a table for two on the beautiful terrace overlooking the strip and fountain show. We had the bacon wrapped shrimp for appetizer (a MUST!), the Chilean sea bass and parmesan crusted chicken with a side of mash potatoes and cream spinach. For dessert, we shared a blend of goodness (see photoEverything was absolutely delectable! I'm already looking forward to our next trip to Vegas as I'd like share this experience again. A true fine dining experience.

I never though that I could not enjoy a big bunk of lobster. But I guess it's possible. This place was just really pretentious without anything to back it up. Granted, we were a big group of 20-somethings but the place was pretty empty so I don't think a bad attitude was warranted. 

I think the theme of the night was quantity over quality. The shellfish platter was full of giant pieces of seafood that tasted like it came out of a freezer/buffet line. The lobster was really rubbery and flavorless, but it was cute that they de-shelled it in front of you. Perhaps I should have gotten steak at a steakhouse (who knew?) The creamed spinach and mashed potatoes were good, but nothing memorable. The creme brulee was really good (isn't it always) and the chocolate volvano souffle was also good. 

But i don't think anything would compel me to come back here. Even the deco is stuffy and pretentious. Boys, come here in a suit.

I was very impressed with the quality of the steak and the atmosphere was nice. Had the 28 oz Ribeye and they cut it for us so that we could share. Sat right by the fountain but unfortunately we were there at 5:30pm so really couln't enjoy the show which looks better at night. It's not a Mastros but decidedly better than most in Vegas. Wine list had some really expensive selections on there but went with the waiter's suggestion which only cost 60 bucks.

We came here today on a Saturday night, I made a reservation at 9:45 PM and I get my table right away, the restaurant was still quite full at the time I arrival, so I would suggest made a reservation if you want to try this place.
They don't have many dishes on their menu, this is very typical steak house, they do have a lot different choice of the steaks.
The environment and decorations inside is really upscale and elegant, a wonderful place for a romantic date or special events with friends. They did have some large round tables for large group, which is great
They also have some tables outside and right in front of the music spring , the view is fantastic.
Our server highly recommended their classical dye aged Bone in ribeye, it said the meat is seasoned very well and full of flavor. So we tried this one, it is so yummy and perfect cooked, highly recommend, but the potion a very large potion, I cannot finish mine
We also tried Bacon wrapped shrimp 
Warm asparagus salad with market mushrooms 
Truffle mush potatoes 
For the dessert, we tried cinnamon bread pudding, this one is so delicious, a must try as well
I have a wonderful time tonight, 5 star

The service was great, the food was good, but the people around us were the worst! I've never felt so uncomfortable eating dinner with my family. These people acted like they've never been around a 3 year old. Who, by the way, was fully occupied watching cartoons, and being quiet. I felt the stares the whole time. We had to cut our meal short because of these rude people. Someone actually had the nerve to come up to my dad and ask us to turn off the cartoons! WHILE WE WERE PAYING THE BILL! Also, the restaurant was pretty loud to begin with. The volume of the cartoons weren't even turned up fully. You would assume people who come to spend a good amount of money on food would have manners & mind their own business. But, no. We talked to a manager who was completely understanding, & while speaking to a manager ANOTHER person came up to my Dad interrupting my father's talk to the manager asking what his problem was! I never want to eat here again. It's not the food or service, it's the people.

I had the chance to dine here a while back but I didn't get to write my review. 5 star restaurant hands down, the food, ambience, service, and atmosphere is all amazing. Our waiter was so professional and helpful with the wine list and menu. The filet mignon, truffle potatoes, and vegetables are all so fresh and prepared exquisitely. We sat water front on the patio, while enjoying two bottles of wine. This was the best high quality restaurant I have ever been to. Our bill was over $800 but worth every penny. You pay for what you get, especially in Las Vegas. Just made another reservation to come eat while we stay at the Bellagio!

Likely the best meal we've had in Vegas to date!

Snagged an early (5:45pm) reservation last minute on Open Table. We had skipped lunch and were hungry early, so this was great.

Dress code says jackets are recommended, but I think I only saw one or two men actually wearing one. My husband wore a button down shirt and dress pants and looked fine. I saw men in Polo shirts, so don't worry about not being snazzy enough. It's the sort of place that is fine with business casual, but you wouldn't feel out of place if you got really dressed up.

We were seated right next to the window with an amazing view of the fountains. We had a main waitress, along with another waiter and a nice young man that served our drinks and cleared our plates. My husband ordered a glass of the house cabernet. Fair warning, it was $26! This is not the place to go if money is tight.

We skipped appetizers. My husband ordered the surf and turf (large lobster tail and beautiful fillet). It was the "special" that evening and came with a $120 price tag. I opted for the salmon which came in closer to the $40 mark. Although my salmon came with (fantastic) truffle mashed potatoes, we also split the gratin dauphinois. Highly recommend. Everything was divine! The sauces that accompanied my husband's steak were delicious and I practically licked my plate clean. 

The restaurant itself is beautiful. Very opulent. Decorated in light blue and chocolate brown. Heavy drapery. Food is brought out on a rolling tray under silver domes. Fancy schmancy. I was a bit surprised that my napkin wasn't swapped out for a black one since I was wearing a black dress. Seemed like the sort of place to do that.

We ordered the cheesecake, and while nothing out of this world, it was still delicious. The bill came. $320. Whew! This is now our most expensive meal to date. But you know what? You only live once. When in Rome (Vegas), right?
Phenomenal food, phenomenal service. You pay for quality as you should. Do not gripe about cost in a place like this. Go ,enjoy, tell friends how amazing it was
Amazing restaurant. The staff is very professional. Food is amazing! And when you sit outside you get the beautiful Bellagio fountain show every 15 minuets. Very romantic atmosphere.

The drone of hopeful millionaires waned as the six of us dipped into the paneled honeycomb of Bellagio's steakhouse, Prime. We had drifted away from the hoots and hollers of night owls and seemingly onto the set of a high budget film that hadn't decided whether its focus was Old Hollywood, Gone with the Wind or French Victorian. Blue, velvet drapes careened from ceiling to floor, busting from a girdle of gold chords that could easily fashion Scarlett's next dress. Fountains flitted outside the window like children intent on a game of tag and added just enough Disneyland amusement to complete this abstract portrait. 

Despite swiveled heads and rubber necks, we arrived at our table unscathed and dwarfed by an immense painting resembling Venus's sister (staring wide-eyed at our plates to ensure we ate all our vegetables). An ocean of carpet, thick enough to swallow any signs of dropped silverware, necessitated "Alice in Wonderland-like" gold knockers on the back of each chair for easy towing. 

Auditioning for the stereotypical role of "Jeeves", our waiter ascended with a raised nostril of disgust (Scene 1: sniffing dirty sweat sock) and upon ordering drinks (Scene 2: serving a stiff cocktail of contention), one of my culinary colleagues murmured, "I feel like the waiter thinks he's better than me." 

We laughed, but the apparent exasperation wasn't funny. Jeeves's superiority was stifling from the first wrinkle of his nose to his wafting stench of arrogance, and not only did it lessen our experience, but lowered the overall standard of the restaurant. A true upscale establishment ensures the customer's comfort at all costs and Jeeves couldn't even spare a dime.

Our annoyance was overridden by a dining cart bearing silver orbs of secrecy, each cover lifted and replaced in the edible version of "find the queen". My fork first tore at symbiotic landmarks of top grade tuna and avocado wading in ginger/ soy with its light, rejuvenating effects similar to a Fountain of Youth (for the palate). The salad set posed an ordinary looking Caesar like a diminutive wallflower, but beneath his classic cover laid a defined body and final punch of citrus that lifted his status to "crowd pleaser Caesar". 

Unfortunately, the crispy goat cheese fondue did not rival Caesar for top billing and was a disappointment in concept and taste. This tomb of fondue bandaged goat cheese (head to toe) in a fried, phyllo sarcophagus that trapped the necessary tart-n-creamy catalyst. "The curse of teeth rotting sweetness" attacked an unassuming frisee salad with grapes and pear vinaigrette (its pungent antidote only inches away).

The "meat and greet" came next with the promise of the protein packed main course that had led us here. My lamb chops, encrusted with chili crumbs, were ordered at medium rare, but arrived closer to rare. Still delectable, I ravaged them, dipping sporadically in the bevy of sauces accompanying the meal (barnaise, spicy pepper, etc.) The steak au poivre was paved with a thick asphalt of peppercorns (not a pothole of naked meat to be seen) with a potency that could remove tar. The tearing and coughing induced by this dish might be used as protection in a dark alley- the original pepper spray. 

Two of our other carnivorous constituents ordered the porterhouse- one requesting medium rare and the other medium. A couple bites into the meal, the medium rare "requestee" found himself in the middle of medium man's steak. Medium man had already manhandled the "mis-steak" placed before him (cooked almost exactly like the other) and munched happily on what he thought to be his order. This was inexcusable- not only did these prices demand perfection (around $50 a steak), but the moniker of "steakhouse" insists on the chefs' aptitude for mastering meat temperatures. This was a blunder that couldn't be overlooked as easily as Jeeves's snippy quips and would be the resounding memory of the meal (though thoughts of their lumpy, heavily salted mashed potatoes would be reminisced of fondly).

I could now empathize with Dr. Malfi's attraction to Tony Soprano. I was immediately enamored with this piece of work's over-the-top and muddled alter egos, but inconsistency and a mafia sized payoff eventually marred my fond feelings. As Prime puckered for its "kiss of death" in my final farewell, I still admired its larger than life character, but couldn't trust Prime's rep enough to invest that type of dough.

Soooooo disappointed in this place. Because this is Vegas I already expected dinner to be at least $200 +. But normally these restaurants come with the flavor so it lightens the blow to the pocket. I really wanted to have dinner here on the patio because they have the water show every 15min in the evening. I made reservations and requested seating on the patio. When we arrived at the time of our reservation we were told patio seating wasn't available & a table would be available in about 40min or so. What was the point in making a reservation (rolls eyes). We sat at the bar and ordered drinks until our patio seat was ready. The service was sooooo slow. I felt like we had to run our server down half the time or ask other servers to go get him.
