We ordered shrimp cocktail for an appetizer which was typical. For my entree I had the chicken which was actually good. My fianc had the steak which was extremely undercooked & not medium well like he requested. For sides we had the sweet potato mash that they put they remix on. It was interesting... I think you'll love it of hate it... I hated it. I also ordered steamed broccoli. The server brought it out with a mountain of cheese on top of it. I ended up sending it back because I specifically asked for just steamed broccoli. He offered to remake it I told him no thanks I was really over it at that point. On the bright side the water show was really beautiful. We really enjoyed that part.
Absolutely amazing quality food. The tuna tar tar was exceptional . Pricey but worth it. Very classy and service was great as well.

Probably the best steak I have ever had. My knife actually fell through the prime cut. The sauce selection they have blew my mind. They had a separate waiter bring out a tray with 6-8 different unique selections to choose from. The view is beautiful too, right on the water where they have the fountain show. Even though this place is really fancy, they let me stroll through in jeans and a tshirt haha.

Not too impressed. Went with two friends and each ordered steaks. All of us ordered them medium and each was delivered medium well to well done. The server offered to exchanged them but we were running to a show and the service had already taken quite a while. For a $62 filtet - you would be better served at N9NE or the Capital Grille. Also, for some reason I find it insanely cheesy when they have the photographers running around from table to table taking professional photos and asking for $30 each. You just ruined my steak and want to charge me $30 for ONE single photograph? 

Tip - ignore their dress code of "jackets preferred for men." This must be a joke. The place was packed when we got there and not one guy was wearing a jacket. We did see one guy in a wife beater, another in sweat pants, and another in shorts (supposedly not allowed).

***This review is for 10/16/17

Oh my what an experience! First off, this restaurant is in a prime (pun intended) location just over looking the Bellagio fountains. We were able to watch the shows during our entire evening, which was lovely. You also have the option to sit out on the patio. The interior of Prime exudes luxury, with long, tapestry like curtains hanging from the ceiling everywhere in a rich colors and fabrics. 

The service was wonderful from the moment we walked in! I love having a good steak dinner to celebrate (this time for my birthday) and this place did not disappoint. They had a lovely selection of bread prior to our soup and salads arriving (try the French Onion it was perfect). My husband also enjoyed their house Old Fashioned and said it was on point. I enjoyed the filet for dinner while my husband had a NY strip. Both were cooked perfectly. But what put them over the top was a house ginger sauce. It was to die for. We also enjoyed the mashed potatoes with truffle oil (was eh) along with the Brussels sprouts with pear, and that was a lovely side! 

Lastly, we enjoyed the chocolate cake for dessert, plus cappuccinos. It was perfect. Highly recommend this place for a steak and ambiance that wows!

Celebrated my husbands birthday at Prime, we sat out on the patio with a view of the fountain. Service was GREAT! Everyone was so nice. The food, ugh I think this was the best meal we had in our weeks vacation. Yes it was spendy but it was worth it.

Hmmm...beautiful steakhouse, gorgeous chandeliers, ornate curtains and fabulous decor. Don't let the decor distract you from the food. Very average at best and service was simply standard, nothing memorable whatsoever. Lamb chops were gristly, and I don't know about that overly spicy and salty mint jelly, spread on top of each chop, I wish they had left it on the side or forewarned me that they were served with jelly.  Breaded chicken cutlet was overly sauced and too lemony for our liking.  The spring split pea soup and iceberg lettuce salad were just okay. That about sums up our dining experience.

We dine at Prime in the Bellagio last night. It was exceptional service and food. From the gorgeous decor, to the view of the fountains the place was elegant and very romantic. I ordered the salmon sushi appetizer which was delicious along with the juicy New York strip. My husband enjoyed his wedge salad and bone in ribeye. Our waiter was excellent and so were the drinks.

Some folks prefer CUT, but this is my favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas.  I have visited nearly a dozen times, and I have not ever been disappointed.

You can sit outside if you wish on the patio.  The seating outside is somewhat limited, so ask for it ahead of time for a better chance of dining outside.  You are ground level with the famous Bellagio fountains, you just can't beat that.

I have tried nearly all of the cuts of beef, and they are always prepared perfectly.  My personal favorite is the New York Strip. 

The sides are large enough for two folks to share, at least.  The baked potato could also be shared if you wish.  If you order the baked potato loaded, it will come with plenty of high quality options.   The asparagus is crisp, salty, and buttery... just fantastic.  The mashed potatoes are not the best I have ever had, just not creamy enough for me, although I did not leave any on the table.

The service here is top notch, nothing to worry about there.

You can't go wrong with any of my top four steakhouses in Las Vegas:

1. Prime
2. Cut
3. Jean Georges
4. Bizarre by Jose Andres
Mediocre service. Seafood and meat that didn't measure up to other steakhouse along the strip.

For our last night in Vegas, three of us decided to dine at Prime. We had an amazing view of the fountains and an amazing last meal in Vegas. Pedro took great care of us and our Filet Mignons and NY Strip Steaks were amazing. I would highly recommend trying Prime.

One of the top five meals I have EVER had in my life.  My friend has eaten here before and he wanted me to experience this amazing restaurant.  We had a nice table off to the side with a partial view of the fountains.  Since it was my first time at the restaurant my friend let me have the chair with the view.  We decided to share our plates.
1.  Steak Tartare:  This was the main reason why I came.  It was magical.  The punch of flavors was amazing.  You pick up different flavors all over your palette.  
2.  Crab Cake:  The subtle flavor of the crab was allowed to shine.  The spice was just right to add to and not take away from the crab.  
3.  Beat and Goat Cheese Salad:  This was the only item all night that I liked, but wasn't blown away by.  The quinoa and pumpkins seeds were not my favorite.
4.  Peppercorn Rib Eye:  We both loved the Rib Eye, but we agreed that the next time we come we would opt to get something else.  We felt the peppercorn wasn't needed on such amazing cuts of steak.  
5.  Veal Chop:  Best veal I have ver had.  The meat was perfectly cooked and juicy.  The meat was outstanding on its own.  It didn't really need the rich sauce that accompanied the meat.  
6.  Cream Spinach:  Excellent
7.  Truffle Potato Gnocchi:  Flavor overload!  Incredibly reach and decadent.  
We skipped dessert and opted to have a cappuccino instead.  We ended speaking with a lovely group of ladies at the next table visiting from England and we joined them for coffee.  
One thing that I LOVED about this experience - we were not rushed.  We arrived at 9 PM and left the restaurant at 1:20 AM.  We were able to savor every bite and enjoy our company over an amazing meal.  After the restaurant emptied out a bit my friend moved his chair to the other side of the table to see the fountains too.  Wonderful experience.

My husband and I love steakhouses and of course this was one of the hot spots that we had to try. I had a couple of people recommend this restaurant and I was so excited to try it out when we got to Vegas. The decor is lux and beautiful. Very elegant but not too much. Low lighting created a great romantic atmosphere. Especially the booming of the water fountains at Bellagio.What great entertainment. 

Well with all the ambiance I was drooling for what more has to come. The service was great, staff was very nice but it wasn't outstanding for an expensive restaurant especially for Vegas. The bread and butter was nothing to rave about. So come on steak! I'm a Rib Eye fan and always order it so then I can do a fair comparison for the quality and taste of the steak. When the steak had arrived, I dived into it and kept on cutting and cutting. Well it wasn't as buttery as I hoped. The fat on it didn't taste that great. And the meat itself was okay. Don't get me wrong. I did eat a majority of it with the three accompanying sides. 2 out of 3 were good. The mushrooms I would not recommend but the potatoes with the bacon marmalade was very good. My husband didn't think his steak was amazing either but we loved seeing the fountains. 

Would I recommend this place? No not really. There are so many amazing restaurants in Vegas this one was not one of them. It wasn't that it was bad but it was just disappointing. The one steakhouse that was unforgettable is STEAK from Gordan Ramsey at the Paris. That place I give 5 stars.

Pricey, but we weren't disappointed.  We reserved online and got a table with a view overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  The seafood platter appetizer was delicious, featuring a variety of shrimp, clams, oysters and a huge crab leg and lobster tail.  The bone-in filet was excellent - perfectly cooked and full of flavor.  The lamb was a little less than spectacular, but still good.  Despite being completely full, we had the chocolate cake and lemon tart desserts. Both were exceptional.
pricey, but worth it.  steak was cooked perfectly and the atmosphere was very refined/classy.

This place is worth every penny. We had a fairly expensive dinner (final bill for dinner with tip was $400 for 2 of us) on Friday nite of Memorial Weekend. We made our reservations by walking by the restaurant on Thursday nite, so it was kind of last minute. They had a sign that the dress code was business casual or something like that. We took note of that. We had Friday 5;30pm reservations which we didnt mind since we like to eat early anyway, so it was perfect. 
Got seated very fast, right by the window, looking at the fountains. It's odd to see the fountains dancing, but not to hear the music for it though :), just didnt have the same effect. 
Our waiter was an older gentleman, with superb service skills. He suggested items, described them really well, same with wine. We were going to order a bottle of good ol' Joseph Phelps, but he suggested something else as well and we tried it. Weren't disappointed! (would like to point out that we are frequent wine tasters so feel to have some ability to distinguish wines). 

For appetizer we had shrimp cocktail (huge pieces of shrimp, I could barely eat it all). Main course was lobster (amazing!,and 8oz was just right) and fillet mignon (for hubby, rare, excellent!). The side dishes were great as well, the truffles mashed potato was to die for, as was the crunchy potato! For dessert we shared the chocolate cake (melted chocolate inside and ice cream on the side). Yum. 

The only complaint - as we tried to dress as best as possible, I was astonished to see a couple at the next table wearing 'jean's'. And another guy at another table as well. Com'on..Why have the sign up if you aren't going to enforce it? ('Jacket Preferred') As we were leaving, there were people wearing evening gowns for godsakes, why would you wear crappy jeans to a place like this??? 

I would definitely go back to this place on our next visit!
After reading comments about all the discrimination, we were quite hesitant to make a reservations. Although we did have to wait 45 minutes the meal was actually phenomenal.

Ahhhh. It is consistent, beautiful view if you get to see the fountain. The outdoor tables next to Prime are Fun.  Honestly, I just can't get really excited about Prime. Nothing bad... Nice food... Just regular.  Not a fabulous thing to say.... It's nice... You are at Bellaggio, how bad can it be.  Lol

Excellent steaks! Perfectly cooked (medium rare) dry-aged bone-in ribeye and bone-in filet; very succulent. Fantastic truffled mashed potatoes with real truffles and not the usual overwhelming use of truffle oil. Very good wine menu.
Really amazing steak and truffled mashed potatoes.  One of the best steakhouses I have been to.  The view of the fountains gave the 5th star.

Went to Prime for a birthday dinner celebration; we were not disappointed!

Service
Excellent as would be expected for a restaurant of this caliber. Seated quickly with a reservation. Server was professional, knowledgeable, friendly, and down to earth. Not at all stuffy. The server managed the dining experience while others performed the job of bringing the food and cleaning up. Water was always topped off. We were checked on at appropriate times but in a very unobtrusive way allowing time for conversation. Pace of the meal was excellent with just the right amount of time between courses to not feel rushed but also not feel like the wait was too long. 

Ambiance 
Very classy and upscale interior inside the Bellagio. Some dark woods and dark upholstery giving it .. a somewhat "heavier" feel inside than the competing SW Steakhouse at Wynn. Upscale without feeling overdone.  

Food
Everything was really just superb. Unique cocktails from the bar were beautifully presented.  The breadbasket... omg!  The pretzel bread was out of this world. The Caesar salad was one of best I've had. And the steaks, of course, are the highlight of the meal. Perfectly cooked. Sides are ala carte - try the mushrooms and of course the classic mashed potatoes!  The baked Alaska dessert was delicious with a passion fruit filling. Such a rare dessert to find in a restaurant. A plate of truffles was also provided since we were celebrating a birthday. 

Mojo
Exceptional. Great service and great food. Slightly more traditional interior design than the competing SW Steakhouse at Wynn but otherwise both are similar in many respects. Upscale dining at comparable prices, but your money is well spent here for an exceptional meal.

Had dinner at prime at Saturday, way overpriced for the quality and taste, service was OK not excellent, I would say the best part of dinner was dessert and the bread, had the bone in filet medium rare and it was just ok have had much better steaks at other vegas steakhouses including delmonicos and delfriscos, I give it 3 stars only because of ambiance and location next to the lake, also the potato neoche was very good

Came to this place for my boy friend's birthday dinner,
We order Crispy Salmon Sushi as our appetizer, and for our main course was FILET MIGNON for me and SOY-GARLIC GLAZED NEW YORK STRIP for him. And we ordered ice wine too, expensive but worth it. The foods was GREAT the way waiter served us was good too. Lil bit pricey but its okay, he enjoyed the meals and the views too, thats all matter.
I gave 4stars is because they put someone's order drinks into our billed and we just realized the next day. So.. Just becareful of that.
This meal was worth every penny.  Sitting on the edge of the patio with views of the Bellagio's fountains is, in my humble opinion, the best way to enjoy an awesome steak dinner!

Eating at Prime is one of my favorite steak dining experiences....Predisposed with a warmly lit restaurant which faces the Bellagio fountains helps with that experience and really makes it special.  Every 15 minutes or so, you'll get a glimpse of the show and really creates a relaxing, decadent ambiance.  The table service / waiters, for the most part, are professional and up to par in fine dining service.  

I've had some outstanding meals here...the best ones included the Seafood Tower which included fresh oysters, gargantuan crab legs, huge prawns/shrimp, and lobster claws - all accompanied with all the dipping sauces.   As for the meal, I go for the New York strip as is my favorite cut, and sides of creamed spinach and mashed potatoes are never-miss choices.  I just love the whole experience from soup to nuts.   A great one to put on your bucket list if you're looking for a high-end steak house while in Vegas.

Food was some of the best my wife and I have had.  Our waiter on the other hand, meh.  Just a heads up, if you order a soft drink ,  they charge for each one and it is just a fountain drink.  Still an awesome experience!

My experience at prime was mediocre at best. Considering the price I don't think I've ever paid this much for a meal I didn't like. Medium rare fillet took almost an hour, and arrived medium well. I sent it back because I refuse to pay $70 for a poorly cooked steak. I asked for assistance with wine and apparently there is no Somme. My waiter just pointed to other wines and said this one is good. I was willing to spend hundreds on a bottle of wine but that shook my confidence so I went with what I knew. There was a crazy amount of salt in the potatoes and all of the sauces. Even after sending two dishes back no manager ever checked in with us. This place is a high end tourist trap that does not focus on quality. Avoid.

Albeit  it is a steakhouse, if you wan the BEST Roasted Chicken in Vegas, this is the spot.  The food here is amazing.  

Here are my favs:

Arugula Salad
Veal Chop
Roasted Chicken
Chickpea Fries

Reservations are necessary and dress fabulous.

I eat out multiple times a week and entertain customers often all over the country.  I made reservations for Prime a month in advance, requesting outdoor seating knowing in late April the weather would be fine if the wind was not too bad.  The restaurant has a front row seat for the fountains in front of the Bellagio and without all of the hard surfaces should be a quieter dining experience.

I arrived ten minutes prior to my guests only to be told by the hostess that my seating request could not be honored.  When I pressed her, she said that she could possible seat us outdoors if I wanted to wait forty five minute to an hour.  I told her I had already been waiting a month and told her I would just accept the indoor seating.

Once my guests arrived, the rest of the evening went well.  The restaurant was not too loud, the service was good and the food was very good.

I haven't been to prime in a few years with the huge selection of steak houses in vegas and we went last night with some people staying at the Bellagio and it was excellent!  All the food was great the the few steaks we had and the tuna and all the sides were all great.  The only reason i'm not giving this place a 5 is that they have an old school dress code requiring pants and my father in law had to get a "loaner pair" from them.  As long as you wear pants, this place is great!!!

Always an enjoyable evening at Prime. This time we dined with a dear friend alfresco on the lovely patio while watching the beautiful fountains of Bellagio. Ambiance makes all of the difference and this was over the top! We highly recommend the patio if you are lucky enough to score one of the few choice tables. We dined later in the evening which probably why we were able to land the choice patio seat. Prime has always been rated as one of the top steakhouses in Las Vegas but they also have a great selection of seafood. My seared rare tuna steak lightly coated in pepper was among the best I've had. My spouse and our guest shared a beautifully prepared 10 ounce filet but certainly could have chosen many other prime cuts that looked utterly amazing at the surrounding tables. Large selection of sides to share made our meals complete. Service
Is certainly among the best too with multiple attendants hovering over us in a respectful manner. It's a "prime" experience dining a Prime.

This is my favorite restaurant in the whole world. The amazing options you have are endless. If you're a steak lover like me, this is the go to place for you. You'll never go wrong with the Bone-in Rib Eye... this place is a must if I'm in Vegas and I look forward to dining here every time. I wish this steak house was in LA too, so that I can dine here more frequently. Also, the workers are very sweet and always make sure you are enjoying your food. Check this place out, you won't regret it!

What a restaurant! Incredible wine list, sampled some of the best white and red wine that I've had. The seafood sampler appetizers were incredible, including everything from crab and shrimp to mussels, oysters, and clams.

On the day we were in, they had a special which was a 10oz bone in filet, and it was incredible. Perfectly charred while tender and medium inside. Not that it needed any sauces, but they also brought 3 nice options, one with some great spice. The chocolate cake dessert...how can you go wrong?

I give this place a soft 3.   Let's forget that steak in Vegas is ridiculously priced for a minute.  Service was a bit slow and the $70 steak I ordered was so salty I almost couldn't eat it.  I was too impatient to send it back so I ate it.  Mine potatoes gnocchi was not too good.  It lacked texture and firmness.  Can't comment on desserts as we did not order.
The atmosphere was very dark and sleepy.   A little more light would be better,

The real thing that is dropping the star count in my eyes was the pushiness of the photographer that intrudes on your table and starts takin photos.  She shows up at dessert with the photos and basically assumes you are buying them.  When you decline she gets huffy.   For the level of restaurant and the prices I am not interested in being hustle into buying picture.   Prime should consider this and develop a softer approach.

Mediocre food served in a well appointed dining room. This was our first time at this restaurant and Prime's dinner was good but definitely not worth the price. Comparatively, I would rather eat at Botero (at the Encore) or Jean George's (at the Aria). 

We began the meal with oysters which were very fresh. They only serve Fanny Bay, so don't expect variety. We followed with an over dressed and average tasting Caesar salad.  The biggest disappointment though is the quality of the meat. I had the bone-in ribeye and my girlfriend had the filet. Both pieces of meat were good, but not worth $66 and $67 respectively. They tasted like choice meant you could get at Costco. The Brussels sprouts are very good but the mashed potatoes have way too much butter. 

The best part of the meal was the cinnamon bread pudding. Everything about it is phenomenal, from the presentation of the melting chocolate dome to the apples at the bottom. 

We will not be returning.
I loved this place . The food and the customer service were over the top . I loved how elegant the placed looked and the atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this place .

Gorgeous view!   You can't beat the elegant cozy ambience sitting alongside the Bellagio fountains.  

Seafood platter - raw clams, raw oysters, muscles, prawns, lobster, crab. Served with a plethora of sauces, your typical vinegar, horseradish, cocktail sauce, tabasco.  Everything elevated on a bowl of ice. My does it feel grand. A bowl for shells conveniently located just underneath.  To prepare you for the next course, a warm damp dinner napkin garnished with a lemon to cleanse your hands.  

Tartar and carpaccio - if you love it raw ;) you'll love this.  The drizzled sauce makes the carpaccio. It's delicious!   

Sides - creamed spinach, truffle mashed potatoes, beans... Probably the smallest serving of side dishes I've seen.  At least you can have space to try a little bit of everything. 

Steak - filet mignon *heart eyes* if this steak could be cooked any better, I doubt it. PERFECTION. just the right texture without char to the outside... Nice and tender on the inside.   Juicy and perfectly medium rare (how it should be ;) ) For the way it is seasoned I would never even think to adulterate it with unnecessary sauces.  3 sauces come alongside.  The famous one they point out, with ginger is TO DIE FOR.  

I always appreciate good food, the best is the kind you crave. I read somewhere, that is the goal of the chef here.  With that sauce I refused to try, because I knew I didn't need it.  Icing on the cake, mission accomplished!  I already feel the withdrawals. 

Service was excellent.   With a party of 6 I would say everything went smooth.  I'm ready for a date night with Prime!

P.S.  I forgot my designer bag at the table. It was turned in to security next the to main cage in the casino.  I was able to retrieve it as soon as I realized.  Thank you much!

My husband and I went here for dinner this week because for one we are vegan and saw they had a separate vegan menu  but still wanted the fancy dining experience of Las Vegas. Everything was great and so delicious! The service started a little slow but came together and everyone was friendly and curious about veganism! They even brought out separate vegan bread for us. The vegan pea soup is to die for, so creamy and delicious and elegant, all in one bowl! The risotto was also on point and very flavorful, as were my husbands market vegetables. We were too full for dessert but will have to try their coconut sorbet next time! Thank you Prime Steakhouse for catering to vegans, it is much appreciated! :)

It was my 30th birthday and I wanted to go somewhere out of or norm and figured after wanting to go here many vacations before FINALLY splurged to eat here, but unfortunately the hype fell very short!

We made reservations for 5:00 and I was disappointed there was no confirmation call or e-mail to say hey your reservation is booked, etc. I had to call and I guess call me crazy, but it's that extra little touch that at least makes you feel special.

On a bright note, my wife and I did get to sit outside on the patio in the nearest table facing the fountain which was an experience to say the very least. It really felt VIP like to sit that close to the fountain and with a sun burn getting the mist from the fountain show upon its completion was an added bonus.

Collectively we had the same problem with our steaks. We both ordered the filet mignon medium and it was more of a how to cook steak diagram. The ends were burnt, the middle was far from medium, and that just didn't cause for a great feeling. We also ordered crab mashed potatoes which were way too buttery and the crunchy potatoes which certainly lived up to that, but that's NOT a good thing. It was too crisp on the outside and mashed in the middle, but the taste honestly just wasn't there.

The worst feeling overall was hearing my wife feel like she didn't belong there. It seemed from the very beginning the staff felt that as well and displayed that all through the meal. It seemed they looked down on us and my wife even said one of them ran to our table after we left just to make sure we paid. REALLY? If I was in the right mindset I would have dealt with that, but honestly Karma is a you know what.

Truth be told they can continue to prepare sub par side orders and wow with a chef who clearly didn't know a medium prepared steak without us. Now drench your house made steak sauce in that Prime!

I've only been to Vegas maybe twice since I've turned 21. In those few visits, I made it a point to try at least a couple of top-rated restaurants, Prime Steakhouse included. This dinner was specifically in honor of my boyfriend's best friend's 40th birthday. We requested window seating and were luckily seated at a table that gave us a front-row view of the water show at the Bellagio. 

Bacon-wrapped shrimp - plump, juicy and accompanied by a sweet, delicate passion fruit mustard and honey.

Foie gras dumplings - musty taste of liver slightly masked by thickness of the wrap and sweetness of figs.

Truffled mashed potatoes - haven't experienced a failed execution of this dish at any restaurant.

Filet mignon - one of the juiciest, well-seasoned cuts of filet I've ever had, even compared to Ruth's Chris.

Bone-in ribeye - had a bite since it was my boyfriend's steak, but tender and perfectly seared.

Glazed market mushrooms - an excellent side to any steak meal.

I could do without the small services of shishito peppers as they did not add much value to my meal. 

Overall, one of the top steakhouses to which I have been!

Perhaps this would have been a better experience if...
1. Our dining companions didn't have to leave before dinner was served b/c they were sick,
2. Their dinner was promptly delivered to their room, as promised, instead of cold and over an hour later,
3. We got to sit on the patio, as requested (patio was closed due to wind, although it didn't seem windy) or
4. The $500 dinner tab matched the quality.

Don't get me wrong, it's a dimly lit, nicely decorated restaurant, with a good menu.  The steaks were cooked correctly and the sides were tasty.  When compared to other steak restaurants we have visited, and for the price, we expected to be blown away and were not.  

If you get a chance to sit on the patio and view the fountain show while dining, I would definitely check it out.  That would be amazing.  Otherwise, save your steak appetite for somewhere more deserving your money.

Prime is a great steakhouse.

The view of the water show at the Bellagio is fantastic, should you opt for the outdoor seating.

The steaks are wonderful, as was the Seafood Shellfish to share amongst the non-selfish :) - - clams, mussels, oysters, shrimp, crab and lobster

The service is good as well.

I had the bone-in-fillet mignon, which was perfect!

This can be what I'd say one of the better ambient sort of romantic steakhouses in Las Vegas, a good place for a meat eating date.

The prices are of course higher than your typical meat and potatoes restaurant, but if you're accustomed to paying $50-80 for a steak, this is a good place.  The avg meal after tax/tip with a drink or appetizer should set you back about $150 per person at minimum, and once you add bottles of wine and the high end appetizers you're closer to $200-250+ per person to do it the right decadent way not holding back and just having a good time... YOLO !!!

ORIGINAL Two-Star Review:

A co-worker and I ate dinner here during a convention stay - this was not our first time to visit this particular restaurant, but the experience this time left a lot to be desired.  We made a reservation and were promptly seated - after ordering, our salad came out then we waited over an hour for our steak and sides to be delivered.  Meanwhile, our waiter disappeared on us yet all of the tables seated after us received their meals and, in one instance, finished their meal and left before we were served.  Our waters were promptly refilled by the staff but it would have been nice to have our waiter come back by to see how we were, offer us another cocktail, etc.

We had to call over a manager (once we finally found one) to inquire about our order.  Lo and behold, it came out five minutes later - no apologies or explanations. The food was good, but this is the most expensive restaurant we ate at during a three-day convention.  For these kind of prices, you should reasonably expect good service.  There are a lot of good places to eat / steakhouses on the Strip, and I would recommend you take your hard-earned money elsewhere.

12/19/17 Updated Review:

I was subsequently contacted by Anna H., the General Manager of the Restaurant, and we exchanged a dialogue of emails.  She graciously offered to comp the meal and remove it from my room bill - that happened, but in a case of bait-and-switch five days later they put the full amount of the charge back on my credit card.  Attempting to contact Anna again, this time by telephone at her alleged direct number, I was informed the staff was unable to take a message for her, unable to answer questions, nor does the staff have voicemail.

This is an amazing display of a lack of customer service - the managements says they are going to give a refund, give said refund, then charge back the full amount less than one week later.  My not going to the Bellagio for my annual visit certainly won't hurt the MGM's bottom line, but you truly see where they stand in terms of customer service.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Went back recently and they still have a phenomenal steak, wish they always had the tuscan fries though.

Its fair to say that we won't be returning to Prime

*We made our reservation for Valentine's Day a month in advance and were only able to dine at 10 pm :( call in December perhaps)
*We called on the day of to see if we could come earlier but nothing was available (shucks)
*We were stuck in traffic and called to let them know we would be late and we were informed that we MUST arrive by 10:15pm. Arrived and our table was clearly ready (could have come earlier?) and there were several large parties that hadn't ordered their entrees (why MUST we be here at 10:15? The kitchen is clearly still open)
*Had a comp sent from our host but the front door staff was unable to locate it and after two people came to our table during our meal it was finally located (organization??)
*Our server was as bland as my filet,  he had zero personality and no enthusiasm (long shift?)
*Filet was ordered medium (preggo lady here, but it was nowhere close so I could only eat a few bites and didn't take it to go) sadly it needed the sauce they privided...not my kinda steak plus it was tough
*Husband loved his rib eye but that was the highlight of our meal, the bacon wrapped shrimp was a close second, and the creamed spinach in third
*Asparagus salad, mushrooms, fingerling potatoes, chocolate cake and creme brulee were boring at best
*There was a really nice back waiter with a unique name from LA that deserved praise. I want to say Rajuk but I'm sure I've moved the vowels around and this is as close as I remember but he was very personable, funny and kind. Give him a promotion asap!
*I really enjoyed dining at Jean Georges in the Aria and in the future I'll stick to my waygu beef. Good bye Prime.

Prime at Bellagio, the last night in Vegas, heads above the meal we had at Gorden Ramsey Steak. Atmosphere, service, and food were all A1, and our server Phong was very attentive without being overbearing, we didn't have to ask for a single thing. Champagne, wine, french onion soup (the best I've ever had) and a shrimp cocktail with 4 huge shrimp, 2 filets perfectly cooked with a shared side, and a shared dessert, and the bill was $309 including a 20% tip. I would definitely return.

It's become a tradition for the sales team I'm on to come here each year. When I dine out, my top priorities are food, service, and ambiance (in that order). Prime exceeds my expectations every visit.

If you like steak, this is the place to get it! Try the steak sauce they recommend that is only available at Prime. My favorite dishes are the tuna ribbon salad and Dover sole. We always get the chocolate dessert as well:)

Make sure to request a table by the window, so you can get front row seats to the water show in front of Caesar's. Fantastic experience all around every time!

Yes, it's expensive but it's worth it.  The service and food was excellent. We started with a tomato and burrata salad, which was delicious, and followed with steaks. I had the filet mignon and it was one of the best I've ever head. Perfectly cooked, tender, and very flavorful. We were there celebrating our anniversary and were able to sit on the terrace overlooking the fountains. What an amazing view! At the end of dinner, they brought us a complimentary plate with several assorted truffles. This is now one of our favorite special occasion restaurants in Vegas.

Delicious food, amazing service and I highly recommend this to everyone who dines fine.... they were so accommodating...they made special sauces for me due to my interesting dietary restrictions lol. They won my heart! Thank you to both Walter and Rob for being very caring waiters and making sure all our needs and wants were met!
Excellent food. Excellent service. Very intimate. Try to get a table near the window.

Bar none the BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER TASTED! I got the Dry Aged Ribeye and it was AMAZING! The Truffle Mashed potato was a great side order for this wonderful steak. Add the fact that they gave us a great table with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains, this was an unforgettable experience.

Food and atmosphere were excellent. Server and wait staff were great. Hostess staff was disappointing - didn't seem to care that we were there for our 20 year anniversary and that we requested a patio table months in advance. Kept trying to seat us inside even though outside tables were available. They tried to explain that the 4 top tables were for larger parties instead of our party of two yet they were trying to seat us inside at a 4 top. Once we were finally seated, the hostess just dropped us at the table without any further acknowledgment, as if she were annoyed to sit us there. As we were dining, several other 4-tops outside were sat with parties of two which contradicted what we were told multiple times. Made what was supposed to be a really special night start out very frustrating, especially for the amount of money we spent. I don't usually write reviews but felt compelled to share our story. Overall the dinner was lovely. Just started out really disappointing.

My friends and I ate here on our first night in Vegas the last time we were in town. Two of my friends had been before, but this was my first experience. When I first walked into the restaurant, I was immediately struck by the traditional cushion-y blue velvet chairs and all of the heavy draperies. Stuffy, perhaps, but also beautifully and tastefully done.

I would recommend dressing up, as most of the men were wearing jackets. Of course, they won't kick you out if you show up in jeans, but it's a classy place, so dress appropriately.

We were seated right in front of the window, which provided a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains at night. So pretty! This was one of my favorite parts of the experience.

Trying not to over-do it on my first night of eating in Vegas, I ordered the Market Tomato Salad and the Scallops. I had a lemon martini to start, and it was fantastic. I asked for more savory than sweete, and the bartender made the drink perfectly. We ordered a Trimbach Riesling for the table, and this very dry riesling from the Alsace region in France has become one of the white wine staples I keep in my home.

The burrata on the tomato salad was perfectly creamy and balanced well with the fresh tomatoes. I've had some mediocre tomato-mozzarella salads in my day, but this one was perfect. The scallops were perfectly seared, and the capers added the appropriate level of salty bitterness to match the sweetness of the scallops. Delicious!

One of my friends ordered the filet as she always does, and it was a perfect medium, with the perfect level of charring on the outside. I tried a bite and dipped it into the peppercorn sauce. It was fantastic. I had a bite of creamed spinach as well, and it had just the right amount of acid to counterbalance the cream.

Enjoying conversation with friends while watching the Bellagio fountains at night capped off the evening. I can't wait to go back on my next trip to Vegas.

It has been a while since my wife and I have been to Prime.  Their remodel was worth the wait for sure. The lighting and dcor is perfect. Exactly what you would want and look for in a high end steak house. Sunday we came in and had an exemplary meal and really enjoyed the short ribs.  If you haven't been in a while it is time to try it again.  Excellent service from start to finish. Our servers were skilled and well versed, especially Andrew and Wayne.  We had a great chat about their extensive whiskey selection.  Andrew's knowledge was impressive to say the least.  If you are looking to dine on a budget look elsewhere but as they say, you get what you pay for.  As Vegas locals we don't make it to the strip as much as we would like but Prime is worth the trip.

I stopped by at Prime tonight after a grueling 9 hour business meeting.  When I arrived, I was seated at a great table close to the window where I could see the Bellagio Fountain Show in the background.  After I ordered my Whiskey, I had a chance to truly appreciate the beauty of this restaurant.  The decor is very upscale, romantic and very ornate.  A great place for a power business dinner or a date.

For dinner, I ordered the Butternut Squash Soup, Bone-in Rib-eye Steak, Potato Gnocchi and their Banana Tart for desert.

My entire meal was amazing.  Each dish was perfectly prepared and super yummy!  
If you want a great steak dinner in one of Las Vegas' most romantic places, come to the Prime!

The food, fountain show and sexy decor rocks!!

Disappointing. The food was okay, but not worth the price. The most disappointing aspect is that they cooked not only my steak, but multiple steaks completely wrong., I ordered my steak black and blue and it came out medium well. I had already added the sides, but after i sent it back, it came back without the sides on. They did not offer to comp anything or even apologize for the poorly prepared meal. This is really poor form for a supposedly high end steak house. Do yourself a favour and go to SW at The Wynn, which is a far superior meal with truly excellent service.

Great restaurant for a romantic dinner, especially if you can get a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  Great food, albeit pricey...very knowledgeable and attentive wait staff and friendly hostesses.  The restaurant is a little too dark which makes it hard to even read the menu.  Their seasonal key lime pie is sublime as are most of their desserts.

Gorgeous restaurant, maintains a classic elegance and steps of service worthy of its namesake. Hospitality was great, food was exactly what it should have been. Highlights were the dry-aged rib-eye & lamb with bolognese. Creme brulee & warm. Chocolate cakes were on point. Check it out, take your time, drink some wine..

It's been about 7 years since I ate here, but I must say I always recommend this restaurant to people because I had a perfect time with this fine dining experience. I took my girlfriend at the time for her birthday here, booked the reservations in advance and told them it was her birthday. The service was great the second we got sat... I had the filet mignon and it was cooked medium rare the way I like it, it was perfect. Desert they brought my gf a cheesecake with a candle and it said Happy Birthday in chocolate on the plate. I was happy knowing I didnt have to remind the server it was her birthday, they were on their best service standards in my opinion and I would love to take another future gf to this establishment soon.

Amazing meal.  It all starts with them keeping the reservation time within a few moments.  It was crowed around the bar but the hostess was quick pleasant and sat us immediately...with a great view of the fountains out the window.  The waiters were great.  Attentive and never rushed you, even with people waiting.  I started with Ribbons of Tuna - so amazing.  The sauce was excellent and made the dish.  I also managed to "test out" my friend's Steamed Shrimp Salad.  Another hit.  So fresh were the seafood portions of these dishes.  My entree was a dry aged bone-in rib eye done medium rare.  Cooked perfectly and it was delicious.  I enjoyed much more than when I went to CarneVino.  We got sides of Yukon Gold Mashed Potatos and Gnocci - both again...excellent.  No room for dessert but overall a great triumph!

Went here with high expectations... ordered dry aged ribeye and scallops. Scallops were great. Steak was awesome UNTIL i saw a fly on the steak! A fly!! I was disgusted and disappointed. Immediately stopped eating and asked for the check. Disappointed. Luckily they took the steak off the check. Will not be back!

I think Prime deserves a 5 for their yummy interpretation of nourishment.  The Prime Steak Tartare Frites is an A+, The Tomato and Mozzarella Salad is de-lish , Asparagus Salad is good enough "to write home about", The Slow Baked Salmon heavenly, The Ginger Sweet Potatoes & Truffle Mashed Potatoes & Salt Baked Potatoes all fit for a king, The Creamed Spinach & Steamed Asparagus both savory, and the Porterhouse-Kurobuta Pork Chops- & Filet Mignon mouthwatering!!  Well worth the hundreds of dollars our friend paid for :-D!!!!!!!!  We were pretty tipsy but can 98% promise the food was amazing! OH, and the view is just spectacular if you're lucky enough to sit by the windows!

This is a very good steakhouse, be prepared to spend a pretty penny, but it's worth it. Highly recommend the dry-aged ribeye, I've had it at other restaurants and this compares well. The nutty full flavors that the dry aging process imparts on to the meat makes it my usual go to at any steak spot. The crispy salmon sushi was very very good. For sides the broccoli was very tasty as well. Our waiter was very well informed and enthusiastic which is always a plus.

I wish I could give the option of a 4.5 star, because it's on that level. Steak was good, but for the same price I have had much better. Great service, steak on par with the price, beautiful ambience, and first for me great steak sauce. Not one for saucing up a steak but they found a a couple good combos. We had dry aged and regular ribeye. Sides of spinach and glazed mushrooms. Sides we're money sauces grew on you. Overall it was a nice experience, but think I could get better for the money in Vegas. Regardless you won't be disappointed.

Let's just say- that they know what they are doing. Food, service and setting is top notch. Could not ask for better. Husband ordered the filet and I had the salmon, both outstanding and the best we've had.

I will say the people asking to take your picture while your enjoying your meal, make things a bit uncomfortable. You think it's a service provided and that you'll have an opportunity to view the photo at the end of your meal and decide then if you want to take it home.... but instead it's presented to you at the end of your meal, printed, framed, and entirely over priced. When you politely reject them your made to feel like you've wasted THIER time. Tad bit tacky considering how exceptional everything else was. I'd say to Bellagio to scrap it all together- you got a good thing going without.

Excellent service, location and atmosphere. Wait staff is on point, recommendations and service exceptional. Decor is beautiful, loved outside seating next to the fountains the mist was nice on a warm night. Beautiful and perfect evening

My boyfriend and I chose to celebrate our 1 year anniversary at Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio and we are so glad we did. It was wonderful! First and foremost, the food was incredible. After we shared the salmon sashimi as an appetizer, I had the seared tuna and my boyfriend had the filet mignon. Both were tender, juicy and just as we ordered. We also split the family-style side dishes, wild mushrooms and truffle mashed potatoes as sides. I insisted on the mashed potatoes after reading about how great they were on Yelp! and everyone was right - they were even better than anticipated. So creamy with a special 'bite' to them that I find impossible to describe. You really have to taste it to believe it. Drooling as I write... but I digress. Prime has an extensive wine list and the excellent staff even surprised us with a 'happy anniversary' free dessert of lava chocolate cake a la mode. Everything from the ambiance to the service to the food was perfect. The incredibly romantic view of the fountains at the Bellagio which went off frequently throughout our meal made the night even more memorable and special and the waiter didn't even complain when we asked him take a photo of us. We had a hard time getting reservations even calling a month out - we had to choose between 5:30 or 10 p.m. so I recommend making reservations as soon as you know you will be in Las Vegas and celebrating a special evening. This restaurant should be saved for special occasions though as it was a very pricey meal! But if you want to impress, this is the place to come.

Prime is one of my top 3 favorite places for fine dining in the city. My husband took me here 4 years ago for our anniversary dinner, and have since then been nothing but please during our visits after. We always recommend this place to our friends looking for a nice place to enjoy a good steak and some. Patio seating is always what we asked for during reservations too.

They always say patio seating is first come first serve, but we never had to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated from our reservation time. Service is top notch. Everyone is very kind and thorough. Someone is always making sure our drinks are filled and our table is free of crumbs. 

We usually order the same things here. We share the 28oz bone in rib eye in medium, lobster Mac and cheese, some oysters and sauted mushrooms. The steak is absolutely delicious and flavorful, cooked to perfection. It comes with a few sauces, but I only taste the sauces and not really having to use them because the steak is already perf without them. The side lobster Mac and mushrooms just go well with the steak.

The water show and night view of the strip is an extra added bonus to a romantic dinner here. Highly recommend this place, the food and the view.

I had made reservations for Prime to celebrate our anniversary.  In the reservation, I requested a table on the patio overlooking the fountains.  When we arrived, we were offered a table on the patio, but it was such a terribly hot day, that we declined.  The hostess kindly seated us inside by a window so that we could still see the fountains.  I didn't even ask, as I figured those tables would have all been taken.  I was thrilled that she did that for us.  The service was second to none.  I was thoroughly impressed with the staff throughout our meal.  They really make you feel special.  We ordered drinks (which were made perfectly).  We then ordered appetizers.  I asked for the beet salad and my husband ordered the pea soup.  Both dishes were great.  I ordered the surf and turf special and my husband got the dry-aged ribeye.  We also got the whipped sweet potatoes and the herbed peas.  Wow.  The surf and turf was unbelievable.  The filet was so tender and cooked perfectly.  But, the lobster tail was probably the best I have ever tasted.  Everything else was also tasty.  My husband really enjoyed his steak.  Although I am a dessert person, I was too full to indulge in anything else.  But, we were presented with a dish with "happy anniversary" written on it with four gourmet chocolates on it.  We had never mentioned this to our servers.  It was such a nice and thoughtful surprise.  Overall, we had an excellent evening.

Two standouts: foie gras appetizer and the house photographer.
So, first, an embarrassing confession--no one at our table ordered red meat. I should have ordered the special of the night: a bone-in filet. Instead, I started off with a craving for duck, but our server squashed that desire by telling me that the duck l'orange was prepared in slices and did not have a crisp skin And he hadn't heard many good comments about it. He recommended the pork chop, so I got that, and I regretted it. When the server inquired how my pork chop was, I told him it was just ok--did not have much flavor. the accompanying mushrooms, on the other hand, were delicious. The server said, "well at least you like one of the things, right? " Uh, okay... I really didn't expect him to do anything, and yes, I was the dunce ordering a non-steak dish in a steakhouse, but our server's lack of concern over my enjoyment was a little disappointing. I've actually had better service at The Outback. And, we overheard the server at a nearby table say, "Whatever you want, I will make it right for you". Wished we had gotten that guy. 
As an aside, my family always stays at the Bellagio, and service at this hotel overall is at a pretty high standard, so I guess I was expecting more out of this restaurant--it was our first time here.
The interior looks like Sleeping Beauty's chamber with powdery blue drapes. The music is really awful--I just have to point this out, and it is disappointing that they don't have a cocktail menu.
Crab cakes were very good, and the sea bass was cooked perfectly with a lovely, delicate, slightly gingery sauce. Potatoes au gratin were rich! Butter & cheese galore. Ginger sweet potatoes were silky smooth and had just the right amount of sweetness. Sorbet looked much better than it tasted--perfectly scooped orbs, but the mango was too tart, coconut did not taste like coconut.
The house photographer (who looked just like Wendy Malick from Just Shoot Me) took gorgeous pictures of my family--she really directed us--made us get out of our seats, place our hands just so...my father has stage 4 cancer, so this is why the photos meant a lot to us.
Will not return to this restaurant and can't say I would recommend it, but I savored every bite of my foie gras and we'll cherish our pictures.
BEST STEAK I'VE EVER HAD. EVER. It was better than MGM grand mansion and it doesn't usually get better than that.

After an amazing Super Bowl....this was the ultimate treat.

It is obviously a Super classy joint located in the bellagio.  There's not much I can say except that you pay a premium for a premium experience.  Service is extremely professional and the restaurant itself is situated right next to the huge outdoor fountain.

I ordered the dry aged rib eye and it was fantastic.  To be completely honest.....steak is steak (relatively speaking), but having it in this setting makes it even more enjoyable.

Tip:  everything is a la carte, so if you're dining with two, having just one side may be enough food in addition to your steak.

Beautiful restaurant in the Bellagio overlooking the amazing fountain show that just never gets old!  A friend of mine and I ate on the patio last evening and had a great experience.  The service was polished and professional and the food was amazing.  We started with the shrimp cocktail and the crab cake...both solid choices that could have been a meal in themselves.  I enjoyed the halibut entree and my friend enjoyed the sole entree - both flavorful, fresh and delicious.  We shared a side of the ginger sweet potatoes and loved them - absolutely divine!  The Rouge cocktail was the way to go too. 

If you're looking for an amazing meal in a sophisticated atmosphere with a view of the fountains, Prime is the place for you!

I don't usually leave reviews, but I feel our meal at this restaurant deserves one. 

FOOD: The food was great. The oysters were wonderful. We all wanted to try the French onion soup, which they split into half portions for us (unexpected and nice of them to do). The bone in ribeye was perfectly cooked and very good, but the real star was the 10 oz filet. Honestly, I wish I had been the one to order it, because it was one of the best cuts I have ever had. The truffle mashed potatoes were a great addition as a side. 

Overall, the quality of the meat was excellent. I did feel like the steak could have been seasoned more. Other than that, no complaints here. 

SERVICE: Here is where things went a bit downhill. Lets start with the positives - first, the hostess was very nice and sat us at a great spot near the windows to watch the fountains. We were also visited by [who I am assuming is] the manager of the restaurant, who was very quick to respond to any requests we had. These two individuals were not only helpful, but very friendly and personable. 

The negatives - from the very moment we sat down, I got the feeling we were being rushed by our server. There is a difference between being attentive and being overly pushy. Our table felt that we were experiencing the latter. Additionally, we all felt that both servers for our table were relatively unfriendly and standoffish.

I was also unimpressed by the attitude of the individual who split the check. Two of us were in Vegas on business and needed to split the check so that certain dishes were included on different cards. For some reason, this was met with frustration. In fact, the server responsible for the check walked away from me mid-sentence as I was explaining how it needed to be split up. Not a great touch. 

OVERALL: The food and the atmosphere were very good. However, they weren't good enough to make up for the lack of personable/helpful service that you should get if you're paying to eat at an upscale restaurant like Prime claims to be. 

Our family visits Vegas frequently but it's unlikely we will be back due to the service (and the fact that there are so many other great alternatives in the area). I would also hesitate to recommend this for business outings - no need to deal with attitude from the server over splitting the check when there are so many other restaurants who are more than willing to accommodate this type of request.

We had made reservations for our anniversary a week in advance with requests to be seated at window overlooking Bellagio Fountains. When we arrived, they were very courteous and seated us exactly as requested! What a great view.
The entire waitstaff was attentive and professional and drinks were out in no time. They did not rush us and went through the menu thoroughly if needed. I am on a special diet and they were able to accommodate without any problems!
I ordered the filet mignon with lobster, which was amazing. The filet originally came out a little over done, but they quickly remedied the situation and I had a new one cooked perfectly, and quickly without any blemish in our dining experience. The food was delicious and plentiful. The overall experience was well worth the price and we will be back every time we come to Las Vegas. It's no big secret that Las Vegas is becoming the food capital of the US, and Prime at Bellagio is definitely setting the bar!
They even brought us a dessert with a candle and decorated with anniversary wishes on it! They definitely went beyond what was expected and deserve 5 Stars! Don't miss this place!

Beautiful  decor and great service. The food tasty but really nothing to write home about. Very disappointed with the size of the side orders considering the cost. Not much more to say. Will I return, probably not.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Probably the best steakhouse. Husband and I were there for our 1 anniversary on July 4th, 2010. 

FOOD
We both enjoyed the Filets, Au Gratin Potatoes, which were the most delicious, decadent foods I've ever eaten. The Bearnaise sauce was the best I've ever experienced. They also brought a few other sauces like a peppercorn mustard and another I can't quite remember...all good.

SERVICE
Spectacular. Helpful and always attentive. They brought us a little desert for our anniversary and made sure we always had everything we wanted.

ATMOSPHERE
It's dark, plush and very romantic. The place settings and dinnerware were of high quality as expected. We sat next to a window overlooking the fountains of the Bellagio. It was after 7pm so it was dark and the lights were beautiful. When you make your reservation ask for a window seat or the patio (in the summer).

OVERALL
First, the filets are easily the best on the strip. The price is a little on the high side as compared to other places where you can fill your stomach. But it is a high-end establishment for a high-end clientele. If you're the type of person who is concerned about $8 bottled water, then Prime may not be the place for you. 

If you can drop around $200-300 (two people) for an excellent meal and it doesn't deplete your entire vacation fund, then I probably don't need to tell you that this is a must. Highly recommended. Go here, enjoy life because it's probably one of the best experiences you'll have.

BIO
Jennifer(27) and Chris(31) are Vegas fanatics. Enjoying multiple trips every year, they continuously search for new and delicious findings Las Vegas has to offer.

Wow!!!  From the service to the food was excellent!  Top notch wine list especially from Napa.  Appetizer to main entre was superb.  One of the best beet salad I've ever had...  The grilled salmon was perfectly prepared...  Lol this restaurant is known for steaks!  With we spent about $200 per person including wine.  Enjoy!!!

This place has two of the three qualities of a great restaurant.  Quality of food and ambient atmosphere.  They lose out where price is concerned but if you want good dry aged grade a beef with the Bellagio water and light show in the background, you're going to have to shell out some clams.  This place also knows about foie gras and truffle mashed potatoes if you're into that sort of opulence.

We come here every year for the outstanding seafood platter. This item is not on the menu. You have to order it by name. Just identify you want a seafood platter for however many people are in your party. It is absolutely phenomenal. Look at my picture for a reference. The steaks and seafood are also top notch here. Accompanied with truffled mash, you have a spectacular surf and turf!

Very pricey but worth it. Took my wifey out here for a date night. Tab for 2 ran about 400. I had dry aged ribeye, she did sea bass. Both were fantastic and cooked correctly. I had the shellfish appetizer (65$ for a small main lobster, 2 oysters, 4 huge shrimp, 2 mussels, 1/4 lb king crab). It was the best appetizer I have ever eaten and was afraid i wouldn't have room for the steak lol. Wife had crab cake (25$). Small for the price but not much filler. Just lumpy crab meat. 


Servers were spot on

This has been my third experience with Prime. I guess I will look for something else. Honestly the only draw here is to dine by the fountain which I guess I would advise to maybe try one of the other restaurants in the Bellagio or watch the show from the street a couple of times and get your fix. Prime markets itself as an upscale steakhouse, they have a dress code that is barely enforced. They may need to revisit this policy. I am far from a snob but if I am going to go to the work to get "dressed for dinner" and go out to enjoy the evening, it would make the experience much nicer if all the other patrons would make a little more effort to a least look nice. Both occassions we came here and had dinner were special occassions (birthday and anniversary) and I would summize that most of the other patrons were there for the same. I was the only male there in a button down shirt with collar. Really? T shirts and crappy old jeans with tennis shoes that is business attire for men? Women dressed like service staff for hooters pass for dress code? We got a table at the outside table to enjoy the fountain show during dinner, every time the show started some of the other patrons stood up and went to the fence to watch and take pictures thus blocking everyone elses view. Isnt this something that could have been done out on the street? The one woman was jumping and clapping in a leopard print dress her ass in front of some elderly woman whos view was completely blocked. I dont know it just ruined the entire experience.  I guess overall I blame management for not controlling the situation, if you have patrons behaving in a way that is disruptive, speaking loadly and inappropriate language (saying FUCK every other word) just diminishes the experience for the other patrons who are trying to have a nice meal. I dont mind this if I am at the bar but here??? Overall It is an overpriced applebees.

Excellent restaurant. Scallops were amazing. Great service too
One big complaint we ordered grey goose on the rocks asked for blue cheese stuffed olives. They arrive great. Bill noted $4.00 extra per drink for olives. Really. What a downer for a high in restaurant to do. They didn't mention this when we ordered. Crazy. We went to the Petrossian bar in Belligio and had the same drink plus the olives. No extra charge. Think Prime needs to think about this!!

Not impressed
Just ok. Was expecting mouth melting steaks, and all I got was an outrageous check.

The food here is amazing! It was our second time here! If you have the chance to go here when you are in Vegas GO! I had the AHI and I was so pleased! I am pretty picky! The ahi ribbon which is an appetizer is a must have to! The staff is amazing to! I can not say anything negative!

Sat on the patio, and highly recommend doing so if you can get a reservation, so we got the full experience of the Bellagio water show while we ate.  Food was very good, atmosphere was top notch, water show added something you can't do at any other restaurant, but the service was a little bit slow for this level of restaurant.  The Filet was good, not the best ever, but very good.  The sauteed mushrooms are a must with your steak. 
Overall, a very good steak restaurant with an amazing show, but not the best service and not the best steak ever.... but I'm from Texas.

One would think that the combination of top notch casino hotel-resort and world-class heritage right next to the famed Bellagio Fountains would mean this would truly be a outstanding meal executed from start to finish.  I was thinking the same thing, but I was wrong.  While Prime remains a "must-go" for any deep pocketed banker, surgeon, or executive attending a convention, it retains a overpriced, pretentious atmosphere that at times a turn-off.  Prime is popular destination for the crowd that is happy to spend other people's money.  Being a walk-in, I foolishly discov ered that reservations means "call us two weeks or more in advance".  Left with only one option, a seat at the bar, I took it and was pleased with a view out the window towards the Fountains.  The Bartender did a awesome job of taking care of me with quick service, good conversation, and, as I watched, well crafted drinks.  Eating here is strictly a-la-carte, which means you WILL pay dearly for any sides you order.  This wasn't a surpise to me.  I selected the $64 Miso Soy New York Strip, medium rare, and added Grautin Dauphinci with Steamed Asparagus.  I added a glass of Gajara Promis Toscana, an Italian red blend.  My steak arrived decided well-done.  Having waited over 30 minutes for my food to arrive, I was quick to complain to the Bartender (my server) and he offered to return my steak for another.  Based with a decision that might cost me 30 more minutes for dinner, I chose to keep my current portion.  To me, there was no point in arguing since I was small-fry compared to much of the clientele.  Had I been someone the likes of Anthony Bourdain, any criticisms would have been respected.  While not cooked to order, the steak was nevertheless a choice cut, tender and juicy.  The Grautin and Asparagus was hearty portions that paired very well with the steak.  The bartender did comp give me another glass of Toscana for my inconvenience.  Perhaps a discount on the meal would have been more appropriate.  My first thought after the hefty tab is I could have done much better at home on my own grill.  My main gripe is restaurants like these are supposed to blow your mind, not just your paycheck.  The pricing didn't bother me at all; in fact I expected it.  Next time in Vegas, which won't be long away, I plan to give Gordon Ramsay's STEAK a try.  I can always watch the fountains from either the street side or from the view from my room at the Vdara.

The waiters where very nice very on it but the food really wasn't that good its very expensive and not worth the prices its salty and oily idk i didnt really enjoy it my group didn't enjoy it we probably won't come back ...

Huge chunk of gristle made half of my $140 porterhouse really unenjoyable.  Service was great until we got our food.  At that point everyone disappeared and our waiter came back when we were finishing up our last bites.  I will say it's a beautiful place.  We didn't go to spend $900 on a beautiful place, though.

We decided to try this restaurant because of its reviews we were staying across the street at Planet Hollywood. There was three of us and all three of us have been to the top restaurants around the world I won't mention their names that you are familiar with them all. All three of us ordered the ribeye the ribeye was $80 just for the steak. The steak was chewy and fatty all three steaks where exactly this way. Even the waiter was not good never came back to ask as how our food was and seem to have an inpatient attitude when we were there. Our bill for all three of us was just over $500 and this was one of the worst steakhouses we have ever been to we all felt the same way.  There are a lot of big-name steakhouses in Las Vegas do yourself a favor and go there. None of us understand how this restaurant could have four or four-and-a-half star review it is not even close to that.

Loved it. Amazing views of the Bellagio fountains and great ambiance. Great steak. I got the filet, friends got the rib eye and porterhouse, one friend for salmon. Everyone was happy with their food. The Yukon mashed potatoes were great, as were the Mac n cheese and mushrooms. Skip the asparagus, it's very meh. Great service.
Great food,great decor,great customer service I loved my first dining experience and I will be back.Jose is a great bartender

Best meal we had in Vegas. Overlooking the fountains...ambiance reminded me of a north east steak house ( but no north east steakhouse had dancing fountains) Food was incredible. Service exceptional. Price was expensive... But worth it!

I ate at Prime for dinner recently. I ended up dining alone and that might affect some of the ratings. I ate the Duck L'range which was excellent. The only problem with it was that the portion was just too small (particularly for the price). I kind of felt like I needed a second entree. Sides were good too. The ambiance is amazing. Truly a stunning restaurant with great views right on the Bellagio lake. 

My only gripe was the service. It was just not 5-star. Of course they sat me in the back which probably was a big reason why. Just felt like I was an after thought the whole night. Definitely disappointed there. I would like to go back and try it again and see if I get better service if I go with someone this time.

This was a splurge for hubby and I's 15th wedding anniversary. We sat outside on the patio which was amazing for me, but I really love the fountains. Even though we had reservations two weeks in advance, we were told it might be about twenty minutes(we got there about 10 minutes before our reservation). Which is fine, I know there are limited seats outside and people will stay and chat. When we were first seated, it took our waiter a good five minutes to ask us what we wanted to drink. It took probably 8-10 minutes to get bread to our table.   Not a great start!  We were decided what we wanted to order and sat there for another 10 minutes or so before our waiter came back and yes, our menus were closed on the table that whole time.  Our appetizer came fairly quick but our steaks took quite a while. We had the crab cake which i thought was pretty incredible. We saw a few tables who sat down after us get their food much quicker then we did.  Whatever, though, it was our anniversary and we had a great view of the fountains. I ordered a medium 18 oz t bone steak which ended up being more rare then I would like, and hubbies medium rare porterhouse steak looked medium. Steaks were tough to cut with the knife provided but melted n your mouth. It was delicious, as was the sauces they provided.  Our water glasses never went empty and that really was the only attentive service we received.  We were asked if we wanted coffee, which I replied yes, along with a dessert menu.  We got our menus right away and it took at least 20 minutes for someone to take our order.  When the waiter took our order, it was another 20 minutes before we got our creme brulee.  The waiter simply forgot because I looked up at him when he walked by our table and the look on his face was one of oh s*&^% forgot their desert.  He did apologize and since it was our anniversary, it was complimentary.  I was in great company but the amount of tip left on our bill reflected our dissatisfaction with our service.  Our total was $192 for the crab cake appetizer, two steaks, two baked potatoes, and some coffee.  Just a warning, they do allow smoking as it is outside, which can be not so pleasant when the smoke is blowing in your direction.  We also had a rowdy group at the table next to us who were quite loud and obnoxious but I understand the restaurant wouldn't want to lose a customer.  We had to ask for our check, as did everyone around us, so I guess that is not unusual.  For the ambiance, and hubby's company it was an enjoyable evening. I loved being so close to the fountains and enjoying them go off every 15 minutes.  We never got any spray and it was a bit windy while we were there.  If we decide to go to a high end restaurant for our next anniversary, we will probably check out another place.

The steak and seafood are fine, but not worth the price at Prime. The New York strip did not melt in my mouth... At $60+ I expected to be wowed more. I've definitely had better steaks for much less $$. The French onion soup was delicious but the bread and cheese had already fallen into the soup upon arrival. The dessert portions are tiny. Ask for a table with a view of the fountain. And for the guys-  be sure to wear pants, as shorts are not permitted inside the restaurant. (Though the restaurant does have crappy pants to lend you)

One of the best meals I've had in a very long time.

I had the scallops and my guest had the rib eye. We also had the macaroni and cheese and creamed spinach and shared a creme brle for desert. The waiter was also incredible, the view is fantastic, and the ambiance was classy and sophisticated. We spent around $300 between the two of us and was worth every penny.

We're fortunate in Las Vegas to have so many great steak places.  Prime steakhouse in The Bellagio is a perfect example.  Yes, it is pricey - but the food is amazing and for special occasions... well justify it how you want the food is great!

I still can't bring myself to pay for imported Japanese Kobe beef steaks - but they have them at Prime!  They also had some chicken and seafood dishes.  It is a Chicago style, where you generally Oder the sides all separately.

Located in a lower level of The Bellagio, they do offer outside seating by the water - great to watch the fountains!  The rest of the interior is elegant and somewhat dark - although lite well enough to see menus without a flashlight app!

Service is excellent, and everything including the desert was wonderful.  Definitely a special occasion place!

My friends and I visited Vegas last weekend and were so excited about our reservation to eat here. Unfortunately, it was the most disappointing part of the trip. The items are so expensive relative to the size. Each side (we got Mac and cheese, Au gratin, mashed potatoes, and steamed asparagus) comes in the tiniest cast iron skillet so portions are about the size of an apple. The Mac and cheese was my favorite, but I could only have a bite since it was being shared at the table. 

For entrees, my boyfriend got the dry aged bone in ribeye and wasn't impressed by it at all. He described it as bland, as did another friend who got the same thing. He also ordered it rare, but thought it was cooked more than a rare steak should be (it was slightly pink, but not that dark pink/ red color of a perfect rare steak). I got the peppered tuna steak and i had to force myself to eat it. It only had whole peppercorn as the seasoning and way too much of it. I let my friends try it and they said it tasted like someone dipped the tuna in a bucket of peppercorn and put it on my plate. I know that "peppered" is in the name, but I thought I'd get something with complex flavors and high quality seasoning. It was so depressing and made me wish I got three sides of Mac and cheese as my main dish instead, which would have been the same price.

At first I thought something was wrong with me for not liking the flavors of most things on the table (asparagus also had no seasoning and I longed for the asparagus I cook at home myself), but I quickly realized my whole table didn't feel blown away by anything they got. When you're spending $150-200 on dinner, you should feel like you're getting your moneys worth either in terms of taste, quality, and quantity. This place disappointed me in all of those ways. 

The highlight of the meal was the seasoned butter that was served with bread at the start of the meal, and sitting near a window where I could see the Bellagio fountains.

I've been to almost all of the fine dining steakhouse restaurants in Las Vegas and Prime is definitely my favorite! Almost all fine dining restaurants will have a great cut of steaks the way you would want them so in my opinion, it comes down to the unique sauces that they may or may not provide. Prime pairs their phenomenal steaks with Soy-Rice Wine, Barnaise, and Peppercorn sauces which won't exhaust your taste palette and will keep you wanting for more!

Prime is a quiet decadent experience.  

Call ahead and make a reservation with a table near the window.  Not only is the food and service impeccable, this is the best place to see the Bellagio water show, which plays every 15 mins after 8 pm.  It's an emotional experience from the windows and ambiance of the restaurant.   If you're here in the summer, they have a patio where you can have a romantic dinner on the terrace over looking the water.  

When you're in Vegas, it's nice to get away from the lights for a few hours, and devour a decadent meal.  The decor here is subtle, reminds me of the London West Hollywood.  Warm candle light, with hints of modern styled art deco patterned glass on the ceilings, and the walls.  Luxurious velvet curtains in deep browns and periwinkle, and fresh cut cymbidium orchids (my favorite).  

RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FOOD: 
You really can go wrong here, but Here are my faves from the menu: 
-Succulent Lamb Chops 
-Bone in Fillet 
-MUST TRY Warm Shrimp Salad.  (Worth coming into the bar and ordering this with a glass of wine)
-Side of Crab Leg

RECOMMENDATIONS FOR WINE: 
If you've won big at the slots while you're at Vegas, by all means indulge.  They have an extensive wine list, some rare French wines that run over $60,000!  If you're looking for robust red wine at a reasonable price point, try Faust, Cabernet 2006.  

Sometimes you get what you pay for, and at Prime, the ambiance, the service, the food does not disappoint.  Indulge while you're in Vegas.  Life is short;  Live a little.

What a beautiful place to have dinner. The fountain view is not to be beat. The service was over the top. The food delicious. 
I am gluten free and they had a special menu. I was there with a party of nine people.  The side dishes are shareable and every dish that was presented at the table the waiter leaned over and told me if it was a safe dish for me to eat. 
It is extremely pricey restaurant but was well worth it.
I thought we were at the Palm's guess not. Too drunk to remember much but I know the potatoes augratain were amazing calamari was sent back.
