Very classy restaurant with kind staff and delicious food! Our steaks came out a little over cooked but our waiter was quick to fix it and they came back perfect and tender. Our side of Au gratin potatoes hit the spot, but barely big enough to share- thats ok though because our steaks were filling. We were able to watch the Bellagio fountain and it was a really nice, beautiful view. All in all this place was wonderful!

Dinned there with my family. The food was very good but nothing really special. We ordered few salads, pea soup, asparagus, risotto, baked potato, salmon and most of it was good. The only thing I would skip is the asparagus salad.
The service was excellent!
I recommend the restaurant. Maybe I didn't give it 5 stars because I don't eat meat.

Very fancy upscale spot. You take the escalator downstairs inside of the Bellagio hotel. We got this private room for 13 guys. A simple menu. We all went with the steaks and a lot of sides. The dry aged rib eye steak cooked medium rare was perfect!! My steak just cut right through it. I really enjoyed it. The sides were pretty good. Truffled mashed potatos , mac and cheese ,brussells sprouts, creamed spinach and more. The bread and butter were okay. They also take a group photo but charge you 35 bucks for it. I would recommend coming here for a solid piece of steak.

Recommendation: Dry aged rib eye steak and truffled mashed potatoes.

Came to prime this past weekend to celebrate with family and friends for my fianc 30th birthday . It was a very expensive weekend from the start . Apparently there was a computer convention for decan if I spelled it correctly which were for computer hackers . Checking into our hotel they mentioned to us you may not want to use the wifi so to the event this week. We didn't think much of it because we had a full planned weekend.

We hit up the pool to set ourselves up for a great dinner which we were all expecting . Unfortunately that was not the case . We had a party of 6 and our ordered took us about 40 min before it came out. We had spoke with our waiter who was very friendly yet attended to us every 20 minutes . The steak was a bit to rare and more on the colder side . Not sure if they may have forgotten out food but didn't want to make a big deal due to my fianc birthday . I bit the bullet since we were with her friends and didn't want to be difficult . 

I  picked this place based on the yelp reviews but I didn't enjoy my steak .... not sure if I'd come back based off my experience . Seems like a lot of the reviews were good here ....

So let me start by saying the Bellagio is awesome and everything about it is great.  Prime is no different...great atmosphere and good food.  But the service was just ok.

We waited a long time to order and everything just seemed to drag on.  For 2 people it took us 2 and a half hours for our meal.  Way too long.  

I had the short rib and it was to die for.  The house sauce was insanely good and the dish was cooked to perfection.  My guest had a filet and said it was a 7 out of 10.

My main complaint was that it's just too expensive.  I'm not a cheap guy and regularly drop $100 on dinner (for myself).  But this was outrageous for what you experienced.  Our bill totaled close to $350 and we had one bourbon each.  There are better places to drop that coin.
Porter house! Great stuff and wonderful view outside next to the water show. Perfect for romance.

This restaurant is definitely a must when visiting Las Vegas. My husband and I were referred to Prime to celebrate our anniversary, and we are so glad decided to make a reservation there. The feel is very elegant inside, yet the hostesses and servers are warm and friendly. Especially so for our server- Walter. He was incredibly friendly, chatty, and personable. We felt as if we were eating at his house with how comfortable he made us feel while dining there. 
The food was as amazing as the service. Hubby had the peppercorn steak and I had the salmon. Both were melt in your mouth goodness. They also brought a few different sauces to go with the entrees, but there was no need for sauce at all. They were delicious already without anything extra. 
The only thing that we felt kind of ruined the night was the photographer, Morgan. She was friendly, but it seemed forced and fake. When she came to take pics, she made it very posed and studio style right at our table. Beware- the pics are very expensive- something like $50 and up for two poses which she doesn't mention in the beginning. I've been to Morton's for a special occasion and they've taken our pic, but never charged for it. When i politely declined after she brought us the pics, she gave me a dirty look, and cold fake smile then left. It was a shame because this occurred at the end of the meal so despite the amazing experience in the beginning and the middle, the end part is now what's stuck in my head. 
We will definitely return to Prime next time we're in Vegas. We will ask for Walter and make sure to decline the pics in the beginning.

Quick side note- the area where you can view the Bellagio fountains is under construction until Dec 2015. Unfortunately when I booked the reservation a month before, and confirmed the day before no one ever mentioned about the construction. The view of the fountains was one of the main reasons why I made our reservation!! It was very disappointing when the hostess informed me upon checking in. Fortunately, she put us at a table that still faced Windows looking over a part of the Bellagio lake, and ending up working out anyway since we were taken care of by Walter.

Beautiful restaurant located inside the Bellagio. Overpriced but worth every bite!

My fianc and I came in for a 7 o'clock dinner. Our server was sweet, friendly, attentive and very helpful. He definitely delivered amazing service.

FOR THE HUNGRY ALERT:::
If you happen to be extremely hungry (like me), take it easy. Split a baby iceberg lettuce, super tasty, appetizing and good for two. 

Our dinner was delicious! especially the 10 oz filet mignon (medium-rare), very juicy and full of flavor. As for sides, yumm! I recommend the truffle mashed potatoes and mac & cheese...to die for! My least favorite side was surprisingly the mushrooms and I loooveee mushrooms!! (they had no flavor).

FYI:::
Side portions are small, 
I recommend 2-3 sides.

PS:::
Don't forget to enjoy your lovely dinner with a full bodied glass of red wine (great selections).
Amazing! The bar is very pretty and the bartenders are very nice and helpful.  We got a table with a view of the fountain and the Eifel tower.  Very romantic and the food was amazing!

We recently took my parents to Las Vegas for their 37th anniversary. We stayed at the Bellagio, went to see the incredible show O and had dinner at Prime. Mind you my parents do not get out much and this was a special occasion that we wanted to be special and enjoyable. The show was amazing the hotel was beautiful however dinner at Prime was not a good experience to put it politely. My mother's steak came out like shoe leather. My sister ordered the lamb medium well and that came out like shoe leather. The service was just as bad. Once the food was served, the waiter never returned to check on us. We had to catch the show so we were on a time crunch. The next day my mother called the restaurant and explained what happened and they said to leave a name and number and they would check the ticket and get back to her. We are still waiting. We are not complainers but again wanted this special occasion to be a nice experience and the restaurant did not try and correct the situation. The lack of customer service is what is most disappointing, not typical for a nice hotel in Vegas.

I had reservations for 4 at 7:30 pm on a Tuesday night in September.  

We did not have to wait a minute. We were seated at a  great table that had a view of the fountains.  The atmosphere is nice, very upscale and service was as expected for this type of restaurant.  However, I have had more knowledgeable servers.  

Since it was restaurant week in Vegas when we were in town, I ordered off the special menu to save lots of dollars! But I had to ask for the special restaurant week menu.  I ended up getting the bacon wrapped shrimp, salmon with bok choy and berries for dessert for $50.  My salmon was cooked perfectly and a large portion.  The bread basket had pretzel bread (delish) and a cranberry and french bread.  My husband ordered off the normal menu, he got the 12 oz filet with a side of creamed spinach.  Very good.  

Overall, the experience was good. And food was on par to what I expected.  I was not wowed though.  So I probably will not go back since there are many other restaurants on the trip worth trying.

I came with my parents, hubby and 3 kids (6 and under). Most $$$$ restaurants are not fans of kids because well kids, they can be loud, annoying and so many other things. As they called us for our table they looked at my group and they were second guessing letting us in. They asked that if my baby cried that I was to remove myself from the restaurant. Duh!! I don't want people looking at me with a crying baby. It was just sad that they needed to tell me and sad someone wouldn't take responsibility for their children. 

Other then that, had a wonderful meal with no crying baby or loud, annoying children because if they act up - NO DESSERT! Lol!

Food: Wonderful and delicious
Between us all; Chicken, Filet Mignon, Salmon,  Hubby ordered something seafood, kids split Mac n Cheese and my chicken

Service: Perfect! Constantly had a full glass of water, great selection of cocktails

Top Notch Steakhouse
--------------------------

Pretty fancy shmancy.  Make sure to wear something nice.  Very classy venue.  

Filet 10 ounce medium rare:  Perfect.  Very thick cut.  A
New York Strip 14 ounce (Soy Garlic Glazed) medium:  Not bad!  A-
GRATIN DAUPHINOIS - To Die FOR!   Absolute Must!  A+
Creme Brulee  - Wow!  Them berries and sorbet on top is something else!  A+

Save this place for a special occasion.  It really is a treat!

This place is amazing! The food here was really good I had the Lamb Chops with the truffle mashed potatoes, creamy spinach and mushroom. And every single one was delicious and filling. It's a very classy atmosphere it is a bit pricey but your in Vegas, at Belagio, sitting in a patio with the beautiful fountains what else you expect.

This was the most romantic place i have ever been. It came with delicious food and great view of the bellagio fountain show. I was sad that i wasnt able to have a professional photo of us taken by their photographer that goes around, but ill be sure to hang on to her next time. Maybe next time we could sit outside in the summer so we can have the full romantic experience with the water show and scenery of Paris!! Overall, we had a wonderful and unforgettable dinner here. I will definitely be back.

First, I should start by telling you that Prime had previously been my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas so I hope that they are able to turn their operation around. However, like many Vegas institutions, once they "jump the shark" it typically does not get better. 

The customer service has been lacking over the past several visits and it was absent on this recent dining night. I had to ask for bread three times and by the time it was brought out my bread plate was removed. Another guest requested drawn butter four times before it was brought out and by then the shellfish platter had been polished off. Additionally, several guests were forced to repeatedly ask for their drinks to be delivered. It may seem like a small detail, but the pepper mill did not work. Who is performing their quality control?

Finally, the attached photo shows just one of the two garbage cans in men's room, both of which were in nearly identical condition. 

For a restaurant at Bellagio, especially Prime, to be in this horrendous condition and without the management oversight needed to ensure a pleasant dining experience from a diner guest service experience is completely unacceptable. I have been dining here since their early days but Prime is off the list for future dining plans.

Service, was excellent.. they even let us move to a better view of the fountains when a table cleared, it was after 10/closing time though, so there's no reason they shouldn't have (we we're sitting outside) 

Food... 

Appetizer was decent.. Bacon Wrapped Shrimp, they were pretty good (far from the best I've had) but you only get 3 of them for $28, which I think is a bit ridiculous even for Vegas. 

Main Course.. 

27 day Dry Aged Ribeye, cooked medium rare (chefs recommendation), my friend said it was quite fatty/gritty.. there was about 4oz or so left on his plate at the end of the meal that was all fat. He rated it a 6.5/7... he ate he a few years ago & had the A5 Wagyu & said it was out of this world, but this time wasn't the happiest, but wasn't too upset either. 

Filet Mignon, cooked medium.. it was excellent, tender, cooked perfect & the bernaise sauce was good as well, wasn't too crazy about the other 2 steak sauces they brought out. 

Sides were 50/50... the onion rings were good & so was the truffle mash potatoes.. however the "special" Lobster MAC & Cheese was simply bland, it lacked a lot of flavor & cost $22.. disappointing. 

Also, they had a surf & turf "special" tonight for $154... the lobster tail & filet mignon are both on the menu & if you buy them both straight from the menu it is the roughly the same price (within $5 or so).. great "special".

Great service, food, and ambiance. They offered to hold c*&% when I went to the restroom. Request to have dessert & drinks after dinner on the terrace overlooking the fountains. Don't order the signature shellfish platter, $50pp. I didn't care for the butternut squash soup or artichoke salad. The braised veal was the best, then the veal porterhouse, then the lamb chops, then the filet mignon. I'm more of a rib-eye guy. The meats were tender and flavorful and liked the sauces. Dessert was good too. Liked the banana bread, chocolate cake, and cable cars. Did not care for the cheesecake so much.
And guys bring your purse, they have little tables where you can place them.

Best dishes I had: braised veal, scalloped potatoes with gruyere, truffled mash, lamb chops, veal porterhouse, cable car, banana bread

Was greeted with a warm welcome at the door seated promptly.  Had a great seat right next to the window by the lake and the famous fountains. Ordered a la carte tried the beef Tartar it was great, next came a Heirloom Tomato salad with age Balsamic it was perfectly seasoned and the Tomatoes were still really good even though it is late in the Season, loved the aged Balsamic rather than a reduced balsamic.  The steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked well.  The wine was great went perfect with the steak.  Desert was tasty.  The evening was great service was perfect had a great time

My wife and I along with another two couples at here for dinner one night.  It was very fancy, classy and elegant.  The server was fantastic, very polite, knowledgeable about the food and items on the menu.  Showed genuine concern that we were having a good time and our food was cooked as requested.  

Everything was great.  It is expensive but the food was worth it.  Steaks were perfect.  We enjoyed it, and spent a lot of money in the process.  

Must make reservations.
Amazing place with amazing steak! The bartender Jeff is awesome! Thanks for making great drinks.

This is such a great restaurant I can't really put it all in a review. I've been here three times and every time I'm just blown away by all of it. You cannot go wrong with Prime. The seafood tower appetizer is seriously incredible I get it every time I come here. Everything on the menu is absolutely amazing. Waiters are awesome. Highly recommend!
Gorgeous and romantic interiors.  Spectacular food.  Exquisite service.  Bellagio fountains.  What more could you ask for?

We are locals and visited this restaurant for my birthday early on a Friday night- we had reservations. The food was exceptional- bacon wrapped shrimp, beet salad, wedge salad, short ribs and garlic soy steak, asparagus, au grautin potatoes plus 1 mojito and 1 cosmo. The flavors of each item were amazing. 

So why not 5 stars? We were shoe horned into a corner next to 2 very large parties and the service by our main waiter was lacking. The other waiters  were very attentive.

Would we return- yes after we save up money as this is definitely an over $300 meal for 2 people.

This is a soft 3 stars. I was pretty underwhelmed by Prime. 

I ordered a medium 12 oz fillet and it was a lot closer to medium well than medium. Had it been a lesser establishment, I might have sent it back. I didn't want to cause a scene, though.

In terms of sides, I really enjoyed the herbed fries -- they were quite tasty and a good complement to the steak. Dito on the house steak sauce -- it was the best of the four sauces they presented.

Oddly enough, the highlight of the meal was the seafood platter appetizer -- huge crab legs and lots of lobster. Very tasty.

They should maybe rethink the name and change it to (sub) Prime or something -- a steak house should excel at steaks.

Loved the place, the view, the lamb chops and the service. 

I didn't really like how to order sides, theyre like ala carte style so it's like 12-15 $ each side. 

And my bf ordered the bone in prime rib that was 30 days aged and he said it didn't taste aged at all, it was 70$. He eats steak all the time and didn't enjoy it but we were really hungry and in a rush so even though the waiter offered a new piece,  we didn't have time to wait.

They took of our wine off the bill which was nice.

Fantastic. My Outlook calendar had messed up our reservation and they went out of their way to seat us nonetheless. The sommelier was knowledgeable and friendly and the staff top-notch. Most importantly, the food was delicious.
Poor service. Came with a large party and several orders were not prepared correctly.

OK so first things first - this place is EXPENSIVE. But in the realm of steak places on the strip, it's competitive. 

Our overall experience here was wonderful. We sat near the windows and enjoyed a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains all evening. The atmosphere is relaxed but still giving a sense of occasion, with a beautifully decorated dining room and traditional service to
match. Our server, Thomas, was friendly, engaging and helpful throughout, making us feel at home in an environment slightly
out of our comfort zone.

The food was excellent. I had the bone-in filet mignon - tender and sweet with a little extra flavour from the bone, and a delicious seasoned crust from the grill. The sprouts on the side were very good as well. My wife enjoyed her scallops very much as well. We shared a lovely warm chocolate cake for dessert followed by some nice tea (spot the English...).

One word of caution - this place has a dress code. No scruffbags in shorts or flip flops here!

Just excellent all round.

Service, Decor, Food and Wine all fantastics and worth the splurge.

This steakhouse is located downstairs of the Bellagio on the side by the fountains. The escalators can be found next to Giorgio Armani. Dress is business casual (no shorts). Very plush decor and dim lighting makes it a cozy dining experience. They do have a small patio area for outdoor seating as well.

You can view the menu we had on our visit on 3/1/15 since there are a few price and dish changes: https://butterfly1465.wordpress.com/2015/05/01/prime-steakhouse/

Our Order:
Potato Gnocchi
Sea Bass
Porterhouse
Dry Aged Ribeye
Bone in Filet Mignon
Bottle of Red Wine: ($188) 13528 Isoceles - Justin Vineyards & Winery from Paso Robles. 77% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Merlot, 11% Cabernet Franc.
Double Espresso: ($5.75) Added a twist of orange zest

The BF ordered the Bone in Filet Mignon. The meat was tender and extremely juicy. It was quite funny because as people were eating, there was a lot of moaning and comments on how good the steaks were made. The two favorite sauces were the Peppercorn and the Barnaise sauce (made of clarified butter emulsified in egg yolks and white wine vinegar and flavored with herbs). BF wanted to try the Sea Bass and since I was still full from lunch, I obliged him (even though I didn't think it was a good idea). Unfortunately, I wasn't too fond of the fish, it had flaky chunks of meat but was slightly dry and didn't taste really fresh. I suggest just sticking to the meats here.

Service was excellent. I had requested a table close to the windows for the birthday boy and the table definitely gave us a great view of the shows. We were super lucky because it had just stopped raining and the night was clear for us to easily see the show. Our waiter was able to give us great descriptions of the food and provided fantastic recommendations. The chairs were pulled out for everyone and every time someone walked away, their napkins were folded. Drinks were constantly refilled and since there was a waiter always nearby, anything we needed was quickly retrieved.

Dinner came out to about $100/person for our group of 7 and was really worth it. With several good restaurant picks for my BF's friend's birthday, I've now been assigned as the restaurant-picker on all future trips! :D

Food, location and service all ten stars across the border. Kristine our bartender was helpful and friendly. Amazing steak house with an unbelievable view of the Bellagio fountains ! Worth the investment

Eating at Prime will always be remembered as one of the best nights of my life. We were there to celebrate our anniversary. We made our Friday night reservations three days in advance and only had a 5:30 or 10:00 option. I am glad we went to for 5:30, because we were able to see the Bellagio fountains by day and by night. They were also able to give us a seat on the terrace which was amazing. Every bite of our meal was unbelievably good. Our steaks were perfect. They offered some incredible sauces. My favorite thing was honestly the white truffle mashed potatoes. WOW! The staff was great as well. Our experience here was nothing short of incredible and worth every single penny.

We had one of the best dinning experiences I've ever had (and I've had a lot).  Try to get a table outside.  We had the seafood tray then the porterhouse and a Australian tomahawk.  Be sure to get the mash potatoes!  Creamed corn is fantastic.  The doughnuts are truly delicious.

Beautiful restaurant looking at the Bellagio fountains. Great wait staff, very knowledgeable and attentive. Now, just a quick bad note, my husband got the peppercorn steak, which was not great at all. A little over done and the pepper flavor over took the steak in a bad way. My husband was too nice to send it back. 

BUT, the lamb made it a 5/5 for both of us. It was a perfectly done medium rare. With a tomato sauce on top. Since my husband had food envy and it was a generous portion, I shared with him. This was the best lamb either of us have had. It's been a few months since we've been there and I'm still telling everyone about it and dreaming of it!
Service, fountain view, baked potato and complimentary sour dough bread we're good.  The steak was very expensive and not that good.  Prime is very expensive and not worth it.

I was the maid-of-honor for a dear friend of mine so of course I planned a trip to Vegas for her bachelorette party! My job was to secure the hotel and pick which buffets we were to eat at (we purchases the $45 for 24 hours of buffets pass) and my sister's job was to pick one nice spot for dinner. That was how we ended up at Prime Steakhouse in Bellagio.

The food was amazing. This was what we ordered:

- Prime onion soup with gruyere cheese = absolutely divine. What's not to like about anything gruyere.
- Filet Mignon with shishito peppers. I had it medium rare because that's how I like mine to be done = melted in my mouth. Lightly seasoned but was very tasty and so tender.
- Peppercorn New York steak (this was what the bride ordered). Done medium rare. I had a taste and it was so good. Nice and meaty and lots of flavor.
- Caramelized scallops = so good! It has a slight sweet kick but also very savory. The scallops filled you up because they were huge.  
- Some of the sides we ordered were the summer corn, creamed spinach and truffle mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. All were superb! Well-made and delicious!

We made reservations and got there right on the dot. We were immediately greeted and seated right away. Our server and all the workers were very attentive throughout the whole dinner, refilling our water glass, making sure our cocktails tasted right, brushing the bread crumbs off our table, etc. Since it was a bachelorette party dinner, there was also a photographer that was there and took pictures of our party. She had it all printed on glossy paper and framed for us by the end of dinner and asked if we wanted to purchase any. We bought two for the bride as a memorable gift.

The restaurant was very clean and the set-up was done well. I couldn't get over how beautiful the restroom was! I could literally live in there! lol.

Prime Steakhouse did me well! I was very satisfied by the quality of the food and staff. 

There are so many good places to eat in Vegas and I'm on a mission to try them all so I probably won't be back to Prime anytime soon. But I highly recommend it! Try it out, pure Vegas experience alright!

The Good
- Attentive (and excellent) staff, variety of bread, great sides, and the view. At first glance the side portions appear small, but it's actually the perfect amount. Oh yeah, and then there's the view.

The Bad
- This is a Bellagio steakhouse. You're paying top dollar. I expect likewise. I ordered the dry-aged bone-in ribeye, medium rare. Came out lukewarm and under seasoned. The food came out relatively quick, so this causes some suspicion. Most steakhouses I've been to (Maestros, Mortons, etc.) usually take some time. 

They provide three sauces and I didn't try any since the meat should speak for itself, or at least that's what I'm accustomed to. Maybe if I drowned the steak in one of the sauces it would've tasted better. I'm not sure. Underwhelming steak experience? Definitely.

The Verdict
- Would I come back to impress a young lady with the ambience and amazing views? Sure. Would I come back for the sides? Maybe. Would I come back for the steak? No.

This is likely my favourite restaurant in the world. Whether sitting inside or on the outdoor dining patio overlooking the Bellagio lake, it is a phenomenal experience.

The service is always professional and diligent, if not a little cold. Being a steak lover, I have had some of the most consistent cuts of filet, always cooked perfect. Dining with a group, we splurged on the seafood tower and although insanely expensive, it was top quality for the evening. The pricing here is really expensive across the board however they clearly haven't cut any corners on decor and staff.

Whether dining with friends, clients or wife/husband it really is a perfect surrounding.

I would have rated this 5 stars but have to admit the last visit was uncharacteristically average but of course the same price. This is likely an oddity and look forward to the next visit.
This place is amazing. Wonderful views and the best French onion soup. The service was great and helped us choose a wine from the many selections. Def a must when in Las Vegas.

Great view, but as expensive as you probably would expect from a Bellagio steakhouse. Each side is like $15 bucks and I think my ribeye was like $70 for maybe a 16oz or something.

Two stars mostly though due to my steak being badly charred on the outside. I really should have sent it back, but I probably didn't since I had been drinking. Sigh.

Real good steakhouse in the Bellagio. My friend had one of his bachelor party dinners here a month ago. Great ambiance, and even better food. Creamed spinach, mac and cheese, and mashed potatoes were all highlights, as was the bone-in rib eye I had. Really enjoyed the french onion soup too. Cooked really well and super flavorful. No room for dessert. The wine pairing was also top notch. Great place to have a fine dining experience on the Strip.
Went to Prime this past weekend for my birthday celebration & we do not regret!! Perfect view, DELICIOUS FOOD, great service couldn't ask for more.

We were staying at The Bellagio for my birthday. We wanted to find a good steak restaurant for my birthday dinner before going to see "O". We chose Prime since it was in the hotel and heard it was very good. Well I can say it's expensive and not very good. We ordered the dry aged ribeye expecting a lot of flavor. For $75 I expected a lot of flavor but there was none. It was cold and absolutely no flavor. The sides was ok. They did not make my birthday special. I can't remember the last time I was so disappointed.

Very unimpressed with the service and food. They overprice just to be overpriced, and I know it's Vegas, and I'm fine dropping cash on a nice meal, but they could do a much better job. I got steak, potatoes and asparagus and have had equal quality at a much lesser restaurant. Our food took an extremely long time, which I can handle if they just let us know, but we got the 'it will just be 2 minutes' about 3 times for a total of 30 minutes (that was after we had already finished appetizers).  The waiter was condescending and snobby, which sucks because I was hoping for a nice night with friends. Was just very disappointed, I would recommend you try somewhere else. If you are going for the view, eat somewhere else and come back to watch the fountain.

If a six star existed, Prime would be the one to get it. I had one of the most delicious meals of my life in one of the most beautiful settings around. Imagine eating a 5 star steak meal window-side to an eye-level view the Bellagio Fountains. Picture front row access to a one-of-a-kind Bellagio Fountain show and eating as the Fountain goes off every 15 minutes in front of your window. This is an experience at Prime. 

Now, mostly everyone has described the food perfectly so I want to focus chat more about the picturesque atmosphere. Yes, the dress code exists so don't plan on coming here unless your dressed to impress. Yes this is the perfect option for a delicious high-end meal (without the cheesy Vegas vibe) and yes, this is probably one of the most fancy restaurants I've ever dined at. I really can't do justice to the restaurant's setting and while it is a little stuffy, it's perfect for a delicious and delightful dining experience. 

I can't leave this review without mentioning the food, especially since it was perfectly flawless. The wedge salad has the right amount of dressing with just enough kick and the pretzel bread that comes with the meal is buttery perfection. But let me talk about the real winners of the meal: the sides and the main courses. You know when people say Filet tastes like butter? Well now I know what they mean. I have never tasted anything so tender in my life. The short ribs are so perfectly cooked that you don't need a knife to enjoy it (maybe a little elf magic helped the chefs create these culinary creations!?) Finally, the sides. Oh the sides! Truffle mashed potatoes. They are expensive and come in a very small kettle. However, it's so rich in flavor and butter that it can easily fill up two people, especially with accompanying sides and an entree. The mac 'n cheese is just as delicious. Between those two sides, a salad and an entree, I could easily have called this my last supper and been happily content in life.

Perhaps a 4.5 would be most appropriate, but then again this was one of the best steakhouse experiences I've had. The dining room is stunning, intimate, and inviting and has gorgeous views of the Bellagio fountains. The service was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. We completely splurged, and went from classic caviar service to appetizers, entrees, and deserts. The steaks were cooked perfectly, dry aged and juicy, with a nice selection of sauces... though they didn't need them. I was told the lobster was as succulent as could be, but I am allergic and could not try it for myself. The shrimp cocktail, however, was excellent so I believe the comments on the lobster. The side dishes - the element that ultimately defines the overall success of a steakhouse for me - were perfect. The onion rings were battered, seasoned, and crisped to perfection. The mac & cheese was ooey gooey. The creamed spinach was fresh and not too creamy. The warm chocolate cake was heavenly.

This is easily one of the best steakhouses in Vegas, and the fountain view might just push it to the top if that's your sort of thing.

Been here twice and I'm always impressed w their service and quality.  I would probably never come on my own since it is pretty pricey.  But with an invitation by my wealthy gambling friends, any time! The steak is unbelievable. I had my first taste of Kobe beef here a few years ago and it was absolutely breath taking.  
Last night I had the seafood tower and it was delicious.  The king crab legs was phenomenal. Although I prefer to eat them hot.  I'm sure if I asked them to heat it they would have.
All in all, a beautiful restaurant in the most elaborate hotels with a gorgeous view of the water show. Excellent, expensive food.

Best meal I have ever had and I know good food. But not the best dessert.
 First off all I asked for a table by the window to see the water desplay when I booked it. i got there and they had us wait for 20 minutes and then kept seating other people by the window so i was pissed but then they came over to us and said since it was so important to us to see the water show they reserved us a table outside on the patio. It was AMAZING. The food was outstanding to. Loved everything but the dessert. Will definitely be going back.

I love Prime and all of it's over the top velvet. It's view of  Paris' Eiffel Tower across the Fountain , is in my opinion,  the best seat in the house,  and when you are lucky enough to score that spot it really adds ambiance .

I love steak,  and i love the steak at Prime as it has been consistently tender, juicy,  and sizzling. I love getting the Miso mustard sauce with my Rib-eye and asparagus and a baked potato as my sides ( the mashed potatoes are to die for but i try and save room for dessert ) I also love their beet salad. I have not had anything other than steak as my Entree  here but i feel they have a pretty solid menu .
Chocolate Souffle is excellent !

Service is more hit than miss so coupled with the great steak meal it still gets a 5 star rating from me after more than a few visits over the years .
*Service last night was on point *~ Thank You !
These Texans came to Vegas and they showed us how to cook a piece of beef.   Highly recommend for a top notch dinner.

Long due review here. Took my girl here for a special occasion. Made a request to be seated on the balcony when I made my reservation. We got seated promptly. Service was attentive and food was great. price is a little steep but you should already know that before deciding to dine here. it's definitely a experience and very romantic place. btw, she said yes...

My wife surprised me with reservations here for our anniversary on our last night in Vegas. The dining room has a great atmosphere - comfortable arm chairs with dim, romantic lighting - and we were seated at a table with a great view of the Bellagio fountains.

After each ordering a glass of wine, we started with the bacon-wrapped shrimp for an appetizer. I had the 8-oz filet and my wife had the slow-baked salmon and we split the Yukon mashed potatoes. All of the food was fantastic and the service was equally good. They gave us dessert menus, but before we had a chance to order one of the servers brought out their signature lava cake dessert that had "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate sauce...what a great ending to a great meal! When it was all said and done - wine, appetizer, entrees, tax, and tip - the bill came to $200.

If I had to find a complaint for Prime it would be that there were only three shrimp in our appetizer, which was about $20, and that they charged us $8 for water (Fiji).

If you're looking for steak heaven, come here and you won't be disappointed. 

It's not cheap but the food here is worth every single penny. We ordered the bone-in rib eye and the porterhouse and both were cooked AND seasoned to perfection (very important). The steaks were juicy, tender and packed with great flavor, and every single bite tantalized our taste buds more and more. Mine was so good that I didn't want to dip any of my 16 oz steak into the three sauces provided (i thought they were a bit too strong and didn't let the steak itself shine through), but my friend had no such qualms. After declaring it the best steak he's ever had, he fell in love with the miso sauce and proceeded to dip every single piece with the sauce since he loves strong flavors. So either way, it's melt-in-your-mouth kind of good steak.

We also ordered a side of whipped sweet potato and that was also amazing. A smooth, creamy texture with a hint of ginger to really let the sweetness shine through. 

And we were seated next to the Fountains. BEST EVER.

Was very Happy to be able to sit on the patio for once. I feel we came at a good time. The host was very personable. Always smiling and sat us right away. Our reservation was at 6 but took us at 5:40. We got to see the fountain show 4 times while eating so that made it more perfect for out staycation. Our server was an Asian male with glasses. He was very robotic and didn't smile once. I know it's fine dining but smiling helps. A lot of the work was done for him by his assistants. I figure with all that help you would spend more time with your tables. They forgot my coke not once...but twice...

I loved the food. Can't complain AT ALL. My soy garlic glazed Ny strip was cooked to perfection. On the side I had tempura onion rings. The kitchen cooks very well here. My Favorite part of the meal was the bacon wrapped shrimp. It came with a passion fruit sauce that more than paired well with it and made it more interesting than a normal BBQ sauce that's served with that dish normally. Only negative thing is that the shrimp came with 3 pieces and there was two of us. Spending $28 for one piece of shrimp was a little extreme. 

From the host to the server assistants to the fountain show to dinner this place was a hit. The service can be more personable and empathetic. 
Manager table touch would have made this night even better. Didn't even see one all night and it wasn't busy.
#ComingFromPeopleInTheIndustry

Steak that's more tender than a newborn baby and tastier than Chelsea Clinton covered in chocolate. What? Don't judge me.

Excellent service, excellent meal, excellent ambiance. You're coming here for steak, so don't be ridiculous and get anything else.

PS. This is my 69th review. 69!

Known for its views of the fountain show at Bellagio, this is not a restaurant that only has a view, but food to match. Unlike places I have visited that have a great view and leave you feeling like the meal itself is an afterthought the opposite is true here!
After a few bites you'll soon forget to look out the window! 
The dining room is luxuriously appointed with a plush and resplendent feel and a definite flair towards the romantic without being overly so. It's a great place for friends and family as well as couples. 
Having said all of that, the food really is the best part here! The NY strip, steamed king crab, bacon wrapped shrimp, bone in filet, truffled mashed potatoes, the beet or tomato salads, all favorites and reasons I come back on nearly every trip I'm here. Come splurge and Salute, they have delicious cocktails!

Awesome experience! Spent a week in Vegas for our honeymoon, heard so many great things about Prime, decided to give them a try! Not a bit disappointed. Ambiance was beautiful and romantic. Had a table next to the glass windows where you over look Lake Bellagio and the fountain show. 

Waiter was on point, continually asked if we needed anything, etc. Paid us lots of attention, perhaps he wanted his tip, either way, he worked for it. 

I had the 8 oz filet mignon and hubby had the rack of lamb. We ordered 2 sides each, I suggest just ordering 1 each otherwise way to much food. Ordered the asparagus, spinach, yams and of course we had to try the truffle mashed potatoes...OMG, they melt in your mouth!!! Oh and we shared the butter nut squash soup very tasty. Too full to have dessert :-( 

Definitely a place to dine while in Vegas for a romantic, tasty dinner!  Make sure and make reservations, we called twice, once they didnt have any reservations left, they suggested we call back around 2:30 for any cancellations and we got lucky.  So make sure and make reservations, no walks in I'm sure.

What can I say? It's a 4 Star Michelin restaurant. 300 bottle of wine. $660 for Kobe beef. The red carpet treatment. View of the strip. It was absolutely the most amazing place I have ever been. Hold your pinky high.

The meal was pretty good but for the price ($200 each with drinks and appetizers), I expected just a little more.  I had the ribeye which was impressive but not the best I've ever had.  It had decent flavor and was actually quite tender.  My friends each had the filet. They seemed satisfied but not blown away.  They had three different sauces to go with the steaks.  This isn't really my style as most good steakhouses let the meat speak for itself.  Also, I found it odd that even though we ordered different cuts of meet, we got the same sauces to go on our meet.  Shouldn't a world class chef be more creative?  Also, the server was unable to tell  which sauces were better for each cut.  

Their wine list was impressive and had all of the Napa wines you would expect to see and most other good Caliornia wines.  We went for a bottle of Justin Isosceles.  It was a very good bordeaux blend that paired well with our steaks.  

The server was friendly but might have been more appropriate for casual dining than a fine steakhouse.  He joked with us that our table was typically one of the worst in the restaurant because it was one of the only tables without a view of the Bellagio fountains.  We were a group of successful 20-somethings so I'm used to not getting the best service but to make it blatant that the hostess gave us the worst table in the restaurant sort of ruined the meal.  Honestly, we hadn't even realized the other tables had a view until he said this and never would have even realized it was a bad table but once he said something, we were left wondering why we were given a bad table.

This place is a nice atmosphere, we knew going in, it was high end and planned to pay for it but it was even more than we could've imagined. Drinks costed a fortune $30 for a bourbon and coke, meals cost $70 that's without sides so tack on another $20 for asparagus and $20 more for potatoes. With dinner, drinks and dessert our meal between 4 people was $800! We expected $500 so we were disappointed. Food wasn't worth that. You can see the light show for the Bellagio Fountains which was gorgeous but this high end restaurant just wasn't good enough.

Holy crap.....Top 3 best meals of my life for sure.  So I flew to vegas just for the evening to see my parents who were visiting and staying at the Bellagio....which was amazing in itself.  So we didn't have any set in stone dinner plans, but we were looking forward to a great meal.  I had heard prime was good, but my dad was actually the one who suggested it.  So we made reservation for 8:45 cuase my parents were going to see Criss Angel (which they said was so atrocious...) so they left early, and we were all starving so we went down to see if we could get in early, and to our surprise they sat us around 8:30 since they were super busy...It was 15 minutes- but still they did everything they could to help us out.  So we sat and were promptly greeted, and I mean service was wonderful and super friendly.  Our server even told us that they were understaffed that night (wow, they work well together) 

So let me tell you what I was super impressed with (i'm pretty easy to please) but our server came over to open our wine...we ordered the Bethel Heights Pinot Noir, which isn't a baller wine, but a really amazing Pinot.  Anyways- so he came over to present it and as he was about to open it the table next to us very rudely kept telling him to come over while he was in the midst of opening the wine.....so I told him it would be fine if he found out what they wanted....since they were making a big to-do about it....it was actually quite absurd and rude.....and he goes "No way, I am opening your wine, and you come first...." now this other table had multiple bottles of very expensive wine/champagne, and were a party of over 10.....the reason I was impressed was becuase the server didn't think about the money he was making with the other table, he made sure to take care of us and give us great service.  I was really happy.

Now the food:  WOW.  I ordered the onion soup to start....I don't think once in my life have I ever been able to finish a full onion soup.....i almost licked the bowl, it was amazing.  My mom and I decided to split the 28 ounce ribeye (very very ambitious)  We obviously didnt' even come close.  But it was cooked to absolute medium rare perfection....the truffle mashed potatoes were super super super smooth- and absolutely melted in your mouth.  We also go the broccolli....okay i'm started to get hungry just talking about this food.  Anyways service was out of this world, food was incredible and the atmosphere warm and chairs were super comfy!!  I can't wait to go back :)

My party of 3 arrived at Prime at 8:45pm and it was already a full house. We were offered to sit outside or we could wait 15min for a table inside. We decided to wait and sit inside because it is really hot outside in Las Vegas right now. 

For starters, I got the French Onion soup. It came out piping hot from the oven with melted Gruyere cheese on top(the best part). 

My friend got the caviar and she really enjoyed it. 1 oz was plenty for 1 person.

My other friend got the tomato salad. She said the tomatoes came out freezing cold (so just be warned if you have sensitive teeth).

Main entree:
28 oz bone in ribeye (medium). I shared this with another person and we finished it. It was good with the peppercorn sauce

Sides:
Truffle Mashed Potatoes
Sauted garlic spinach

Prior to seeing "O" that evening, my Mom had put in her vote for a "steakhouse", and left us to decide between Fix and PRIME. After browsing through a few reviews, in addition to reading through the menu, we decided on PRIME. The restaurant itself is absolutely stunning, and the front-row seats to the fountains (both indoor and out) certainly didn't hurt. The waitstaff was out of this world - attentive, humorous, and knowledgeable (ask for Howard, you won't be disappointed.) Cocktails were perfectly balanced, and dangerously delicious. Their Gluten-Free menu was extensive, and Howard made sure every side that could be made GF was, as well as oversaw the plating to ensure neither my Mom nor I got sick. I don't believe there is a bad dish on the menu, from the Colorado Lamb to the Filet Mignon (the Steak Tartare was divine, and both the Truffle Mashed Potatoes and Ginger Sweet Potatoes were out of this world.) While certainly not a restaurant we will return to daily, this will absolutely be our go-to spot for special occasions.

The mother of views and the mother of bills on...Mothers day.
Honestly I though I would be blown away. The food is good solid and sometimes wonderful, but nothing made me beg for more. Here we go:
Inside is dark as usual, keeping in theme with every expensive restaurant. My theory is people dont want to see each other?
Inside is damn depressing: outside seating is a must even if you have to wait. Luckily even with a reservation we only waited 30 minutes when told may be up to 90.
Complimentary bread=sadly, CPK, yes Calif pizza kitchen has much better bread.  Excited to see pretzel bread, but quickly extinguished when I felt the texture ( not stale or fresh, kinda like Nicolas Cage movies). The best in there was the sourdough, but none were really warm or crispy. 
Which fool dissects comp bread in a food review? This muthafucka right here, take it or leave it.
Ok...ordered 4 appetizzies, only 1 was borderline heavenly, and thats the salmon sushi rice cakes. This is a terrific appetizer.
The asparagus with mushrooms: great asparagus, mushrooms were too salty.
Wedge salad with bacon= standard good, could use more dressing and more bacon instead of just one long strip on top.
Crab cake= was pretty good, only ONE for $22 bucks. Most of these are in the 20 to 25 bucks range.

Main dishes: Wife and I had the scallops; they are HUGE I will give them that; 4-5 massive pieces the size of yams. It was quite good but...not the best Ive had. Bok choy was crisp and good (dont like the wilted ends but the roots.) I almost went to tears as 2 giant pieces were left cause we were stuffed, and last night I checked the rooms arent equipped with scallop fridges to take home back to L.A. (too bad)

Son had the lamb chops, there were good....but again not close to the best Ive had or even in the top 5, maybe cracks the 10. Lovely plating and presentation on all dishes however.
Fountains...I am over it the first time I saw it like 20 years ago, but if youre into that sorta thing and want to see them so close the mist hits the hairs or your forearms, this is the place. I was distracted by a silver- haired 70's white man and Asian "night worker" 20-30 years to the younger engage in deep conversation, not touching their steaks and having 3/4 of each doggie bagged. Bizarre sex props? Hey, its the LV.

I wish I could eat this meal every day! (Though it would be horrible for the waistline)

Had the opportunity to sit out in the patio where you have front row seats (from the back) of the fountain show.  The location was enough to make this a 5 star location.  Every 15 minutes, you are enchanted by the fountains of Bellagio.  What else do you need?  You can get full of that! But luckily, this place serves amazing food as well.

Seafood Platter:  A medley of raw oysters, raw clams, lobster, king crab legs, mussels, shrimp and a mixture of dipping sauces.  The oysters were extremely fresh and sweet.  The lobster was cooked well.  Not chewy.  The king crab legs were brine-y but also sweet in flavor.  The shrimp may have been one of the best shrimp cocktails I have ever had.

Filet Mignon: Ordered medium rare and it came out medium rare.  What a shocker.  No matter where I go, it's always so hard to get a steak delivered to your preference.  The meat was tender, not salty.  Dip it in their special soy dipping sauce, which the waiter said goes well with anything, and you are in carnivore heaven. After the platter,  you don't have any more space for the whole filet but you will want to eat it all.

Truffle Mashed Potatoes:  Creamy, rich goodness with the essence of truffle throughout.  SOOOO Good.  A must try when you are there.  Sprinkles of truffle on top.  Be shady and just scoop the top layer so you can get all the truffle flavor that your taste buds can handle.

The service was also amazing.  Waiters (and waitresses) were very attentive: always refilling water, refilling wine, providing details of the dishes and always asking if everything is OK.  Very polite and also very personable.

Had a great time at Prime.  The location was already amazing but the food and service topped it all off.

I had a fantastic experience at Prime.  The food was savory, well prepared, and the presentation was very nice.  It is very expensive, however, and only a few select tables get the views of the fountains.  

We started out with orders of Salmon Sashimi and Ribbons of Tuna.  Both were incredibly flavorful and exceeded our expectations.  The Ribbons of Tuna comes with a radish and ginger marinade that completely rocked my world.  I was not sure if I would like it or not, but I ended up using bread to soak some of it up once we finished the tuna.  I highly recommend it!

Everyone in our party ordered steak.  I opted for the special which was a bone-in filet.  The steak came out cooked to perfection and I savored every single bite.  Fantastic!  It was not the best steak I have had, but nothing has ever held a candle to the Wagyu steak I had back home.  I really wanted to try it here, but I just thought it was too expensive ($30 per ounce).  

The side dishes are very good, and the portions are large enough to share.  I opted for the Tender Broccoli with Truffle gouda fondue.  It was rich, and I couldn't finish it.  By then I was already full from the appetizers and steak.  

Our service was top notch, and I expected nothing less.  I have little doubt that we will be back again soon!

Took my boyfriend to celebrate his birthday and I have to say one of the best restaurants I have even been to. The view is amazing! The food was delicious ( I wasn't impressed with the Brussels sprouts tho). The service was out of this world. I forgot our waiter name but I believe it's Thierry? The steak, the sea bas, the beet salad and omg the truffle mashed potatoes were amazing. Worth every penny.

Their filet and rib - eye were phenomenal. Seafood?--ummm.. no. It's a steak house. My dove white fish had weird slimy yet chewy texture that i couldnt get over. I had to return the dish and got scallops. It was really salty! So get the steak.

I give this place 5 stars. It was the best filet I've ever had. I ordered it rare and it came out perfectly. However, my fiance had the filet also and ordered it medium rare. It arrived way overcooked and had to be sent back. The second attempt was only slightly better. The server was overly gracious and happy to accommodate us. However, I will have to subtract one star because my fiance did not like his filet as much as I did. The sides were standard for high end steakhouses, and the creamed spinach was quite good. The decor and touches are top notch.  You can also view the Bellagio fountains from the side windows. Overall, a great place for a special, romantic occasion.

By NO MEANS is this going to be a disappointing meal.The ambiance was outstanding. Anyone considering eating here, really should try it. Now, for starters, I am a local. When we go for steak dinner, we have ONE place that we always go to and it never fails. (God willing, it never will) The Golden Steer. For my dad's birthday, we wanted to do something different this year so we tried PRIME. While waiting for our table we sat at the bar. You can tell these guys have been working here for a while. They had a great attitude and had stories for days. When we were seated, we could't be happier. We sat in a small room to the right (most private area) and were right by the window on the water watching the fountains in full light. It was stunning. We started with the Seafood Tower. Magnificent. It was beautiful and of course delicious. Here is my complaint: they brought us a serving for three people, which there were three of us. But, if you have ordered a seafood platter before, it is not customary to serve per person because there is SO MUCH. Most places have offered to make it for a person or two less than what is in your party. Afterall, this is an appetizer. $67/person. I wish our server would have been a little more honest with us. This is something that will happen when you're on the strip. Some of the wait staff will try to take advantage of you. Especially when in fine dining and they are only going to turn their tables once or twice on a busy evening. So needless to say, we had way too big of an appetizer. 

For entrees we ordered the Bone-In Ribeye, and two peppercorn NY Strips. $61 for the NY and I believe $70 for the Ribeye. We got sauteed mushrooms, creamed spinach, and mashed potatoes for the sides. We also ordered some bernaise for the steaks. Yeah yeah, so I like sauce with my steak. The steaks were great. Cooked perfectly as well. But, first world problem, it just didn't melt in our mouths. It was missing that perfect tender melt in your mouth feeling that just disappears with a couple of chews. There was just something missing. They did however have a really nice char on them that left a crispy crust. The mashed potatoes though. My god. It was like a pot of melted butter. You had to eat them with a spoon. They were the best I have ever had. The sauteed mushrooms were great too. It is a wild mushroom blend fyi. The creamed spinach was okay. Nothing to write home about.

Total Bill: $544 (Tip not included.) We left a $100 tip. So this was a little over $200/person. 

I am very happy I went. It was a memorable dinner filled with good company, lots of alcohol, and some professional pictures taken by their house photographer. (Completely unnecessary but we were drunk by this point) So if you are considering going to PRIME while you're visiting in town, do it. I am sure you won't be disappointed.

**waiter name: Brandon
**team #20

Came here this past Saturday (3/28) for my birthday dinner that was suggested by Maribel T. I went on Yelp! and trusted my fellow Yelpers with over 400 reviews and 4 stars. Made reservations through open table for 7 people at 9:30 after our jabbawockeez show. My friend told me they closed at 10, but they still took my reservations so we were fine.

We made it to the restaurant a little before 9:30, I went up to the hostess that we were there, we didn't get seated right away. Probably took 15 minutes or so to get seated, not sure why when I had made reservations, tables were vacant and it was close to closing so they weren't busy! We finally got seated and several of my friends noticed our waiter was "sassy"!

Food:
* Filet Mingon ($66) medium rare. I ended up getting a steak, well duh! Something you should order at a steakhouse, haha! My steak was perfectly cooked and all 3 sauce that they gave me were delish that I couldn't choose which one was my favorite! 

*truffle mashed potatoes, they were yummy!! I totally recommend!

Service: 
Our waiter had a stupid, awkward, sarcastic, rude, dry personality! Since the moment we sat down half my party were annoyed by him. My friend asked where the restroom was and pointed one side and when she was getting up he told her something else. Towards the end, the waiter came up he asked if we wanted dessert. We said no thank you and he stayed saying "talk to me" leaving us in an awkward situation as if he would not leave until we ordered. Not only did we have a problem with our waiter but the other two waiters cleaning the table next to us were very unprofessional. They are cracking inappropriate jokes to each other that it made me feel like I was eating in a "ghetto" steakhouse; they were obnoxiously loud. One of the waiters continued to crack jokes across the table while he refilled our glasses with water. We would say thank you, and normally we get a "my pleasure" but nothing from the waiters here. A friend of mine asked for a to go box for her food, the waiter brought back her food in a to go box and said "here's your doggy, I mean your food." They were such jerks! We felt treated like dirt as if we weren't paying customers!

 I've been to several steakhouses in California and service was always superior, always exceeded my expectations. The food was good but it does not outweigh the terrible service we received. 

When my friend went to the restroom, the lady was cleaning the stall but told my friend to use it and she will clean it after. My friend said she'd wait for the other stall...obviously she didn't want to clean it twice. As an employee, you should treat your customers as if you just opened. Just because you're about to close the restaurant, doesn't mean you should rush your customers out of the restaurant or act inappropriate. 

This dinner was for my "golden bday" (28th bday on the 28th) and it ruined all of our nights with the service. I don't recommend anyone coming to this place, especially if you care about customer service. The employees here act like they're in high school, very unprofessional and immature!
Super classy atmosphere. Great food. Obviously it's an expensive place. You could probably find similar tasty food elsewhere that's not as pricey.

First off let me say that the food at Prime is impeccable.  The ambiance, view of the fountains, stellar.  So why the two stars? We came here for a friends 40th birthday.  It was a special fun night.  Our waiter Thierry was so rude and condescending.  Truly awful.  I wish that we would have just asked for someone else.  The lady that started us out was so amazing then we had to endure his constant scowl and bad attitude.  Considering my husband and my bill alone was 700 plus dollars and there were 6 other people with us I'm sure our table spent an ample amount of money to have to put up with this nonsense.  Not pleased.  

The food was all great 
Tuna ribbons 
Salmon sashimi 
Mac and cheese 
Oysters 
Dover sole 
Truffled potatoes 
Creamed spinach

I had one of my best dining experiences in Las Vegas at Ptime. The food was excellent and I'll never forget the truffled potatoes, even if they were "just" the side order.

Discreet but attentive service, perfect location with a grand view of the Bellagio fountains, a large wine list gives me many reasons to come back next time I'm in Vegas.

The place is beautiful and elegant, specially if you get lake view. The food was ok, but for the price I was expecting better taste! Staff was ok. Probably my expectations were too high, I would recommend other places I.e. El Lago!

I went with my husband  to prime on July 4th. We were seating on the patio and had a spectacular view of the bellagio fountains! The steak was excellent and we had great service. Would definitely recommend for a romantic date night spot!

Couldn't wait to come here for the 50th b-day dinner, but sadly, the whole experience was ruined by the hostess.  We arrived at 9 pm, walked passed the outside patio area and asked to be seated there, since almost all of the tables were open.  This rude hostess told us that they didn't offer patio dining and to try Picasso's or Olives.  What?  I had been seated in the patio many other times.  Dismayed, we left.  Upon returning, another hostess greeted us and asked if we would like inside or outside. Right then, the original hostess popped up from behind the counter and exclaimed "I already told them we don't offer outside dining!"  We were dressed very nice and were very pleasant, yet couldn't understand why this woman was so hell-bent on not giving us a patio table.
We then took a table inside.  I asked the waiter when they stopped serving outside.  He said that there were plenty of open tables, and he would ask the hostess.  She then came to our table and told us that those table were for reservations only.  It was then 9:20 and 4 tables were open.  Not sure what was said in private, but we were then moved to the patio.  No other parties ever did take those tables until closing.
This hostess, with her condescending yet does it with a smile attitude, was by far the rudest person I have come across in a long time.  I will never go back, no matter how good the food is. The rudeness overpowers all of that and ruined what should have been a great dinner celebration.

An annual update from my 5 star review from 1 year ago. 
We came back as we had a near perfect $400 dinner last year for our 45th wedding anniversary. Unfortunately this year was not a repeat.   Here is the blow by blow...
1. My wife discovered the bathroom had no soap... mind you this was at first opening. 
2. Service.  We were the first table seated, and was done so immediately at opening. Water and menus presented at seating.  After that the waiter disappeared for an extended time. Other guests had their orders taken quickly. In terms of service, our entrees came out about 20 minutes behind other guests... remember, we were literally the first ones seated. I finally had to ask about the status? Generically, the attention vs last year was night and day different.
3. Food: my wife had a Parmesan chicken dish., like last year. Presentation was AMAZING. It came with a lemon cream sauce, but the chicken was literally floating in it. She asked for a separate plate to drain off the excess.  The lemon was also a bit overpowering.  Last year I had the filet, but asked for a recommendation on the rib eye. He recommended a dry aged one. It was cooked nicely, but was a bit tough. Personally, I would stick with the filet. I also had the lobster tail, which was delicious, but at $85 was shockingly small. Independently, my wife observed how small it was...seemed at least 1/3 smaller than last year, and more expensive!!!
4. Lastly, my only issue last year, was the refill on a very small coke was another $5 like the first glass..... for 25 cents of soda, you are going to charge me ANOTHER $5? Restaurant responded here last year that they would address with management... I checked... still $5 for a refill.... on a $300 dinner...?? Waiter agreed it did not make sense. 
Unfortunately, we will likely be looking for another great Vegas spot to have our 47th anniversary.  Bookmark removed.
what an experience! WAIT FOR OUTSIDE SEATING WITH A VIEW! it is worth the wait no matter how long it is! breath taking!

My family and I went to Prime this weekend and thought that we were going to be in for a treat - we scored a table last minute on the beautiful patio and could not wait for our food.  The problem was all we did was wait - 20 minutes for water, 60 minutes for bread, and we had to ask twice to order wine and our food...you get the picture.  

After over an hour had gone by and we still did not have our appetizers - one french onion soup and one Caesar salad - my sister and I finally went into the restaurant and asked to speak with the manager.  After briefly explaining the situation to the manager, he informed us he would "look into it."  As we returned to our table, we found that our appetizers had finally made it.  The french onion soup had good flavor but was really greasy.  The Caesar salad was extremely bland.  

As we were taking our first bites of the appetizers, we saw the manager pop his head out on the balcony and presumed that he was coming to speak to us.  Instead, he never came back.  At this point, we were all happy to have a bit of food and prepared to sit back, relax and enjoy the entrees with our wine.

Again, we were disappointed as the entrees took much longer than expected to arrive.  When they finally did arrive, we were surprised to find that the food was pretty terrible.  The salmon was woefully undercooked (more than raw in the middle). The sea bass was far overcooked, chewy and fishy.   The seared tuna appeared to be covered in some sort of batter and flash fried.  The chicken entree was just blah.  Though we were starving, not a one of us came close to finishing our meal. 

Given the disappointing service and food, we asked to speak with the manager again.  When he approached our table, I asked why he had never spoken to us the first time - he mentioned that he saw we had a our starters and thought everything was fine.  After listening to our complaints on the food, he gave us a couple of excuses that really made no sense (it's a big restaurant, the patio is more relaxed).  

After confirming that our experience was sub-par, he then asked what we would like him to do about of experience.  We instead asked him what he thought he should do and suggested that the restaurant at least consider correcting the bill a bit given the poor quality of the food.  We were pleasantly surprised when he returned with the bill for the wine, soup and salad only - all of the entrees had been removed.   

We enjoy fine dining and thought that we had been so lucky to get into Prime - unfortunately, our night was almost ruined by this experience.  I would prefer to give this restaurant no stars because everything was just so terrible from the food to the service to the manager's response.  However, I to give the restaurant credit for two things - the manager properly adjusted the bill so that we did not feel like we had been robbed and the atmosphere is quite lovely.  Would I go back? No, but if you decide to go, stick with a couple of drinks and a fun appetizer or two and then move on to a restaurant with more consistent food.

We ate here for the first time. Got seated on the patio overlooking the fountain and I have to say I never get tired of the fountain! Our waiter was very friendly and so was the rest of the staff. I had a reward for 2 free glasses of champagne and my waiter took care of that right away. He also noticed the military imprint on my rewards card and gave us a military discount, without us having to ask. I ordered the filet and it was one of the best steaks I have ever had. It was melt in your mouth tender. My husband had the New York strip and he really liked it. Everything is expensive, but the sides are big enough to share. We split a Caesar salad and ordered 2 sides but were unable to finish it all. I definitely recommend the truffle mashed potatoes. Our waiter recommended them and they were spectacular. Make sure you plan ahead and don't mind spending a lot, but it's well worth it! The patio was heated and the view was amazing.

Located inside of Bellagio, I picked this steakhouse because of the reviews I saw on Yelp.  When we arrived we were shown right to our table.  

When I opened the menu I was struck by how simple it was, there weren't a billion choices it was just simple and to the point.  Our server was very attentive to the details and we had an awesome dining experience.  Our waiter also reminded me of the butler from Mr Deeds.  When I came back from the restroom, I didn't notice anyone around me when I went to sit down.  But as I was moving my seat forward there was a slight push from the back, I thought I had bumped into the seat behind me.  I turned around and there was our server, whoa like super sneaky.  When I told the waiter of my stomach not feeling well, he suggested right away soda water to help settle my stomach.  He also very patient with my lack of knowledge to pair which red wine to the filet mignon my dad was having.  We also ordered the Ribbons of Tuna, Truffle Mashed Potatoes, and Creamed Spinach.    

The Ribbons of Tuna was a very nicely designed dish.  The tuna sashimi was top grade because there were no lines running through them.  There was finely chopped avocado at the bottom of the dish with a sauce containing yuzu and a slight hint of spicy oil.  It was delicious, so light and tasty a great way to start a meal.  

I specifically requested that the butternut squash soup be brought out as my entree since that was going be my main course.  And the staff brought it out exactly the way I wanted to.  The filet mignon came with three sauces the soy rice wine was my dad's favorite.  The Truffle mashed potatoes were fluffy and had little chopped up pieces of truffle which brought a nice texture to the dish.  I wasn't able to try the creamed spinach and it looked ok.

Overall the service was spot on, attention to detail is the way I like it, and the food was outstanding.  O yeah we also got a nice view of the fountains outside which was like the cherry on top of the ice cream.  I highly recommend this restaurant and its a great stop in Vegas.

Great steakhouse in Las Vegas. Make your reservation early and request a seat by the windows to see the water show.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it's tacky to have a Photographer come around, take your photo during dinner and then haggle you to buy the photo. That seems more appropriate for an amusement park than for Bellagio's steakhouse.

Ever wondered what the holy grail of steakhouses looks/smells/feels and most of ALL TASTES like? Yes, you guessed it--Jean Georges can do no wrong! Absolutely EVERYTHING from the minute you walk into the restaurant to consume and experience is 10 notches above top notch.

Going through the meal chronologically--
 
The wine list needs to be tackled by someone with experience or a sommelier. Do not attempt to navigate this if you're a novice!
 
The freshly made bread basket has a mix of pretzel bread, nut/raisin loaf slices, and an awesome sourdough with room temperature butter that spreads very easily and is of the FRESHEST variety you can get when it comes to tableside bread and butter
 
Get off your high horse aversion to salads/vegetables and order one of these:
*Market Tomatoes -- the Burrata in here can kick the CRAP out of the kind made in most multi century old Italian institutions
*PRIME Chopped Vegetables -- a classic that's light enough for you to handle the onslaught main course
*Roasted Baby Beets -- the pairing of yogurt, balsamic, and hazelnuts almost belongs in a great brunch place but works well pre-main course
 
The clear standout in the meat department is the filet mignon. There's no rivaling this steak in terms of the meat itself, cooking technique applied, and balance of seasoning. However, should you choose to order something else:
*Roasted Organic Chicken -- the crispy skin, balance of seasoning, and tender meat will send your taste buds to new heights. The unfortunate side effect is that It will forever make you scoff at grocery store roast chicken.
*Braised Beef Shortribs -- this could easily fall in anyone's legit list for a last meal dish. Its fatty, juicy, and tender chunks of meat are euphoria inducing. DO NOT hit up a club after this because food coma is absolutely expected!
 
Side dish standouts:
*Ginger Sweet Potatoes -- clearly in a league of its own. This has converted sweet potato and ginger haters alike.
*Tempura Battered Onion Rings -- this raises an important question: why don't more places tempura batter?
*Glazed Market Mushrooms  -- a nice blend of unique mushrooms (not just garbage white/button mushrooms) in (what tasted like) a red wine reduction
 
Dessert
The Valrhona molten chocolate cake -- the quality of chocolate used here will make you think twice about ordering this anywhere else in the future
 
Some parting words--give this place the respect it deserves and show up wearing something nice. No doubt your girl will (cause she understands that sorta thing), so you should too.
If Yelp allowed 6 stars, Prime should get 7!

Located inside the Bellagio, this is a high end steak house with a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains.

Its price lives up to its location, but the food isn't nearly as memorable as the setting.

I came here for a family meal Thanksgiving week and had a great - if not quite outstanding - experience. The wait staff were knowledgeable and attentive, making recommendations when prompted. 

The starters were the star of the night, with large and tasty oysters and the most delicious horseradish I've ever tasted. The French Onion soup was also delicious, topped with plenty of chewy cheese. The Cesar salad, though, was forgettable, which is a shame.

For mains I went for the filet, which was cooked perfectly medium rare, tender with a good crust. We shared a handful of mains including an ultra rich potato dauphinoise - one of my favorite dishes, so no complaints there!

All in all it was a great meal, but for the price and location you may come away feeling like it wasn't quite as good as you anticipated.

I see lots of good reviews here....  but last Saturday Prime at the Bellagio was not on their "A game".   The steaks were not good.  They did mess up the order on one steak.  Two of the steaks were cooked to the wrong temperature - and missing flavor.   What was really weird, is that when things went bad our waiter went into hiding.  He let others on the staff apologize and try to fix the problems.   The mixed drinks and the wine was spot-on good.  However for a "upscale" steak house in Vegas....  they missed the boat...  sooooo disappointing.  They should be embarrassed to put those prices on the menu and let steaks like that walk out of the kitchen.

Ohhhh yes. Ohhhhhh yes yes yes yes yes yes yes.... 

Mmmmmmmmmm.

Yes. 

Filet mignon & truffle mashed potatoes.

That is all.

What is up with the restaurants at The Bellagio? First a totally disastrous outing with Michael Mina. An entirely mediocre experience at Olive and last night Jean-George's troops were struggling for mediocrity.

Upon making reservations, we were alerted to the dress code. Jackets required. I dressed well and upon arriving a large portion of the clientele was jacketless...some downright funky. If you're going to state the rules, stick with them.

Upon being seated in the beautiful surroundings we were offered menus and the wine list. The wine selection was broad and deep. The markups were also broad and deep. I know many of the wines represented and they were unreasonably priced. Silly. A glass of Veuve Cliquot was considerably more than what I'd pay for a bottle. 

The food....well, it was mixed. The bread was awesome. The sourdough was excellent but the pretzel bread was the real winner. We each got a piece. When I asked for another I was told they were running low and there would be no more pretzel bread for us. That was really too bad because it was the best thing on the table all evening. It was that good. I began with a salad...Heirloom Tomatoes, Burrata Cheese, Mussini Balsamic & Basil. The tomatoes were purple...a bit firm but OK. The dish was, well, ok. Kinda bland but passable. I had a steak waiting for me, right?

Unfortunately, yes. A Peppercorn New York Steak with Red Onion Compote. The compote was good. The steak was very tough. Cooked to a good medium rare, it was stringy and hard to eat. I ate less than half of it. Too much work. My guest is lactose intolerant which means no butter. The kitchen could not see it's way to prepare the carrots without butter. Same with the Brussels Sprouts. Maybe if we knew Jean-Georges Vongerichten...the enfant terrible of the food scene. Ah well. 

I wonder if Jean-Georges has ever been in Las Vegas. Nonetheless, I'd advise to wander across the hall to Picasso or head off to the Palms to visit Alize. Now they know what they're doing.

1.5 stars.

It's hard for me to review anything in Vegas because theres nothing authentic about that city and I love the authentic experience of food.  

The food is awesome and quality for the money.  The drinks are good.  The watershow is fun.  What more can I say?  it's not my thing but it does not miss the mark.  

Get a window seat.

Great restaurant.  Beautiful decor.  We got the best table outside with a perfect view of the fountain.  Food was amazing.   Best fillet I've ever had.  Truffle mash potatoes and creamed spinach were perfect.  One of the best dining experience I've ever had.

Great food great service just took a little long to get the food and very pricey absolutely high-end dining they were really only got steak here and seafood I've been going to steak houses all week long so I didn't get to enjoy it quite as much as I normally would.... but overall good food and great staff

This was the place to be, after Gordon Ramsey didn't allow us drinks we headed this way, once we arrived they were able to accommodate us for 3.
