We arrived here at prime and we were able to get seated pretty much immediately at the bar.  Once we were seated we immediately felt comfortable and well taken care of, they made us feel like family as Gordon Ramsey was complete opposite, make sure to go to prime as it is the place to be.

Bring your high limit AMEX cuz ya gonna pay big bucks - and it is worth it!
Wine list - is stellar - food is outstanding - get the seafood appetizer.

Request Russell - "bad Russell" that is (self proclaimed) but is a great server just asked him!

Our Vegas trip is not complete unless we go there. The great food, ambience and staff. Between my friends and i, we ordered close to everything on the menu and we never had a disappointing experience with the food or the portion sizes. Looking forward to our next visit.

What could be said about Prime that hasn't probably been said already. The restaurant is beautiful with views of the Belliagio Fountains. The service is fantastic and our professional servers were friendly, attentive, and very helpful with the menu. After a couple of masterfully executed cocktails at the bar our group was seated.

John Burke our Sommelier for the evening has an incredible ability to pair wines with everything you are eating weither it be Seafood, Steak, or Salads. He knows just what your palate and especially your soul needs.

I ordered the seafood tower, tomato and mozzarella salad, aged bone in rib eye (medium), and the donut tower. All accompanied by Mr. Burke's selection of several incredible wines. A monumental meal.

Our table of 6 had everything one could desire to eat and drink. The bill, hold your breath. 

$2,880 with tip. Worth every hard earned penny.
Best NY Strip steak that I have experienced so far; good atmosphere, great service ad outstanding food...!!!

One of my favorite places to dine in Vegas!! THOMASSS was amazing and was very helpful to us, this review is all about you!! THANK YOU!! The management/ employees were extremely professional. Will definately come back here and I highly recommend this place to everyone!! Amazing everything!!!!!!

Our party of four arrived a little early for our 8pm reservation, but the hostess had us wait just a minute while the table was prepared. I had requested a table on the patio since we were celebrating my husbands birthday and they were happy to accommodate our request. Once seated, the night couldn't  have been better. One of our party is vegan and the fact that a steakhouse had a special vegan/vegetarian menu available was really awesome. The others in our party enjoyed the sea bass, short ribs and bone in rib eye. All the dishes were fantastic. Mushrooms as a side dish were terrific. As we enjoyed our slow paced meal, we also enjoyed the wonderful Bellagio fountains and music every 15 minutes- a highlight of the dinner for me! We were never rushed so they could turn our table and we sat there for dinner and dessert until 10pm. Dessert was a cinnamon bread pudding presented inside a chocolate sphere over which a warm caramel sauce is poured, melting the chocolate. It was amazing. This is a place for a special meal!

So where to start. The server was generally rude. We tell him where we live and he starts talking about his timeshare there and how he can't be bothered to play at anything but the best clubs there. It was almost like he was talking down to us but kind of funny at the same time because we honestly don't really care.

I was hosting a corporate dinner there and this guy was going for the company card with no mercy. Ask for a wine selection and he suggests a bottle that is on special for $140, so I select it. Well, he billed me $255/bottle so much for it being on special, I missed that when i went over the bill because I was looking at the up charge on the steaks. 

He asks our guests if they would like something to start with, perhaps some caviar and a seafood tower made special for us. One of them spoke up and said we just came from an event where we had all of that. Before we could ask for other options, he looked annoyed and walked away, no give me a second, no i'll be right back, literally turned around and walked away. Our guests and I got a chuckle out of it. Then someone jokingly pointed out that the seafood app was $65/person and the caviar was up to an extra $200. 

The server comes back after literally 15 minutes to take our order and starts the hard sell again. As we go around the table, some of the guests order the filet and he looks at them and says "your want that bone in right?", so they said yes, well no mention that the bone in is an extra $20 per guest. Its not a big deal but its the way he did it, his intentions were so obvious, he was just so slimy. Every suggestion he made was the most expensive thing he could think of. We went along with it but even the guests got a laugh out of it when he walked away. One commented that he should be a used car salesman with how apologetically sly he thought he was being. He hit the deserts and scotch hard as well, we just played along at this point. The guy was such a tool. Anyway, the bill came, I gave him a shitty tip and got out of there. This is the first time i have given under 15% ever. I know these people live off their tips and its a big deal but this guy was just so slimy i couldn't support it. Anyway, i'll never, ever, ever go back. The rest of the meals we had in vegas were great. We hosted a dinner at Sinatra's and it was awesome, we definetly spent way more per person which really didn't matter but when we left, we felt like I had been served well and got great food. It was a relaxing environment with class. Not some guy druling over your corporate card hitting you up like a used car salesman selling an 1985 caddilac.  

Anyway, the food...
The good: 
Bone in filet was amazing. Really well cooked, well seasoned and good sized.
Salads were good as well, nothing out of this world but good.
Desert was amazing. It really shined. 

The bad
The steak tartar was terrible, its one of my favorite dishes normally but they had some kind of sour cream sauce on it and it was chopped in chunks with lots of big fat hunks. I would have sent it back but just didn't have the energy to deal with our server. He probably would have suggested that I wash the taste out with the Louis XIII and 2 ounces of caviar while he prepared a new "special for me" tartar for like $600... 

So i leave you with this. If you want to go to a "5 Star" steak dinner hosted by a shameless used car salesman, this is the spot.

Jean-Georges Vongerichten does steak, in Vegas - AND it's not going for the stupid Vegas prices I've become accustomed to... What's not to like?

I had the lamb - cooked to perfection, served with a selection of house-made sauces.  Delicious.

Well done, again JGV, well done indeed...
Wonderful experience!!! the service was fabulous, food so delicious, wine amazing!!!! Oh and the view...simply the best!!! It puts the Myrtle Beach location to shame!!!!
Legit one of the best steaks I've ever had. Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten definitely knows how to make a steak! The flavor and marbling were to die fo

I'm a big fan of Jean-Georges restaurants, and Prime is no exception.

The blue curtains and velvet chairs are stunningly elegant.  The food is wonderful.  

The biggest drawback?  They don't have outdoor seating.  Prime does have the outdoor garden/patio area, which is about as close as you can get to the fountain show, but it's only for cocktails.  I think Steve Wynn's group learned from that oversight as he thought through Botero and the SW Steakhouse.  Once you experience the settings at those places, it's hard to overlook it at Prime.  

You'll have up close views of the fountain show here, but the better views of it are across the street at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.

Classy romantic restaurant with a view!  Highly recommend getting a table near a window to watch the fountain show.  Located at the Belligio Hotel.  American Style Steak House at it's best!  Beautiful decor and attentive service.  Dry aged bone in rib eye was cooked to perfection with tasty sides.  Nice place for a romantic dinner or night to celebrate!

Went here for the first time on Monday night. UH-MAZING! I don't usually go to restaurants like these..but since I was in Vegas for work, the boss took us here. We got to sit right where they show the water show. It was pretty great :] . They ordered an onion soup for me because I can't eat seafood....fantastic. So cheesy..mm!

I ordered the filet mignon..AOSDOAJDSOJ
It just pretty much melted in my mouth!
Never tasted anything so amazing..

My sister also ordered the truffled mashed potatoes...best I have EVER tasted. It was amazing.

Of course a very pricey place.

It was the boss's girlfriend's birthday that day. Usually restaurants would bring out like ice cream, or a slice of cake..NOT HERE.

THEY BROUGHT A FULL CAKE. It was HUGE. I was so shocked..and...it was delicious :] 

DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!

We had reservations for 7PM and was at the restaurant before 7 and we did not get seated until 7:23PM and that was after we had to go up to the hostess to ask what was taking so long. There is outside dining where you can see the Bellagio water show. If you say inside with a window you could also see the show. The dining room is very royal and elegant. It's a little dark. We ordered the bone and NY strip both cooked well and the sauces were amazing. It had such good flavor. Our server was on point.

My boyfriend and I visited for my birthday and I was very impressed.  The atmosphere was wonderful and we sat in a secluded library overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  We shared a steak that was one of the best I have ever had.  Jean-George is one of my favorite chefs, especially after eating at his restaurant in New York.  He truly out did himself and they suprised me with a delicious chocolate desert.  I highly recommend this place to anyone celebrating a special occasion, although I was a little dissapointed they didn't offer to take a commemorative picture for us to by like they did the bachelor party at the table next to us.

Oh, what a night!  We came to celebrate my husband's birthday as he hit another milestone in his Life.  Thanks to wonderful friends, Jan K and Randy F, for joining us in LV.  You made this momentous occasion extra special and so memorable at Prime.

We were winding down on a 5-night drink, eat and be merry fest (husband's birth week) with Jan and Randy and had planned dinner at Prime on my husband's birthday.  From the late 90's when we've visited Las Vegas for either business or leisure, we've often passed by Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten's elegant steakhouse which overlooks the fountains at The Bellagio but never dined there until this Saturday.

I have to say that we've been fans of Chef Vongerichten since the early 90's when we dined at his first Vong restaurant in NYC.  He masterfully played with exotic spices and herbs to create his version of Thai-inspired French cuisine.  So, to dine at the first one of two Vongerichten restaurants in Las Vegas was a no-brainer.   

This elegantly appointed restaurant offers a romantic ambiance within a classic steakhouse.  During warmer months, one can book a table overlooking the Fountains at The Bellagio.  But, it was too chilly so we that dined indoors.

Our server for the evening, Jason, was top-notch as he offered his oenophilic expertise while we placed our dinner selections.  He was attentive and non-intrusive as he and his team seamlessly kept our beverages filled, cleared plates, paced our dining selections and maintained a personable professional manner.

Appetizers:
-Chilled Shelffish Platter with Coctail Sauce, Mignonette & Mustard Sauce.
-Seared Hudson Valley Foie Gras with Black Olives, Lychee & Brioche 
-Golden Osetra Caviar with traditional accompaniments
-Ribbons of Tuna with Breakfast Radish & Ginger Marinade

Salad:
-Caesar with Romaine, Parmesan & Lemon

Meats:
-A5 Certified Kobe Beef from Kobe, Japan 20 oz.

Seafood:
-Cold Water Lobster Tail, 8 oz.

Sides:
-Creamed Spinach
-Gratin Dauphinois with Comt Cheese

Desserts:
-"Fountain" of Glazed Donuts:  Blueberry, Chocolate, Oreo, Grand Marnier & Classic with Chocolate and Caramel Sauces
-PRIME Cinnamon Bread Pudding
--Birthday Truffles

This was an unforgettable and truly memorable birthday celebration with great friends.  Thank you, we are humbled by your company and generosity.

Steakhouse was delicious. View was great. However it was definitely pricier than steaks I have gotten back in NYC that are better. I know being compared to a Peter Lugers, Keens or Del Friscos is a hard hand to be dealt but if you're gonna charge more than those places and then name yourself "Prime" then you're challenging someone to wonder. I wouldn't consider this steak equal. Its still great but I'm being critical for the reasons above. 

All that said, I didn't have a horrible experience. I ordered a filet mignon rare. Before you jump on me for being at a steak house and ordering filet just understand that I wasn't hungry. Everyone else ordered the bone-in rib eye med rare or rare and I got to taste it. 

My steak didn't come out rare. It came out medium. The catch is someone else ordered a filet and they got theirs rare but ordered medium. By the time I realized it was too late since my friend started eating his while I was in the bathroom. So the servers messed up. Whatever. 

Again, just want to end with this place isn't horrible. It has an average rating of 4/5 for a reason. Im being critical on purpose. When i go back to Vegas Ill be visiting a different steakhouse though. It wasn't good enough to compete with the best so I have no reason to be loyal to them when there are so many other options I have yet to try there. 

TLDR: It is overpriced and not as good as the best NYC steakhouses I have been to. Its still good. The view is great.

One of the best restaurants we have ever been to! Fantastic ambiance , very chic and classy, the food was beyond amazing. Dry aged rib-eye and the beef short-rib were excellent. The Caesar salad was delicious as well. We had a lake view table and the view was breath-taking. An amazing place for a romantic dinner. The staff were extremely polite and professional as well. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

Food is good, but not much beyond average. Honestly preferred the meats at Wynn buffet. Service was fine, but not particularly accommodating ( my mother was very cold, we asked to lower the AC but they wouldn't budge ). Prices are very, very high. I would never return here personally.

Super expensive but the food/view was fantastic! I had the short rib and a ginger martini both were incredible. Highly recommend if you are looking for a super nice night out. Be sure to look at the menu pictures if you want to see sample pricing.
Incredible dinner! The steak was amazing. Make reservations and skip the mashed potatoes. Order a martini. Leave room for dessert!

Probably a top 5 steak for me, the food was outstanding and the service was great as well.  Only issue I had was our table.  We had a reservation for over a month and the restaurant wasn't busy but they put my bachelor party in the corner by the bathrooms, it was awful.  The food is great but sadly next month I will not dine there again because we were thrown to the side with our reservation.

Expensive as hell but their a5 wagyu is amazing. Go here to experience it once. Its a really fancy place so expects to pay a lot.

It's a difference experience eating and tasting the wagyu and comparing it to other meat. It melts in your mouth like butter. It cost around $50 an ounce so get the 12 ounce one and share. Cuz sharing is caring.

Dont waste money on any other items cuz you're already broke from eating the wagyu.
Typical steak house. Very overpriced but you pay for the scenery and service. Still a great date night. 18 dollars a martini.

I had to find an anniversary dinner which had amazing food with equally amazing views.  I was a little skeptical of Prime because I've been to the other restaurants on the Bellagio waters, and they were nothing to write home about.  

We were seated outside, overlooking the fountains.  The dry-aged ribeye was a party.  My wife and I were trying to figure out what made each bite so good, but at the end, we came to the conclusion that it was just damn good.  I've had Mortons, Flemings, etc. and this steak ranks higher than those places.  

The wife ordered the Chilean seabass, and it was just alright.   The fish was flakey, but there was not much taste.  

I'm comfortable giving this place a 5, even with the mediocre fish, because our dining experience was everything we hoped for.

Five stars for the service and view of the fountains.  Beyond that less than average food at inflated prices.  Oversold on the lobster which was not good... two bites and I was done.  Tartare was raw meat and chives... with lime wedge on side.  no quail egg.  Disappointing.

They made a decent martini.

My mom took my sister and I here for our 21st birthday prior to seeing Cirque du Soliel's O at the bellaggio.  ABSOLUTELY AMAZING, I still think about the mushroom encrusted salmon and truffle mashed potatoes.  I have never been served such a giant piece of salmon. Our server was excellent, I wish i knew his name to give him credit, but he was great at explaining menu items and the different wines to us.

Let's just start by saying that Vegas has become an over-priced, over-hyped, self-indulgent toilet of a town, if it wasn't already.  Second, I have never enjoyed any meal I have gotten in Vegas, nor has it been worth the price or crappy service that accompanied it.  Letting that color my view of "fine" (and I say that with a grain of salt) Vegas dining, it could be hard for me to put that out of my head.  I had recently eaten at Brand in the Monte Carlo.  So I had a feeling of what was to come.  Let's start with bartenders at the entrance of Prime.  Complete jerks.  Just because I am in my early/mid-20's doesn't mean I am poor or not going to spend beau-coup dollars.  The food is horribly overpriced, but when you are trying to cultivate a "superior," asshole feel to your restaurant, that's okay.  The problem is Las Vegas is miles from any reasonable agricultural area or the ocean.  That raises some flags for me.  Maybe that is why it cost more to eat there, but when you look at craigslist for jobs and homes, you see that cost of living is not insane in the Vegas area, so maybe I can just chalk it up as a "tourist trap."
The food was actually okay.  I got a lamb dish that was small, but reasonably cooked and came with a tasty mint sauce.  I also got a side of mac and cheese which was decadent beyond all belief but relatively standard for such an easy dish.  We split one bottle of wine for  our group because the prices were psychotic.  While the list was very voluminous, it wasn't worth paying for half the bottles on there since you were paying well over 150% over store retail.  I have a problem with this restaurant because it is no different from every other crap offering that every casino in Vegas has.
The service was average, but our waiter was clearly perturbed with the average age of our table.  We tipped well anyways but we felt like he made a thinly veiled comment regarding our ability to pay and the possibility of us ditching the bill.  That cost him $20 as we left since one of our party, who works in restaurants, had said he never heard such a comment.

Prime. (5 stars).

"Prime: of the best possible quality; excellent." - Google

"Opulence: great wealth or luxuriousness." - Google

These 2 words go hand I hand when describing the feast & service u will enjoy at Prime Steakhouse in the Bellagio.

---

I have been to Prime 7 times (6 of which were really pre-Yelp days) & each visit has been more enjoyable than the last.

If ur willing to spend a little more to have a phenomenal Certified A5 Kobe Beef Steak, then u have come to the right place!!

Why do I say that, because Prime's "non-Kobe" steaks, while tender, are in line with most other notable Steakhouses, & I can't say there is much of a difference, aside from the beautiful ambiance!

Kobe Beef really is the game-changer!!

---

On one of my previous visits, my server told me that Partner Chef Jean-Georges VONGERICHTEN, who also owns Jean-Georges Steakhouse in CityCenter, is authorized to serve Certified A5 Kobe Beef. He told me that Prime uses the same supplier as JGS which is why Prime can say they also serve Kobe Beef.

Now I don't know if all of that is true, I just know the Kobe steaks at Prime have been tender, savory, & exquisite!

---

We ordered so many different items off the menu that we had to play "Tetris" with all ur dishes.

I felt bad that I took over the ordering, but I really wanted my friends to just enjoy the evening!!

I did finally get to try caviar! Russian Sturgeon Eggs were $195/oz. Honestly, I'm not exactly sure what I thought they would taste like??!! Perhaps fishy or briny??

But no, they just tasted like muted Tobiko (flying fish roe). I enjoyed the light crunch but can't say I have a refined enough of a palate to understand this delicacy...

---

Instead of rating every dish, I'll highlight my two favorites:

Certified A5 Kobe Beef (Ribeye) - $55/oz. (5 stars).

"Wagyu refers to any cattle that is bred in Japan or the Japanese-style. Kobe beef is comprised of a very particular strain of Wagyu called Tajima-Gyu that is raised to strict standards in the prefecture of Hyogo. (Hyogo's capital city is Kobe, thus the name)." - https://www.mychicagosteak.com/steak-university/2016/05/10/wagyu-kobe-beef-difference/

No, ur eyes aren't playing tricks on u.

Yes, our Ribeye was from Hyogo prefecture.

Prime charges $55/oz. Our ribeye was a behemoth of a steak weighing in at 20oz!

Note: U can pick any weight u want.

What makes Kobe Beef so coveted & sought-after is its marbling, flavor, & tenderness.

The seasoning of butter & S&P was spot on! Each slice was tender & bursting with flavor.

The shishito & bell peppers also absorbed all of the savory juices which made them... MINE!! ALL MINE!! LOL... I have to say I absolutely loved the peppers as well. Slightly crunchy & oh so divine!!

The Ribeye was marbled, fatty, & juicy!! My steak melted upon impact with my tongue. Ohhhh... Emmmmm... Geeeee!!

I'm sure the company had a huge influence on my outlook, but nonetheless, the best steak I have ever had. PERIOD!

Note: U can order a Kobe sampler which comes with 9oz (total) of NY, Ribeye, & Filet or u can mix & match which cut u prefer. Kobe sampler - $495/9oz. I have tried the sampler twice & decided I just enjoy the Ribeye!!

Sauted Sea Scallops - $47. (5 stars).

I caved in & decided to get an order of sea scallops because I had a wicked bad craving for these succulent & buttery mollusks!!

OK, OK, Rod U., in this instance, the scallops were just as delicious as Maine's!! I can admit it.

This dish actually comes with a black bean sauce that I didn't even need or notice!? I am extremely glad that our server didn't pour the sauce into this dish as I think it would have ruined it (for me).

These scallops were seared to perfection. A light crispy outer crust was noted & greatly appreciated.

Biting into a perfectly cooked scallop is like biting into a marshmallow to me, as far as texture is concerned.

Prime's scallop had a succulent & buttery bite that was just chewy enough to know that the scallops were cooked through, but not rubbery, which would indicate the scallop was beyond over-cooked.

The baby bok choy were tender & seasoned perfectly with S&P & butter. It made me feel healthy for eating something green!

---

For those who plan to use ur MLife Comps, just remember, the gratuity is NOT included in ur final bill.

Nor can u use ur excess MLife comps to pay ur tip. Shucks. LOL JK!!

Only cash or room charges (credit cards) are accepted as forms of tip.

---

Although I never rate service, I have to say, the service I have been given every single time I have dined at Prime has been phenomenal!

The servers are very knowledgeable & personable. They cater to ur every need or want!

Luxury, Quality, & Service are what is to be expected when dining at Prime.

I still think Prime should change their name to Opulence!! Prime is my current meat-lover's dream come true & I don't have to travel abroad to enjoy Prime!!
Wonderful atmosphere with glorious fountain views. On the pricey side, however, for the quality of meal. Overall a quality splurge

Celebrated our 4th wedding anniversary here. Our first getaway in over a year since having our son,  everything hands down was amazing.  The decor and view is perfect for a date / upscale environment.  The service was great.  Not only gave excellent recommendations, knew the menu, and they cleaned and refilled drinks quickly before you even have to ask.  Food flowed out nicely.  The tomato salad with burrata was delicious.  I also ordered the sea bass and my hubby ordered the steak.  For dessert we chose the honey crisp apple pie with cinnamon ice cream.  I don't think you can complain about that.  Come in here if you are not worried about spending the money on a nice meal.  It's worth it.

I love steak and I promise you will not be disappointed here! We came here for my cousin's bday while visiting Vegas. It is located in the Bellagio and it is a high end steak house. Like every where in Vegas, the place is pricey, but the quality of food is also there.

Our party was seated promptly and we had 2 tables. The service was amazing and one of the steaks was overcooked and our waiter took it back and made another without any issues. The view is nice because you can see the fountain from our table which went on every 15-30 mins or so. 

I had the Bone-In Rib Eye medium rare and it was cooked to perfection. It wasn't too rare and most importantly, it wasn't overcooked. The steak had just the perfect amount of fat in it and the quality of the steak was good too. I would definitely pay the price for this steak again!

Love the place, It's inside Bellagio underground..kinda lol. I havent been here in years (last time was in 06). Decor was nice, it gives me that romantic feel. The food was great, like, It's REALLY good. The BEST lamb chops I've EVER had. Of course I've had other food as well but the lambchops makes me want to come back for more! Serve only the best of wines. The service was GREAT, it had to be! I saw Michael Jorden here from us, he was literally right next to us.. that was cool lol. But You know what they say, Big names does come first. They gave him our table the night prior. But it's okay.. he didnt know. besides, who were we comparing to him? We're only big names in the Poker industry, but him? world wide.

I was with a dining party of three. The experience was good; however, our overall impression was three stars. My Filet Mignon with grilled Serrano chilies was to my liking. It was preceded with an Onion Soup appetizer. I had mashed Yukon Gold potatoes with my steak. The Ribeye steak was judged to be ok, not in keeping with Prime's reputation. A Shrimp salad was deemed very good. A Broccoli side dish was considered strange, it was seasoned with fresh mint. Not to the liking of those who tried it. Our waiter was genial, yet we had a feeling of strained politeness from the waitstaff team - and a collective sense of moving our party out as fast as possible. We chalk-up this experience to "been there, did that."

The place came highly recommended by a friend. I won't be listening to them anymore. Ordered the dry aged ribeye , my choice, but highly touted by the waiter. I ordered it rare, but he said that would would make the meat too chewy??? I asked that it be on the rare side of medium rare. Steak arrived well done, so I asked for the next to be rare, and I would take my chances. This one came out medium well. It was supposed to be 18 oz bone in. It was a half inch thick, and couldn't have weighed 12 oz. I haven't been to the Sizzler since I was 12, but I would give the edge to the Sizzler. They offered to redo a third time, but my wife was already done. They took my steak off the bill, and I still had to pay $175 for apps my wife, 2 sides, and 2 drinks. When I asked the manager to rethink the bill, he said that was the best he could do. With all the good choices in Vegas, this should be your last choice.  P.S. I eat out 7 nights a week, and you'll see I only have 5 other reviews. I only take the time to do this if the place deserves it.

The food was delicious. The ribeye, Sea Bass and scallops were the tables entrees and they were very tasty, but the risotto and the mac and cheese are incredibly good!! The service was excellent. The wine is very overpriced but it is a great selection. The experience was great, but when I asked to go to an almost empty patio to order dessert and coffee, the server brushed us off and said they don't do that anymore. So I need to get on my iPad and re-reserve just to do dessert at an empty patio? Should rethink that a little for slower nights and customers I think. Overall really good experience for us!

We had a large group in town for furniture market - we made our reservations early and the Prime experience didn't disappoint! Attentive staff that made sure every thing we wanted or needed was provided. From the amazing seafood towers to the extensive wine available, all the way through to the deserts our dining experience was complete. The atmosphere can accommodate large groups like ours or the intimate date night - we will certainly be back!
Everything about this place is first class. Sure, you will pay for it but it's worth it to experience royalty on special occasions.

Unbelievable service and food, truly a delight!

I was lucky enough to be included in a business dinner at Prime. The service was incredible. The dining room is dim, but somehow creates the perfect intimate sentence amongst the velvet back drops.

Our party had a seafood tower that had chilled muscles, clams, lobster, shrimp, crabs, you name it! It was all of an extremely high quality and car with 3 excellent sauces. For dinner I had a 10oz. Filet Minon with a side of creamed spinach and brussel sprouts. The sides were split amongst colleagues and there was plenty to share. My steak was cooked a perfect medium and melted on my mouth. 

Dining at Prime is an experience. The Belagio fountains outside were a stunning back drop. It is, in a word, divine!

Disappointed in this restaurant sad to say. We had a party of 9 and arrived at 6 pm on a Saturday. Seated promptly for our reservation. Server seemed a little snooty and when asked to customize a salad basically a Caesar with a different dressing seemed very put off. The onion soup was tasty but lukewarm.  Our filets were requested medium but came out undercooked. The fries and onion rings that came out at the same time were cold. Once our steaks returned 5 minutes later  they were cooked appropriately and were very tender and well seasoned. The sever rarely checked on the table. The sauces served with the steaks were very good. If we had not been with a large party I would have sent back our accompaniments to have them at the proper temperature but didn't want to delay the table. Overall a disappointing experience for a highly rated restaurant with a high ticket price.

Too pricy and not worth it .
If you want to watch water you can watch it from somewhere else other than thais place .

If you have lot of money to spend you can visit this place.


Don't ever ever go...

We had dinner at Prime Monday night, St Patricks Day to celebrate our Anniversary. We both ordered the dry aged prime rib steak, which was excellent. Started with squash soup and Seared Foie Gras both were good. The ambiance is fantastic with the Bellagio surroundings and the memorizing fountain... stunning. It is very pricy, but inline with higher-end Las Vegas showcase restaurants.  

So the negatives: I started the meal by ordering a dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives, it was very good. The problem is they started slamming down plates as soon as the drink was served.  I hardly had time for a few sips before the super fast service started.  It was Go Go speed racer style service. It felt very rushed. The rushed plating and service made the experience feel very touristy. The waiter forgot our wine order, we had to remind him. This seems especially bad for a fine steak house to fail to service up the ordered wine with the main course., a fat juice steak, that begs for a big red wine. I would assign most of our negative experience at the hands of the waiter... he seemed distracted and lacked the finer art of high quality service.

I fully enjoyed my dining experience at Prime!  Beautiful restaurant, plush furnishings, romantic lighting, all first class. We were lucky and got a table with a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains. 

Service could not have been better. Our service team was attentive but not annoying. Everything was timed perfectly, dishes cleared properly, etc. 

I started with the black and blue martini. Gin and blue cheese stuffed olives with a sprig of rosemary. It was good but the rosemary was overpowering. Gin is so aromatic already, I felt like it was ruined with the rosemary. I quickly pulled it out and enjoyed the rest. 

They bring out a complimentary bread basket. Pretty basic with two types of bread and regular butter. Nothing special. 

For my appetizers I had the bacon wrapped shrimp. They were absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection. I also had a wedge salad. It was good but pretty standard as far as wedge salads go. I have had better. 

The steak that I ordered was great. New York strip medium rare. It was done perfectly and had great flavor. You can choose peppercorn or some type of glaze on your steak. I chose peppercorn but should have ordered it plain. They bring out three kinds of sauces with the steaks, so it's probably better to try the steak plain and add sauce on your own. It didn't disappoint though. 

For sides I had baby brussels sprouts with pear and bacon (a special that night) and also had potatoes gratin. Delicious!! 

Dessert was a very slight let down. I had the pumpkin creme brle. It was more like pumkinless creme brle but still good as far as a creme brle goes. 

They have nice restrooms within the restaurant. Anyone familiar with Las Vegas restaurants knows that having restrooms within the restaurant itself is a treat. They also provide Molton Brown soap and lotion. Nice touch! 

I will definitely return to Prime at Bellagio. 

Enjoy!

A wonderful view with delicious steak how can you go wrong ? We came here with a party of 8 people. My boyfriend and I have been to mostly all of the bellagio restaurants. The prime was a beautiful location near all the other restaurants. The food was so delicious. Since we were a big party we ordered a lot of sides with our main dishes. Of course I had the French onion soup. The dessert was really delicious and chocholaty. Unfortunately the service was okay it could of been better dinning at a fancy restaurant like this one. The servers kind of had an attitude which wasn't very pleasant when your trying to enjoy a nice dining experience.

Very enjoyable experience. Classy ambiance, nice service and very good food. Some detail on each:

Ambiance - The restaurant is nicely decorated with long curtains and the tables were well spaced so that you weren't sitting on top of anyone else. They played great standards in the background (Sinatra, Tony Bennett, etc.) One of the biggest pluses is the setting -- you're right next to the Bellagio fountain. It definitely adds to the experience to be able to watch the water cannons fire off every 10 minutes. Be warned, though, I don't think every table has a good view of the fountains. You might want to request that when you make your reservation.

Service - All of the service staff, from the hostess to the busboys to our waiter Russell were very friendly. Everyone was polite and asked how you were doing. This is the kind of class you expect from a nice steakhouse. On the other hand, Russell was actually almost a little too chatty. When he found out we were from New York, he took the opportunity to tell us about his daughter's recent trip to New York with her friends and on and on he went. This happened a couple of other times too. Listen, it could've been much worse. He was very friendly and offered good advice about the food. But someone just needs to remind him that people don't go out to eat to make friends with the waiter.

Food - Smallish house cocktail list. My wife enjoyed the house cosmopolitan. I ordered a Chimay Red from the good-sized beer menu. For dinner, I had the 21-day aged bone-in filet mignon special. The waiter said it was 8-10 ounces but when the plate came out it was definitely at least 10. Was overcooked just a tad (more like medium than medium rare) but had excellent flavor anyway that was even better with some of the waiter-recommended soy ginger steak sauce. My wife had a New York strip which was served already marinated in a soy-ginger glaze. That, too, was very flavorful. We added a side of the brussel sprouts and pancetta, which we gobbled up eagerly. My wife's only complaint was that her steak knife was actually quite dull -- she traded knives with me and even though I had the more delicate cut of meat, I still had some difficulty making a clean cut in my filet. For dessert, my wife enjoyed a delicious bread pudding and I struggled to finish a large, tasty trio of raspberry, coconut and mango sorbet.

My wife and I came tonight for dinner at prime,we had scheduled reservation nights back to back because we enjoy this restaurant so much. Russ was our server, he is amazing. We started with the shrimp cocktail , with 4 huge shrimp fresh, wasabi and a delicious cocktail sauce on a bed of ice with lemon perfectly displayed.  We next ordered the iceberg wedge salad with blue cheese, bacon and tomato. We ordered it chopped and split it, was perfect for two.
For our entre we ordered the Parmesan-Crusted organic chicken artichokes and lemon. potatoes.  Since we were coming tonight back to back we chose to have a non-beef entre it was cooked perfectly and the flavors were well balanced it was delicious.  For our sides we chose   Gratin Dauphinois-Comte-Cheese and the butternut squash,  they were perfect with our entree selection.
For our dessert we slected cappuccinos and cream Brul . As always Russ G. our server and team provided exceptional service. Grace the photographer, always drops by the table and is so pleasant.  My wife and I have been coming to Prime since 1998, it has always offered exceptional service and food.

Dined here once and only once.... several years ago, so things might be better now.  But ---

Food was quite disappointing, especially considering that this place is located inside one of Sin City's premier casinos.  Steaks were overcooked (asked for medium but got a notch below well).

The most disappointing thing about Prime, though, is the service and overall experience.  One guy serving our table.  That was it.  At the competition, one would would get a captain and a couple of "assistants" at their table.  But not here.  And the server was neither attentive nor professional.  Saw him maybe four times the whole evening.

We celebrated our 1st anniversary here and they did a great job making us feel special. We had a seat by the window for the water show and a sweet "happy anniversary". The lobster and filets were very good! Cooked perfectly. The steaks come with 3 sauces and they are all very uniquely delicious.

Prime steakhouse exceed my expectations - the steak and sides were all some of the best I've ever had. For example, who knew onion rings could be that light, yet that delicious?  My peppercorn crusted NY strip was perfect.

I'd probably pass on the mini donuts when we go again - beautiful presentation, but the oreo one for example didn't taste anything like oreos.  The cream filled ones were perfect, however.  Small quibbles with an otherwise superb experience.  We will be back!

There's no shortage of steakhouses on the strip, but this place has something that none of the other spots have...a patio with a stunning view of the Bellagio fountains and Vegas strip.  I HIGHLY recommend asking to sit on the patio when dining here.  It's an unforgettable experience.  

I got my go-to steak which is the cajun bone-in ribeye. Theirs is dry-aged and cooked perfectly.  I ended up splitting mine with a buddy who made the horrid decision of going to a steakhouse and ordering the salmon (whoops), but still left full.  The menu offers a wide selection of cuts, including A-5 Wagyu at $45/ounce, and a huge selection of sides (truffle mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, Glazed Mushrooms) that round out your meal nicely. 

If I'm in Vegas, I always make it a priority to visit this place.

The best steak hands down!  Service is the best.  I ate here twice, once outside and it was so magical because of the fountains.  There is mist from the fountains be warned.  Inside was amazing and everything we ordered was made perfectly. The best.

Fantastic service, atmosphere and food.  We ate until we couldn't anymore.

My first visit here was spring break in college and my roommate who had not eaten steak in years (he went veg for a while) decided he would break down and try it since we were in such a highly regarded steakhouse.

He loved it and raves about it to this day.  Good times.

I took my fianc here for his birthday dinner, and we had a wonderful meal with fantastic service! I started with the delicious beet salad and had the filet as my entree. The filet was perhaps the best steak I've ever had...and we are from a city that prides itself on its meat so there is definitely a list to compete with! He started with the onion soup and got the surf and turf for his entree and was thrilled with all of it. We also split the mushrooms and gratin as sides. I didn't love the potatoes but he did; the mushrooms were delicious, though! I had mentioned it was his bday when I made the reservation and they surprised us with a TO DIE FOR molten cake and homemade ice cream. The service was also excellent -- very sociable and knowledgeable. Russell and Scott were the best! Although this was of course on the pricey side, the next morning, he woke up and thanked me again for the meal so it was worth it!

My wife and I ate here a few years ago, while staying at the Bellagio. It's a classic Prime steakhouse that's very luxuriously decorated.

The steaks are all prepared correctly, have good marbling, and are very tasty!

We tried to Beef Tartar for an appetizer and thought it was amazing. The mixture of the chilled beef, sauce, pepper and capers made for a very yummy dish. My wife typically orders her steak 'Medium' and even she loved it!

Seeing as how this was my first time in Vegas I had no preconceived notions about Prime, and had never heard of it, so I walked in with an open mind. I ordered the Soy-Garlic Glazed NY Strip, and the Truffel Mashed Potatoes, and it was amazing. Sometimes you get steaks from restaurants who take so much pride in their steaks, but in my opinion without some type of sauce or glaze, it's just bland to me, I don't care how tender it is. I am a man of FLAVOR...lol. This glaze was soooo good, even after I knew I was full I was determined to finish that steak. There was no way it was going to waste, not one bite. The service was great, the environment calm, chill, and relaxing, very classy. The only thing I wasn't impressed by was the Caesar Salad. I think I had a Caesar Salad every day in Vegas and in my opinion it wasn't as impressive as the steak, not bad, just wasn't impressed.
Dinner included the seafood tower which was packed with great super fresh shellfish.  Had the filet cooked perfect, had had a few fries and Mac n cheese.

What a disappointment! It's too bad that Prime is a big sore spot in what is otherwise a very strong lineup of restaurants at Bellagio.

Unfortunately, we encountered service issues all night. Overall, the waitstaff seemed very slow and inattentive - which is amazing considering how many staff they seem to have just standing around - and I think some of the problems indicate poor management and training. Most noticeable was that we often had to flag down waiters to get our wine and water refilled. The food runners also kept putting food in front of the wrong people - this happened with our appetizers, entrees, and even after-dinner drinks! The most mind-boggling service failure occurred when the runners brought out all appetizers, salads, and soups at the same time, leaving a bunch of appetizers to be chucked in the middle of the table vaguely near the person who ordered them (and only after we told the runners who had ordered what).

Also, I think the way Prime does the table settings and places food could be improved; we were at a larger round table and it felt like waiters were constantly leaning over us to get to stuff nearer the middle of the table - personal space violations abound!

And even given the service problems, Prime's biggest failing was that our steaks were very poorly prepared. Mine was perhaps the worst; they offered a bone-in filet as a special, which I ordered medium rare but came out extreme 'black and blue' - gushing red in the middle while being charred on the outside. Several party members noted they had steaks that were overcooked. The steak was also very, very salty.

Originally, I was going to give +1* because of some solid sides, including the truffle mashed potatoes, macaroni and cheese, gnocchi, and Brussels sprouts; also, my tuna ribbons appetizer was tasty, with a nice spicy kick to the accompanying sauce. The problem is, who goes to Prime for appetizers and sides and ignores the steak and bad service? I wouldn't, and even though Prime is closer to a 1.5, that's why I can't in good faith rate any higher than 1*.

I am so glad we checked out Prime on my birthday! My sister-in-law lives in Vegas and said she's been wanting to try Prime, so why not? We made reservations, got seated outside with a spectacular view of the Bellagio water show. It was a hot day but when the water show goes on, you actually get a little bit of cool water breeze every now and then.

From beginning to end, this experience was classy AF. Our server was Brandon and he was kind and funny, our kind of dude. He totally entertained our need to take pictures of all of our food (see attached food photos nom nom nom) and cracked little jokes with us when we scarfed down the appetizers.

We ordered the oysters, steak tartare and market tomato salad for our appetizers. So delicious, came out quickly and we finished every bite of it. It all went well with the bottle of bubbly we got (celebrating my birthday!) and soon enough our sided and entrees came out.

The sides: crispy maiitake mushrooms are the BOMB! Be careful because that sauce it comes with is spicy. We were saying the mushrooms taste like Hot Cheetos! (In the best possible way of course!) And the truffle mashed potatoes were heaven. We also got mac'n'cheese as a side which was super yummy as well. 

The entrees: my husband got the dry-aged bone-in rib-eye, my sister-in-law got the sea bass and I got the filet mignon. All of them were superb all around and went well with the sauces that came with it to. My filet mignon was tender and perfectly cooked medium rare, the sea bass was seasoned just right and I didn't try my husband's dish but he loved it. It was more than enough food for all of us so we took some home. We finished the night with some creme brulee and special birthday truffles for me!

All in all, a wonderful experience and I would come back again for more special occasions.

Ambiance and Atmosphere are A+, Food is excellent, Service needs a little work.  It's in the Bellagio so you expect a little upity and they sure do deliver.  If you look past the high class attitude of the staff you see true elegance and fine dining.

Our experience started off with a long wait due to a mix up with the reservation, good opportunity people watch and checkout the fountains.  They later made up for the botched reservations, but still annoying.  Very crowded for fall weekend night and the sure sign they over booked was the sight of the staff rolling out tables to setup mid evening.

Steaks are surely prime cut and the kitchen really knows their stuff.  Head waiter was a bit stuffy and kept disappearing on us.  Wife has the Rib Eye, nice and tender, cooked perfectly - rare warm center.  I went off in left field and ordered the Duck - must have been the cocktails that threw me off course (nice stiff drinks $$$).  Was expecting something different but after mulling it over a few days, came to the conclusion that it was a spectacular dish.  Hearty breast fillet that cut like a steak, cooked perfectly.  The almond crust was like candy and the red wine amaretto reduction was paired perfectly.

For the sides, the table shared the Truffle Mashed potatoes, Mac and Cheese, Roasted Mushrooms, Roasted Broccoli, and Crunchy Potatoes.  Mac and cheese seemed to be everyone's fav but it had too much depth (if there is such a thing) for me, if you like sharp cheese this one is for you.  The crunchy potatoes has a great name but in the end was just a deep fried baked potato.  The truffle mashed was nice and creamy.  The roasted vegetables were surprisingly good, the broccoli has some heat with the jalepenos.

All in all a good experience, will definitely order steak next time!

This place was easily the best place I've eaten at in Vegas. It's located in the Bellagio, not too far out of the casino. Me and a friend had a table right by the water, while the water show was going on. It was the coolest table-side entertainment I'd ever had. Steak was terrific, as were the sides. If you've got the money, try it out.

Yes, it is an excellent steakhouse....  the peppercorn new york strip was incredible.  the mashed potatoes were out of this world.   the sauteed mushrooms were the best I've ever had.
Fancy/Dressy- yes.
The service----  let's just say our server had mild anger management issues. I sinced it immediately,  I am a feeler and I picked up on his negative energy  immediately.
I should comment that as the night went on the servers  attitude elevated, but I must say I am knocking off a star because of his demeanor and poor knowledge of wine.

We were so excited to try this restaurant for a birthday.  They have a little something for everyone.  Service was friendly and prompt.  However, Pretty sure when we reserved our table we requested a table by the window to celebrate.  We didn't get it.  We got seated in the back behind a post.  

We were unsure of what side we should get.  Sides on menu run $14-18.  The waiter kept pushing us on risotto saying it was the best ever.  We finally gave in and ordered it.  It was not good.  It had a strong pungent odor to it and was hard to eat.  When we got the bill, we found that they had charged us $44 for the risotto.  We regretted not getting the Mac-n-cheese or mushrooms as sides.

We ordered ahi tuna, which was good, but had a rice around the sides which kept sticking to my teeth.  

Overall we were extremely disappointed.  Our bill for 2 people was $272 and for that we really expected something more outstanding.  Disappointed.

Nice place with delicious food.  Location inside Bellagio.  The bone-in filet was melt I  your mouth delicious.   All the sides were super good.  Great service.  Highly recommend the coconut souffle...it is a beautiful dessert creation for any bucket list.

It is expensive, so go there with customers (;

Excited for a night out at a very nice steakhouse.  Sat outside which gave an amazing view of the fountains, but was quite chilly even with the outdoor heaters.   Service was slow although the 4 wait staff we had were attentive.   When the meals finally came we were definitely underwhelmed.  My filet was overcooked... ordered it medium and there was no pink inside.   My husband had the peppercorn crusted NY strip ordered medium and his was absolutely rare to medium-rare - red cold center.  We did not send them back... we were cold and had already been there an hour and a half.  Sides and salads were good as were our drinks.   Nothing over the top, but good.  Overall have had a much better steak from Flemings back in our hometown... for a much more reasonable price.  For the price of our meal and after the recommendation from friends  I had expected much more.

If it were not voluntary it would be larceny. The pros: Excellent filet mignon-gorgeous setting, very relaxing. Very good waiter if a bit pompous, but he's French.
Cons: wine prices at about 1000% markups. Wine list prices are for high rollers who don't pay directly but you do. A "reasonable" bottle suggested for only $116 is a Cabernet with the Bellagio name on it. Vile is an understatement. No good restaurant would have this bitter mouth wash on its wine list. It was sent back. Finally ordered with sommelier help a $100 bottle that was ,at best, acceptable. They allow people who know zilch about wine to take your order and make recommendations. really unacceptable. Then again, this is Vegas, a place with absolutely no class unless it is no class. This restaurant is a perfect example, in my view, of why Michelin stopped rating Las Vegas restaurants. There are simply no restaurants in LV, especially the big French names, deserving of the old Michelin ratings, not even the forks. 

The place is slightly understaffed and really understaffed with professionals. We ordered a sushi dish as an appetizer. Really bad, the crust tasted like cardboard, could not find a Sushi taste with the fruit like pilings on this thing. It also went back. A $14 piece of fruited cheesecake was good, a value here. Service was good but not up to the price level. They should send their entire staff to Taillevent or the old Jamin for lessons. But why bother when most of the sheep accept whatever they are given.

Amazing food, stanch atmosphere that feels a little rushed. 
All staff work together for the full experience but I can assure you that you are moved through with a timer on. We were sat next to the entrance of the kitchen. It was like being next to the opening of a tunnel lol
These people were on a high speed mission to get in and out with lightning speed of a Waffle House. We decided to take dessert back to the room to allow some peace to eat. 

SEARED HUDSON VALLEY FOIE GRAS*
Was really fatty this resulted in a mushy feel
Great flavor but texture was lacking 

BUTTERNUT SQUASH SOUP
Biggest thank for no mushrooms and was amazing. Perfect presentation 

FILET MIGNON 10oz
Absolutely perfect temperature and taste
Please create a smaller portion 

GINGER SWEET POTATOES
Wonderful 

You can't even describe the dessert with anything other than MAGIC

If the experience matched the food and staff, your ratings would climb

This was one of those dining experiences when I knew from the time I was greeted that it was going to be a special dinner.  I made reservations as a Yelp friend had recommended well in advance of the date I wanted.  I had a ticket to see 'O' at 7:30 and this was one of the Bellagio restaurants that I never went to and also one that opens at 5 giving me plenty of time to enjoy dinner and not worry about making the show on time.

I was seated promptly after a few parties ahead of me.  I was taken to a side room in the front--not one of the coveted center tables directly overlooking the fountains--but it was a really nice room and I could see much of the fountain show in any case.  My servers were Team #18.  I'm not sure if the waiter gave me his name or not.  If he did, I missed it.  He asked about drinks, gave me the menu, and explained some of the things on the menu.  I was also brought a nice selection of bread and some butter.  The bread had been warmed nicely.

I started with the tomato gazpacho.  The bowl had several groupings of avocado, celery, some peanuts and other goodies.  Onto this vegetable grouping, the server poured the cold gazpacho.  He then ground some fresh pepper on the soup and I was off enjoying the first course.

For the main course, I got the 14 ounce filet with bone in cooked barely--blue.  It was accompanied by two shishito peppers.  I also got a side of gratin dauphinois with Comt, a gussied up name for potatoes au gratin.  When I saw Comt, I knew this was it.  It's the kind of cheese I always buy for eating at home.  The steak was done exactly the way I like.  The potatoes were excellent.  A very pleasant side dish that I almost finished.  With the steak, the waiter brought a platter with three sauces, peppercorn, a classic Barnaise, and their house soy, rice wine sauce.  Of the three, I liked the soy, rice wine the best but I used it sparingly.  I'm generally a purist when it comes to steak.  It really doesn't need a sauce.

For dessert, I got the coconut souffl with chocolate sorbet.  The plating was beautiful.  The souffl was perfect and the round of sorbet on a small bed of toasted coconut was a perfect accompaniment.  

Now as to service--it couldn't have been better.  It was top notch.  The server was a friendly gentleman and the bus person was quite efficient.  I had a fresh glass of iced tea before I finished the first one.  The plates were cleared promptly and when my server said the souffl would only take 7 minutes, he was correct.

The maitre d'htel came around twice during the meal to check how things were and we chatted for a bit.  It was a grand meal and I'll be returning.  This would be a great anniversary dinner.  I think I'll make the reservation soon!

Wow..what an experience.  Prime is absolutely beautiful inside and the level of service matches the prices they offer.  I was wearing black pants so the white napkin was replaced with a dark one.  We had two servers and they attention was consistent without being obtrusive.  I had the aged bone in ribeye which was amazing.  Their prices are not for the weak of heart but you need to know that in this town, it is par for the course.

I went here to celebrate my graduation from UNLV due to its reputation. Everything was great, atmosphere was warm and seats comfortable. The food was very good. Only thing that bugged me is usually at high end restaurants if you tell them u are celebrating something they would bring a desert out for you. They did not, it's a small touch that goes a long way.
best dry-aged rib-eye steak! worth the price! great service!
Excellent service, excellent food, excellent ambience! 5 stars if you go you must sit on the patio area, when I went it was down for remodeling so I guess I will have to come back again

Here on a birthday trip for my wife. We had the great opportunity to stay at the Bellagio (Her dream hotel). I decided to surprise her again with tickets to "O". Before we went to the show we ate here. 

High class, fancy shmancy. This place oozes with opulence and romance. I really enjoy going to a place like this a few times a year. The lighting is low the waiters are attentive and the food is excellent. 

We started off with the french onion soup, not the best I've ever had but very good. 

The waiter then informed me that they had A5 Japanese Wagyu beef for 50 dollars per ounce. You only live once people, might as well live as much as you can. I ordered 4 ounces. 

The $200 filet came out, and it was worth every penny. The BEST filet I have or ever will have eaten in my life. I've been to some of the best steakhouses and this without a doubt was worth the $200. For me it was a once in a lifetime, unless someone else is paying next time. Melted in my mouth and had flavor for DAYS! 

The sides were mac n cheese and scalloped potatoes. Bother were great, but all I could think about was that filet... damn that was good.

Alright, let's cut the crap. 

Nice atmosphere? Yea not bad. 
Dry Aged Rib Eye? Yea it was pretty good. 
Did I go "Goo Goo Ga Ga" over this place? Absolutely not. 

Here's the problem I have when I go to a high end steak joint: you reach a point where the quality of the steak reaches its zenith and you're basically paying extra for the ambiance and service. If you're going to take my money, by all means, please work for it! 

Maybe it's just me, but I like it when the person waiting on my table is knowledgeable about the different cuts of meat. Yea, I already know all the good stuff, and I know what I'm going to order, but I find it entertaining when they go through the menu with me. Anyone off the street can stroke my ego and say, "excellent choice, Sir". 

Very good steak but I've had better (with a better experience) at other places. 

And served with steak sauces? No no no no no no nooooo, please, that's a straight up sin in my book.

With Prime's level of snobbery, you'd at least think the chef would season the steaks before cooking...

If you're looking for a standard steakhouse menu set in the palace of Versailles, then Prime is probably for you.

Highlights: The menu is pretty standard fare but it's got all of the staples - steaks, potatoes, French onion soup, shrimp cocktail, creamed spinach etc. The quality of ingredients is very good and the potato dauphinoise were a very tasty side dish option. The wine list is pretty expansive as well.

Low lights: Prime's ambiance is extremely stuffy. The waitstaff does little in the way of making you feel at home and we found our server to be very impatient and overbearing. The ornate setting doesn't really compliment the menu properly, however the panoramic windows in the dining room provide a nice view of the Bellagio's water show. None of our steaks had been seasoned before cooking which is practically a cardinal sin. How would any chef hope to create the perfect crust and flavor profile without a generous helping of salt and black pepper? Seriously disappointing...

If you're staying at the Bellagio and looking for a steak dinner, Prime is a convenient option. Otherwise, go to the absolutely fantastic Carnevino at the Palazzo.

Amazing food.  Amazing service.  Everybody knows exactly what they are serving and what goes with what.  Foodie or not this place is worth spending the extra money to get a amazing meal with an amazing view.  The fountains going off just added to the ambiance.

My gf & some good friends treated me to this place for my bday dinner!
Reservations were made for 5:30pm. Things came up so we pushed it back to 6pm; they had no problem with that and were nice about it. A friend ordered a ribeye, and about 10 minutes later asked if he could change his order to a porter steak. They allowed it and were also very nice about it. A+ for service here.
A steakhouse in the Bellagio... It was very nice & elegant, as one would expect from the sounds of it. We were seated in our own private room around a round table.
We ordered
- Porter steak: a friend & I ordered one. Delicious. Huge. Parts of my medium-rare steak were more so rare (a friend said it was still moo'ing), but I didn't mind. My friend's medium steak had parts that were more so medium-rare - he didn't mind this either. 
- Filet Mignon: My gf & her sister got this. I honestly thought it was the best piece of filet I've ever sank my teeth in.
- Ribeye: it comes in an 18oz and a 28oz. My friend is a big eater and he mentioned that he should've ordered the 28oz.
- Mac & cheese: AWESOME! I ordered it with my porter, and I thought it complemented my meal perfectly. Yummmmmmyyy.
- Asparagus: Fresh
- Broccoli: Fresh
All in all, the meal was a very memorable one for me. My steak & mac/cheese was delicious, and service was top notch. Very, very pricey. I do remember my porter steak being around 58$ on the menu, and the other steaks being of similar price. The side dishes were all around 10$ or more.
*One of my friends wanted prime rib in particular and at a place called "Prime" Steakhouse, you'd think they'd have it, right? Wrong.
**Advice: I'd suggest that you order ur steak to be cooked at one level higher than how you normally ask for it. Ex. If you like urs cooked at medium rare, ask for medium.

This review is longgg overdue! Visited Prime Steakhouse on Valentine's Day. My boyfriend made reservations a month in advance to celebrate both the holiday and our two year anniversary. I couldn't have asked for a more romantic and beautiful setting to celebrate these special occasions! Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio was truly a wonderful experience.

First off, the ambiance. Breathtaking. The inside of the restaurant is dim and decorated beautifully. Glass windows gives you and incredible view of the fountains and of the rest of the city lights. Dress code is formal, so ladies, make sure to put on a nice dress and your sexiest heels, and men, a dressy shirt and tie is suggested. Seating indoors seemed great, but my boyfriend had reserved a table for us outside on the balcony/patio. Wow! That's all I gotta say. You are sitting right by the water, where the Bellagio fountain show takes place every 15 minutes. This was truly and amazing and breathtaking view! Your table is under heat lamps so being cold is not an issue, and it's also decorated w a candles to set the mood. Very romantic! Would definitely recommend trying to reserve this section. Holds about 5-6 tables.

Now to the food, delicious! We started off by ordering the shrimp cocktail, served over a bed of ice with wasabi and its cocktail sauce. So good! The shrimp is cold and fresh and definitely very tasty. My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon and loved it! He said it was cooked just right and the sauces it comes with adds the perfect touch to it. I ordered the Parmesan Crusted Chicken, comes with white asparagus and lemon basil butter. It was good, but very big! Such a huge dish! I couldn't finish it and left a little more than half in my plate. Very filling because of its size. Order if you're hungry or maybe share it with someone. Huge! 

We also ordered the truffle mashed potatoes to share. Mouthwatering. The mashed potatoes literally melt in your mouth and the truffle oil tasted so good! A definite side you must order! 

As for drinks, we each had a cocktail, which I believe was called the Jasmine. So good. Very light and refreshing, great for a lightweight like me. :) I had 2 glasses! 

Dessert was a must! We had a chocolate souffl cake that came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Of course we finished it all! Amazing!

I really loved this place! If you are looking for a classy, romantic night out, Prime is the place to be! We even saw a guy propose to his girlfriend during the fountain show! So beautiful! 

Reservations are very easy by either calling the restaurant or booking online through Opentable. Hope you enjoy the restaurant as much as my boyfriend and I did!

Prime is inside the Bellagio with a classy interior and a romantic ambience. This is actually not my first time coming here, but I absolutely adore this place. Their filet mignon is the most tenderest cut of meat that I have had at a steak house. It was cooked a perfect medium rare. Their seafood platter was exquisite; and the crab was so juicy. What I love about this place is that cold plates are actually cold and hot plates/soups are HOT! Not just Luke warm or mildy hot if that makes any sense. I would recommend anyone to go eat here!

Every time we come here we are never disappointed! Not only is the food delicious the service is fantastic! This is what fine dinning should be all about!  We split a filet mignon  and lobster tail. To die for and had their famous scalloped potatoes! It was perfect I would defiantly recommend coming here it is the perfect!

Five years later, it's still good! I'm actually glad I reread my previous review because I got to order the creamed corn again even though it was off menu. Our waitress checked with the chef and he made a pretty standard version. Looking back at the pictures, I wish I had the fancier one from before but all is good.

+ easy to make reservations through OpenTable (I requested a window seat this time if possible and we got pretty close but not exactly)
+ excellent service by the entire team (including the hostess that generously took a few family photos for us)
+ thank you myVegas - got to redeem for 2 complimentary glasses of champagne

This is truly a special occasion type of place. The wine list is extensive and very expensive. On some pages you can't tell if it's the year or the price of the bottle, haha.

+ tuna ribbon appetizer - very interesting twist on the classic tartare
+ roasted beets - with apple, ricotta and quinoa
- bone-in ribeye - I should've listened to myself from 5-years ago and not ordered it again
+ FILET - omg so good! (no bone-in this time because they are changing providers)
+ truffled mashed potatoes - still just as good!
- creamed corn (albeit it was by special request, doh!)
+ roasted butternut square - surprisingly good with the chili and toasted pumpkin seeds

the food, the view, our server.. the overall experience......

this will be a place we'll visit everytime we're in vegas. everything was so delicious!
Heard so much about this place we just had to try it.  Great food, one of the best ribeye steak I have ever had.  Of course the service was exceptional!

Wow! 

From the food to the service to the atmosphere - this place is one of my all time favorites...ever!

Sit outside, if the weather permits, and enjoy a front row seat to the watershow.  The peppercorn crusted strip is prepared to perfection...and there are really no words for the chocolate lava cake (so make sure you leave some room).

Wonderful experience...top to bottom!

When my girlfriend told me that she was taking me to Prime Steakhouse, the first thing I thought of was, "God, that's selfish of you (she loves steak). Why not one of the more well-known restaurants on the Strip if you want to go the expensive route?" The name of the restaurant wasn't exactly impressive to me. 

My impression of the place heightened as soon as I saw the interior though. This is actually quite classy! Then, to top it off, we had a nice window view of the Bellagio fountain and of the Paris hotel.

Phuong, our server was also quite helpful with his recommendation of the 28-day aged rib-eye steak with crab mashed potatoes. He also recommended that we pair it with a pinot noir, which we did. The meal was splendid. I only wished that he had mentioned how big the rib-eye steak was going to be... It looked like it could be a 32-oz steak. Wow. Ok, I can eat, but not quite that much. I ended up boxing half of mine to go. I especially loved the crab mashed potatoes -- what a perfect combination of two of my favorite food: shellfish AND mashed potatoes (the perfect side dish for steaks, in my opinion). 

We also ordered a key lime pie for dessert with espresso. I enjoyed the pie a lot. It came with a thin layer of rock sugar in the middle. Crunchy and sweet, like candy. 

Next time, if we come here again, I'd like to split the surf and turf. It appears a more reasonable serving per person.

The highlight of my meal was the foie gras! It was absolutely perfect.  Unfortunately that's where the amazingness stops :/ had the braised ribs and scallops and they were, MEH. Forgettable,  not that great. I can't complain about the service,  staff was awesome!  But what took away from the experience was that tacky photographer pushing us to buy photos while my friend and I tried finishing our meals.  She stopped TWICE and kept interrupting our meal. Totally took away from the 5 star,  upscale experience. I kinda felt I was in a wedding and not at a wonderful restaurant prime is. Definitely not returning
"I am so glad we chose Prime at the Bellagio. Amazing Steakhouse! Filet was like cutting through butter.. Foie gras, fantastic. What a great dinner..."

There are plenty of reviews here but I'll quickly add my two cents.  Basically this place is fantastic but you are going to pay through the nose for it.  As long as you realize that, you'll be fine.

The special that night was a bone-in filet that was incredible.  I've never had such a good steak and I am well-versed in the ways of cow chunks.  Also to die for were the truffle mashed potatoes.  I could have eaten a giant bowl of these myself.

For an appetizer we had a giant bowl of seafood containing lobster, shrimp, oysters, clams, and king crab legs.  It was fantastic and would have made a nice meal by itself.

The wine is expensive.  I didn't see a single bottle for under $70.  Be prepared to spend big.

I've been to Prime a couple times now and both times were enjoyable. 

Besides the food (which I will get into shortly), I want to highlight the service. 
The servers and other restaurant staff here are professional, accommodating and most importantly, have good timing on when to be at the table for any needs. I don't think this can be trained, and believe it is the servers' experience and intuition after many years in the industry. 

On to the food... Standouts: 

Foie Gras - if you love Foie, you will love theirs. Perfectly seared and flavored, with nice acidity on the plate to complement. 

Carpaccio and Tartare duo - This is the best of both worlds. When I see Carpaccio and Tartare on the menu, I usually have an inner battle on which one to choose. Well Prime must have thought of this too and decided, why not put both on a plate! The tartare and carpaccio are fresh and the presentation is beautiful with the latticed cream (but side note, a bit too saucy for me and I would ask for less sauce or on the side next time). 

Sea Bass entree - It's not a petite piece! It is a large piece of fish and cooked well. 

Truffled Mash - Buttery with bits of Black Truffle folded in and garnished on top!  

Next time I will be back for the Dover Sole as (I was told) they de-bone right in front of you. 

All in all if you are looking for fine dining and great food, Prime is solid.

I will be back and will probably bring the family when they are in town again.

This was my first time at this beautiful restaurant!! The ambiance was awesome. Definitely try to get a table with the view of the fountains. The food was delicious..worth every penny.  I had the caramelized scallops and my husband had the bone in filet mignon. The service was good...a little dry but good! We will definitely be going back!

This is by far my favorite steak house. I had the bone-in filet mignon and my boyfriend had the porterhouse. Both cuts were excellent. It was just the best! Truffled mashed potato is highly recommended. It just melts in your mouth. Everywhere I go, if I see a beef tartare or beef carpaccio on the menu I always get it. With that being said, Prime's was the best I've had so far. The dining experience is not just about the food but also the service. The server was on-point. He was not too much or too little.
Excellent steaks. The seafood tower was amazing. Recommend the porterhouse with the lite ginger sauce and peppers!

My husband and I dined here this past weekend before going to see "O" while in town. He had been once before with a group in the private room and raved about the whole experience so I was excited to try it. 


The ambiance and decor is absolutely stunning, as was the view of the fountain. Super romantic and very elegant. We actually had the same server (initially) that my husband had previously but my husband remembered him because he provided such great service. I believe his name was Danny. We picked out a bottle of wine and perused the menu. After we ordered the wine, we placed our order with someone entirely different, he did not introduce himself other than to say 'I'm Danny's assistant' when we looked at him with confusion. Ok fine- they are busy so makes sense. But we literally never saw Danny again at our table. My husband and I both assumed it was because we ordered a moderately priced bottle of wine and as soon as we were labeled as not big spenders we were ignored. Just because I'm not spending thousands of dollars here does that mean I don't deserve excellent service?? Don't get me wrong, the assistant was very nice but it just wasn't the same experience. 

Our food was very good - I'd say 4 stars. Started with the hamachi which was divine. Then we each had the butternut squash soup which was just ok. Kind of bland and very stingy on the mushrooms. It came with maybe 4 mushroom slices when that was listed as a key ingredient on the menu?? I ordered the filet (wish they offered a petite version) which was well executed but not the best I've had. My husband had the dry aged rib eye and he loved it. We also tried the brussel sprouts and mushroom sides. Be warned - the brussel sprouts come with potatoes even though it's not listed on the menu. We don't eat potatoes and would not have ordered them if we had known. Mushrooms were delicious. 

My biggest issue wasn't the service snub or the fact that we have had better steak for less money. It was overall service. Only one word to describe it: GLACIAL. Our food took FOREVER. After we ordered we looked around and noticed that no one in sight had food in front of them. That's a scary sign. Our appetizer took 45 minutes to come out. It was 5 slices of raw fish. What takes so long?!? Finally at 9:20 I had to inform our server (Danny's assistant) that we needed to leave by 9:45 at the very latest to catch the show. He had a look of panic on his face but said sure he'd do what he could. Our steaks came quickly after that and we did leave on time so I appreciate the efforts made but we were so rushed we didn't get a chance to enjoy our expensive meal or finish our wine. Instead of it being romantic it gave us a slight bit of anxiety. My husband didn't even try the sides because he didn't have time. 

I wouldn't advise people not to go, but if you do just plan to make it a 3 hour event.

Highly recommended to anyone who understands and appreciates high quality steaks and excellent service (fast, attention to detail, great recommendations, professional). This is MUCH better in both quality and service than Jean George's at ARIA. 
I would highly recommend any of the steaks, as well as the mashed potatoes, mixed drinks, rice pilaf, and chocolate cake desert. The seafood was also very good we ordered some of the shrimp wrapped in bacon (highly recommend) and a raw tuna dish (strong flavor, wasn't my favorite). 
Two very small improvements I would make would be to add a few vegetarian options, I know it's a steakhouse but we had two vegetarians in our party. And a more affordable/basic section to the wine menu, I think the cheapest glass was $16 and bottles were around $70. 
I'd say about $80 a head is what you can expect to spend here, totally worth it!

PRIME is my favorite steakhouse on the Strip. I've dined here over 20+ times and the service has been outstanding each and every single visit. 

I love the location, ease of pulling into valet (Flamingo) and walking down to the escalator into the restaurant within a minute or two. I barely bump into tourists, very convenient. 

Once you enter, love the feminine dcor. Elegant colors, beautiful lighting, mirrors everywhere, fabulous tables overlooking the waterfall and experienced staff all make for a fabulous evening. Not to forget, massive floral arrangements throughout the restaurant. Reminds me of home. 

LOVE the seafood tower, priced at around $200/person is great. Freshest seafood and neatly arranged. I always order this as an appetizer to start off.
