I only eat medium rare steak - (each visit) my steak has been prepared to perfection! 

I do not feel taking photos of my dishes (in this classier environment) is ideal. I have not, and will not pull out my cell to take photos. 

If you love steakhouses, you'll love PRIME ~

Ok food, very expensive as expected. Nothing special. 
The catch here is that The Bellagio suggests this place when you do a weeding package with them. We booked our wedding over two months ago and made a reservation at Prime for the reception right after. 
As we made the reservation, we requested a view to the fountain, as this is probably the main reason why people go there. Is right in front of the fountains. 

For our surprise, the request was not accommodated and we were placed inside, at the end of the main room. Very disappointing. I will not come back and if you're planning a nice dinner after your wedding or just if you're staying at the Bellagio, don't come here either. 
As a note, the manager came to the table to apologize and when he saw I was upset, he was rude and made no effort to try to make out experience better. Shame on them. I will also complaint to the Bellagio management.

Follow Up Dinner on July 27th, after a call with the assistant manager.

The main dish was refunded and the last experience was perfect again!! 5 Stars now.

Customer Service is excellent, as my original Yelp-comment was followed up immediately. Will definitely come back.

The restaurant is popular as it is located inside of the Bellagio Casino and is situated just behind the fountains. Make sure you book a reservation in advance if you would like to dine here. This is my second dining experience and the service is very good along with the food!!
Appetizers:

Raw oysters-10 !!! Super sweet and fresh- make your own Cajun style sauce with the cocktail sauce, lemon juice, horse radish.

Shrimp cocktails: 8/10- plump and meaty. Nothing that sets it apart but very good

Fois gra:8/10 rich and buttery/ nice to have a restaurant who knows how to sear fois gra properly. My expectations of fois gra is similar to the restaurants in France so I am a bit tough with this.

Entrees: Colorado lamb chops: 8/10 , nothing mind blowing but cooked medium rare. The flavors are ok. Needs a bit of salt and mint jelly. It was prepared with some weird looking breading... what?!! You just ruined the lamb being the star of the plate!

Filet mignon: 9/10,'prepared just as requested medium rare , and flavorful/ juicy.
Ribeye bone in- very tasty but our friends who ordered this could not finish their meal. Definitely a dish to share.

Beet salad: 5/10 skip this. Look at the picture and you will agree.

Chilean sea bass- 9/10 super great!!!! I was a skeptic ordering fish at a steakhouse but very glad that I did.

Side dishes:
Maiitake mushrooms: very earthy and flavorful.
Truffle mash potatoes- better than the garlic mash potatoes.
Mash potatoes- ok
Broccoli- nothing special
Mac n cheese- not difficult and tough to screw up this dish. 
We were too full to even look at dessert.

The server was gracious and brought out a page of truffles for our guest in honor who celebrated a birthday!!

The setting, service and steaks exceeded expectations and are among the best I've experienced. Dinner here was definitely a driving factor and the primary reason I planned my return trip to Vegas. I typically don't order steak but last year a filet here changed my life and convinced me that beef is possible of trumping all when prepared properly.

To celebrate a special occasion I made reservations in advance to secure a seat along the windows which allows you to enjoy the Bellagio fountains throughout your meal. Our server Beau set the bar for service. He was personable, knowledgeable and attentive without being overbearing.

He suggested a moderately priced wine which paired perfectly with the 8oz filet I ordered. Although the truffle mashed potatoes are delicious, they are sometimes offered with lobster, which is divine. 

This place is expensive, but true to the cliche "you get what you pay for" So if you're looking for an experience and not just a meal I highly recommend Prime. It just might change your perspective on culinary quality.

If there's one weakness I have, it's a good steak.  Therefore, I tend to enjoy my steakhouses.  Prime provided me with a truly divine experience, and not only from a culinary perspective; the service, presentation, and ambiance were second to none.  Magnificently situated on the lagoon in front of the Bellagio, it's subdued and pleasing on the eyes, but provides sweeping views of the fountains every 15 minutes.  I ordered a Porterhouse and an 8oz. lobster tail.  It wasn't cheap by any means, but by golly was it worth it.  The steak was cooked to perfection, and just as I had ordered it (medium rare).  Many steakhouses and restaurants have the tendency to stray on the conservative side, particularly when it comes to raw meat.  Not this time.  The strip and filet were both delicious, flavorful, and tender, and the medley of sauces they provided only added to the experience.  The lobster tail, well, does lobster tail really need any introduction?  Highly recommended if you want to escape the hubbub of some of the more mainstream dining choices in Vegas; it was a taste of culinary serenity nestled in the middle of a zoo.

It's so funny how the best meals are often the ones you don't plan for.

Was having drinks at the Bellagio with some clients and this turned into dinner. We popped into Prime and managed to score a lateish sitting with minimal wait time.

This was my first visit to Prime, and I'll say it has now usurped SW @ Wynn as my favourite Vegas steakhouse. 

The decor is understated and classy, dining and conversation noise seems muted due to the room set up, the service is comfortable and professional and the food is just bloody superb.

We enjoyed a few dry aged rib eyes (absolutely massive - see photo) which were seriously well cooked and not overly fatty (no reflux the next morning - awesome!).  The mushroom, asparagus and spinach sides were also completely up to par.

The only area where SW has Prime beat hands down is the bread basket.  The SW bread basket comes with piping hot, freshly baked bread ranging from cheese&bacon, olive to sourdough etc.  The Prime offering was actually a tiny bit stale and nothing to write home about.

All in all, Prime is a very classy, comfortable yet upscale steakhouse and an excellent experience.

It is definitely not cheap (steaks start at $70 - our bill for 3 people before tip was $580ish with one bottle of mid level Cab) but definitely worth a visit.

Terrible and bland, don't come here unless u want slow service and poor quality food for the price u pay.  From appetizers to steaks to sides everything was mediocre at best.  Nice place but plenty of better steakhouses in Vegas, pass and thank me later
It was alright.  Would not return.  There are so many better steakhouses in Las Vegas.
One of the finest steakhouse in Las Vegas... I have been there many times and it gets better each time.. Fantastic!!!!!!!

4.5 but i do.. love LOVE love JG & his creations.

My boyfriend & i have been avid followers of the Kimchi Chronicles since his parents have told us about and cannot stop watching.  Watching JG & his wife on the show is the reason we had interest in Prime & decided to come and celebrate our V-day weekend dinner out at the Bellagio.  We booked a table through Open Table & requested a table near the windows so we could see the fountain show in the front of the hotel.  You can't hear the music, but you can hear the roar of the water.  We were seated in this smaller dining area, tucked away near the entrance, next to the water & fountains.  It just so happened that night, Carlos Santana was there with 4 other people sitting right behind us.  "Happy Birthday" never sounded so good.

As for the food, we started with the salmon & oyster tartar with black bread.  SO GOOD.  The olive oil and light oyster flavors were really good & paired well with the sashimi grade salmon.  We then ordered a salad (fairly large mixed greens salad) & soup (french onion), both good, but could have probably been happier trying another appetizer on the menu instead.  For our main course, we split the Porterhouse, roasted brussel sprouts and crispy potatoes.  My boyfriend likes his steaks cooked medium, bone to edges, the steak was perfect.  One of the dining staff members or "team 18" cut our steak for us portioning out half and half onto separate plates for us.  The brussel sprouts were were paired with pork & quince, sweet & savory.  Crispy potatoes, think of a really good potato skin with creme fraiche.  Although we were both stuffed, we couldn't skip out on dessert.  We split the cracking key lime pie.  What made it crackling was that they put in pop rocks into the filling.  Definitely a nice pleasant textural element.  The key lime was very tart and paired well with the whipped cream topping. 

Along with our meal, we shared a bottle of Tobin James Zinfandel Reserve.  Their wine list is a huge directory of wines, local and international.  I want to say that the year they brought out for us was different than what was listed in the menu, but I still love that winery so it was an easy no-brainer.  The wine was listed at $65, one of the cheapest, if not the cheapest wine in the directory, but i still love that winery!

Pat on the back JG.. too bad you only go there 3 times a year to check up on the menu.

The steak was just okay. It was very dry, and definitely not worth the price. The photographer who came by to take our picture was a bit over the top. That being said, the restaurant was beautiful, and the service was good.

I almost feel like a jackass for giving this such a low rating, but since my experience didn't feel any special, why not be honest right?

Once arriving at Prime, I noticed that things seemed to be a little out of order. My group (4 of us) had made a reso for 8pm, and arrived about 10 minutes early. Once I went to the hostess to confirm, she had told me it would be about 20 minutes (place was not even half full). Now, I don't mind waiting at all. I've been in the restaurant biz all my life, and I know the tricks of the trade. Mainly, when a restaurant is empty and they tell you to wait, it's generally a way to get you over to the side bar to buy a round of drinks. Usually I would take the bait because Kris loves me some drankssss....but this time we decided to pass since we were drinking at the pool all day.

Once finally seated, the service was outstanding. If there was no food involved, I would give this place 5 stars on the service I recieved. By service, I mean someone who greeted us quickly, explained the menu in detail, provided a wine list, and made sure drinks were filled at any opportunity they could be filled.

Now on to the food. EHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH.

I am no food snob. I would rather eat nachos and dirty water hot dogs then have a fancy french dinner. However, I do enjoy a nice outing every now and then, and don't mind spending for it. The sides were very good. It was a few weeks back, but I remember getting a potato side that was outstanding. Also, their side of brocali was perfect.

The real problem was the steaks. 3 out of 4 of them were just horrendous. I ordered the Ribeye. I order Ribeyes' just about every where I go for steak. Mainly bc of the quantity, and the heaviness to the cut. This was probably the fattiest steak I have ever seen in my 26 years on earth. Where did they cut this from, the cows ass? Seriously, I was perplexed as to which part of the cow this fat came from. I looked around and almost laughed out loud because I thought I might have been on a game show. 

I ate up all of the side dishes, and the portions were a good size. I left about 3/4 of the steak with all of the fat cut up on the plate. Now, I would NEVERRRR complain about food at a restaurant, it's just no my style. The way I look at it, I CAME INTO YOUR KITCHEN, and you cooked for me. If I don't like it, shame on me. However, being a bartender I know that if I saw my guest barely touch his 60 or 70 dollar entree, I would ask if something was wrong. The server didn't say a word as he took my plate, which made me want to shove it down his throat. (Just kidding, wanted to add dramatic effect!)

All in all, very nice place but I am sure there has to be better options for an expensive steak. And if there isn't, Im sticking to sushi and hooters.

The absolute best bone in ribeye i have ever had.  Sides are also delicious -- potato gratin is on point!  Service 5 stars.. Everything about this steakhouse is top notch including the view of the bellagio fountain.

Wow, wow, wow...The same superb service and food, time after time. My husband and I have been coming here for seven years now when we are in town. We were just there on Valentine's Day to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The food was delicious, especially the truffle mash potatoes. You can't go wrong coming here.

Being from Chicago, I am spoiled with numerous amazing steakhouses. This leaves me a little skeptical, especially in places like Vegas where every Hotel claims to have a top-notch steakhouse. At Bellagio's Prime, our expectations were exceeded. The service, the ambiance and the food were all spot-on. I would highly recommend it dry aged bone-in ribeye. It was an amazing steak and priced fairly. 
 
I wish I would remember the waiter's name. Because he was also superb. He deserves acclaim.
Bone in filet was awesome. Truffle mashed potatoes too. And a glass of Glenlivet. Perfect dinner. View wasn't bas either.

The number one romantic spot in Las Vegas hands down. Especially if you get to sit on the patio or by a window. Beautiful views of the fountains. Husband thinks this place has the best steaks. no other restaurants steaks can compare to Primes. The Lobster is delicious & Huge. Definitely worth the $250.00 for two people. We will definitely be back!

If you happen to win a lot of money in Vegas, or if you already have an abundance, head over to Prime Steakhouse at Bellagio's to pamper your palate.  We each had the $100 surf and turf and the window seat seemed like the best one in the house.  The service, food, decor, and atmosphere were all immaculate.  The water show was just as impressive as it was on PBS's New Years 2000 special, and we kept our table far too long drinking wine and eating a couple of desserts, which is probably why it costs so much to eat there.  There are not a lot of people coming and going...every one stays for a while.

I would recommend Prime Steakhouse to anyone celebrating a special occasion or if you just won the lottery.

I would have given The Prime 5 stars, if not for one experience I had. But before I get into that, here are the positives: It is one of the most beautiful resturants in all of Las Vegas (especially if your fortunate enough to get a good table with a view of the dancing Bellagio fountains). The food is superb, and service is great. The prices are in-line with other high end resturants in Vegas. Now, as for the reason why I did not give it 5 stars: One time, when I made reservations for dinner, the hostess asked me if there was any special occasion that they should be aware of....I said yes, it was my mom's 80th birthday...the hostess then said "wonderful, I will make a note of it". When we showed up for dinner they literally gave us the worst table in the resturuant (right near the entrance, with no lake view, and people constantly walking by). There was also no complimentary cake, or anything else, for my mom (not even a "Happy Birthday" greeting). Needless to say, I was very disappointed that The Prime did nothing special for her....I am sure it was just an oversight, but I still have to subtract 1 star for that night.

We went to Prime last week and had reservations for 9:15 pm. When we got there, we had to wait about 5 minutes before they seated us. Although we sat inside this time, I would love to sit outside next time! The Cosmo here is one of the best I've ever had! We started off with the bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer. It only came with 3 shrimp so we added an extra in there so we could both try two. It is definitely good but overpriced for what it is. ($7 per shrimp). 

My boyfriend ordered the dry aged rib eye steak for his main and I ordered the New York strip. His rib eye was very good except it was very fatty. I know rib eyes are suppose to be on the fattier side but this piece in particular was extra fatty. However, overall it was very good. My New York strip was perfectly cooked, my boyfriend actually enjoyed mine more and I enjoyed his more! For our sides, we got truffle mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese. BOTH are a must try! I think the sides really stood out. Very generous with the truffle in the mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese had the perfect amount of "gooey"-ness. I will probably go back just for the sides! 

We finished the night off with the chocolate cake, which was a very decadent molten chocolate cake with the perfect amount of vanilla ice cream to go with. I highly recommend this place for special occasions as it can get quite pricey! Service was very attentive as well.
this place is great...the steak was amazing and that seafood platter we had was slamming.

Party of 6. Reservation to sit by the patio a month ago. Got there at 8 and the hostess told us its gonna be another hour wait. Thats fine... we waited. An hour later we got sat. We ordered our food and never got our food. Manager comes over and APOLOGIZES with the most bitter attitude and asks if we wanna cancel our order.... Seriously?! RUDE MANAGER but our waiter was good. Theres no point in staying waiting for food that was "on the way" for the last 40 minutes.

Extraordinary experience. Was lucky enough to score a table on the patio right next to the Bellagio Fountains. Ordered two types of steaks and were impressed with both. Also ordered some veggies including mashed potatoes and a nice bottle of wine. Such a once-in-a-lifetime experience and worth every penny. Would highly recommend this restaurant if you are celebrating something special or just wanting to splurge on some great food and service (and view, of course).

Beautiful restaurant with a beautiful view. Started with the beet salad and the tomato and burrata salad as an appetizer. Then I went onto the French onion soup which was the best French onion soup I have had thus far. My partner had his usual wedge which was just OK the dressing was a little thicker than usual but Maytag blue cheese makes everything great. We share the dry aged bone in ribeye which was cooked completely perfect to a charred real plus. We also shared the mushroom medley mix the mashed potatoes had chunks of black truffle in them and their house Layered style potato was nice and crispy on top. The sent us out a beautiful dessert platter with all the new deserts. It's a beautiful steakhouse with one of the best views I've seen in Las Vegas and has a hefty price tag to match. Prices aren't on the Internet or on OpenTable but you're averaging between $60-$75 for a steak $15-$20 for a salad and $15-$20 for sides. I have to put in that the back waiter Eric was one of the most pleasant back waiters that has ever served on our table. And he made our experience fantastic!

Service failed.

Made a reservation on 5/31/17 at 7:45 PM for two weeks in advance and specifically requested a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains to celebrate our anniversary. There's no point in going to this restaurant and paying the upcharge on their steaks that you can get at other steakhouses as the only distinct thing about it is the view of the fountains.

Take a wild guess what happened.

We arrived and were seated in the back of the restaurant.

When I mentioned it to the server, I was told this table was "just as good." Requested to speak to a manager and was assured we would be moved to the first available table with a view. I watched as a table came and went as another party with a later reservation was seated ahead of us.

Be aware: based on observations and if you read the other negative reviews of this restaurant, you'll notice a racial trend about which parties Prime accommodates with views of the Bellagio fountain and which they shove in the back of the restaurant. If you're a POC or appear young, you'll have a very tough time convincing the staff that your request and your money hold just as much value as someone who looks like a 50+ WASP banker from the Hamptons. 

Try Cut Steakhouse instead for phenomenal food and service that doesn't discriminate based on age, race, or class.

I ate here with my wife and really enjoyed the experience. We were given recommendations, but not pushed into anything in particular. We really wanted to sit outside to watch the fountains but it was SO HOT. We had to ask for a table inside within 2 minutes of sitting down. We were very fortunate and landed one of the few tables with an unobstructed view of the fountains inside. Everything we ordered was prepared to perfection down to the wine recommendation. I only wish we had saved room for dessert.

First the good:  our table for this business dinner was amazing. Out on the patio with views of the Bellagio fountains was fantastic. Couldn't ask for a better ambiance in Vegas. The Au Gratin potatoes and bread budding were both delicious. And the sauces they served with the steak were good. So was the bread. 

After that, I really don't have anything nice to say. My $74 dry-aged bone-in ribeye was stringy and tough. My colleague ordered the same and agreed. If a steakhouse can't do steak, they fail. Period. We also had the broccoli with jalapeo cheese sauce, and (not sure how this is possible) it was basically flavorless. 

The service wasn't great. He never asked if we wanted salads or appetizers. My drinks were always empty, and the last refill I asked for never came. 

This was a complete and utter letdown (except for the potatoes). Will not be back.

My wife and I spent our first anniversary in Vegas last weekend and had dinner at Bellagio's Prime Sunday night. We're both lovers of steak and felt it would be a good way to start the night.

From the moment we arrived at the restaurant we were well taken care of, we got a booth immediately in a quiet room with a few tables that looked out onto the Bellagio fountains. While we couldn't hear the music outside, it was still nice to look out and watch the fountain shows while we enjoyed the atmosphere.

We opted to skip appetizers as we wanted to ensure we would be able to finish all of our respective dinners. I had a bone-in rib-eye while my wife ordered  filet mignon. Both were perfectly cooked, and had some of the best flavors I've had in steaks.

The real treat however was the sauces they brought out. At first I was appalled a steakhouse would suggest a sauce, let alone bring out three, but I skeptically tried each one on some small pieces of my steak, and boy was I happy I did. Both the bearnaise and pepercorn sauces were very tasty and worked well with the steaks adding flavor but not overpowering them. The real winner was the house rice wine sauce however; they could have served the worst steak ever and paired it with this sauce and still gotten me to finish it. 

The gratin potatoes we ordered as a side was extremely tasty as well and was more than enough for the two of us. Again, the house sauce was an amazing addition to the already delicious gratin. We got a look at the rest of the sides when a neighboring table ordered one of each and they all looked equally delectable. I look forward to trying the ginger sweet potatoes and the truffle mashed potatoes on future visits.

One thing to be careful of though is if you ask for water and only want tap water, be sure to make this clear to your waiter. We asked for water to go with our drinks and got an $8 bottle of Fiji water.

Prime has the winning combination which is great food in a scenic location.

The location feels very secluded and separate from the chaos of the strip. The restaurant is on the lower level along the fountains. We made a reservation and were able to get a table next to one of the large windows in front of the fountains. The table was even set so that my husband and I were both facing the beautiful view. 

The feel of the restaurant is swanky and regal, but without being stiff and pretentious. The design of the restaurant was very appealing. 

Our service was good as you'd hope it would be in a restaurant like this. Our waiter insisted on taking photos of my husband and I when he saw me doing my Yelp thing. The waiter and server were never far, but not in a hovering manner. 

Before coming here I read so many articles talking this restaurant up and the food lived up to the hype. I had the 10 ounce Filet Mignon and my husband had the 14 ounce Peppercorn-Crusted New York Strip. We shared the Gratin Dauphinois. 

The Filet Mignon was perfectly prepared, tender and flavorful. The 10 ounces was more than enough meat. The Peppercorn-Crusted New York Strip's peppercorn crust was delicious and seasoned well. This steak was also well prepared and flavorful. The Gratin Dauphinois was a sizeable portion for two. There was plenty of cheese sauce in the dish and broiled on top. Delicious.

One of the unique things about this steakhouse is that they bring out three steak sauces. The sauces offered were Soy-Rice Wine, Bearnaise, and Peppercorn. I loved all three and enjoyed trying them on both of the steaks. The meats didn't need sauce, but I always love a good sauce.

We finished the meal by splitting the Apple Pie with Maple Ice Cream. It arrived bubbling and hot. This appears to be a dish that is freshly prepared with each order.I loved the flavor of the apple pie and the delicious maple ice cream on top.

Having been to a few of the steakhouses now I would rate this among some of the best. The food is great, but the view and puts it over the top.

Good food and great drinks.  I would say if your looking for a Grade A steak this I'd the place to go.  Look forward to spending high triple digits for your meal though. Is it worth you ask... depends how much you like steak.  I love it so it was worth it!  We got some kind of shrimp appetizer and to honest I probably could have ate them for dinner they were so good... also try a drink called "cable car", so good for the ladies (I promise they won't be disappointed).  The reason I gave it 4 stars was because of the prices....

I don't even know where to begin w/ this place.

First of all, it's beautiful.  Second, the staff is soooo nice - and not fake nice - like genuinely "I like my job" nice.

But I digress.

We ordered some Malbec (yeah, I know) to start.  
We had the gruyere fritters (WTF!!), parmesan crusted chicken (which was gigantic, btw), and a filet and by the end of the meal, if I'd had pants on, they would have burst.  Literally.  Luckily I had on a dress, so I was safe.

They brought out a chocolate lava cake and vanilla ice cream w/ a candle on it for my birthday (YAY ME!), and which I devoured in about 30 seconds flat.

I have nothing bad to say about this place.  
Except for maybe enforce your dress code.  Who let the douchebag w/ a tee shirt and ratty jeans in?

Service was incredible. Thank you Russell for the great suggestions and service. Everything was very good. We had the peppercorn strip with house sauce, Mac n cheese, and crispy salmon. Highly recommend.

I must preface this review by saying that I did not actually eat here. They would not let me. 

I had reservations for two at 6 pm. Our flight arrived in Vegas at 3:30. My friend, who was traveling with me, arrived without his bag. They said it would be around 10 that night before he got it. The big problem - my friend only had shorts. The restaurant had a "no shorts" policy. I called the reservation line and asked if they would make an exception - NO. I went directly to the restaurant and asked if they would make an exception - NO. I understand policies. I have them in my business. My deal on policies is that, if circumstances dictate, I make exceptions. This is not the theory for Prime Steakhouse. At least for us, it wasn't. 

I saw many of the patrons of Prime later that night. I have to say I couldn't effectively gauge the dress code. There were hookers with body parts spilling out of all parts of their dresses (that's using the term "dress" liberally). There were men in ripped jeans (which they said they had a policy against) but I guess when you pay $400 for ripped jeans, it doesn't count. Shorts are not okay but T-shirts are??? 

I wish I could tell you about Prime, but their inane adherence to selective policies prevents me.

We went as part of a business group- a table of 7. Service was ok. It was very lacking in the beginning and we were seated abut 5:30pm. We server seemed frazzled and uneducated on the menu. 

My meal was good. I had the garlic and soy glazed steak. It was slightly overcooked- more of a medium than medium rare and VERY heavy/strong in the soy. The truffle mashed potatoes were delicious. The best side out of the ones we ordered. (Brussel Sprouts, Mac & Cheese, and mushrooms) 

The views of the fountain are fantastic- depending on where they seat you. Unfortunately they did not dim the lights or sync the fountain music with the music in the restaurant, like they do at Disney. 

The best part of the meal was dessert. The only reason I would return to Prime. The Donut Fountain is SO GOOD! It was 5 or 6 mini donuts, all different flavors, but our server didn't explain the differences- with a Carmel and chocolate sauce for dipping. SO GOOD y'all!

Went here our first night in Vegas. Right on the fountains at Bellagio which is cool since you can see the shows from a good seat. Food was good. Ginger sweet potatoes were awesome and so were their other vegetables. Steaks come with a number of sauces. Dessert was good as well. It's a bit pricey and it didn't feel it blew me away.

While I have yet to dine at SW Steak at our hotel, Encore, I feel confident in saying that this is steak and steakhouse the way that it should be done. Never have I been to a restaurant that nailed down both ambiance, service, and steak so well. The restaurant is gorgeous, and as picky as I am, I have ZERO complaints about anything. I love that they still require jackets, and bonus points for COMFY seating! The sauces only compliment what is already a perfect steak, and this place has only cemented my love for chef Jean Georges Vongerichten. If I could levy one criticism about this place, it is the fact that they deserve two michelin stars and they have none, which is the fault of the Michelin guide, not this superb dining jewel.

Some of the best service in Vegas. Personally got escorted to my taxi as I was running late for a show. 2 fat thumbs up guys!

Great food on the pricey side but well deserved. Amazing views of the fountains if you can get them. Great establishment for a special occasion.

mmmmm, i was pretty unimpressed with prime. came here for dinner before clubbing at the omnia to celebrate a friend's birthday, so we were ready to eat (to pad all the alcohol..) the reservation was made about 4 weeks prior for table of 8 with a view of the bellagio fountains - no promises they said, but they'll make a note. i was pretty disappointed with our view - only 3 people could see the fountains at all, and with a very limited view. meh.

on to the food - we all got apps (foie gras for me) but others had oysters, steak tartare, salad, basically one of each from the appetizer section of the menu.  there was basically silence as we ate our food - there was nothing to say.  usually its a good sign because people are focused on their food and tasting it, but not with this group. we just didnt want to be rude... the apps werent very memorable. my foie gras wasnt complemented super well with items on the plate, and was more grainy than usual. bleh. on to the entrees..

since we were at a steakhouse, most people ordered steak. i got the short rib instead (cant eat much steak).. which ended up being a dry hunk of short rib that wasnt very tender, but quite salty! i was pretty disappointed. no imagination on the plating or accompaniments either. bleh. people seemed to at least enjoy their steaks - hope they werent overcooked.

overall...i didnt feel special at this restaurant. being a jean georges establishment, there was no refinement in the service or dishes that they served. everything was just 'all right.' their redeeming dishes were, with consensus from the entire group, the french fries and bread pudding. isnt that sad? the 2 bottles of wines we got were good, as well as the dessert wine, but they didnt produce those, did they. sigh.

i will not be returning here given the plethora of amazing dining options in vegas.

Eh pretty much had everything on the menu in 1 sitting.  Had a huge ribeye and lobster tail and it was good but not jaw dropping mouth watering good.  Price again is expensive as hell but thats no surprise since your in vegas.

Horrible experience from start to finish. Waiter never introduced himself, didn't welcome us to the restaurant or tell us anything about the menu. He came up behind us and asked if we were ready to order, never saw him again until it was time to pay. Restaurant was dead but our server was MIA. We ordered the rib eye and filet with mashed potatoes. Food had zero flavor and mashed potatoes were runny. Oh and the ducks...nipping at your feet/jacket while you wait for your food was not a 5 star experience.

After much deliberation on the choice of steakhouse to dine at on our Saturday night we picked Prime.  I have to say I'm a bit disappointed.  I really wanted the Wow factor and didn't get it.  The service was excellent.  The view overlooking the fountains was great.  The food was average. My husband tried the aged bone in rib eye. He said it was good but not better than a regular rib eye he has had elsewhere. I had the salmon.  Again, it was good but that's as far as it goes. The side dishes were tasty although it seemed like there was a lot of salt in everything. $250 for 2 meals, 2 sides and 2 cocktails.

This past weekend was my second trip to Prime and I was not impressed either time. 
The only thing that really saved the night was the awesome company; my BF, his family and our casino host. 
I really wanted to love this place, the setting is amazing and so is the decor.

First, we made reservations for eight o'clock, but when we arrived on time the table was not set. We ended up standing around for ten minutes. Keep in mind it was a birthday dinner for my BF's mom and our casino host was eating with us. You would think the employees of Prime would have their shit together since the restaurant was not even that busy. 

After being seated our waiter was horrible. 
I ordered a glass of champagne and he forgot it, not once but three different times! Mine was not the only beverage he forgot on more than one occasion.

Our table of eight ordered the shell fish appetizer, which cost around four hundred dollars. The crab, shrimp and oysters were good but the lobster was awful. It was chewy and flavorless. 
Seriously about an hour after we had our appetizer our main courses come out. Our table ordered everything from the duck, to sea bass to stake, no one was that thrilled. The food was mediocre, defiantly not worth the price. 

The kicker to the entire night was "dress code". 
They are suppose to enforce a dressy attire and yet I saw guys in Affliction shirts and girls in jean skirts. 

Moral of the story, save you money and eat at one of the other amazing restaurants in the Bellagio.

The service was impeccable. The server was basically at ur side always refilling our glasses. We had a great view and the atmosphere was very tranquil and pleasant..the food was absolutely amazing as well. I had a bone-in ribeye that was delicious, then golden mashed potatoes were great as well.. Would definitely come back soon.

Wonderful service and food! We decided to get the filet mignon and the peppercorn New York strip with a side of the au gratin potatoes! WONDERFUL! We asked for a fountain view during dinner and our seats did not disappoint!

Prime Steakhouse in the Bellagio is owned by the reknowned chef Jean-George Vongerichten. I have eaten at his name-sake restaurant in New York so I was very excited to experience the food here. My overall opinion would have to be that the restaurant was good, but fell short in a few areas.

My friend and I split two dishes, the Chilean Sea Bass served over braised mushrooms, poblano peppers and dill, and the special: a bone-in filet that was dry-aged 21 days. They served our meal first, which was a little disconcerting as it was split table-side. I was slightly cringing at the thought of the other dishes getting colder while ours was being prepared. The filet was terrific, perfectly cooked and juicy, while the sea bass was good, but rather un-inspired. The mushrooms underneath the seabass were superb, however, the poblano and dill were so mild the flavors never would have been obvious to the consumer. My friend's fiance ordered the roasted duck breast with almond crust and red wine amaretto sauce. The crust was fantastic, but sadly the duck was tough. The best dish of the evening was ordered by my friend's grandma. This was the rack of lamb with smoked chili glaze and broccoli rabe. The lamb was so tender and juicy, and the inherent flavor was fantastic. Obviously it came from a really good little lamb.

As far as the sides, I would have to say they were hit and miss. The brussell sprouts were something worth going back for. They were roasted with just the right amount of char, and the use of pistachio nuts was ingenious. Execution = perfect. The sweet potato puree, which I swear also involved butternut squash, was superb, but the parmesean broccoli was painfully overcooked and the florets were cut too large for easy sharing.

All in all, I would say that Prime definitely uses great ingredients, and the food was solid, yet for the price I think one should demand more. I think this is a case of the talented, celebrity chef opening up a restaurant in Vegas because the $$$ is there (or rather, used to be there) and in the process reliquished a bit too much power to someone not as talented as themselves.

The service is phenomenal.  Jesus & Lisa were our main servers.  They were very attentive and helpful.  The hostesses were super nice as well.

The food was cooked well but I'd have to say the experience of where you are dining is what you are paying for.  I wish when kitchens are using any kind of hot peppers on or in a dish they would state it on the menu,so I could have them left off/out.

The Gratinee Dauphinoise potatoes were much more flavorful than the mac n cheese, so even if you dont care for potatoes.... get them.  

Definitely worth the trip & cost for the experience of it.  Thank you again Jesus, Lisa & hostesses for being so nice & attentive!

Of course the view of the fountains from the patio is lovely as is the restaurant itself.

You must get a table on the patio overlooking the fountains.  Best restaurant view in Vegas!  The steaks were cooked perfectly and the waiter was over the top accommodating.  We probably spent 15 minutes talking with him about growing up in Vegas.  It's pricey (even for a steakhouse) but well worth it.

Peppercorn New York Steak, mashed Yukon Gold potatoes, Lemon Parmesan Caesar salad.
Most know that I eat steak unlike many others that live on this planet. I'm not only honored but extremely happy that as of yet this steak was the best steak that I have ever had so far.
As chef Jean-Georges mentioned on a commercial for the steakhouse in my Bellagio suite, every decent Chef can cook a steak, but what complements it are it's sauces or condiments. Many will agree with this, and few will disagree. But those who know where to get great cuts of meat, aged to perfection, know that salt-and-pepper and a good grill will always equal to a good and some even say a great steak. But what put this steak over the top, was the chef's recommendation to try his house sauce. I am not talking about some sort of steak sauce/barbecue sauce. I am talking about his signature steak sauce or juice as some may describe. Along with trying this steak with the other three common sauces normally used on steaks, his shined through with brilliance.
Accompanied with a very well matched and seasoned subtle mashed Yukon Gold potatoes and a Caesar salad that I will never forget. This made for, if not the best but, one of the best meals I have ever had in my lifetime so far.

We made reservations for Prime for my birthday. Easily the most beautiful and elegant restaurant I've ever eaten at. I felt like I was in a movie. Dim lights, sunset, the Belagio water for fountains every 15 minutes, and the wait staff treated us like we were the most important people in the world. There was a photographer to take pictures ($70 for the small package). The food was absolutely to die for. The best steak I've ever eaten, hands down, and the desert left me in heaven. I highly recommend this restaurant for any sort of special occasion dinner. And if you're looking for somewhere to propose (as my now Fianc apparently was) this is the perfect place to do it. As there is a wandering photographer, it's even easy to get pictures of the proposal!

Edit 8/2017: we came back to Vegas for our honeymoon, and of course had to go back to prime. The service and food was just as impeccable as the first time. Truly the best restaurant I have ever been to.

We decided to by pass the usual, Mastro, Spago, STK, Mesa Grill, etc. ya know, what we always do, and I think it was kind of a mistake. Prime is located in the Bellagio, down a set of marble stairs facing the fountains. Now let me tell you, view and decor, absolutely me, fancy, fancy, fancy and that is 5 stars in my book, however, food..... Good, but not unforgettable. My husband ordered a $70 Porterhouse, which is a downgrade to his usual $120 Japanese Waygu, needless to say, he didn't quite like it. I thought it was perfectly cooked, he thought it to be way too salty. Oysters and wedge salad were good, and my Chilean Sea Bass was decent, but I have had better. Bread basket, I could do without, not impressive, and cocktails were ok. However, I was impressed by their Murano chandelier that hangs in one of the private dining rooms, only because I have had the pleasure to stare at the exact same one, but smaller, hanging in my parents dining room still to this day. Overall, it was  nice quiet dinner, enjoying each other and of course sitting there all gussied up, but I would probably pass and make this a one and only time.

The meat taste is great , but other than that it is terrible.Waiter , service i am very dissapointed , my expectation was very high.Service is super slow i might come back for the meat but the thing is i will give a dollar tip for sure that maybe they can understand their mistakeS

A regular spot for me when I go to vegas with colleagues. Among the best views on the strip when you get fortunate enough to grab patio seating. Watch out for asking for "extra olives" with your Martinis at the bar, they charge extra......

I do not eat a lot of red meat so this was not my choice. It's very formal/beautiful and the service is excellent. The food was very good. I ordered the ahi tuna but tried a bite of my friend's steak and it was excellent. We also ordered the crab cake appetizer and it was very good. I may not return but that's just a personal preference and not a reflection of the food or service. There was a small wedding reception next to us (10 people) and this would be the perfect setting for an event like that.

It is a five star restaurant with a five star price tag. If you are looking for an upscale restaurant and don't care to pay for it, this is your place.  From the Fuji water that they pour from the bottle to your glass to the gourmet food, it is top-notch.  As classy as this place is, it is not quiet and stuffy.  I wore jeans and a dress shirt and my wife wore a cocktail dress.  We had a table of eight and were celebrating my best friends birthday and we were far from quiet.  Highly recommend for that special occasion, but not a place to go frequently.

This restaurant is fantastic, very elegant and very stylish.

The food is really good and the service is top notch. The portions are quite large, but that's how it's usually in Vegas.

Top notch steak house at the Bellagio. Everything you expect from a Bellagio restaurant, this restaurant either meets or exceeds. 

The steaks here are ALWAYS cooked to your order. If you tell them medium rare, it'll come medium rare. We all know at least one steak house that will bring out our steaks at a medium when we ordered medium rare...... 

The sides here are phenomenal along with an extensive wine list. After all, it is a five star MGM owned property. 

Besides all the delicious food and impeccable service, the best feature about this restaurant is the view of the Bellagio fountain firing off water show after water show during dinner.

Decadent and fine dining!  The service is fabulous - leaves one feeling pampered.  Never was able to reach the bottom of my glass because the staff keep an eye out for the diners' needs.

The food was well-seasoned, neatly presented and served at the right temperature.  The portions are reasonable.  Sides are definitely meant for sharing.

Several choices for vegetarians too. 

The French onion soup was served piping hot and delicious.  A bit salty but worth a try.  Chilean sea bass and beet salad were favorites.  Dover sole was delicately seasoned and also yummy.  Our table enjoyed the green beans and Brussels sprouts.  

It's a treat to see the warm chocolate cake served.  Warm, melted chocolate syrup gets poured over the chocolate dome.  Done melts revealing the cake inside.  A must see.  Fine dining!

I have a challenge to eat at 24 new places in 2017. This was #9. 

OVERALL RATING: 5 (SCORED  25 OUT OF 25)
STAFF: 5+ (All very friendly and enjoy working)
FOOD: 5+
SERVICE: 5 (Multiple people working on your table, not just one waiter/waitress)
CLEANNESS: 5
PRICE: 5

This location sits on the water of the Bellagio where you can watch the water show!! An amazing view if you get a window seat. Even better view if you can sit out on the patio. Make sure to make reservations for special occasions and request window or patio. You won't be disappointed. 

STAFF: I am a firm believe that if you have a rude front service hostess it can ruin the whole night. I will say that here they greeted you with a smile and was very polite. 

FOOD: I am not one that likes to pay high prices for food, normally the more you pay, the smaller the portions and you leave hungry! Not here! You get a good amount of food at a great price! 

SERVICE: Multiple people working on your table. All very nice, friendly and attentive. They don't ask what you are drinking over and over.  

CLEANNESS: Very clean. Not like some places where someone drops something and they leave it for someone else to pick up or just don't even care. If it is dropped it is picked up immediately and taken care of. Tables are turned quickly, because that equals more $ for them. 

PRICE: Dinner was $100 per person and that is with each having a drink. The food was amazing quality and each bite was AMAZING.

Das Steakhaus im Bellagio. Das Lokal ist im Untergeschoss gelegen, ein Teil der Tische hat direkten Blick auf die Wasserspiele vor dem Casino ebenfalls gibt es noch ein paar Tische auf der Terrasse ber dem knstlichen See. Dieser zustzlich Genoss erfordert jedoch eine zeitgerechte Reservierung. Das Steakhaus selbst bietet vor allem natrlich Steaks und einige Fischgerichte bei gehobenem Service und entsprechendem Ambiente. Die Preise dafr sind natrlich entsprechend hoch. Ein Novum bisher hier in Las Vegas, war die Frage des Tischkellners, ob bei einem Gast spezielle Allergien bei der Speisenauswahl bzw. der Zubereitung zu beachten sind. Die Speisen waren ausgezeichnet, der Service war vorbildlich und es gab sogar einen guten Espresso zum Abschluss, was ja bei dem landestypischen "Bodenseekaffee" wirklich eine Ausnahme in Restaurant ist.

I spend a lot of time in Vegas (on business) and a lot of time eating cow. My pallet is open-minded enough to enjoy street meat of the gypsy varieties as well as private chef fare in the homes of UN dignitaries. After 40 some years of travel and esoteric gastro-tours all over the world I hope that of all the food genres out there that I would be considered a credible critic of steak.

Blah blah blah! Please forgive the prologue.

Jean Geaorges' Prime is essentially a perfect steakhouse. Maybe not the best but you'd be hard pressed to find much area for improvement. The setting is elegant. The service professional without being stuffy. The cheapest cuts are great. The expensive cut are heavenly. You can easily drop over $200 for a specialty cut... a la carte! Well worth it though. I went for the aged bone-in ribeye. Perfect.

All the sides are as they should be: creamed spinach, sauteed spinach, mashed potatoes, etc. The wine list is legitimate. If I were forced to find a flaw it would be in their sauces. The au poivre was too think and bit sweet. two others they offered forme to sample were lack luster, though I can't remember what they were. 

Thy to get a seat close to the windows to enjoy the view of the famous Bellagio fountain. Though really there is no bad seat in the house.

Like I said, maybe not the best ever but no one will leave disappointed.

I know I'm a bit ridiculous for going to a steakhouse being a Vegetarian. However, I knew I would have limited options and knew what I would order prior to arriving at the restaurant. That being said, my limited amount of options is NOT the reason for my low rating. 

I went with a few girls for Valentine's Day, for fun and for a nice fancy dinner before a girls night out. We were seated and it took about five minutes before we were greeted by our server (at least who we thought was our server). He disappeared for a bit and then came back to ask what we would like to drink. I fully understand that it was a busy night, but I know that restaurant is busy in general, and can handle busy nights. After our drink orders were taking, we waited about ten minutes before receiving them, and another ten minutes until a completely different server took our orders. I understand its odd that I venture to steakhouses and don't order meat, but I don't make a fuss over what I eat; so I really didn't understand why the server had to give me a disapproving look when I didn't order a meat item. I wish I was exaggerating with the amount of time between when we would see our server (if at all) but I'm not. Our reservation was at 9:30pm and we left the restaurant close to midnight. Considering that this restaurant has earned a Triple A 4-diamond rating, I assume it solely due to the steaks, chops, and seafood options. 

On a happy note, I loved the truffle mashed potatoes! Luckily, we were seated close to a window and as always, any view of the fountains is breath-taking :).

Way overrated, especially for the price. I had the iceberg salad with vinaigrette to start and the dressing was very strange, tasted like soy sauce. For my entree I ordered scallops and they were great! My husband shared a few bites of his ribeye with me and we both found it to be pretty bland. It was served with three sauces that I didn't try because a great steak shouldn't need a sauce. Our sides were macaroni and fries. The macaroni was delicious but the fries were just average everyday boring fries. Service was great. I understand that the restaurant is classy and upscale but I'm pretty sure this is one of the last few that doesn't allow shorts, nice shorts, not talking cutoffs or cargos here....but jeans are acceptable, strange to me. My poor husband had to borrow a pair of their pants which they have on hand because apparently it's a common issue and even stranger he had to walk through the entire restaurant in his shorts to get to the restroom to change. Seems pointless.

Went to Prime for my bday when in Vegas. I gotta say the food was good but the waiter was one of the worse i have ever seen. I was really surprised to see that at a high end restaurant like that. I felt like he was pushing me to buy stuff from the menu and at the end i left him a 20% tip and said thank you, he had nothing to say and didn't even say goodbye, when he was right there when we left. I guess $55 is not enough tip for him. 
Very dissapointed at the waiter Prime has working for them.

Great place to get a prime steak, hence the name.  Standard steakhouse decor, so much so that I hardly recall the details.  It's what you'd expect when you are paying $150+ dollars per plate.  No surprises here.  I'd recommend it.

Good food. Service is the issue. Not friendly wait staff. For the kind of $$ you spend I expect staff to find their happy place. Instead you kind of feel like you are walking on egg shells with them. Half the dinning experience is being made to feel comfortable. Lots of equally good food and better service elsewhere in Vegas.

I came here to celebrate my B-day weekend, and I was VERY impressed.  First off, AMAZING service.  Our server was very friendly and paid the perfect amount of attention.  He also recommended a DELICIOUS Cabernet to pair with our steak (not TOO expensive either).  We started with the crab cakes which was heaven in my mouth.  Even the complimentary bread & butter was epic! I ordered the Filet Mignon, Onion Rings, Truffle Mashed Potatoes, Potato Gratin and corn.  ALLLLLL amazing. My favorite were the truffle mashed potatoes if I HAD to choose one.  They brought me a complimentary chocolate cake for my bday which was so nice :) We also ordered a creme brulee & coffee.  All were delicious. Finally, our server brought us free tickets for the Bank nightclub, where we went after we saw "O." Must say...great weekend at the Bellagio.  Will definitely come back for the next special occasion :)

I went with a few guys to Vegas for a bachelor party weekend, so we hit up a few nice restaurants.

The three of us ordered the top 3 most expensive steaks on the menu and split them, so we could all try each of the steaks.  None of them impressed me. The flavor was a little watered down. Still ok, but certainly not $70 steaks.  I've had better at Ruth's Chris, and I'm not really a Ruth's Chris fan.  The truffled mashed potatoes were incredible, but they were $14 for a little side.

I asked the waiter why there were only 2 steaks on the menu that were dry aged, and he tried to tell me that wet aged was just as good as dry aged.

Overall the service was cool, and I loved the ambiance - probably the most impressive ever. But I don't think I'll be going back.

Early dinner (5pm) due to early start the next day. I'm not a 'meat person' but there are certain places like Prime... "when in Rome, eat the steak"
I did a surf & turf. The meat was good!

The view was great, the tables were lively but quiet enough to have a conversation. The decor- decadent and a nod to another era. 

Get the freakin chocolate cake

Smooth wines, juicy steaks, melt-in-your-mouth sides and rewarding desserts... this was one of the best meals I've ever had. And, I got to experience it with some of my most favorite humans on earth. 

Met a few of my faves in Vegas, to welcome 2018, over a great meal. A couple of them had chosen Prime, as they had it a few years ago and said they wanted us to taste for ourselves. They told no lie. 

It's located inside the Bellagio and if you can, you should request a table with a view of the fountain show. It's truly a spectacular view. Arrive early and grab a drink at the bar and just really enjoy the views, because it's a visually stunning restaurant. Btw, the Emeritus Pinot was devine. 

The service is impeccable. Every single staff member displays the utmost hospitality, from the hostess, to the sommelier. 

We started with a bottle of the Melka CJ Cab and Hourglass Merlot, which both were velvety smooth. The Hourglass had a slightly bitter afternote, but wasn't bad. The Melka was the table's fave, so we had to get another bottle. The wines paired extremely well with all of the food. 

The food was nothing short of amazing. The steaks are juicy and cooked to perfection. Hubby and I shared the dry-aged bone-in ribeye, which was so marbly and yummy. We also shared the filet mignon, which was tender and delicious. The steak sauces were all flavorful, and surprisingly the soy was my fave, because I thought I'd like the bearnaise more. The entire table shared all the sides, which we ordered 2 of each. The truffle potatoes were whipped to perfection and literally melted in my mouth, SO yum!!! The mac and cheese was so good, as well as the brussels, and creamed spinach. I should mention I had a bite of my friend's cesar salad, at the beginning of the meal and it was also really good. Oh, the walnut bread was my fave too, but the pretzel one was also good! And the desserts were soooo good too! I had a bite of the chocolate cake, which was the perfect ending to the meal. The bread pudding looked amazing, but I could not take another bite of food, or I'd pass out right there. 

It's not often that I endulge in a 4-star restaurant, so it's truly a treat to experience and Prime was a great choice! Treat yo self!

Stars for amazing ambience.  We sat on patio and the fountains were A-maz-ing! We made reservations for 8, with caviot of an anniversary and wanted to sit on patio so we were sat at 830. I expected alot more from the service. We had to tell our waiter we were ready to order appetizers, which arrived before he came back to take our main order. So we were sitting there with our menus trying to hold them and eat our apps, waiting to do our main order. Service was painfully slow but was ok because we got to watch more of the show. Know that inside the restaurant, you cant hear the music for the fountain. Food was good but not great. Filet was tender and cooked perfectly but not alot of flavor.  They were accommodating for a gluten allergy and even brought gf bread to the table. I just expected outstanding service for that price and was disappointed. If we hadn't set outside,  I would of felt ripped off.

Best Steak I've Ever Had.  I dream about this steak.

Now, lets take a step back.  Of course make a reservation.  My party made a reservation well in advance and requested to sit in the patio overlooking the Bellagio fountain. It was July and hot as balls, so they gratefully did not seat us outside, but we had a window seat to see the wonderful fountain show time and time again.  It was great.

Now the Steak.  A good steak needs no additional sauces.  This one did not, it melted in your mouth.  However, they provide sauces and they were so good.  Such a great compliment to an already great piece of meat.

It's a beautiful restaurant.  It's classy but not overly done.  The staff are knowledgable and warm.  It's an overall great experience.

Anytime I am in Las Vegas I will be eating there.

I was very lucky to eat at prime and have my dad pay the bill. 

I've eaten at nice steakhouses before such as Mastro's and BOA, and I've concluded that most top-of-the-line steakhouses are very similar in their menus. Other factors are what can make the difference, such as service and ambiance.

This place does have spectacular views of the Bellagio Fountains, but inside the design was a bit tacky. I get it, I get it, it's supposed to feel like an opulent steakhouse from many decades ago with chandeliers, columns, big drapes everywhere, and waiters that bring food out on rolling carts. But for me, it was a little stuffy and got pretty old after a while. 

My impression of this place is that it's trying very hard to be a classic fancy steakhouse. But I was just left with chairs that were uneasy to maneuver and a waiter who seemed kind of absent. I've had better waiters at a Chili's while ordering nachos. This guy was only at our table a handful of times, while an army of other people kept our water glasses filled. He didn't check on us nearly enough  throughout our meal and wasn't very personable. 

(And they could stand to update their bathroom)

At Mastro's, you do get amazingly attentive service in a more modern and classy place. Although, just as at Mastro's, you do get an amazing steak at Prime. 

As for the food, my initial impression was of how small the menu was. There are maybe a dozen entrees. There are a large number of side dishes to choose from, though. 

I would say that the sauces--particularly the bernaise--make the steak entrees very good. I ordered a filet mignon medium rare. It was cooked nicely, with a juicy and red interior, but the outside of the steak was dry. 

The sides are nothing to write home about, except for the black truffle mashed potatoes. These are whipped clouds of carbohydrate perfection. The earthy black truffle is generously shaved on top and is abundantly stirred throughout. (But let's be honest, you could shave black truffles on anything, even a twinkie, and it'd be delicious.)

Eating at prime was a wonderful experience and I do recommend it. But as for its rank among other steakhouses, I would say it falls toward the upper middle. With Mastro's still on top.

Had a great dinner with the family during the holidays. We all ordered the bone in rib eye. It was delicious. I did however, have to send mine back. Everything we got was delicious and full of flavor except for this weird squash thing we got as a side. Skip that. I was even happier at the end when I saw that my steak was comped due to me sending it back. The waiters and the staff were all friendly and knowledgeable. Find dining isn't just about the food. It's about the whole experience and our server made sure we had an amazing dinner.

Great steaks. All around great service, except when we tried to make a reservation.  We were staying at the Bellagio and decided to eat at Prime. I called the restaurant around 4 and asked for a 7 reservation for 2. The lady told me she was booked till 9:30. So I called the concierge to book a table for the following night. The concierge told me she could get me in for either night I wanted, we decided to go the first night. We got there around 6:40, there were maybe 20% of the tables occupied. We finished eating around 7:45 and there were still 50% of the tables empty. Why turn down a reservation if you're not close to full?

We came back recently because of Karina and Christian and had a much better experience. The service was spot on and the food was better. We were celebrating a friend's birthday and ordered a variety of steaks/dishes. I really liked the updated version of the Caesar salad. I also thought the sides were spectacular this time around. The onion rings, mashed potatoes, brussel sprouts, and mushrooms were all fantastic. The steak was just as I remembered, especially the miso one. I really appreciate them getting back to me about my first experience, and would happily recommend Prime to family and friends in the future.

If you book only one lavish dinner for your Las Vegas trip, PRIME is your place.

Fiance and I came here for an anniversary on a Friday night and had the best time.

*Magnificent view of the Bellagio fountain show - ask for a table near the window!
*Best steak and truffle mashed potatoes I've ever had.  Worth every penny.
*Beautiful customer service from host to bar to table.
**TIP:  They will come by and ask to photograph you.  Let them!!  Our gal spent time making us both look as good as possible (i.e. skinny and natural, ladies) and took a few different angles from our seated position.  Before the meal is over, they will present you with the photos printed in Bellagio frames, no obligation to buy!!  They were SO beautiful, of course we did buy.. and now a small one sits at my computer in my office to look at each day.

Prime, thank you for making our dinner so memorable.
Went there last year with my wife.  Ordered a Wagu 5 filet mignon.  The absolute best  I've ever had!  Manager even walked us to our event we were there for.  Arriving on the 29th for another week.

My fianc and I have decided to review restaurants based on five criteria: Food, Alcohol, Cleanliness & Ambiance, Service and Value/Price.

This was our first meal after I proposed so everything might be a little on the favorable side keep that in mind as you read on. 

FOOD

We started with a half dozen oysters. This is the first time I mention oysters in a review but we love them. These oysters were from Nova Scotia and they were fantastic. They were smaller which we prefer and on the sweet side which we also prefer.  We definitely enjoyed them and would have had another half dozen if we didn't have all the food we had coming. 

The next plate was a Caesar salad which we split. The split portion was perfect. The salad had a lot of flavor but really just tasted like regular Caesar salad nothing out of the ordinary. 

The main course was a shared 18oz Dry Aged Bone in Rib Eye with an 8oz white tail lobster to complete the surf and turf. We also had roasted Brussels sprouts that were prepared with bacon, pear and chervil.

The steak comes out with three different sauces and it didn't need any of them. It was incredibly juicy, spiced perfectly and prepared to the perfect temperature. Every bite was amazing and that is all we can say about that one. 

The lobster was also prepared perfectly and tasted great. I am not a big fan of butter on my lobster and this lobster didn't need it to really complete the flavor. 

Finally the Brussels sprouts were very good. I am not a huge Brussels sprouts guy and these were definitely worth trying. Not the best I have ever had but really when you mix it with bacon I am not sure you can go wrong. 

The food was delicious but i am still deciding if it was just better because of the night.  Regardless this food was worthy of one star. 

ALCOHOL

We started with a glass of Veuve Yellow Champagne each and ended up sharing a third. The Champagne was good but a little dryer than we prefer. Still a great glass of champagne if you enjoy bubbles. 

With the main course we each had a glass  of Italian Gaja Promise. This was a cabernet to go with the steak and it paired perfectly. 

Overall the alcohol deserves 3/4 of a star. The only reason for a small deduction was because we didn't have cocktails so I can't really judge that and it is difficult to give a full star when I don't know how all the drinks taste.  

CLEANLINESS & AMBIANCE 

The Ambiance was fantastic especially for a night like last night. The table was right next to the glass looking at the Bellagio fountain.  That combined with the sexy steakhouse lighting made the experience very romantic. 

The restrooms and bathroom were very clean and well maintained. I assume there is a full time team making sure that is the case. 

Overall the cleanliness & ambiance gets a star. 

SERVICE

The service was spectacular. The waiter knew when to come over and when to give us space on our night. He made excellent suggestions when needed and really knew his stuff.  I didn't catch his name but thank you for making the evening perfect. 

One note that is important here they do have a photographer that comes by to take pictures. I am sure you can ask them to leave you alone if you like.  I know some people get bothered by this but you are in a nice restaurant at the Bellagio in Vegas.  

Overall the service was perfect and deserves one star.  

VALUE/PRICE

The overall value is where i am having a difficult time.  I know and understand that this was a steakhouse and it was a nice meal but the prices were a tad on the high side. For one appetizer, one salad, a surf and turf with a side, three glasses of champagne and two glasses of wine the bill came out to $400 plus.  I consider that quite significant and I would say it was only the alcohol that was over priced and the Caesar Salad.  Even as far as steakhouses go this was on the pricey side and I have to dock some stars for this.  

Overall the value/price receives 1/4 a star. 

In conclusion Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio was amazing. It was the perfect place for a special night such as the night I proposed to my fianc. The overall rating is 4 stars.  We would probably return but not until we cycle through more restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip.

Prime is one of my favorite places in town. I've been here dozens of times and each visit has been exquisite. I always say, that for some reason, the staff at Prime seem to read my mind. Every detail here seems to be meticulously planned and executed. From the smooth, attentive, yet unobtrusive service to the sublimely prepared seafood platters or the stunning cuts of beef paired with wonderful selection of sauces and sides, I thoroughly enjoy every second here. What I love the most is that the wait staff make us feel like a million bucks from the second we are received. They never say "no". Everything can be arranged, customized or put together. I absolutely adore coming here and will most definitely continue to do so in the future.

Not impressed at all!  Specifically made reservations here to celebrate a special occasion for a friend more than 3 months ahead of our stay.  Asked for fountain view seating, outdoors if possible, and asked  for a special dessert item.  We did indeed have a fountain view, in the corner with another couple (not with our party) practically sitting on top of us, with my back to the view.  The outdoor area was open but that request was not noted on our reservation in their book (although it was listed on my email confirmation) and was full.  The food itself was of high quality, cooked to perfection, and very tasty in and of itself, but ruined by bitter sauces.  I could not finish my sea bass as the sauce was literally making me feel sick.  My guest enjoyed his steak but again, the sauce garnishing the plate left a lot to be desired and enough of it saturated his filet that he could not enjoy it nearly as much as he should have.  The dessert item was available and they did bring out a petit tray of complimentary truffles with a candle for my friend, which was appreciated.  Overall though, not worth our time or money.

Fabulous! The menu has amazing options on it. I ordered the organic jidorhi chicken and added broccoli as a side. The meal was outstanding. Then broccoli did come with a white sauce on it which, has I been paying enough attention to menu, I would have left it off. I just prefer my broccoli steamed with nothing creamy added. The dessert was a cinnamon bread pudding. You MUST get this. I was hesitant and would have never ordered it, but the bartender recommended it. We always eat at the bar and this one has a tv for those who are into things like games. This place is high end, very classy and expensive. Very. Worth every penny!

We celebrated our anniversary here. Very nice and good atmosphere. Food was delicious and the staff was great. They even brought us a complimentary dessert as a surprise for our anniversary, which was very thoughtful. We had a great time.  We got sat at a table with a window seat and watched the fountains front row and center.  Worth the $ for a special event.

I'm not afraid to pay up for a great steak. For the nosebleed-high prices they're charging here (the filet was listed at $62 bucks...I had the porterhouse which was less??) this should be one of the best steak experiences you'll ever have. It's nowhere close. In fact, it wasn't even in my top 50. Just another Las Vegas corporate-restaurant shaking tourists down for as much money as possible. 

Skip it.

I just thought it was a typical menu with a typical steak for Vegas
The view of the water was great. 
Nothing memorable
Always have had good experiences at Prime.  They have high quality meats and good service.

My husband and I had a lovely dinner here last night. Service was phenomenal. Nice atmosphere, a little loud though. Definitely will come back. We also had a nice view from where we were sitting . We got to see the fountains of the Bellagio go off many times. A lady came over and asked if she could take our picture, we agreed. Thinking we're not going to buy these anyways. Well the pictures turned out wonderful, so we bought them. What a very nice experience and the pictures to remind us of a nice time we had here.

Wonderful service, classy atmosphere & the food as amazing

the beef tartare & carpaccio was delicious.
i highly recommend getting the truffle mashed potatoes.

a very nice view of the water show too. i loved it here.
my new favorite place to eat in Vegas~

The Good

Ribeye was solid. Very good, but nothing spectacular in comparison to other high end steakhouses.

The sides were magnificent. The truffle mashed potatoes were a truly unique treat, and the mac n cheese was also tasty.

We were seated with a direct view of the Bellagio Fountains, which was pretty cool.  

The Bad

Waiter was some serial killer looking old man. Not only was he a ghost during the meal, he told me to "hold on" when I tried to hand back the bill. The couple next to us shared our agitated sentiment. Then again, we were the only "young" people in the establishment. We actually became acquainted, and I invited them to join our table at the club later haha...only in Vegas.

Overall

My rating is leaning towards 3.5, as I really enjoyed the sides, but I can't ignore the atrocious service.

My wife and I went here for our 5th anniversary. We had requested fountain view seating when we made our reservations 2 months before arriving. When we arrived, we were told the seating wasn't available for at least an hour after our reservation. We decided to just be seated instead. They seated us right next to the kitchen entrance which was horrible. My chair was constantly hit by servers without any of them apologizing. Our drinks were never refilled including our water until after we were already finished eating. The only reason why I'm giving 2 stars is because the food was excellent.

Really disappointed with this restaurant, especially for being in the Bellagio on a beautiful water front with RIDICULOUSLY expensive food. Someone in my group got the steak and it was..just okay. Nothing special. I had been eating red meat a lot so I got the chicken. I love chicken. But they served me a large, flat piece of boneless chicken that was deep fried. I was super confused about the chefs choice in cooking and serving that. It's a nice restaurant for goodness sakes, don't serve fried chicken like that. 
I have too many loves in Las Vegas to come back here again.

I was so looking forward to my ahi tuna.  The chef must not like fish... I get peppercorns on steak but with fish, being a delicate protein, he killed it.  Couldn't even taste it.  And at $60, I expected so much more!  Having worked at fine dining restaurants and dined at many, I was very disappointed.  My wine glass sat empty for more than 10 minutes without being addressed.  Not a place to go to impress.
Food is amazing ,ambiance is superb love love this restaurant i recommend to try out the seabass and the duck

While I can say only excellent things about Yellowtail, a fantastic restaurant also located in the Bellagio, I can't unfortunately say the same for Prime, this time around.

I've had excellent experiences at Prime before so I expected nothing different, however this time, this past Wednesday, I couldn't decide what was worse, the service or the food.  Maybe they were both equally bad.  My drink wasn't filled for almost 20 minutes, and I had to ask and then it took another 10 minutes for it to arrive, then I ordered another, and same story...no one asked us how our food was, the waiter was busy doing something else unfortunately and the people at the table next to us was also waiting and waiting.

The NY Strip w/Soy looked great, but I actually had to change knives from the first steak knife they gave me, to a different stronger one because the meat was so poorly preapred, it was tough and I barely ate 1/2 of it and then gave up.

The sea bass my buddy ordered was also over powered by the sauce it came with, another less than appetizing meal.  

On a positive note, Yellowtail, I would highly recommend...ate there twice this trip and both times the service and food, as usual, was flawless.

I hope Bellagio fixes these types of issues at Prime, I have had good experiences there in the past, but I don't know if I'll visit it on my next trip.

This steakhouse inside the Bellagio is rated one of the best steakhouses in Las Vegas and from the minute you step inside you know you are in for a couple of things.  Great ambiance and very hefty price tag. Magnificently appointed from the small 8 seat bar when you first walk in to the large tables placed not to closely with views of the fountains through the large picture windows its pure Vegas.   Table for 9 on this Saturday night and we are given a large round table where we are seated very comfortably.   Fresh baskets of bread, pretzel bread, are a nice start as we peruse this shall we say ok no way around it Ridiculously overpriced menu. There I said it. 

The wine list is long as it is equally if not one of the most expensive wine lists I've ever seen.  In fact most were 300% mark up.  There was an exceptional vintage a 2008 Justin Isosceles which for $131.00 was simply marked up 110% which made it the best value on the entire list.   Note 5 bottles were consumed tonight.  The menu itself is your typical steaks & chops menu with some fish thrown in.   Don't think I'll be able to get to each appetizer and entree but I'll try. 

Appetizer Highlights:  
Shrimp Cocktail exceptional, Cesar Salad authentic and outstanding. Special tonight Burrata cheese over watercress was really unbelievably good, A dungeous crab cake also as good it gets.  Knocks off for poor Seared Foie Gras. 

Entrees: 
NY Strip Dry aged incredibly tasty and cooked  to perfection but the typical dry aging left it no juice whatsoever.  (8) out of 10

 (2) Small Bone in Rib Eye with Shishito peppers was tasty with just enough marble to give it some excellent secondary flavor (10)

Rack of Colorado Lamb was simply killer, not gamey and rich in color texture and taste. (10)

Prosciutto wrapped pork chop was dry and lacked flavor (5) Nice looking but didn't get it done.

Pan Roasted Dover Sole was fresh and tasty but completely overpriced at $65.00 (7)

Veal Chop was grilled and tasty and hanging off the bone as it should be.  Very rich flavor (10)

Filet Mignon with Shishito peppers everything a filet should be and then some (even for my friend who tried to ruin it by ordering it medium well :(   (10)

Sides: 
Mashed Yukon Gold Potatoes (6) Nothing special

Baked Potatoes large giant with all the fixings (10)

Mac & Cheese crusty topping and rich and creamy underneath (10)

Creamed Spinach lacking that extra kick (6)

Glazed Mushrooms again nothing special bland (6)

No Deserts were tried.  Service was exceptional throughout the meal from every direction.  

Bottom line is was the price tag worth it?  Really borderline as almost every entree except the Sole was top shelf, and the appetizers were great. Ambiance, service exceptional as well.
