Negatives All but 1 of hundreds of wines were so overpriced we were lucky to find a bottle to order.  Sides and prices of entrees were completely outrageous.  Kind of a 4 star if you have unlimited spending in your budget as it certainly was not a 100% slam dunk perfection and 1 star off for price points and wine list.  3.5 stars is more like it but we have to be fair.

*** 1/2 stars

This is a luxurious looking restaurnat with a view of the Bellagio fountains to boot. We had a beautiful corner table that was cozy and romantic. 

The food was excellent traditional steak house fare. We started with some excellent crab cakes for appetizers. Followed by the peppercorn crusted NY strip for me and the bone in filet special for my girlfriend. Both steaks were aged well and flavorful. I have never been a fan of doucing my steak in sauce. However, I have to admit that the miso mustrad was a nice compliment to the steak. Truffle mash was a perfect side. The surprising highlight of the evening was that they has a mille crepe on their menu for dessert. The only time I have had a good rendition of this dessert outside Paris was at Lady M in NYC. Prime's Version gets an A+ from me. Perfectly textured crepes stacked with a layer of cream in between. 

The big downer of the evening was the impersonal service. While our waiter was attentive and we were checked on by couple other people over the course of the evening. It just seemed like no one really cared. This might be a contrast to our luxurious experience at Twist the previous night. 

I have to take away some points for service. Although, I think I may not be the only one that thinks so. I did notice that this restaurant had a 4 diamond rating, while possesing the makings of a 5 diamond restaurant. It isnow clear to me what type of restaurnat garners that extra star.
Dry aged rib eye medium was perfect.  Plus i got them to make us lobster mashed potatoes--yummm.  Expensive but you get what you pay for service was spot on.

What an amazing experience.  The service is top notch, the view is astounding overlooking the Bellagio Water Show, and the food is par excellence.  My family went for dinner on Christmas Eve and everything was just so well done it is difficult to express just how good it was.  Firstly the bread that comes is exquisite, there is a compilation of breads with a chive salt and butter and the rolls are hot and fresh and perfect.  The salads seemed steep for a side salad but in reality, they are nearly a full meal in themselves and really we did not need a salad and dinner but we did not realize it would be so big.  I had the mixed fall vegetable salad and it came with a whole wheel of goat chevre with delicate vegetables in a vinaigrette.  My father  had the Caesar Salad and Butternut squash soup which were dynamite.  My mother had a truffle salad and it was just a touch woodsy for my taste.  Where this place really shines though is the steak, oh the glorious steak.  I had the mammoth 18 oz bone in ribeye cooked medium rare.  For $66 it was an absolute bargain.  The meat was so flavorful and tender and perfectly cooked, no gristle and perfect melt in your mouth fat.  My father went one bigger and had the 28oz steak and even though he had it cooked to well done it was still tender and juicy.  My mother had the Short rib which was a bit over salty but still really good and sweet.  The side dishes were also very good, the Brussel sprouts are well worth getting and the gnocchi is so soft and pillowy they are truly heavenly. We also had the macaroni and cheese which was standard fare but good and the potatoes dauphanoise which were just a bit dry and over done.  
In all though for the service and truly reasonable price for the amazing meal that you get this place is well worth a visit for some special occasion, indeed I wish that I was rich enough to eat here every night I don't think I could get tired of all of the truly exceptional food and atmosphere that this place provides.

Sides were extremely small. Cesar salad was ok. Steaks: some thought too salty some said not enough. I got bone -in ribeye and was ok not much flavor. FYI we had a fantastic steak dinner In Vagas somewhere else
Comimos atn sellado y cortes americanos, deliciosos. Adems la vista de las fuentes del Bellagio es privilegiado. Un lugar con mucha clase

Excellent. We sat on the patio and enjoyed every minute of it except the couple in front of us who were way too frisky. I had the 18oz ribeye and my wife had the lobster tail. My steak was superb and so was her lobster tail. We shared a side of mac and cheese, very good. The staff was awesome and we had no complaints. It is pricey but well worth it.

For a romantic dinner with a show, Prime is a primo place for just that type of situation. The restaurant sits right behind the Bellagio fountain show and if you are fortunate enough to get a window seat or sit out in the patio, it can be a very romantic evening. Even if you sit in the middle or back areas of the restaurant, you have a decent chance of seeing the water show as well but just not to its full potential. 

The service was simply amazing as most of the fine dining establishments in Las Vegas, however the food is a little hit or miss depending on what you order. AND like most fine dining in Vegas, it is extremely pricey as I had the custom made surf and turf style dish. 

The waiter for our evening made some excellent suggestions as far as cuts of meat and even some unique sauces which I tried and were amazed with. Again, service brought Prime up a notch with me otherwise I might not have rated it as high. 

Our group ordered the seafood bonanza (not the actual name but that is what it felt like) and it was simply crazy. From crab legs, jumbo shrimp and oysters ... just a hodge podge of seafood. It was good but I am not a fan of most of that stuff except the shrimp. 

I was also tempted to have the lobster bisque which I always enjoy at restaurants. The presentation was very nice however the soup itself was way too rich for my taste. Because of that, I didn't finish it which is very rare for me. It should have been toned down quite a bit but the lobster in the soup was very tasty. 

I did have the special order of the surf and turf which was a 6oz Kobe beef strip along with a lobster tail. The Kobe beef could have been cut with a spoon and simply melted in my mouth, I was amazed. I did order it medium as I like my meat but it came a little bit under but I didn't care because it just blew me away. The lobster tail was very good but what put it over the top was instead of using the butter, I tried this butter/shallot emulsion and it was amazing as well!!! 

Sides are a la carte and I do recommend the spicy mac & cheese. Never made it to dessert but that is ok ... I am stuffed. 

Soup: So so 
Main Course: AMAZING 
Sides: Great 

Favorite dish: Kobe beef (medium-rare) with lobster tail in the special sauce (which comes on the side). 

Go out and EAT!

It was good but not great. Let me start by saying we do not normally spend $300 for the two of us to have dinner. Steak, a bottle of wine, and a couple of sides.  The best I could compare it to was a recent dinner at Ruth's Chris which was under $200 and we enjoyed much more. However, this is not Ruth's. It's nicer in most ways.  The environment is very nice. If you get a window table you get awesome views of the Bellagio water show. Our table was ready without a wait which was nice.  Service is good but we felt rushed and had to slow things down a couple times. For that much money I don't want to feel rushed.  So, again we don't normally eat fancy. We are Chili's and Chipotle type people so take that in to account. To us this meal simply wasn't worth the cost. I would rather eat 50 meals at Chipotle, LOL!  Seriously though, if you want a very nice atmosphere, good service, and good food this is a good spot.  If you want to impress your date bring her here!  I just don't think it's worth the cost to ME. Oh ya, I had the tomato salad and it was especially good. Unique, large and VERY good. It stuck out more than anything else we had. Otherwise just good.

It's four $$$$ on Yelp for a reason.. the steak is amazing! Their soy-rice wine house sauce was the icing on the.. steak? It was such a unique and delicious sauce.. I wanted to drink it. I ordered the filet mignon, and it was cooked wonderfully and so juicy. The sides are shareable. My two friends and I shared the mac & cheese, and the truffle mashed potatoes.

The decor is gorgeous, and was the perfect place to satisfy our craving for steak before going to the Cirque du Soleil show nearby. If I'm in Vegas again, I'm going back to Prime for another steak.

I really wanted to love this place... for my birthday I was looking for an awesome experience for both the palate & setting. Of course being at the Bellagio the ambiance & decor was breath taking, especially with the water show in the background. Our server was excellent & attentive to our needs. The truffled mash potatoes melted in your mouth, however, we were sadly disappointed with our main course. The Colorado lamb was topped with a mushroom/tomato mix & shredded Parmesan (no indication on the menu). The portion size was sufficient, however I found myself scraping the topping off the lamb. I appreciate a nicely seasoned rack of lamb, but the toppings over powered it with a spaghetti flavor. The veggie accompaniment had a little too much pepper flakes. My husband requested a medium New York strip which came out mid-rare, a little to much blood for his taste. For a $300+ dinner, you should not have to compromise on food & flavor, which is what I feel we succumbed to. If it were service that wasn't to great & food on point we might take a chance on going back, but it wasn't. Definitely not to thrilled about our venue choice & I don't see ourselves coming back a second time.

Cooked to perfection. I mean perfection. Red mashed potatoes were pured. Bacon wrapped shrimp were beyond flavorful. Peppercorn steak spot on. Request to sit on the patio and the fountain debuts every 15 or 30 minutes. The view is breathtaking. The wait staff is there for every need or accommodation. All high class professionals.

Gorgeous decor and Bellagio's lakeside dining room sets the stage for a great dining experience if only the human element were as perfect.  Despite arriving dressed to their code, we were seated in the very back corner by the toilets and service station.  It would have been an appetizer and go had the maitre 'd not obliged our request to move closer to the windows.  Dinner on again, we had bacon wrapped shrimp, crab cake, ribeye, lamb, cauliflower, potatoes gratin, brussels sprouts, and a souffl.  All were good but the lamb was a bit dry, ribeye and veggies were super greasy (buttered).  Nothing wowed; this is more high priced comfort foods with a nice environment.  Wait staff was professional but not very personable.  Overall acceptable but not worth a repeat.

Wow! I went here in a party of 8 and was seated at a window side table with a gorgeous view of the remarkable Bellagio fountains! The view was amazing, the restaurant's decor was extremely elegant with a modern touch and the ambiance was superb. My dining experience here was amazing and let me tell you why... 

1.) Appetizers set the bar super high for the coming meal
For those who love raw stuff-
*We started with two large Seafood Platters. Served in an elegant setting that had the oysters, lobster, crab, prawns, mussel and clams over ice. Underneath the setting was another bowl that was conveniently placed (yet still hidden) for the shells. Everything in the seafood platter was extremely fresh and of great quality. I'm usually not a fan of oysters but these oysters were to die for. Alongside the sauces which include: cocktail, horseradish, and vinegar, *dont forget to ask your waiter for melted butter and Tabasco* best and most fresh seafood platter I have ever indulged in!
*The Steak Tartare and Carpaccio was another great choice that we started our meal. Served with Tarragon Aioli and Grilled Crostini, I highly recommend this especially if you are drinking wine.

2.) I think the Steaks are made in heaven
*The filet Mignon, medium rare, melts in your mouth. The steak cut so easily and was tenderly moist. It was perfectly seasoned and charred on the outside but exactly medium rare on the inside just how I like and wanted. It was served with a zesty roasted green chili, perfect to change up your palate.
*The bone in rib eye steak was just as tasty! Seasoned more than the filet Mignon and a little more "fatty" I would recommend this for those who like their steaks more flavorful. This too melted in my mouth!

3.) The sides are small and properly portioned 
*The glazed market mushrooms and truffle mashed potatoes were my favorite but I also was able to taste the creamed spinach and steamed asparagus. The mushrooms and mashed potatoes are a must order! I'm just glad they we're small portions or else I would've eaten all the sides and wouldn't have room for the main course! 

4.) The service was amazing!
*i wish I remembered our waiters name but he was awesome, I wish I could give him credit. After a couple of martinis, I forgot to ask. He was attentive, personable and funny. The dining experience definitely would not be the same without him and the incredible staff.

I went here last Thursday with my boyfriend for my 30th birthday. We made a reservation for 6:00 and were seated right away on the patio. The view is amazing and I love how you can watch the fountain show while eating dinner.
The service was impeccable! Everyone was very nice and attentive. Unfortunately, I forget our servers name but he was really cool and made us feel relaxed and even had our salad split because we said we wanted to share it.
I had the filet mignon with the au gratin potatoes and my bf had the short ribs. The portions are a good size so go hungry! Everything was cooked perfectly and was delicious! 
They even gave me a complimentary dessert for my birthday which were delicious chocolates! 
Overall, we had a great time and I'm glad I chose this restaurant to celebrate my birthday!

Came here with a group of 13 people. The food was very good but the meal was over shadowed by the fact a lady came to take our picture. We've gone to nice restaurants before so we thought it was a nice gesture. After our meal was over they lady brought our pictures back and suddenly said that the price was accepted by cash or credit. We were caught so off guard. Not only was it crazy after we had this elaborate meal but the price was really astronomical. It really created a changed mood with our group. I was pretty disappointed.

We started our dinner off with the seafood platter -- crab legs, oysters, mussels and shrimp served of ice.  It was fresh; especially the oysters! I remember the oysters melting in my mouth as I squeezed a lemon on top and slurped each one into my mouth! I ordered the fillet mignon and my fiance ordered the rib-eye.  The fillet mignon was great; grilled exactly how I liked it -- medium rare.  I personally enjoyed the rib-eye only because the cut was more tender.  We were told the meat has been aged for a period of time which indeed brought out the flavor in the beef. Can't wait to go back to this place the next time we visit! 

The service was phenomenal; waiters are well attentive to your needs. They are very personal & are consistently checking up on you making sure the food is tasting great. We got a lakeside view next to the window, so we got the chance to see the water show in front of the Bellagio nemerous of times. It's much more pleasurable to watch from the inside of the restaurant rather than standing with the crowd of tourists outside. I enjoyed the romantic ambiance of the restaurant... quiet, dimmed lights and tables covered in white table cloths with candles lit on the table. There was a photographer that came around each table to take pictures; she even showed us how to pose for the camera. But unfortunately we left too soon before she was able to come back to our table. We were given two complimentary guest passes two the Bank night club as well at the end of our dinner.  

If you're a steak-lover, this place is a must try!

My husband and I went here to celebrate his 30th and we were VERY impressed with the food here.

While it is expensive (expected), the food is excellent. It is the best filet mignon I've had - perfectly cooked with a fabulous flavor. 

We split the mac n cheese and truffle mashed potatoes which were both DELICIOUS.

While we were a little disappointed that they didn't give us a window seat when we called to request one, they made up for it by giving my husband a free dessert for his b-day!

While we couldn't go here on an average night, it was the perfect place to celebrate, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good steak dinner in Vegas.

Disappointed all around.  

The ONLY bright spot was that we were able to nab a patio seat, so the view and the entire spectra of the water show was a major plus.
Besides that, everything else was all down hill.
We were seated 10 minutes later than my 8:30pm reservation on a busy Friday night.  This is a given and I have no problem with this, considering that we did get the patio seating.

Here are the breakdowns...


Service : There was only 2 servers, that I saw, serving the entire patio floor, of perhaps 8 table or so.  It was difficult to flag a server for help.  For a restaurant of this caliber, I shouldn't have to flag a server, much less wrestle to get their attention.
In addition, the delivery of the drinks, the bread, and the food was painfully slow.  If not for the water show at the Bellagio fountain every 15 minutes, I would've thrown my hands in the air long before we received our food.

Food: Our order was taken at about 8:50pm.  
Our drinks and bread came at around 9:00pm (10 minutes after the order was taken?)  The 3 different types of bread were all cold and stale, but we were all famished so our party took in what we had.
The food came around 9:30pm (40 minutes AFTER our order!!!)
It arrived COLD and uninspired.  The cream of spinach was so cold that I could not separate it.  The whole thing lifted from its plate as one whole lump piece.
GROSS!
None of the food was warm, or hot.  Why the food was left standing for so long is beyond me.  Our party was too tired from our delayed flight in to make an effort to flag a server to let them know of the food quality.
The porter house steak was uninspiring and overpriced at best.  The new york steak which was literally covered with peppercorn was so disgusting, that we had to return it for filet mignon...(surprisingly, the exchange only took 5 minutes!)
Filet mignon, too, was just bland.  The ahi steak I had was just overpowered by the thick crust, and once again, non inspirational.

Take away its "PRIME" location at bellagio, and this steakhouse would've been closed down long ago.

I, for one, will not be returning.

A very good steak with one of the best views on the strip (but only a small number of tables that can enjoy same). . . 

Unfortunately, very good is as far as I go.  Three SMALL filets ordered.  Each was requested medium rare.  One was near med well, one was Med Rare and one was Medium. . . . .  unfortunately, pricing demands excellence.

Oh - and, if you do decide to bring your own bottle of wine, check with the restaraunt first. . . . . anything that is on their list will not be poured.

No problem with the policy !  But woudn't you think that if you're going to adopt that policy at least make the wine list available online through the web site.

My family and I ate here on Sunday January 11, 2015
My wife two kids, and two of my friends.
My friends had the French onion soup, both said t was delicious.  My daughter 6 years of age but a very refined young lady enjoyed the butternut squash soup with oysters, my 1 year old couldn't get enough as well.
I enjoyed the foie gras appetizer it was melt in your mouth marvelous.  The waiters couldn't believe how well behaved my children are, it's because I myself own a restaurant and I teach them proper table etiquette.  

One of my friends ordered the porterhouse in his words the steak was a 10.
Other friend ordered the filet he said it was the most tender cut he ever had.
We opted for the baked potatoes 
Our sides were Fingerling potatoes that wasn't so wonderfully, neither was the creamed spinach 
The Brussels sprouts were on point and perfect
As we're the Yukon gold mashed potatoes. 
My daughter enjoyed the sea scallops while the wife said the lamb chops were the most tender she has ever had.
I loved my dry aged bone in ribeye. 
All in all a spectacular meal, at a very upscale restaurant. 
Not cheap at all. If saving a buck or two is what you are looking for, you will not find that here.
The bill was 577.00 I had a 400 dollar resort credit from M-life so my friends covered the 177 and I covered the 140 dollar tip.
Well worth it, resort credit or not. We will be back.

I can't say enough positive things about this place; everything I had was excellent. I went for a birthday dinner in a group of 5, made reservations, and we were seated as soon as we arrived. We probably weren't as dressed up as we could have been, but we were all presentable, and there were no issues. The table ordered a variety of things from appetizers through dessert: the french onion soup, wedge salad, filet mignon, ribeye, chicken, salmon, loaded baked potato, asparagus, lava cake, and more! We also enjoyed cocktails beforehand, and even those were noteworthy. The service was impeccable, with water refilled as needed throughout the night, without ever having to ask. They timed letting us get settled, ordering drinks, followed by appetizers, meals and desserts perfectly. I am definitely going back the next time I'm in Vegas, and would recommend this to anyone looking for a beautiful restaurant, delicious meal, and flawless service to round out your night!
It was good obviously pricey. Had the filet and lobster tail with asparagus. Good atmosphere and excellent service. Nice dessert menu.

Prime Indeed.

Name really says it all.  Located in Bellagio, we asked the concierge to recommended  a dinner place inside and she directed us to this magnificent restaurant.

Prime is located inside and front of the hotel next to the famous water fountain.  Upon going down the escalator to the restaurant, we immediately saw the upscale and classy vibe of the place.  The host was able to seat us on a Saturday evening without a reservation.  Husband and I felt a little under dressed for the establishment and were lucky that they still seated us.

We both ordered the bone-in ribeye, shared creamed spinach and sauteed mushroom sides.  The food came out to be amazing!  Steak was juicy and flavorful.  It came with three pairing sauces and my favorite was the red wine~ It was a yummy!  Portion was so big that we both only ate half of our steak.  

Although we didn't sit near the window with the fountain view,  I was still able to see the spectacle.  It was so grand that each time the finale of the fountain erupts, it lit the window area with bright mellow yellow and it was gorgeous.

Recommended: Dates. Business,  Engagement location, Special Night out.

Definitely call for reservation and request a window seat.

This was just fantastic.  Ate with a group of 6 and had impeccable service.  Water and wine glasses never left wanting.  The restaurant is very classic and demure.  And, as many note, you can see the fountains well from some tables.

On to the food:

We had the seafood tower.  Usually, the lobster is the star, but in this one, it was the crab for me.  The shrimp were perfectly cooked.  

Crabcakes was probably the most disappointing dish.  Serviceable, but not what I expected.

Had several sides.  The stars were mac n cheese and onion rings.  Will defintely get these 2 dishes again.  My wife had the filet and lobster.  Filet cooked PERFECTLY rare.  This was textbook, and no black on the outside, which was a feat for such a thick steak.  The lobster was one of the best I have had.  I had the bone-in ribeye, which was another perfect medium rare.  Excellent flavor, the dry aging came through.

The wine list is extensive, and pricey.  We had Italian at our table and all choices were excellent.  Port for dessert was actually not as bad price wise.  But, expect to pay if you are a wine drinker, as is common on the Strip.

Overall, a very expensive evening but one that we will do again.  If you are a steak fan, highly recommended.

I will say, the bathrooms were underwhelming for such a nice place.

WOW WOW WOWWWW, POSSIBLY ONE OF MY TOP FINE DINING EXPERIENCES!

-WHY: Fine, upscale dining at its absolute best. Probably one of my top, favorite restaurants of all time.

-ATMOSPHERE: An exquisite experience with wonderful and attentive staff. One feels like a whimsical princess or royalty as the staff all make room for individuals to pass through the restaurant with ease. Their recommendations and service is fitting for this restaurant. I loved the beautiful, classy decor and low light setting.


-SEAFOOD: Large platter of various crab legs and oysters. Delicious, fresh and as good as it gets!


-STEAK: At some steak houses, people will fight with me to ensure I order the medium well rather than well done. (I do not understand this. I absolutely hate any pink in my meat and will feel sick looking at pink so how can you know what my taste buds will enjoy?)

As snooty as this sounds, I can tell how fine the dining experience will by the response I get when ordering a well-done filet mignon. Here: no funny looks or push back on my request. (The same response for my friend's extra well-done rib-eye)

I am happy to share that a well-done filet mignon is still very tender and absolutely delicious here. No chewy, jerky style meat. They know how to cook their steaks!

All meat entrees came with an assortment of fine sauces: Soy-Rice Wine (Favorite), Barnaise, Peppercorn, Miso-Mustard


-SIDES: Creamed Spinach (I'm still drooling over the though of this, HIGHLY RECOMMEND), Truffle Mashed Potatoes (Probably the best truffle mashed potatoes I've had in my life. HIGHLY RECOMMEND), Mac & Cheese, Glazed Market Mushrooms, French Fries, Roasted Cauliflower

Came here for Christmas Eve dinner with some family and friends. The decor is really nice and appropriately fancy. The tables were big which is great to put all the food to share (sides are family style) but sometimes difficult to have a conversation with the person sitting accross from you. Minor details.
I had the oysters for the appetizer and they were so good. Light and crisp taste, I just wish they had more oysters on the plate! The beet salad and the pole foie gras were also both delicious. 
For the entre I had the lobster. It was ridiculous. There was so much meat and it was cooked just the right amount. I was so happy that day! My friend has the bone in ribeye and loved it. For the sides we had the gratin dauphinois which was our favorite, the mac and cheese (that was meh), the mushrooms, creamed spinach and brussel sprouts. 
Finally for dessert we got the creme brle and that was the perfect dish to end our lovely meal. 
Really enjoyed my dining experience over there!

I mean where do we start?
The atmosphere: very laid back, but dress nice. The views of the bellagio fountain show is breathtaking, the waiters are super informative and very funny guys. We had seafood platters which included every seafood you can think of, lamb chops, ny strip and filet, along with caesar salad mash potatos, mac and cheese(to die for), asparagus, mushrooms, i mean you name it.

Most def will be back. Thanks to the CHEF!

I could not be happier with Prime! When you make your reservation they ask if you are celebrating anything, which we were and then they surprised us with a FREE dessert that said happy anniversary, such a sweet touch. As soon as you walk in the door they seat you, didn't even wait two seconds! Figi bottled water, amazing drinks, truffled mashed potatoes, what more could you want! There was a photographer taking pictures of your table so we got one, $45 for two poses that come in a frame, pricey but not too bad. Love Love Love this place, will definitely be back! Dont get me wrong, the place is pricey, for us its a special occasion only type, but worth every penny, be sure to sit on the patio or ask for a view of the water show in your reservation!

A beautifully furnished steakhouse with amazing ambience; with gorgeous drapes that hug the tall windows outside of which you can see the Bellagio water fountain show at dinner time, perfect table settings, excellent menu selections of not only steaks but also seafood and chicken entree choices, Prime is THE steakhouse to be in Vegas to celebrate a special occasion.  
This is the spot where you can feel like a real adult who's "arrived", ready to plot your genius plans with your comrades right before (or after) you conquer the world. While there to celebrate a friend's birthday, I felt that Prime is one of the classiest places to dine, truly a creme de la creme place to celebrate any special occasion. We were treated superbly well by our server who was charming and gave sound advice as to what wines to complement with the types of entrees we planned to have as well the types of side dishes that would work best with the entrees.  
Another high point was the professional photographer Grace walked among the tables offering to take (and sell framed) photographs of the patrons, and I'm so happy we took her up on the offer as her control of the lighting effects on camera, the way she was able to "direct" us and take the photos made us 5 already beautiful women look even better in the photos that turned out.  Her service/product provided a wonderful keepsake for all of us from this special birthday occasion.
In hindsight, although I loved my 14-oz New York steak (medium well is perfect) and its soy-ginger reduction, 14-oz was definitely WAY too big for me (eyes bigger than stomach, what can I say :-).  If you are 5'6" woman like me who usually can barely finish a 8- or 10-oz steak, I'd stick to the 8-10 oz steak selections, not to mention the super yummy sides will take up room in the belly too.
Watch out for the very expensive wines (by the glass, I ordered a $40/glass Cab to go with my entree). The wine was delicious but they are definitely on the premium price side even by the glass.  Ask for corkage fee if you can bring your own wine.
Overall, a beautiful place to dine with excellent food and service.  Would love to go back again.

WOW WOW WOW!!! Don't mess with my meat!! And they did not! Huge steak eaters and have dined in just about every other Las Vegas Strip Steakhouse but, this now our favorite!!!! Might be a few $ more than the others, but well worth it. The foie gras was beyond good, the dry aged bone-in rib eyes perfectly cooked, sides of creamed spinach and truffle mashed potatoes delicious and the desserts yummm! Service top notch!! Worth every penny and will be back next year!!!

Disappointing.  Was here several years ago and had an outstanding meal.  Visited this week and it unfortunately has taken a big step back and clearly is at best a 2nd or 3rd tier steak place in Vegas.  Location is great and the service was generally good- but the quality of the beef was truly disappointing.  Had an "aged bone-in rib eye" that was one of the toughest steaks I've had in the past 12 months.  A steak I would expect at a mass chain for a third of the price.

if you want to enjoy the beautiful setting go here.  But if you are looking for high end beef I would look for a restaurant in the top tier of Vegas steak places which this is clearly no longer in.

Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten's Las Vegas steakhouse is one of the top dining experiences on the Strip. The darkly handsome restaurant inside the Bellagio overlooks the hotel's famous dancing fountains and provides an extra treat for diners. Not that they should need it, however, for the food here is world-class. Let's start with the steak, since that's what Prime is all about. We sampled the filet, a 10-ounce cut of wonderfully lean, pungently flavored meat ($67) that was oh-so tender to the knife and meltingly tasty in the mouth. We didn't find it required salt, pepper or -- God forbid -- any kind of sauce. The Caesar salad was a yummy accompaniment, and the French fries were amazing: fried golden brown, crunchy on the exterior and packed with a rich, potatoey (is that a word?) taste. Yes, we enjoyed some appetizers and our bread, but we really just kept raving about the steaks. They have some other entrees on the menu, but honestly, please do yourself a flavor (pun intended) and order a ribeye, t-bone or filet and savor your wisdom. By the way, the bartender is darned good, too; he made the best dirty vodka martini we've ever had. And he did it several times, too! Add into this fabulous mix very attentive yet unobtrusive service and we highly recommend Prime for your special night out.

We sat outside for our first year anniversary. It was splendid!!! Our server and food runners were amazing! 

We ordered a bottle of wine (house malbec; I love malbec with steak and beef, goes very well together), 2 soups (I ordered butternut squash and my gf ordered the French onion soup; both were delicious), 2 steaks (Filet amd peppercorn rub NY), 2 side dishes (onion rings and mashed potatoes), and we received complimentary dessert to celebrate our evening. 

P.s. We would normally order a vegetable side dish, but I wasn't feeling a veggie dish tonight. Lol. 

We also purchased photos to remember our experience! Wonderful venue, the views of the strip and water show were all breath taking

We recently visited Prime Steakhouse on May 27th and it was the the most disgusting meal I've ever had. The steak...or what they call steak...was uneatable. We spent over $350 on this meal and I would have to say I regret it each time I think about it. We had a great experience a few year back. We wanted to experience it with our kids and was almost a complete let down. If it wasn't for the fountain view I don't know what I would of done.

I brought my wife here for our 4 year anniversary and we got a seat close to the window that looks at the Bellagio fountain. Good atmosphere and a nice restaurant inside. The service was good and the waiters were friendly. We ordered a Caesar salad to start off, which we shared and I didn't like their dressing at all. My wife got the French Onion soup which she really liked. For our main course, I ordered the Rack of Lamb which was amazing. I really liked the sauce they put on it also. My wife ordered the Ribeye which was equally as good. We also had sides of steamed asparagus and mashed potatoes which both were good. We opted for no dessert as we were pretty stuffed. I was a little surprised that the restaurant didn't do anything at our table since it was our anniversary and I let them know that when I made the reservation. Usually a nice place like this will bring you out a plate of chocolates or a small dessert but we got completely stiffed this time. Overall the dinner was pretty good, but a little pricey for what it was ($217 after tip, no wine or alcohol at all). We said that we lived the meal and the view of the Bellagio fountain, but not somewhere we would be craving to come back to.

After getting an email from an employee several months back I decided to give it another shot. The food was great and so was the customer service.  Close to being 5 stars, but not quite there.  Maybe next time.  What I will tell you though is that it will be a good meal in a good location with service you would want.

Service - 3 stars - nothing fantastic. 

Food -  3- scallops slightly over cooked.  Steak was charred nicely, but cooked slightly over medium when I asked for medium rare. Macaroni and cheese was amazing. Intense cheese flavor. 

Drinks - 5 stars - boozy and flavorful. Old fashioned was da bomb.
My fiance took me here for our one year anniversary and it is one of the best in Las Vegas. The ambiance is great and the food was amazing. Will definitely be going back!
Ask to sit outside on a nice night.. food and service was great. We ordered the filet mignon, truffle mashed potatoes, cheddar broccoli and asparagus, yum

This place has an awesome steak and ahi tuna! But sad to say THEY GAVE MY PARTY  a HORRIBLE service! my experince with prime was 7 years ago and i couldnt shake off the horrible memory.. We were celebrating for my friend who was leaving for the navy, i give the ambiance a 4 star and the food a 4 star. everything was pricey but worth every bite. The thing i did not like most was the service! Just because our party was young and we did not order bottle service the waiter decided to ignore us! After we left the restaurant we approaced the person in charge and told them how horrible the service was. all he said was " what can i do to make it right" , like all he cared about was giving us comps thinking we were these snooty little rich kids who just wanted to complain. All we said was NOTHING we just wanted to inform you, because our intentions was not to get anything for free we just wanted to inform the person in charge of the horrible waiter... Would I dine again at PRIME? perhaps i really did enjoy their food and Prime Patio is to die for giving you an awesome view of the fountains as you sip on your coffee..

I chose Prime as the location to propose to my girlfriend yesterday and I am thrilled that I did. From the reservation a few days before all the way through they were kind, courteous and extremely helpful. I initially picked Prime for the location and knew that I wanted a seat on the patio where we can watch the fountains go off. They sat us at a table close to the water and right in the center. Could not have asked for more.

She ordered the 18oz ribeye and I ordered the beef short rib. We shared a side of the fingerling potatoes. Everything was delicious and exactly what you would expect from a fine dining experience. The bread basket has three bread options... sourdough, pretzel and a sweet raisin/walnut I believe. I have to say that I could have just ate bread and would have been thrilled. It was sooo good.

They brought out a beautiful little desert with Happy Birthday inscribed right as the fountains were going off as I had requested.

I look forward to returning to Prime down the line and know that I will receive top notch service and food.

Thank you to the staff (Charles-manager, Jesus-waiter and the rest of the team) for making our experience one to remember. You guys are awesome!

Love Prime!!! I have been numerous times and it has not disappointed. A huge fan of their Steak Tartare and Carpaccio as an appetizer. Some places throw to many dressings and toppings on their carpaccio, but at Prime they just do a perfect aioli. For entrees, I always try to get the filet and short ribs and split with someone. The filet cuts are always perfect and tender. The short ribs have the best flavor. The glaze they use on them is killer! Every time I come the exceed expectations. Top steakhouse!

Prime; one of the top four steak houses in Vegas.  A pantheon of beef.  Where Bacchus reigns over a 500+ selection of to die for wines.  Where the "brown" libations are over the top.

At Prime, the menu is seasonally updated.  The fall of 2012 features an outstanding, air flown colossal stone crab appetizer (three huge claws the size of your hand with a pile of knuckle and leg meat).  Heaven and at $75, and worth every penny.  Sweet.  Perfect.  The steak tartar on a platter of Carpaccio is delicious but slightly unbalanced with over the top Asian spice heat.  Finally, the bacon wrapped shrimp.  Wow.  The fat of the bacon permeates the rich, sweet flesh of the barely cooked through shrimp.  Outstanding.

Beef mains are to die for.  Japanese A5 Kobe cuts of beef (4oz minimum $35 per ounce).  Sublime if you don't over indulge.  A four to six ounce portion is enough for anyone.  Offered in a strip, rib, or fillet cut.  The rib is the most flavorful.  DO NOT ORDER THIS IF YOU WANT YOUR BEEF COOKED BEYOND RARE.  You are wasting your money as the fat will melt during cooking and the beef taste like any other piece of beef.

The 30 day dry aged, bone fillet is excellent.  Huge umame finish without tasting edgy.  Soft and tender.  The veal chop is equally good.  Sweet, deep beef flavor from free ranged calves.  Double cut, perfectly seared and moist throughout.  

All mains come with sauces and sides.  They match and are very flavorful but do not pass on ordering some veg and off the menu potato dauphinois to share.  Sides are perfectly cooked.  Rich and refreshing.

Killer wine list with great depth of cult wines.  Great values to be found at higher price points (best priced Screaming Eagle in Vegas). Outstanding cognac selection.

Service is excellent.  Friendly and extremely efficient.

Note:  Unlike most Vegas restaurants, for reservations, you MUST be a high status member of Mlife to book the best tables and times on short notice.  If you use OpenTable, make your reservation at least 60 days in advance  Outdoor and window tables where you can view the incredible fountain show at the Bellagio are very difficult to secure.

A truly memorable experience in Vegas not afforded to everyone.  Do whatever it takes to try it.  

A dozen plus visits since my initial review.  Extremely consistent.  Highly Recommended.
The food is delicious, top notch. It is pricy but you get what you pay for. Great for special occasions. I absolutely love the ginger sweet potatoes, and every other thing here as well.
The food was amazing. The host was completely helpful and the view was awesome. Will be back for sure!

I don't think I can judge this restaurant fairly until I have a second visit. I was here last Saturday for a wedding dinner. There was about 25 people in our party. The service was okay, not great. To be fair, yes we were in a large party but also if you can't provide superior service for that many people you probably shouldn't accept the challenge. A few of us had to ask for our drinks 3 -4 times before getting them. I asked for a simple ice tea 3 times. The ambiance was beautiful and the food was great! My filet was cooked perfect, so tender it melted. The bearnaise sauce was awesome! The creamed spinach, Yukon gold mashed and sauted mushrooms were delish and I could have ate them all night long.

Made reservation a month ago for seating on the outside patio. They called me the evening prior to tell me it was unavailable due to an event. That was very disappointing. Still kept the reservation for inside seating since the reputation for the steak is still pretty good. Had the Dry-Aged Bone-In Rib Eye and 2 sides (creamed spinach and mushrooms). The medium rare steak was indeed very good, but I've had slightly better. The sides were excellent. We also got dessert (Bread pudding and don't remember the name) both were amazing. Service was on point. And vibe was like a classy gentleman feel.

This is a great restaurant, especially if you are meat eater.  I was not overjoyed with my two salads, but what can you expect at a steak house?  Great ambiance.  Excellent service.  The wine list did not get me excited, but then again, wine's that go well with steak are not my thing.  I probably won't go back, but only because I don't love steak.

Will you still love me
When I'm no longer young and beautiful?
Will you still love me
When I got nothing but my aching soul?
I know you will, I know you will at PRIME STEAKHOUSE! - Lana Del Rey (young and beautiful)

Honestly if I wasn't able to secure an outdoor patio table, I wouldn't have eaten here. The view was a very big draw for us so I'm happy it worked out.

Pros:
-as expected, the view is spectacular
-it's not as hot as you think, the slight breeze from the water helps
-the bread and caesar salad was very good
-great picture opportunities

Cons:
-they only had one main server (with many sous servers) to take orders and give out the checks for the entire patio area of like 9 tables (we had 2 hours set aside for dinner before the show and we ended up being a little late)
-if you don't order a steak here, don't expect much as the seafood is just average here
-dress code somewhat enforced, might be inconvenient for people walking around in the crazy summer heat all day wearing shorts

Overall, I did have a good time with a few hiccups in terms of service but my steak + foie gras was good so I was happy. It's a good experience to try once but with so many steakhouses in LV, this is a one and done for me.

This is a 5 star review! If your visiting Las Vegas or looking to have a possible life alternating steak then this is the place. 

I'm usually on top of snapping a few photos of everyone dinner plate. However, it was a special night celebrating my brothers bday and I got so excited to try all the dishes, I forgot. I've been on a health kick lately so this was a cheat meal. I must say FAITHFULLY cheated. It was delicious!! My brother enjoyed his dinner, too. That was my biggest mission. He religiously and generously is a high profile high roller in the family who has been to all the top spots around town. So it's hard to server this man a good, GREAT steak. The server suggested a the old aged prime rib! In addition, they brought 3 different house steak sauces to our table. Generally, I never care for the extra sauces but I couldn't resist. You have to try all 3 of them. That's exactly what I got and exactly what I recommend. Any restaurant at the Bellagio is generally a hit. Plan accordingly and treat yourself! MY TASTEBUDS WERE IMPRESSED!!!

Lack of one star is the service! I felt like the nagging customer reminding them we needed a refill, we needed a dessert menu, we needed our bill, we needed our server. It was towards closing time so most of the staff were occupied cleaning the tables down. :(

I went here with a girl friend of mine. I will always love this place. The menu alone is amazing with so many choices. I ordered the lobster tail and I couldn't finish it cause it was so big. This place was so good. I highly recommend going here as a part of a really complete Vegas experience. You will enjoy it. I wish I could remember our servers name, but she was very nice. Very good service. I can't wait to take more friends here. Enjoy

Well, this is a first for me, in writing a review where the experience was so poor on entry to engaging the restaurant that I can't even comment on the food.

Tonight is our 10 year anniversary, so I thought it fitting that we go to an iconic location while in Las Vegas, The Bellagio.

Prime is their center field front row top steak restaurant, or so they market themselves.

The idea is a traditional steakhouse in an ideal setting with indoor and outdoor dining while viewing the majestic Bellagio fountains.

I took the time to call this afternoon and secure a late reservation (9:30pm) indicating clearly the importance of the date and asking for a special location.

When we arrived, after walking through the Bellagio AKA Grand Central Station meets Disneyland's crowd, we approached the hostess stand.

Now a restaurant selling itself as a top notch experience should have a direct human interaction upon entry, not two teenage girls working behind a desk.

Worse, what clearly must have been the assistant manager walked past us, ignoring us on the way to take a phone call that was obviously more important than acknowledging their guests.

While we stood there dressed in suit and my wife's beautiful gown, we endured the conversation that consumed the attention of both "hostess" explaining to the fat man in shorts and an untucked polo shirt, that he was welcome to come in later but needed to wear pants.

Now at this point I have to laugh at the irony. Clearly Prime's reputation is strong enough from a perception standpoint to bring clients in, and the stuffy 'dress code' is there to enhance the "exclusivity" if you will. All the while the service is worse than the worst McDonalds restaurant. What a joke.

We finally connected with one of the hourly employees at the front counter and they proceeded to try to negotiate with me about wether we had actually requested an outside table or not. It was the equivalent of a conversation with a night club promoter about what it would take to get he table you want. Happy Anniversary I guess... 

The good news is we went to the bar where a very friendly, competent and quality old school bartender provided real service. We ordered a glass of champagne, settled the check and informed person number 6 that I had to interact with that we would be going elsewhere.

They quickly back peddled, all of a sudden a front row table outside was available.

I politely informed them that we would be going elsewhere.

The four employees were huddling around with the real manager and watching to see what we would do. I doubt they expected that I would take the time to share the truth about the experience on line.

Look, here is the bottom line. When you are heading out to an expensive dinner, especially for an important event, and preparing to spend a considerable amount of money, you deserve the absolute best service and mentality. There's no entitlement here. Just because your restaurant is overlooking the Bellagio fountains doesn't mean it's automatically any better than a revolving restaurant exploiting its view to sell you overpriced food.

The restaurant is down stairs from the Bellagio Esplanade, it's a stuffy, dark, cave like environment with a very heavy small of cooked and worked over food. Think senior retirement center cafe with expensive decor.

If you want my advice, there are a dozen steak houses in town, all much better in every way. I would recommend the SW at Wynn or Carnevino at Pallazo. Of course I can't speak to the food since I couldn't stand the mentality. I can only tell you about the smell and the attitude. Both stink.

Try the bar I guess then high tail it out of there before they take your cash and feed the snob beast.

Better luck elsewhere.
Awesome classy place out of the old time Vegas era.  Loved the food and quality and service. For those special dates or just feeling like spoiling oneself.

Loved the ambiance, elegant, classy, we got a window view of the billagio water show. Perfect! There are people there to take pictures If you want, but overpriced. 
Food was great, I feel a little overpriced for small portion sizes, i got scallops still hungry after, but we didn't get apps. Compared to other classy restaurants on strip, but nothing major, just slightly.
Breads were great, truffle mashed absolutely delicious!! Ate every bite!!! 
Severs were absolutely great: helpful, polite, gracious.

Not worth the money.  Went here because it was at Bellagio. Expensive and steak was not seasoned and  chewy. Side dishes were small and something I could make at home.  Lot better steak house in Houston,  where I'm from.  Never going back.  Good service though.

Yeah, not the best place I have had steak.  My rib-eye was actually very good but my wife's fillet trio was just plain bad. But what really made me give Prime two stars was the service.  Mike and Walter were our servers.  Walter was great but Mike, not so much.  Basically he was just indifferent towards us.  I expect more from a $$$$ steak house.

Great steakhouse! Nice and friendly staff. It was an anniversary dinner, and everything was perfect! A nice spot near the fountain view windows, a delicious steak, and a nice anniversary dessert from the restaurant. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that I made reservations 3 weeks in advance and still had to wait to be seated. Also the steak knives were dull, I ended up using my fork to cut my steak, but that shows how tender and delicious the steak was. Great job on this one guys!

Great food, but the service was totally horrible. Our waiter was "Bob" and he was very tacky. First, we brought our own wine and expected a corkage fee. This is typical. Bob seemed as though this bothered him. Was very snooty about it and said couldn't cork anything on the menu. He would "send his guy over". "Guy" comes over and is totally cool. None of our wines were on the menu. He made recommendations as to what to drink first. Cool! So rest of dinner was fine, food was great. Still picked up on this weird snootiness from Bob the whole time. We get our check, pay, sign. As were sitting there in the middle of our conversion, he flat out interrupts us, sticks his arm in front of our faces to take the signed check before we even left. Absolutely unprofessional and rude. You do not cut me off mid sentence and take the check from our table before we leave. This is not Denny's. I really wish I would've known that he was going to pull such tacky behavior before I tipped him. Will only patronize Mastros from now on. Prime pales in comparison.

Best steak house in Vegas by far. Try the fillet or porterhouse. The sides make for an excellent meal. Very professional staff and nice atmosphere. Warning : Random photographer will harass you for pictures once every 30 minutes like a panhandler.

Amazing service. 
Amazing food. 
Amazing wine list. 
Amazing views. 

The house sauce for the beef is to die for. It's a homemade soy rice wine and perfectly complements the meat. 

There is a bone-in 12oz fillet that you wouldn't know it was there unless the wait staff tells you about it. It's not a special, it's just not on the menu. The truffled mashed potatoes are excellent - very rich. The gulf shrimp wrapped in bacon as an appetizer was good. 

Inside is stated decor. We sat outside on the patio, overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio. We had a new show every 15 minutes. 

There is a dress code - jacket or at least collar shirt/tie for guys. It is pricey (2 of us had $300 check). But you get what you pay for in food and service. 

I have to say that the bathrooms were not what I expected of a restaurant of this caliber. They were kind of rundown, not spacious, there were hand towels that they were out of, also out of soap. Not that I need an attendant to hand me a towel and expect a big fat tip, just a little kept up.
Always looking forward coming to Prime. Best of everything. Great food, ambiance and staff. Thank you and Merry Xmas
I'd like recommend this place if you are looking for a fine restaurant with fabulous view. I'll give 5 stars for Short rib steak and truffle mashed potatoes.

As Borat would say, "Veddy Niceee." Was it the best steak I've ever had? No. But, it was very good.

We went there on a relatively-slow Sunday night. We didn't make reservations because honestly, we didn't think we'd need any. We got there at 8:30 and asked for a table for three. Even though the dining room looked busy, it wasn't completely full. They asked if we had a reservation, we said no, and they put one in for us for 9:00 and told us to come back at 9:00. So, we went and gambled, then came back and our table was ready right when we got there. I appreciate promptness.

The dining room is a tad on the small side, but dark and cozy. The chairs are nice and comfortable, and the tables are large. I felt underdressed in a T-shirt and jeans. Though they don't "enforce" a dress code, they have a sign that says they recommend a jacket for men. Not sure what the dress code for women is, but I'm pretty sure my T-shirt and jeans didn't quite make the cut.

Unfortunately, we didn't get a table by the window. We could still see the water show from our table, but we couldn't hear the music. I'm sure if we had a reservation well in advance, we probably could have requested a window table, but oh well. But yeah, if you make reservations, ask for a window table! They're really nice and the water show comes on every 10 minutes or so. It's a nice little distraction during dinner, y'know?

Anyway, our waiter was the bomb. Generally at these uppity-steakhouse places, the waiters are a tad pompous. But, ours was awesome. He cracked jokes with us, told us what the specials were, and answered any questions we had about the menu. He also made great wine recommendations as well. He was great!

We each got a steak as well as a few sides (a T-bone for my friend, filet for my bf, and some kind of regular steak for me). Our food came out in about 20 minutes. My steak was very good -- moist, juicy, and flavorful. My only small complaint is that it was a *tad* overcooked. I asked for medium-rare, and it came out a little more on the medium side. All of their steaks are accompanied by several homemade sauces. My favorite one was their house sauce, which was some soy-based sauce. It was so yummy! For sides, we got the creamed spinach, asparagus, and sauteed mushrooms. The sides were an OK size. All three of us could split them, but a bigger helping would have been great. The asparagus was not good at all. They were overcooked and more soggy than crunchy. I was disappointed because that's one of my favorite veggies. The creamed spinach was good, but could have used some garlic or other flavoring. The mushrooms were by far the best side dish. They were flavorful and so delicious! If I had known that in advance, I would have gotten two orders of the mushrooms and passed on the asparagus. 

We passed on dessert, since we were all pretty much full. When the bill came, it was a tad over $300. Not bad for the three of us. All in all, it was a positive experience. I probably wouldn't go there again, seeing as how I don't go to Vegas much and would like to try a different steakhouse next time. But, I definitely liked it and would recommend it to a friend.

Setting is elegant as it gets.  The service is polite and attentive, but they are not rushing.  Your meal will be an hour at least.  We were seated on the patio as close as you can get to the Bellagio waters.  Best seat in the house for the water show.

A fantastic experience with great family and friends for my bachelor party weekend.  Truly a memory I will treasure for the rest of my life.  The food was spectacular and so was the bill!  But for the mood of the evening, it was perfect.  Anyone who was been knows that if you've been to Vegas once, you've been a thousand times, but for Prime I will probably return with my wife for a getaway in the future.
just had dessert and wine here, fantastic stuff.  not getting into details but the lemon tart was awesome.  also, the view of the water show from the patio is breathtaking.  definitely go.

Was stuck between 4-5 stars, but quality of food won the day.  This was one of the best meals I've ever had.

The lobster, broccoli, capaccio and au gratin potatoes were some of the best versions of each I've ever tasted, and my entire party agreed.  My steak was just okay, cooked perfectly but a little light on flavor, however the sauce (soy, rice wine vinegar, etc.?) was amazing.  I wanted to bathe in it.

The place is definitely upscale, and though we weren't dressed like slobs, we were clearly underdressed a bit, which may have accounted for the very average and not overly attentive service.  Maybe they thought we couldn't afford the place, but the service was decidedly average.  The waiter was nice, but didn't seem to take much time at our table to make suggestions, explain the menu or stop by to make sure we were doing okay.  Considering I spent $250+ on my portion alone, I would have expected that to be elite as well.

Still, like I said before, food rules the day ultimately at restaurants and in that regard it was amazing.

I would suggest a sport coat for guys at the least and not just a buttoned-up shirt or nice sweater like we had on, as most parties seemed a little more dressed up.  Other than that, amazing.

We had a lovely dinner last night. The host staff was very accommodating by reserving a table on the patio for our dinner. The patio was beautiful, and the view of the fountain show was spectacular. It was a very intimate, date-worthy spot. Our food was delicious, with my bone-in ribeye cooked perfectly, melting in my mouth. The service was a little spotty. My date had to ask a few different people for his soft drink several times. Our server (I cannot remember his name - he was probably in his thirties, Asian-American with glasses) was very rigid and quite inattentive. I could tell he was profiling his tables and spending the majority of his time with the wealthiest looking table in his section. His SA was very pleasant, and very attentive. The food runner did auction off our entrees, which is something that I'm not accustomed to at establishments like this, but was very pleasant. The portion size of the bacon wrapped shrimp was awkward since there were two people enjoying it, but the sauce was to die for, and the shrimp AND bacon were cooked perfectly. I would order this again, just for myself, though. I am eager to return to try more of the seafood and wine selections.
#ComingFromPeopleInTheIndustry

I ordered medium rare steak I got medium well and well done steak. I just want to let our server know what is wrong my order. I wasn't trying to complain and ask for anything. But the answer she gave me is because of the lighting in the dining room.

I haven't been here in two years but I can still feel the filet mignon melting in my mouth. The ambience of the indoor dining room is above par, although due to the glamour that is Vegas it pales a little in comparison to some of it's nearby counterparts. The wine list is extensive and fair and their white chocolate martini is one of the best I've ever had. I started with The steak tartare. Of the five times I've had this dish this ranks second (to Tony Bourdain's). The entree was amazing. The truffle mashed potatoes seasoned perfectly, the filet melting in my mouth. They asked my party if we would like to move to the terrace for dessert with water fountains. The chocolate Lave cake was intense and could have used a little more ice cream ala mode. Overall one of the best meals of my life.

Items Selected:
Raisin Walnut, Pretzel, White, Baguette, Salted Butter
Seared Hudson Valley Foie Gras - Strawberry Rhubarb Jam, Marcona Almonds, Shaved Raw Almonds
Klein Constantia Vin de Constance 2008
Prime Onion Soup - Gruyere & Emmentaler
Market Tomatoes - Burrata Cheese, Arugula, Balsamic Vinegar, Basil
Clouds Rest 2012 Forbidden Sauvignon Blanc
Gratin Dauphinois - Comte Cheese
Glazed Market Mushrooms
Parmesan-Crusted Organic Chicken - Artichokes & Lemon Butter
18-oz Dry Aged Bone-In Rib Eye
Sauces - Soy Rice Wine, Bearnaise, Peppercorn
Walt 2012 Pinot Noir Blue Jay Anderson Valley
Barbieri Syrah 2011 Colson Canyon Vineyard
Warm Valrhona Chocolate Cake - Vanilla Ice Cream
Coconut Souffle - White Chocolate Feuilletine & Dark Chocolate Sorbet
Yuzu Pudding Cake - Toasted Almond Sorbet
Prime Cinnamon Bread Pudding - Salted Caramel Ice Cream, Golden Delicious Apples
Double Espresso on Ice

Soon to renovate the outdoor patio, but carrying over a room thought to be one of the most gorgeous in the world, PRIME Steakhouse at Bellagio had long been on a list of fine dining experiences yet to be enjoyed in Las Vegas, an admitted mistake and given the quality of the cuisine, service, and setting, perhaps even a sin.

Toqued by Rob Moore, whose brief departure to open JG Steakhouse at Aria has seen it too grow into a place held in good regard,  it was at a two-top big enough for four that my friend and I were seated, the Bellagio water show visible through large windows to the right while the draped dining room decorated in fine art soon filled to capacity at our left.

Served by a team of at least six, Sommelier John Burke entertaining us with stories from Steve Wynn's reign as well as those of bottles sold in excess of $60K, it was in a four course meal that two-hours was spent talking, the ingredient sourcing, portions, and preparations all justifying prices that may turn many diners away.

Far more classical than Carnevino or Ramsay and certainly more elegant than Delmonico or CUT, the evening began with bubbles alongside a basket of bread and making quick work of salty pretzel batons as well as a nutty raisin loaf it would not be long before a starter of seared foie gras was presented, the acidic sauce of rhubarb perhaps the most interesting steakhouse pairing seen to this moment while shaved almonds worked wonders to meld flavors of fruit to the unctuous liver of duck.

Told that soups and salads at PRIME are far more fanciful that the typical broth or wedge, round two consisted of heirloom tomatoes dressed in milky burrata atop vinegar splashed arugula plus a truly inspired bowl of French Onion, the blend of cheeses lightly toasted atop a crispy brioche float while the potage beneath was beefy enough to be noticed, though the bulk of the flavor came from the caramelized namesake ingredient itself.

No doubt a place with more than just beef to offer, though the options for steaks are plentiful without going overboard on information about sourcing from several different farms, it was in the 18oz Dry Aged Bone-In Rib Eye cooked medium rare that $71 was invested, the quality of the product allowed to show for itself while the menu's cheapest protein shined even more brightly, the pounded half-chicken fried textbook crisp beneath a Parmesan crust as sides and sauces each proved every bit as compelling, the Soy Rice Wine and Comte Potatoes each well deserving of their server-suggested clout.

Unable to resist desserts, the menu's only service error occurring when Jean-Georges' signature molten cake was served in place of the souffle selection of the trio, suffice it to say that as good as each item was there is no doubt that those with an eye for the dramatic will be wowed by cinnamon bread pudding, the tableside saucing seeing a dome of cocoa melted into the custard soaked base as notes sweet, spiced, and salty all dance on the palate.

Trending a bit more pricey than other Steakhouses on the Strip, and somewhat limited by offering only two breeds of beef with fish and seafood not really venturing too far outside the box, PRIME is undoubtedly a place worth visiting for those looking for a 'fine dining steakhouse,' particularly those averse to loud music or looking for a more romantic night out.

This steak house is worth the splurge.  I treated my husband to Prime for his 45th birthday.  We were seated in their more intimate dining room, a remarkable view of the fountain show...the best seats in the house!

The kale Caesar salad was surprisingly good.  It's the perfect summer salad.  My husband  was completely silent as he inhaled his  French onion soup.  Afterwards, he had a huge Kool Aid smile.  The salmon,  NY steak, mac and cheese,  truffled potatoes, and chocolate cake were all stellar.   The view was extraordinary!  A table elegantly placed  near a window  with  gorgeous  panoramic  look into the  dancing waters of the Bellagio fountain, and the strip in the backdrop!

Love  it and going back for more!

We were seated promptly and we got a great view of the fountains. I really liked the view but I didn't really enjoy the decor it was dark. A little too gloomy for me. We ordered our food and it was good. I ordered the sea bass it was good but I wish they told me it was lightly breaded because I probably would have chosen the salmon. Our server was not good at all. We had to pour our wine 4 times and this wasn't cheap wine. In a restaurant like this you would they would be on point. The desert was pretty good we ordered a couple dishes and we enjoyed every single one of them.

PROS: Desert, view of the fountains
CONS: service, decor

This meal was a complete letdown, especially given the high prices. The service was average, and the food was even worse. I'm attaching a photo of my "medium well" steak. If you are to spend this kind of money on a meal, I'd advise you to go to one of the many other "fancy" restaurants on the strip that have far better food and service. Prime was NOT ready for prime time

Arrived 5 minutes before reservation time. Sat 20 minutes before being seated. Ordered dry aged ribeye with Mac n cheese and a Chimay. Ambiance and decor were top notch. Received steak and was just ok. Was fattier than expected however. For as much as I paid for this steak was, I felt underwhelmed. Mac n cheese was a bit too sharp and runny. Service was great.

I was there for a work dinner...I sat next to a co-workers wife who I did not know. We both ordered the 8oz fillet cooked medium; they both came back rare. We sent them back, which was no big deal, I had my sides on my plate and hers on her plate. They returned both our steaks, unfortunately they did not replete them on new plates AND they put my steak on her plate and her steak on my plate, we only knew this because we had different sides. VERY amature. Our server could care 'o less...he was probably upset that the wine we ordered wasn't $300 a bottle. I pointed out the error, they were semi-concerned. I didn't really complain, but wasn't too happy. The manager came over and apparently knew what happened, she graciously took both of our meals off the bill. I was appreciative. I would still not go back.

Reservations a must. Great food. Had their special Kobe steak. It was beyond good as the meat just melted in your mouth. The sides were average- nothing stood out. Extensive wine list. Order a recommended red that complemented the food well. Decor was beautiful. We had 12 people in our party so we received a small room to the side. Felt like a rockstar walking in.

Went to a rehearsal dinner in August 2011 at Prime. The place is beautiful. Everyone was in place and the guests all looked fantastic. 

The food was of course really expensive and the portions were small. We all took a group photo.. and each guest got a copy that was very nice so we could remember the evening. 

Until the manager realized he had made a mistake and they were not paid for. He immediately took all the photos back and told us if we wanted them we had to purchase them for $40!! 

All in all it was a good time, long walk for Aria Hotel but I would say it was worth it.

Amazing. 

Mama took me here for my big 4-0. service was excellent from the beginning. we had a reservation for 7p, but, requested patio seating for their water show. we grabbed a couple seats at the bar for some cocktails. friendly bartender served up a great old fashion and dirty martini. got seated on the patio about 30mins later. not too bad for a convention weekend.

table service was prompt and accommodating. we ordered a Caesar to share to start. mama ordered the lamb and i got the bone-in ribeye with the accompanying sauces. side of mushrooms and broccoli. a nice glass of house chianti put it all together. 

food was all amazing. juicy and buttery ribeye. tender lamb chops. the mushrooms were a meal in of themselves with how meaty they were. oh, and the water show is THE best dinner view in vegas. if you can afford the $$$$ price and the slight wait, grab a seat at the patio here.

Excellent restaurant!  I made reservations for my wife and I about 2 weeks in advance.  Got a seat next to the fountains and that made the meal a memorable one to say the least.  Very fancy place, as is just about everything in the Bellagio.  

We ordered the butter poached king crab as an app.  It was basically huge chunks of crab floating in a butter sauce that was absolutely delicious.  A little rich, but that's what butter poached crab is supposed to be.  I ordered the surf and turf for my meal and the wife had a great petite filet.  Both were mouth watering dishes and couldn't have been cooked any more perfectly.  The server was excellent and really knew his stuff.  He recommended a really good wine with our meal that was the perfect pairing.  

Unfortunately we didn't have room for dessert, but that was ok becasue i could taste my lobster for the rest of the evening.  Like others have said, be prepared for a $300 bill if you like wine with your meal.  

This was one of the best meals I have ever had.  Well worth the price!
Amazing! First time we ate here. Would definitely come back. Excellent service and food came out fast.

When I walked into this restaurant I loved the decor and comfort of my chair.  However, as the dining experience continued I found the atmosphere to be too dark.  My party and I got sleepy.  I LOVED my beet salad, but my short ribs were VERY salty.  I few others  in my party felt the same about their dishes.  The gnocchi was very disappointing.  No dessert as dessert menu was underwhelming.  I had only a glass of wine, but flipped through a very extensive wine list.  I found the waiter a little over the top and at times I became annoyed.  Lastly, the photographer who takes professional photos and puts a guilt trip on you  for not buying a proof DID NOT fit the atmosphere.  I'd go back for that beet salad!

When you pay PRIME prices you expect PRIME service and PRIME food. This was at least our fifth visit to PRIME and very likely our last.

We have celebrated birthdays and anniversaries at PRIME and on December 23, 2010 were looking for a quiet getaway and a splurge on dinner with perfect service as we had enjoyed in the past. We arrived at our reservation time. Our prior request for a table by the window was not honored but it was a nice table and we were happy when we were seated. In all past visits I would have given PRIME a five star rating. We ordered drinks and appetizers. We soon noticed that the highly attentive, though not imposing service we have come to love and expect at PRIME was not present. Drinks took over 10 minutes and bread took 20. The shrimp cocktail was amazing as usual, keeping in mind that 4 shrimp for $20 ought to be amazing. 

We each ordered the Baby Iceberg Lettuce with Crispy Bacon & Maytag Bleu Cheese Dressing. This was served about 30 minutes into our visit. (By then my husband was ready for another drink and started trying to catch someone's eye to request one. Our waiter was occupied with the table of 5 seated next to us. Finally my husband asked someone else for another drink. It took at least 15-20 more minutes for the drink to arrive and the person who brought it was not our waiter and not until after we had complained to the manager.) For $18 each you might expect some interesting salad presentation. I enjoyed eating the salad but not the fact that I had to cut the lettuce myself. It looked like they had just cut a center slice of the baby lettuce head and plopped it on a plate. My husband thought the salad was too rich as there were blue cheese chunks and heavy blue cheese dressing along with very thick bacon. 

For the main course we each ordered the small filet mignon $44 for 8oz. These don't come with any side dishes so we also ordered sides of potatoes and mushrooms to share. We had been there about an hour by now and my drink was empty, our waters were empty and our waiter was now taking an order at a third table. I asked a staff member passing by if I could please speak to a manager. The General Manager came right to our table. I told her we were sad that the service was so poor and that our waiter seemed not to have time for us. My husband still did not have the second drink. The Manager was extremely polite and said she was very sorry and that she would take care of things. This did get things going -- though we did not like to have to complain to get decent service. My husband's second drink came a minute after she walked away. Then the filet were served but again not by our waiter. I suspect they had been sitting "up" for a while. The filet were cold to the touch but each had two small charred green chili peppers sizzling next to them. The charred pepper smell was overpowering to the point that it hit the sinus right as they lifted off the silver cover.  Within that same minute sides were delivered. We got the mushrooms but instead of potatoes, we got creamed spinach. 

That was it. The dinner we had been looking forward to for months was ruined. Since neither of us like hot peppers or spinach, we decided to leave. I asked for the manager again and told her that we needed to leave as the wrong side and hot peppers along with the poor service had ruined our dinner. I asked her to please charge what we had eaten up to that point to our room, but she declined to do so. She was very empathetic and offered to reseat us and start over or send whatever we wanted back to our room. This was a kind offer but we were just not up for either as our experience was ruined. By then it was around 9pm and we were just tired of trying to beg for service in what is supposed to be a four star place. 

After many good dinners and fond memories of the exceptionally fine service, superior food and decor as well as the beautiful view of the fountains, I don't think we will go back. This awful experience has ruined it for us. Given that this hotel opened in 1998, we both wondered whether the waiters we had so very much enjoyed in prior visits had moved on to newer places or were just not working.

Really a 4.5. Obviously the food is fantastic, only knocked it down .5 because it just feels a little stuffy inside and that isn't my thing. Tuna Ribbons and Steak Tartare - amazing. My filet mignon was cooked nicely (medium rare) and I love all the sauces they bring for you. Sides are ordered separately, and our waiter did lead us astray saying they were individually portioned. Uhmm NO. 2-3 people can easily split them, especially the mashed potatoes, which are more like liquid gold. Also worth trying: the wild mushrooms.
I order bone in age rib eye, medium well. Very dry. My wife order filet Mignon medium well, very good. But service not to good. I think for this price much better Steak house around.

Vegas is a great spot for every cuisine and all different types of restaurants. I have tried numerous steakhouses in Vegas, but Prime is definitely the best one I have tried so far!

Went there for a special anniversary dinner, called a day ahead for reservation which was very smooth and easy.
We arrived there about five minutes early, were welcomed by a friendly professional host, who immediately took us to our table.

The staff is as high-end as the place and the Bellagio.
The ambiance is set great, very lush, classic with a trendy touch.

Price should not be an issue for the diner, it's nothing unexpected for a restaurant of this level.

We had the caviar and seafood assorted platters..which was great. Onto to the mains, we ordered porterhouse and fillet mignon, ending it with creme brle.

The patio has a one of a kind view on the Bellagio fountains, if you're lucky, you'll view a musical fountains' show.

It's tough to standout when you're in Vegas since the competition is real high, but I recommend Prime for anyone to have a night to remember.

My favorite restaurant in Vegas and I wish I had one closer!  Every time we go to Vegas my husband knows no matter what, he has to make a reservation here.  Without fail every time I am there I order the tuna extremely rare and it comes rolled in rice puffs.  I don't care for the sauce that it comes with so I order the soy rice wine sauce and oh my gosh... heaven on a plate!  The other thing at prime that I have and I have about three of them every time is the martini called the cable car which is one of the Bellagio's signature martinis.
