I dream about this meal and that drink!  On a side note... I love the bartender in the front.  He has been there for many years and he is just a delight!

So this steakhouse was pretty good, but to be honest STK @Cosmo or SW@ Wynn or Botero @Encore are better.  I had the bone in Filet with the crab mashed potatoes that was the chef's special for the evening.  Both were very good.  I started with an heirloom tomato and mozzarella salad, very good, but hard to mess that up.

Creamed spinach was very boring and lacked flavor. I had to add salt to it & was missing the 'creamed' part of it.  Mashed potatoes were too soupy for me, was like baby food.  But the creamed corn was a definite winner.  Their peppercorn sauce was rather boring for me.  

We asked for a table by the window or water so we could watch the Bellagio water show.  We go the furthest thing from it.  Some lady came and asked if we wanted our pictures taken at the table...TACKY...where are we Disneyworld???  They also were over booked or something b/c towards the end of the meal we felt pressured to 'hurry up and go'  like they needed the table.

Very upscale atmosphere, business meeting dinner rather than a date place {stk is a date place}.

see pix of my salad

Disappointing...

My wife and I were very excited to dine here, which made our experience that much more disappointing...

Reservation - arrived promptly at 7:00, were told we would have to wait.  Waiting is not generally a problem, but it is when the restaurant is not full and tables of two that showed up after us were sat.  Also, another couple (who arrived after us) were led to their table only to return a minute later because they did not like the location.  The hostess then asked if they would like to be seated in another section because there were "plenty" of tables available...meanwhile it is 7:30 and we are still waiting.

Bread - stale...literally difficult to swallow 

Appetizers - options were limited as I am not a seafood/shellfish guy, but we were not planning on ordering one anyway

Steak - this is where it gets really disappointing...To start, the presentation was awful.  Prime makes a show about wheeling their silver covered plates throughout the restaurant, but I did not know our steak had arrived until it was unceremoniously delivered over my shoulder onto the table.  The steaks (Bone-in Ribeye, their most well liked steak according to our server) were visibly unappealing.  To start, the cut was very thin, an inch at most.  I am not sure what they were trying to do with the butter when cooking the steaks, but they did not finish - it was a gelatinous mess.  I have never seen something like this, even I can properly melt butter when grilling steaks at home.  I wish I had taken a picture because of how terrible it looked.  Because I order my steaks Black & Blue it is difficult to comment on the temperature, but my wife's was not hot, or even warm.  In all fairness, the flavor was decent.

Sides - I am not big on sides, I tend to only need the steak, but my wife loves mashed potatoes.  We ordered a side of the Yukon mashed.  I think they served it in a bowl the size of a coffee cup.  For $18.  I understand this is an expensive restaurant and you are paying for ambiance, location, etc. - but $18 for a coffee cup of Potato Buds is a tad excessive.  We both agreed these "potatoes" either came powdered from a box/bag/sack, or their potato masher competes in strong man competitions - you could almost drink them, with nary a lump to be found. They were also lacking in flavor, and again, not even warm.

Desert - Although we agreed we would be throwing good money after bad my wife ordered the molten chocolate cake.  Another disappointment...decent flavor, but the cake was extremely dry.  Presentation was lacking and it was pretty evident it also came from a box or plastic tray.

Service - The staff were average, not exceptional, and we did not feel like valued guests.

Overall - We expected so much more from this dinner.  We have been to many high end steakhouses across the country, and this experience was one of the least enjoyable.  I don't post often, but felt I had too on this one...

Outstanding steakhouse. I'm usually not one for 'top dollar' kinda restaurants but I was in Vegas and it was my girlfriend's birthday. We just came out from the Pacquiao Bradley fight and has reservations here.  
Let me say, I would normally have been taken back by the prices, but since I was 'in Vegas', I figured I would just roll with it. 
Conclusion: I spent a lot of money, however, I really enjoyed the experience and the food. 

I had the filet mignon, and my gf had the lobster tail. The main entrees wee great.  The sides were also exceptional. They were pricey for side dishes but they did not disappoint. 
The best part was the 'house sauce' steak sauce. I forget the name but it was a ginger-soy sauce., that was crucial to the overall party going on inside my mouth! 

Scrumptious, to say the least. 

Now, one thing j really didn't appreciate at first was the photographer chick that shower up at our table and asked us if we would "line our procured taken".  
Look, my gf is Asian and as you should know -- Asians like to take pictures. She is no exception. So, there we were.   "taking pictures".
The initial result there was a $70 cost. But, the nice part is we have a 4 pack of nice pictures of that moment -/ which was very forced. ..  By the photographer. 
Anyway, it was still very special and since I was 'in Vegas' -- I rolled with it and had a great time. 

Thumbs up, Prime!

After carefully researching LV steakhouses - and having been to a good many before - we decided on Prime for dinner before seeing Love a few weeks ago.

I am giving it three stars on a straight ratings system.  Grading on a curve, using other top-end steakhouses as a reference, I would give it two stars.

The food was good, but not great.  The small lobster tail in my $100+ (DANG!) surf and turf was overcooked.  I've never sent anything back at a nice restaurant before and I rarely send anything back period, but that had to be resolved.  Staff was cool about it and handled it perfectly.

Service was good, but not amazing.  Our waiter was nice enough, but was not allowed to taste the bottle of wine that we brought, which was kind of a drag.  We never even smelled the somalier.  Where the eff was (s)he?

Finally, as we finished dinner and the wildly overpriced Chteau DY'quem, we were asked to move out to the frikken patio!  The restaurant was nowhere near full.  

Turns out, however, that last half an hour after dinner was the highlight of the meal:  we got to enjoy the water show, finish our wine and cast occasional glances at TV's own Tom Selleck sitting nearby.

Unlike meals that I have had at other fine establishments, looking back, nothing about Prime (other than the patio scene) stands out to me.

Here's the thing:  when dropping major coin of this sort, I expect to be dazzled.  Good does not cut it.  Prime just didn't dazzle me.

When searching for the perfect steak in Vegas, all forums and review rated Prime as one of, if not, the best. We made weeknight reservations the morning prior to our meal, dressed appropriately, 10 min. early, and were promptly seated.

We were seated away from the windows/fountains, but could still take in the sights from our table. The room is dimly lit and decor is dark in the classic steak house vibe. We didn't do wine, but had coctails with dinner. Then menu is ala carte and the sides are big enough to share. 

My fillet was perfectly prepared at med. rare and arrived with the standard three sauces on the side. My wife had the sea bass and was happy with it. She said it was nothing amazing and admitted she should have done steak and the steak house.

The service was attentive. All in all a very good meal and one of the best steaks that I have had.

I've waited so long to be able to write this review. 

I finally got to eat here for my birthday last weekend, and wow it was SO worth the wait. We started off in the bar and were served by 2 awesome guys...Doug and (not sure other guy's name). Turns out all the bartenders have been here since it opened 13 years ago, so you know they like their jobs and they are happy to chat with you. 

2 dirty martinis with blue cheese stuffed olives please! OMG...do NOT miss these olive. 2 more please!

We had requested a special seat for my birthday so we could see the fountains, and even though we had to wait a little bit (2 more please!) it was SO worth it. Best seat in the house!

Miguel was our server and he was so nice and knowledgeable....I loved how he took time to speak with each table and we did not feel rushed or pressured. Here's what we had:

Steak Tartare - a very delicate portion of raw beef with some sort of spicy mayo...very good. I think it was a bit light for 2 people to share though. 

French Onion Soup - (BF's starter) Oh wow...super chunky, hot, cheesy deliciousness...this could be a stand-alone meal and in hindsight, it probably was too heavy to have before the steak. 

Ceasar Salad - (my starter) Honestly jut ok. Nothing special to the dressing. 

Filet - (BF's steak) Cooked a perfect medium rare with just the right amount of searing. So soft you could cut it with a spoon. 

Bone-in Filet - (my steak). There's nothing I love more than a bone-in filet. Imagine the juciest, tenderest, mouth-wateringest piece of meat, and then throw extra flavor on top of that from the bone. This was a special that night, and Miguel had to go ask Chef to find me one because they were sold out by the time I ordered. If this is on the menu when you go, do NOT pass it up. Amazing, I'm still slobbering over it. 

The only "ding" I will give them is that you can't bring in your own wine. We brought a special bottle all the way from CA for my b-day, and they would not let us cork it. I get it, they need to make money, but it seems like they could have bent the rules just this once. 

Overall, a fantastic meal. I've been asked if I think it's the best steakhouse in Vegas (that I've been to) and I think it edges out Craftsteak by a margin. 

Save your money and try this place!

STEAK lovers paradise!

this place was PERFECT...I loved everything about it...the decor totally screams steakhouse and the food was well worth the price! Expensive to say the least, but didn't expect any less from a steakhouse inside the Bellagio! 

Celebrated a birthday there. It's great for intimate dates or if you are looking to make an impression on your significant other! The food was brought out on a cart all fancy and covered in silverware! The manager actually came to cut our steaks for us to make sure it was cooked to our liking! After the fabulous dinner they escorted us to the patio for dessert compliments of the restaurant for the birthday we were celebrating. The patio was sooooo nice..we ate dessert over looking the Bellagio fountains at sunset so the fountains were lit up and sooo pretty! It is a beautiful restaurant and I totally recommend taking your guy/girl for a date there if visiting Vegas with someone!

My review of Prime can be summed up very simply... so-so steak, not that great sides, and the waiter spilled something all over my back .... the manager offered NOTHING but an apology for my soiled dress shirt. I've had way way better in Las Vegas. Save your time and money and clothes.

Last night, our bill for 4 people was $820. 

...and i'm not a food snob. I'm saying this because of the following bold statement of the day: IT WAS AVERAGE. 

So, did I miss something? I simply don't understand why it gets so many high ratings. It was very disappointing, to say the least. My steak was so incredibly dry that it tasted like something from Denny's (...yeah, gross). I'd rather spend money at Ruth Chris's or Flemings.  Anyways, let's get to the details. We ordered the following: 

1. Seafood appetizer (came with lobster, shrimp, oysters, crab, and clams) -- not bad, the seafood tasted quite fresh and delicious. I'm a fan. 

2. French onion soup -- please, do not burn the top of my soup. The top (the bread and cheese part) was so burned that I could actually taste it while drinking the soup. Uhmm, no. 

3. T-bone steak -- my steak was DRY. I asked for medium, but it was honestly well done. For $70, please do not overcook my steak. The others in my group agreed, their steak was overcooked. Major negative. 

4. Side dishes: macaroni and cheese (the cheese was WAY too strong), asparagus (good - but honestly, how can you go wrong with steamed asparagus?), sauteed spinach (ew - do NOT order this, the sauteed flavoring is just weird. trust me), baked potato (...it's a baked potato, nuff said) 

5. Caesar salad - standard. 

Honestly, i'm a huge steakhouse fan, and this has got to rank as one of my bottom choices in the future. Like I said, Ruth Chris's and Flemings tastes much better because the steaks are juicier and prepared with more detail. If i'm going to be paying $70 for a steak, the chefs should be sure to cook a steak medium if requested. This is just super disappointing...

Was here for my birthday dinner and it was great.

Tried the Rib Eye and it was delicious.

Bacon wrapped jumbo shrimp were awesome.

Mash Potatoes were fluffy and creamy, asparagus was so tender.

Bread was soft and tasty.

One thing you get here is class. Great service and great food, but come here without a budget, because you will spend some dough.  

Been to enough steakhouses to say this steak was one of a few best I have ever tasted.

The prices are high not because they might be better then other places, but it's the location and a nice view.

Treat yourself to a nice dinner while you're in Vegas, would say try this one, but with many options I will probably take my money some where else to see what other great restaurant is out there next time.

My husband and I were celebrating our first anniversary and doing dinner and a show. I looked up Open Table reservation availability, and the place seemed to be booked up from 5:45 to 8:30, which overlapped with our show, so I made our reservation for an early dinner at 5:30. I just want to note that throughout dinner, the place was only half full, so I don't know why Open Table said it was booked up. Was it to promote exclusivity? I don't know.

Anyway, I had written in our reservation that a view of the fountains would be appreciated. The first table we were escorted to was against the wall and in a corner with a slight view. It was an OK spot, but considering that pretty much every other table was empty with no one in sight, we requested to be seated more centrally at the window. Our request was met with some trepidation as apparently that particular table was booked. Again, half-full restaurant at 5:30. It still confuses me. Anyway, finally we were moved.

We were greeted by...a sommelier? A waiter? I'm not sure. Leaning towards waiter. He was not particularly friendly. When my husband asked for a recommendation, he was kind of gruff and short. Not the best sell. He gave us the wine list and we ordered two drinks (lemon drop for me,wine for husband). After this, he disappeared, and another waiter (Asian, bald head) took over in his place. Maybe the first waiter was covering for this one? In any case, neither of them introduced themselves. In fact, in the ten minutes between them we looked at our menus and then the second guy showed up. His greeting was, "ready to order"? In most places, this would be really no big deal. But if you're a steak house who prides yourself on service and class, introductions should always be made. Not to mention you're in the Bellagio and it's not even particularly busy.

We ordered. Went with truffled mashed potatoes and a tomato salad with burrata cheese, filet mignon for me and rib eye for my husband. We wanted to also try the macaroni and cheese but the waiter was particularly judgmental about this, telling us everything would be more than enough. I'm sorry, but if the waiter is not asked this particular question, they should not comment. This is not a tapas place and maybe we wanted to sample a little of everything? Especially if people note it should be tasted. I was really turned off by this. Personally, I didn't eat all day so that I could indulge in everything that I wanted. He kind of made the decision for me when reciting back what we ordered.  I was incredibly uncomfortable and felt judged for my appetite, so I didn't put up a fight and told my husband to keep quiet as well. I've been to many fine steakhouses and this has NEVER happened before. 

The food is what deserved the stars, but the service negated a lot of points. The truffle potatoes are worthy of all the praise. The salad was delicious. My steak was a little red for my liking, even at medium rare, but still yummy. I liked that the steak came with three sauces to sample, and really enjoyed the house speciality sauce. It was a bit of a soy sauce Asian blend. My husband also enjoyed his steak. Interestingly, I noted that a woman to my left got the same steak, but the same waiter offered to...cut it up for her? And to my right, the first waiter who was so gruff with us, was practically kvelling and gossiping with the two older ladies next to us.  Did we look like degenerates? Um, answer is no. I had on a beautiful dress and my husband a beautiful Italian suit. But nevertheless, it seemed like we were targeted as...not big spenders? Not worthy of attentiveness? Who knows.

The only star at that restaurant is the waiter that comes around and refills the water glasses and removes the dishes. He was friendly and chatty and we would have rather tipped him 20% than the guy we did.

At the end of the meal, we were given a free dessert in celebration of our anniversary. It was ok. More chocolate cursive letters than dessert. But hey, it was free. This pleasantness was again negated by having to wait for the check for 40 minutes. Once the waiter had collected our credit card and finally come back, he tried to hand it to me. The name on the credit card is clearly one for a man.  It exemplifies the lack of polish here, as at any other fine restaurant, the credit card would be handed back by name to the person who possesses it (and it's pretty easy to tell who did between the two of us and similarly so if you note the person handing it off to you before you swipe it). Even places like TGI Friday's do this. 

Anyway, I would never come back to this style over substance establishment even if the truffle potatoes are at the top of my favorite foods to eat in Vegas. There are better places to dine. Even in my hometown of Philadelphia, Del Frisco's outclasses this place by miles!

Great steaks, great views, great service!

Mama Bear wanted a nice place to dine at for Christmas Eve in Vegas, I of course, did my due diligence to find her just that. But because it was a holiday, reservation by the patio/windows were all full. :( So reserve ahead of time during the holidays!

FOOD:
We ordered filet mignons, short ribs ($41.00), and their Chilean Sea Bass ($45.00) with a side order of Ginger Sweet Potatoes, Jumbo Asparagus, and Butternut Squash Soup. I would stick with the Filet Mignon ($67.00), definitely their specialty. It was soooo good. The meat just melted in my mouth, it also came with three different sauces to complement the meat, but I prefer mine plain. The cut was perfect, no tendon was to be found, and the quality was absolutely perfect! My grandmother also really liked their sea bass, said it was cooked perfectly and she absolutely loved her Butternut Squash Soup. Their Asparagus and Sweet Potato Mash are highly recommended, both very good quality and light side dishes to pair with the steaks. The short rib was okay, while the meat was very tender and juicy, the enormous amount of heavy sauce just ruined the dish for me. We also got a basket of bread as appetizers! The raisin bread was highlight of the basket. :)

SERVICE:
Our waiter was just terrific, he was very personable and knew how to talk and draw his customers in. He made a lot of great recommendations and was also making sure we got what we needed including all allergies and special diet restrictions. The food could take a while, but they provide bread as you wait.

ATMOSPHERE:
They do have a dress code that they enforce- business causal is more like business formal. All the men were in clean-cut suits and the women in nice dresses and heels. The lighting is dim and very classy, it's a quiet place that don't allow kids under 6 years old to dine in. Although from looking around, no kids seemed to be around the restaurant.

Lastly, they have complimentary self-parking for Bellagio if you're dining in!

Okay, this is only my review of the bar within Prime.  So you've gotta take this with a grain of salt.  

It was eh.  The bartenders were rude and gave us a funky vibe.  My cousin and i wanted to stay and eat, but were so turned off by the atttitude of the bartenders.  

I'm sure we'll eat here some time.  Its unfortunately that our first impression was so bad.  Again, i'll eat here... but there is no sense of urgency and its not a priority for me to try this place. Sorry.

While the food and service were good, I have had better for much cheaper.  I had the aged ribeye which was good but again I have had better steaks at many of the steakhouses in Chicago at a much fairer price.  My wife had the filet which was ordered medium rare and came out medium and dry.  The ribbons of tuna appetize; however, was the highlight of the meal.  It was extremely flavorful and was an excellent recommendation by the waiter.  Overall we didn't get what we paid for which was disappointing because his was the place we chose to splurge for our last night in Vegas.  If you love steak, I would give another option first shot.

An almost perfect dinner in an almost perfect seat accompanied by almost perfect service.  The steak is certainly phenomenal, but I'll leave that to the other reviewers to rave about.  I don't think the steak is the BEST in the world, but my best might not be your best.  Once you hit a certain level of goodness, it's becomes exponentially difficult to stratify what is best and what is second or third best.  

But I think I've fallen in love with our waiter that night.  If he was my waiter at every restaurant I go to, then all my yelp reviews would probably end up with an extra star.  Friendly, engaging, accommodating, caring, smart, eloquent, polite, perceptive...I've ran out of adjectives...   Too bad he's not the person who actually bring you the food or takes away your food; they were not as A+ quality.

The restaurant is beautiful and if you're lucky or special or important enough, you'll be able to get a seat at the window/balcony and watch the fountain show every 15 min.  But don't expect to get those seats if you're not  some VVVIP.   And unfortunately, being that this is in sin city, you will occasionally see diners in t-shirt and jeans...just look away and stare at the pretty decor instead...

Side note:
I met Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten the night before at the Grand Tasting (a Vegas Uncork'd event) and what a gentleman.  Super nice and kind and took the minute to autograph my souvenir bag :)

Pros: Amazing view of Bellagio fountains, great steak, great service. 

Cons: No complaints really. Except the people taking selfies and photos of the fountains right next to our table during entire meal. Maybe they could discourage this somehow, it really takes away from the moment.

Full review:

I went to prime for my birthday. It was also my first time visiting Las Vegas. I had an amazing meal on the patio overlooking the fountains. I definitely recommend sitting outside if the weather is nice (two other parties in front of us at the hostess station were denied patio seating, so make sure to mention it when you make your reservation if you want to sit there!). 

The service was incredible. There were several waiters in our area, all were extremely attentive, but unobtrusive.

My date and I both ordered the Dry-aged Bone-in Rib Eye. It was hands down the best steak I've ever had. It was cooked to perfection. I savored every succulent bite. It was served with 3 different steak sauces. I tasted each one, they were alright, but I don't know why anyone would want to mask the flavor of that meat! Unfortunately, the steak does not come with any sides, they must be ordered separate. 

The wine list is the size of a small novel. I finally decided on a bottle of Chianti, it was superb. Every time I neared the end of my glass a waiter would appear to refresh it. 

After the main course they brought me a complimentary dessert with a candle and "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate on the dish (I had mentioned it was my birthday on the reservation that I made far in advance). It was a nice gesture. 

Be aware, this place is on the expensive side. 2 steaks, 1 bottle of wine, 2 sides, and the tip came to about $400, but it was worth every penny! I left very happy and would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice dinner.

BF brought me here for our anniversary dinner...may just have to keep him a bit longer.

I will not let the little blue tiffany's box on the table cloud my judgement of Prime :)

Since the BF 'knows' people, the chef came out and greeted us at what had to be the best table in the house, gorgeous views of the Bellagio fountain show.  The Chef then sent us out a Kobe treat he whipped up....oh my.  Kobe on top of Shitakes with a spicy black pepper mustard.  Oh baby!

After that we had the 'fondue', which was delicious but quirky as I didn't get a little pot of cheese but rather a eggroll looking - cheesy treat

BF got the surf n turf :)  Filet and Lobster, I just got the Filet.  Was cooked perfectly and so tasty.  I do recommend trying your steak naked before tasting all their great sauces - it is mighty good naked.

We tried the mushrooms and Spicy Mac&Cheese for our sides.  I fell in love with the Mac&Cheese and BF is now on a hunt for the recipe.

At the end we were surprised with a lava cake and homemade icecream...what a treat.

Would definitely come back - everything was delightful.  Food, Service and Atmosphere.

Make a reservation. This is an absolutely outstanding dining experience from beginning to end.  Anything on the menu is great. The rack of lamb is perfect. There is nothing about Prime that I wouldn't recommend. Excellent service and staff. Worth the price.

The service here was the best part of the meal. They have professional staff who are very attentive. The food itslef was good, it wasn't great or life changing. I was honestly a bit dissapointed because I expected a bit more for the name and the price.

In this week for dinner.  Good but not great.  I don't mind the prices, but I do expect to be blown away by a $63 filet.  It was fine, but just that and wouldn't come close to even making the top 25 for me.   Same with the scallops - nothing wrong with them - but just good, not great.   

It is a nice setting and if you are close to the windows the view of the fountains is a bonus.  The service was very good, our waiter very attentive and pleasant.  

$400 (w/tip) for 3 - that was salads and mains and a few glasses of wine,  no desert.  

Again, overall it as fine; but not a place that makes my list of great places to have a steak.

Really overpriced and pretentious.
I am from the Bay Area, so I know I am spoiled in regards to great restaurants and someone from SF recommended Prime to me...what a huge disappointment.  First of all, the staff person who showed us to our table pulled the chair out for my husband and not me - while HILARIOUS, was a tip-off that the place is "off."  Our waiter was obnoxious - condescending and LOUD voice.  We had a reservation at 6 and tickets for a show at 8 - he seemed uncertain that we would be done on time, which was ridiculous as we were completely rushed through dinner.  He treated us like rubes who just fell off the turnip truck, "Heard you heard of Alaskan king crab legs?"  Really.  "Uhhh, how do you say that word, 'craaa-bbbb?'"   D'oh - annoying.  We started with a salad, which was fine, very small portion size.  I had a filet - okay, but didn't change my world.  My husband had the lamb.  Fatty.  We split some brussel sprouts and potatoes - again, really unremarkable.  Rushed service and the very loud waiter made it a not-so-fun experience.  $230.00 later, we should've skipped it. 
We are foodies.  Prime is not for foodies.
On the plus side, elegant decor and nice views of the Bellagio fountains.

The review is basically because of one employee at the restaurant....THOMAS!!! he is absolutely amazing. He made our whole experience wonderful. Don't get me wrong I'm the food was amazing, the decor was beautiful and the views were breathtaking. But a group of 6 girls can me complicated. But Thomas made us feel so welcome. He was so sweet an attentive. The best service ice ever received in any restaurant!!!

My first night and first time in my life ever in Vegas. This place definitely was a night to remember for my palate. This steakhouse is located lakefront of the Bellagio and it was super gorgeous inside from what I could see.
 I couldn't help but to notice it was one of those restaurants where the lights are so dim, you can't read the menu and everyone is literally whispering around the table.

 Our server was very helpful and brought out a wine list. I ordered a delicious bottle of cab! 
I took a look at the menu and lamb chops were crying out for me! So I had to!
HANDS DOWN. The best lamb chop I've had. MELT IN YOUR MOUTH GOODNESS! 
 
I couldn't pass up on deserts! CRACKLING KEY LIME PIE. Mmmm.. it was so fun to eat! Every bite crackled in your mouth because of the pop rock candy they sprinkled on the top. The key lime pie tart level was JUST RIGHT.  Such a wonderful medley! 

I can't wait to come back! I had a great experience. I just hope they would have the lights on a little brighter. The place reminds me of a dark cave. :(

In the interest of full disclosure, dinner was hosted by someone who has been here before, has the means to make dinner phenomenal and even had a favorite server (Russell).

We started off the evening with a GIGANTIC seafood plateau with lobster, rock crab claws, king crab legs, oysters, huge prawns and a trio of delicious sauces.  Our server did us a service and suggested we ordered the plateau for four people even though we had five.  This appetizer alone filled me up half-way!!  Everything was super fresh and sweet.

That evening, Prime was featuring Tasmanian lobster tails.  You can add it to your dish as a "surf and turf" option, have it as an entree or order one for the table.  Our host went with one for the table and let me tell you...never in my life had I seen such a gargantuan lobster tail.  It was probably a foot long and 10 inches around.  It was presented, carved up and served to us with plenty left for the middle of the table.  Sweetest lobster I've ever had.  The flesh was firm yet tender (indescribeable).  No drawn butter necesary!

So Prime's thing is steak.  I went with our host's suggestion for the 5-peppercorn New York strip.  I'm really glad I did!  The flavor was bold and delicious.  It's what I like to call "fancy steak".  I had a few bites of our host's filet and that was melt-in-your-mouth delicious as well.  They give you three sauces to go with your steak and we ignored them all.
For sides, we had their spicy mac and cheese, truffle mashed potatoes (DROOL...I could have had the whole thing on my own), sauteed mushrooms, and specially ordered caramelized onions.  All were great sides.

Alas, due to the giantness of our appetizer, I had to give up trying to finish my steak.  Meanwhile, my husband had no problems finishing his porterhouse.

We were contemplating dessert when someone let slip to our server that it was hubby and my wedding anniversary.  The dessert menus were respectfully plucked out of our hands and in short order, their signature chocolate lava cake was brought out to us, served with a delicious home made caramel ice cream.  They wrote Happy Anniversary on the platter which made it all the more special. 

Prime has a great wine list of which I did not get to see.  However, the wines we had were delicious.  I brought the first two bottles (Kamen, CS, 2005) which opened up beautifully.  (NOTE: Their corkage fee is $35 but their policy is that they will only allow it if the wine is not already on their list).  Second was a D.R. Stephens CS 2005 and finally, the crowning glory, the Penfolds Grange 2001 (?).  I was in expensive wine heaven.  If wine tasted like this at a reasonable price, I'd have to have Al Anon on speed dial!

Our evening was fantastic.  Service was perfect.  It felt like we had an army of people waiting on us and constantly bringing us more water, constantly pouring us more wine.  Our server was almost embarassed that he caught our host pouring his own water and ran right over to take the bottle from him.  The best part was service was friendly, humorous and not at all snooty like a lot of fancy places.

This was definitely an experience to remember, even if I did stumble a little on the way out.  Just a little!!

********************* 1124 ********************* 

      My parents have celebrated their anniversary here a few times. They love it here each and every time. 

      Prime Steakhouse is an Award-winning, 3 Michelin Stars of Jean-Georges in NYC, and many more restaurants offer a modern steakhouse dining with prime steak, seafood,  lamb, delicious sauces, sides and award winning wines list. 

       Luxurious decor, chocolate brown and tiffany blue curtains - the elaborate beautiful design of designer Michael DeSantis. There're gorgeous pieces of artwork are on display including 3 paintings by Carlo Maria Mariani, George Deem and Michael Gregory, as well as a canvas  by Joseph Raffael. 

      A garden patio provides the perfect outdoor setting for a tranquil dining experience where you can enjoy the breathtaking view of the Bellagio water fountain. 

     At the Prime Steakhouse, executive chef Sean Griffin, a veteran of  the Four Seasons Hotel Beverly Hills and Nero's at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas. He was at Bourbon Steak in Scottsdale. Now the executive chef of Jean Georges' Prime Steakhouse at the beautiful Bellagio.

      A few dishes we always love: 

- Steak Tartare & Carpaccio, Tarragon Aioli & Grilled Crostini 

- Caramelized Scallops, Green Vegetables, Spring Onion Vinaigrette & Chili-Lime Crumbs

- Dungeness Crabcake, Sweet & Sour Peppers, Celery Salad

- Veal Chop, Potato Confit, Kale Sprouts & Onion Cream 

- Dry-Aged Bone-In Rib Eye

    Service is always excellent to the details, although we didn't care much for the photographer kept asking if we want our pictures to be taken! 

    Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio is 1 of my family  favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas.

Average, average, average. 
Food - The steak carpaccio was delicious. This was definitely the highlight of the meal. In terms of entrees the porterhouse was good but not mindblowing. Same goes for the sauces. The sauce made from grapes was good but the others were pretty standard. At the suggestion of the waiter we ordered the crispy potatoes as a side. They were literally exactly the same as TGIFridays potato skins, but maybe a little greasier.  

Service - This was mixed. Our waiter was very nice but the host/busboy/captain (?) kind of huddled and made my friends and I a little uncomfortable.

Atmosphere - The person selling photographs is tacky. The view is top notch but the other decor feels a little tired. This also definitely isn't a young or happening crowd (which I probably should have figured).

It's vegas, go somewhere better.

Food was amazing but get ready to pay for it - disappointed that the waiter had an attitude with me when I tripped off the entire bill when my client and I split the tab (when you split the tab you split the tip) It was a nice atmosphere sitting outside watching the fountains however the Prime is way overpriced for what you get.  The manager was very nice however the waiters were pompous in my opinion.
It's all about the servers at Prime. Michael and Juan are great guys and do a wonderful job. Food was on point. Ambiance was great.
This place is really amazing. You are facing the fountains of the Bellagio and the food is delicious and really worsts the price. The service is great too.

Amazing!  Sit on the heated patio for beautiful views of the fountain!  The Parmesan crusted chicken was very tender and juicy.

 Do you like bacon!?!  Try the bacon wrapped shrimp! 3 large shrimp and very yummy. 

The dry aged ribeye was mind blowing. Cooked to perfection, tender, and flavor to make the tastebuds burst! By far the best steak ever and well worth the $73 price tag!

Food was great. Really delicious. Steak was beautifully prepared. Sides outstanding. We usually have a rule that we don't go out for steak - we can make it at home just as well. This was a very good choice!

Service was great! 

Very noisy. Seems like you can't actually have a conversation in most restaurants these days.

Prime is a rare treat, it's not very often I get to eat a place of this caliber so I'm very fond of it. The restaurant itself is dimly lit, with super comfortable chairs, and a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains. They enforce the dress code pretty strict here, most places in Vegas will let you in wearing just about anything. This is a 1 or 2 page menu place, alot of expensive steaks, and sides you would expect in a high end steakhouse. The iced shell fish platter here is killer!  It's a quite beautiful piece. My wife had a bone in fillet which was fantastic. Don't ask for a wine recommendation from the waiter unless you won some serious cash  at the baccarat table. The pretzel bread served before dinner also blew mind.

This was my 3rd JG restaurant... I have been to 'Spice Market' in NYC and 'Market' in Cabo San Lucas... both top notch.

This place was fantastic... from the decor to the dessert.  

I was there with a large group of people and never felt like neglected.  We started at the bar area- martinis were great.  Cocktails were stiff.  Service was way above par.  Our server was knowledgable and fun.  Had a great sense of humor... but wasn't annoying.  Was there when you needed him yet not hovering.

The wine selection was spot on.

The seafood tower was to die for.  They gave a very large portion and it was beutifully presented.  The heirloom tomato and burata salad I had was excellent.  

I had the braised shortribs.  I also tried many other people's steaks. All fabulous.  The sides were spot on (truffle mashed.... get it!).

Desserts were also amazing.   

This place is expensive, yes... but for a special occasion you can't beat it.  The level of service makes the check worth it.  Prime was a great experience overall.  I highly reccommend it.

Me and the guys visited Prime once before and "wow" were we impressed. While it was one of the more pricier dinners it was certainly worth it. Their service made it feel as if we were catered upon as if it were a spa, the appetizers delectible, the steak entrees mouth watering, and their bar selection had some of the rarest cognacs & scotch wiskeys I've seen. Be sure to make a reservation far in advance and ask for a window table so that you can also be entertained by Bellagio's fountain show.
It's worth the trip. Service was exceptional and food was great but just not off the charts great. A worthy special event and awesome dinner spot for business at the high end.

Two years ago, I had a pretty disappointing experience with this restaurant's hostess, which left a sour taste on our experience despite the great wait service and food. 

This Christmas holiday, my family and I decided to give it another shot. Our experience with the restaurant's (different) hostesses had greatly improved, and I was very impressed with their patience, kindness, and professionalism. The hostess kindly told us that while we had requested a fountain view, it is based on a first-come, first-serve basis, and for the moment they were all taken. She suggested another table, but first made sure to give me and my parents an opportunity to decide whether we were comfortable with this table or not. We were seated in the center of the dining room and still had a view of the fountain outside. The wait service was fantastic and the food remains amazing (tip: get the foie!). I'm impressed with this restaurant's management, it's willingness to make the necessary changes, and its employees for their professionalism and tasteful service, from beginning to end. My family and I are certainly looking forward to coming back soon.

Great place for steak.  Good service, good ambiance.  However, you will pay thru the nose.  I'm glad somebody else paid for my dinner as part of a business expense.  Otherwise, this place would be a once-in-a-year kinda place for me.

I have been to Vegas so many times and have never felt compelled to eat here.  We actually came because it was my friend's choice we were dining with a large group.  I'm so sorry that I did not come here earlier. 

They make a fantastic dirty martini, though I have rarely met one i didn't like. The real standout for me was our appetizers.  Most of us ordered the foie gras which was nothing short of spectacular. It was perfectly seared and absolutely delicious. 

The steaks were solid, though I've had better in Chicago and elsewhere in Vegas. The sides were amazing, the mac & cheese is very rich and very tasty.   

I honestly can't remember if we ordered desserts maybe was too many of those damn martinis. Overall I would definitely come back if nothing more for appetizers and the sides.

Service was top notch! We were lucky to get a table with a view of the fountains which made me add an extra star. Food was good but not amazing justify a $300 bill for 2 people. Overall it is a very nice and romantic place but if had equal if not better steaks for much less.

I don't like mashed potatoes.  However, 3 words for you.  Truffle Mashed Potatoes.  

The restaurant is everything everyone says it is.  Romantic and fantastic. Go.  Try it. You will not be let down.
I STILL can not believe people like the steaks at this restaurant. Go figure!
Was going to go here until I saw "Children Under 5 Not Allowed". Not only is this distasteful but it is most likely illegal to discriminate against a person based on age.

What can I say about this place... Absolutely beautiful, I went to this steakhouse for my birthday and I couldn't of asked for anything better. Sitting on the patio is a MUST because of the incredible view, the bone in Filet Mignon might have been the juciest filet I've ever had in Las Vegas. The flavors, aromas, and a beautiful girlfriend made the perfect birthday Dinner. The only problem was when I ordered my filet the first time medium rare it was well done. The waiter returned it immediately and gave me a new Filet. Definitely going back!

Had a company dinner here and my first thought from looking at the prices on the menu was that this would just be an expensive meal for sub-par food. I was wrong. I had the best steak I've ever had. The drinks were good and the service was friendly. Oh and being able to watch the fountain show at the Bellagio from your dinner table isn't so bad either.

Let me begin by saying this is the most elegant steakhouse I've been to. ( Although CUT is my favorite steak wise ) It is beautifully situated on the lakeside level of the Bellagio hotel. We were seated right by the elegantly draped huge windows that overlook the Bellagio fountain show and smashing chocolate brown and light blue decor.  The posh surroundings are warm, welcoming and yes... romantic.  The staff was very courteous and very knowledgeable on their selections of wine and food.   Although there are many other notable restaurants to choose from at while in Vegas, we didn't want to be late to our cirque de soleil - O show so dining here seemed to be the most practical solution. On to the food..

APPETIZERS 
1. Shrimp cocktail  =  Succulent and delicious 
 2. Butter-Poached King Crab w/ apple-chive Salad & Brioche = How can you possibly go wrong here? Melt in your mouth sensation as soon as it touched a taste bud. The chucks of crab were huge which i would have expected for an almost $30 dollar appetizer. Hehe. Well worth the price.
3. Caesar salad = Your typical Caesar salad with a little twist, the parmesan baked cone. So cheesy! 
MAIN COURSE
1. Bone-in Rib Eye Steak 18 oz = We both opted for the same steak and unfortunately I was NOT impressed. The quality of the meat is honestly not worth mentioning.  It wasn't very juicy or marbleized as other steaks I have tried.  Very mediocre, which I was not expecting.. sadly.  I almost forgot to mention that there are three different sauces for the steak that are provided, but for good steak the sauce just gets in the way. Well at least, in my opinion. =)
2. Bone-in Rib Eye Steak 18 oz
SIDES
1. Truffle mash potato = Ahhhh, SO GOOD.  I absolutely love anything that has truffle in it!  The flavor will explode in your mouth!  A definite must try for yourself!  
2. Mac and Cheese = I tasted white cheddar here.  Rather tasty. 
3. Steamed asparagus = Perfectly seasoned, but wasn't cooked enough.
OTHERS
1. Grey hound = Refreshing and light. 
2. Red Zinfandel = Recommended by our server, GREAT! Not too acidic or dry. Went well with my steak.
3. Red wine =  I forgot this one. 

Overall,  the atmosphere is close to perfection, but the food was very mediocre in taste with the exception of the Truffle mash potatoes and appetizers.  Although I was not impressed by the steak, I would return to try the seafood on their menu and the butter king crab again.  One thing I like about Prime is that they cater to their clientele. If something is not to your liking, they will do whatever they can to make sure you are pleased. The staff is exceptionally warm and personable too. Would return, but no steak for me! How ironic to say at a steakhouse.. 

1 out of 5. 5 being the highest
Food - 3 , truffle mash potatoes gets a 4!
Ambiance- 4
Service- 4
Price - Total with tip $308.00

I want to hire their interior designer for my house, it is so beautifully decorated inside! The wait staff is extremely knowledgable down to the tiniest details and funny as well, so you don't feel like your in a snooty atmosphere. The cocktails, wine, steaks, and dessert just kept outdoing themselves. Bravo Bellagio and Bon A Petit to anyone lucky enough to have the pleasure of experiencing such a magnificent meal!

Save your money and skip the completely overrated/flavorless Wagyu ribeye - if a $35 per ounce steak is suppose to taste like that then the world has gone completely insane.  Plus it must have been the bartenders first day, fresh out of the corner bar tending school, how is it possible to make such a subpar manhattan and don't even bother ordering a sazerac unless you want a club soda and watered down J&B on the rocks (which is not even close to the actual drink).  The only thing that was marginally good was the breadbasket. The waitstaff was incompetent and smug. I'm not sure what happened to Vegas and especially the Bellagio but 5 diamonds, really?  I wish Michelin still rated the restaurants out here.

We had a wonderful first time dining experience at Prime over Memorial Day weekend. 

We thought the decor was very classy. The dim lighting set a very relaxing mood. The wait staff worked together like a fine oiled machine. Every detail of the dinner was executed with precision. 

We ordered the Crispy Salmon Sushi as an appetizer, wedge salad, and market tomatoes for starters. They were absolutely delish! If you love garden tomatoes, you'll love the market tomatoes with burrata cheese. Our filet steaks came out perfectly cooked and were succulent and tender. For sides, we had the truffle mashed potatoes and broccoli jalapeno cheddar. The sides are perfect for sharing and did not disappoint. Three types of sauces for the steaks were also served. We thought that was spectacular as we got to try all three. Although the steak itself was so tasty you could eat it with no sauce at all.

I had two cosmo martinis which were perfectly crafted. I'm always looking for the perfect cosmo and they were one of the few that got it right.

Our dining experience was truly 5 star experience! The only suggestion I could make, is to offer a petite filet. I could not eat 9 oz of steak. 3 oz basically went to waste as we were staying at a hotel and had no way of keeping it or heating it up.
Does not get much better than this. Our table was over looking the fountains and the steaks were fabulous. What more could you ask for? But if you did, make sure you do the desserts.

Probably the greatest steak I have ever had. The Filet Mignon was perfectly cooked. We were seated right next to the windows over looking the fountain. It was an amazing night. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great memory.

Oh My Gawd!  The best steakhouse that I have ever visited.  I have been to many around the US and globe.
The service and the knowledge that each server has is unmatched by any other restaurant.  
The cuts of beef are awesome and are always cooked to the temp that you request.
When in Vegas, please stop it.  It is costly, but well worth it.

In my never ending quest to find the perfect steakhouse ... I find myself this time at Jean Georges' Prime at the Bellagio.  After a rather disappointing experience at his other outpost next door, the JG Steakhouse at the Aria, I was a little skeptical to say the least ... that feeling went away the instant I entered in.

Situated "lake-side" next to the 2star Michelin PIcasso, Prime occupies one of the best locations in the hotel overlooking the famous fountains of the Bellagio.  If you reserve early enough you can easily request prime seating, pun intended, with a beautiful view of the lake, the fountains and the Vegas strip.  

As for the food, we started with the grilled foie gras with jalapeno marmalade.  The foie was excellent and cooked to perfection ... though I must admit, I find it exceedingly difficult to use the words "foie gras" and "disappointment" in the same sentence.   We opted for the 28oz bone-in rib eye for two. Now I must say that in reviewing any steakhouse in the past, I always get the rib eye and therefore I can honestly say that I'm comparing apples to apples.  The rib eye was cooked perfectly and the table side carving was a nice and sexy touch. The beef was super tender and full of flavor with the proper amount of marbling.  The steak came with several sauces - and though I don't normally use "sauce" at a high end steakhouse such as Prime ... I must admit that the soy rice wine sauce gave the steak that extra punch ... that it didn't necessarily need it was more than fine the way it was.  For the sides, the truffle mash potatoes were exceptional as well as the mac and cheese ... though I more than preferred the truffled mash version at the JG Steakhouse next door.  The lemon tart dessert was a bit of an after thought ... but then again I came here for some great steak and a great steak I had.

Again, in my eternal crusade to find the perfect steakhouse ... Prime is at the moment, the undisputed leader of the pack.  The impeccable service, the elegant interior, and most importantly, the unparalleled steaks combine to truly put this place in a class of its own.  I suspect that I will no longer be trying any other steakhouses in Vegas as I have officially found my favorite steakhouse in Vegas if not the entire planet.  The bar has undoubtedly been raised by Prime.

Wow.  I can stop this review after the next sentence (although, I most likely won't).  "The Bone-In Filet is Amazing!"  I ordered it medium rare, and it was just delicious.  Cooked with just salt and pepper, the flavor was amazing.  I have never had a bone-in filet before, and I am now ecstatic that I have!  The following day during lunch, I was eating my mediocre sandwich wishing that I kept the remaining part of the bone from the filet to gnaw on.  It was just outrageously good.

In addition, we obviously ordered some wine, side dishes, a couple apps, and dessert.  Favorite app was the Foie Gras because we are not allowed to eat it in CA.  It was a special treat to have.  Best dessert was the creme brulee.  Very light and flavorful.

Prime is one of my favorite steak places that I have been.  5 stars!

I came with in hungry and with an open mind, being a huge steakhouse fan.  They charge a hefty price for their steaks; and the steaks are very good.  However, the steaks are nothing special.  I had the ribeye, and my date had the filet.  Both were obviously quality cuts of meat, but just nothing that would set either apart from other steakhouses.

I did not appreciate the attitudes of the snooty staff and hostesses.  This place is over-the-top pretentious, which is to be expected, but I just felt like there was an ora that was disgusting.  In Vegas, I've enjoyed Guy Savoy and Joel Robuchon which are other even higher-end restaurants.  There was a warm feeling with the service and I felt like their guest for a special treat.  At Prime, they made it feel as though I should be thankful to be served and seated in such a prim and proper, "high" class environment.  

Prime is trying to be something that it's not.  This restaurant is located 45 yards from a wheel of fortune slot.  There is nothing privileged about working/eating there.  We're not in Paris folks, we're in Las Vegas- king of the nobody doing his best to act like he's somebody, and paying the credit card price for month's to come (LV is my favorite city in America).

Finally, the $100 seafood appetizer platter was a complete waste.  The oysters were terrible (relative).  Prime needs to lose the attitude, and focus more on special food that matches the price.

Primed with a gift card from my son and daughter-in-law to ease the financial outlay required to dine well here, Diane and I at last ventured forth to sample Prime.  And, besides finding it to be the most expensive restaurant we have each visited to date ($330.52 for 2 diners, including tax and tip, but without any alcoholic beverages), even taking into account many renowned restaurants we have frequented at some time or other across the globe, it was without doubt one of the best.  We did not scrimp on food, but did not order that extravagantly either.

After being promptly seated at one of the few booths in the cavernous restaurant as requested in our reservation, with a distant but still good view of the Bellagio Fountains, and immediately receiving black cloth napkins substituted out for the white ones on the table to cover our black pants, we decided to begin with a Shrimp Cocktail app.  After being presented with big shrimps unconventionally lying side by side on a plate, we then enjoyed the great cold and meaty morsels, which I dunked in a fresh and quite tasty Wasabi Cocktail Sauce.

Next for me was a large gargoyle-headed, and seemingly bottomless, white crock of hot and cheesy Prime Onion Soup.  With well-caramelized onions, a very generous supply of clotted Gruyere and Emmentaler Cheeses, and a few chives sprinkled on top, it was a memorable Onion Soup Gratinee that took me awhile to fully consume.  But of course I eventually did, to the last drop!

For our entree we each ordered a medium-rare 10 oz. Filet Mignon.  The tall and long, lightly charred prime-grade steaks yielded buttery, melt in the mouth meat which was quite tasty in its own right, but even better after being joined with a trio of sauces: Soy-Rice Wine Sauce, Peppercorn Sauce, and classic Bearnaise Sauce.  I enjoyed alternating forkfuls of beef with a few drops of the three sauces, and never did determine a clear favorite between the Soy-Rice Wine Sauce and the Bearnaise.  Each was an excellent flavor amplifier of the perfectly cooked beef, as were the Shishito Peppers that accompanied my Filet.

Along with our steaks we split a single wide Crab Leg from South Africa with Drawn Butter at $38.00 a pop.  I had decided in advance that if the one crab leg seemed insufficient, I would order another.  But there was no need.  In fact, because my stomach was quite full, I left 2 ounces of my steak on my plate, uneaten, which is uncharacteristic for me, and which I now regret!  

I'm sure that our sides took a toll on our bodies as well, making us very content.  For what is a steak dinner without some fine sides?  And fine sides we had!  Gratin Dauphinois Potatoes were as cheesy and as great as they looked in photos on Yelp.  We reveled in oozing Comte Cheese.  And, Roasted Glazed Market Mushrooms were a quite interesting array of several types of mushrooms, including Enoki.  Each side was easily enough for two diners, and a few mushrooms were also left behind.

Not to be overlooked were the fine slices of complimentary Sourdough Bread and great Raisin Bread with Walnuts served with an elongated slab of butter with some specks of Chive Salt on top.  Initially I thought I had encountered my first slice of salty Sourdough Bread--until I realized that the Chive Salt was causing the sensation of a burst of salt in my mouth.  But I grew to like this, and more Chive Salt Butter was ordered, quickly received, and slathered on more bread.

To finish, Diane enjoyed Warm Valrhona Cake with a molten center and a scoop of Vanilla Bean Ice Cream, while I very much liked my scoop of Chocolate Sorbet specially adorned with a brittle Chocolate Bow.

Service by three attendants was superb.  A request for decaffeinated Iced Tea was responded to with three successive pots of brewed hot decaffeinated Chamomile Tea and Relax Tea made specially for me, and poured over a large glass of ice.  Water glasses were continually filled without any need for a request, and we were regularly visited by a member of our formally clad waitstaff to see if we needed anything.  

Our seating in a corner booth was very comfortable.  And the sumptuous decor surrounding us, combined with our window view of rising jets of water from the fountains just outside and the sound of jazzy music piped in overhead, afforded a classy, upscale ambiance that, along with the wonderful food, yielded a luxurious and quite memorable five-star dining experience.
      
I am going to start saving real soon for our next visit to Prime, and highly recommend this dining experience to all!

We ate at Prime this past weekend as we were celebrating our son's 21st birthday in Las Vegas.  We generally try and get in one or two nice dinners when we are in town, so we decided to try this restaurant. 

Everything started off well, service was pleasant, had good drinks, and the tuna ribbon appetizer was fantastic.  But, somewhere after we finished our appetizer, the service completely changed for some unknown reason.  While our waters were constantly being filled and our used dishes taken away, our waiter completely disappeared.  I noticed other tables received the nice restaurant "reveal" - not for us, we were just given our meals, one by one.  Not a big deal normally, but you notice when your table is treated differently than everyone else's.  We honestly didn't see our waiter again until after we completed our meals and my wife went to the restroom, and then he came over to fold her napkin.  Not a word, not a look, nothing.  He never checked on our food, asked how we were doing, or if we wanted another bottle of wine or drink refills.  I can honestly say I've never been treated like this at any restaurant, much less one where you can expect to pay hundreds of dollars.

I'm not one to make a scene, so I didn't, but when my wife was walking back from the restroom, the manager stopped her to ask how dinner was and she told him about our experience.  He said he would make everything right, and at that point, another server took over our table.

I have to say, for the most part, the food we had was really good.  My son loved his filet, which was prepared perfectly and had great flavor.  I had the sea bass, which was really well prepared also.  My daughter's peppercorn New York strip, unfortunately, was so overdone, it was hard to chew.  Yes, she had ordered it medium well, but this steak was beyond well done.  Unfortunately, again, since our waiter never checked on us, we weren't able to give feedback.  At that point, I should have had it sent back with one of the other servers.

So, the manager, Chris, really did make this right, as best he could.  They brought over three desserts on the house, including one specifically celebrating my son's birthday, they removed my daughter's steak from the bill, and comped our bottle of wine.  Completely and way more than we would ever have expected and we were thankful and grateful for that.  Sandy, the server who took over, couldn't have been more apologetic, helpful and pleasant, and we appreciated that.  

It's unfortunate because we came to the restaurant to celebrate a special night.  I'm sure the restaurant is normally great.  Great ambiance, fantastic food, really the perfect setting.  But, our experience was ruined by one bad server.  It's interesting to note, too, that Sonia S's post below occurred from dining the same night we ate at Prime, so not sure if we both had the same server.  In the end, there are so many good restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas that one bad experience like this is enough to make you never come back.
They overcooked my steak, nuff said.  At least we got a view of the fountains.

I came here for my birthday dinner and was seated outside near the fountain, absolutely beautiful. The food was amazing, I had steak with french fries and it came with three different steak sauces. Each sauce was AMAZING. Pretty pricey but you really get what you pay for. The only reason why I give it four starts instead of five is because our server was a bit rude but other than that yummy food, lovely atmosphere.

After reading some reviews I was a bit dissapointed that this place couldn't keep to one standard. Lucky for me I was one of the guests that enjoyed my meal and the service.

We got a table in the back of the restuarant in between the kitchen entrance and the bathroom. Not very happy about that but I guess thats what I get for making a late reservation.

There was three of us and we all kind of shared our meals. Caesar salad to start. BOO this was the worst part of the meal. I felt like the salad wasnt freshly tossed in the dressing, but was sitting there getting soggy and unpleasant. 

We ordered the porterhouse, filet, and off the menu a bone in filet. All cooked to a perfect medium rare. 

The bone in really took our breath's away. At $70 it damn well better! The other two steaks were very good as well. Nice cuts and cooked to perfection.

We ordered the mac n cheese. It was good but I have had better.

Also the broccoli with cheddar. Not that great. something about cheddar cheese to me just makes a meal cheap. 

Overall, it was a great meal and great service. We didnt have any wine with dinner but their list is very impressive. 

Make sure you call a head of time and request a table with a view of the fountains as that as truly a special event to see during dinner.

Awesome steakhouse, the service is exactly what you expect from this type of establishment and they provide great direction when it comes to selecting a bottle from their superb wine list. There's only a few good steakhouses (proper, not a nouveau style) in Vegas, this is one of them. The star rating is obviously taking into account the area - I've had slightly better in other parts of the country, but you will not go wrong with Prime.

Food was above average but the atmosphere was just way too stuffy and borderline snobby and the view of the water show from inside the restaurant is pedestrian at best and way too hot to sit outside. We were told seating was first come first serve but when we showed up we were sat far and away from the tables near the window, not like the place was busy at the moment there were plenty of seats next to the window to watch the water show -that simply ruined the entire experience.
Excellent food and service!  The filet was like butter!  The seafood tater was absolutely huge and divine!

One of the best experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. Not only was my ribeye steak perfect but the service was outstanding. They sat us at the window so we can see the water fountain show. We loved everything about this place. Totally worth checking out for an overall Vegas experience. Awesome steaks, great service and hopefully you get lucky and have a table near a window for the water show. Can't wait to go back!

I don't know how I feel about Prime. Sure, the location can't be beat. However, the restaurant itself is large and is not intimate or romantic. My girlfriend and I sat down at the last seating (10 pm) and there was still plenty of commotion. The decor is very old fashioned and seems outdated and like I am in my grandmothers dining room. 

I prefer modern decor in an intimate setting where you can enjoy conversation and not feel rushed . This is not Prime.

As every other review points out, the food is good and so is the wine list. The highlight from out meal happened to be the salmon sashimi appetizer, it topped sashimi from Nobu.

Fancy is a perfect word for this place. Dim lighting, heavy light teal colored curtains all around... you can smell glamour all around you.

Service is top notch. Now at a steakhouse you would think the seafood menu wouldn't be so great.... but NOPE! The seafood platter/tower which had lobster, crab, jumbo shrimp, clams, oysters - ALL HAD ITS OWN AWESOME FLAVOR!!

Now moving forward on the steak.... damn you AGED STEAK! Why do you have to be soooo good?!?!?!  

Didn't need any of their sauces just plain as is! pairing with the sides as mac n cheese and cauliflower was my way to enjoy it!

Def will be back!

Without a doubt absolutely delicious but be prepared to open your wallet ... We had the bone in aged rib eye prepared medium rare ($ 71), the side dishes of creamed spinach ($ 17) and gnocchi ($ 17) with an asparagus salad and French onion soup for starters. Everything was delicious. The steaks were served with 3 side sauces: peppercorn, bernaise, soy ginger, and they complimented the meat very well. Coconut souffl with chocolate sorbet for dessert. My only complaint would be the offensive prices on the menu but it's Vegas ...

Fioe gras with jalapeo and apple was awesome!  A must. 

Skip the ceasar, to much citrus.  

Rib eye and filet were great!    Ask for rare plus!  

To full for dessert.
My 2nd time dining at this restaurant and I was more impressed this time around.  Ordered ,truffle mashed potatoes, Sea Bass,  bacon wrapped shrimp and short ribs! All were delish

Prime is a wonderful example of perfect service, matched with a lovely setting and great food. 
Our reservation ran over a half hour late but having a drink at the bar with a great bartender appeased the situation. 
If possible, request a lakeside table as it is the best view to watch the Bellagio fountain show. 
The steaks are of the best quality and all of the appetizers are excellent. I suggest ordering a few to share with the table. The oysters were perfect (I understand the irony of seafood in the desert but it's that good). 
Look around and see the other diners enjoying every last morsel and once you eat a meal there, you too will understand. Definitely plan ahead and make a reservation as it is always packed.

Prime is a pricey steakhouse located inside the Bellagio Hotel. The steak and service  is on par with other high end steakhouses I've been to, but what's really special about this place is the ambiance. The setting is very intimate and you have a view of the fountain/Bellagio watershow from the restaurant. Great spot for a special occasion.

As for the food, the dungeness crab salad tastes like a very expensive california roll sans the rice--light, refreshing and tasty, but not sure if it's worth the price. The dry aged bone in rib eye was tender, beefy and flavorful, but i'd definitely suggest you split it with your dining companion(s) because it is way too much meat for one person. The chilean sea bass (which was what I ordered) was a smidgen overcooked and therefore a tad dry, but the portion was also huge at 8oz; usually restaurants give you a small filet of fish, but the portion here was double the size. This place is definitely not for those on a diet as the food is quite rich and heavy.

I attended a wedding followed by a reception here yesterday, and I will remember this wonderful day for years to come. Without exception, the entire staff went above and beyond to make this spectacular event even more so. Incredible bartending staff, great cocktails. The steaks here are beyond compare. From the appetizers, to the salads, main courses, to the delectable wedding cake, Prime hit it out of the park. Just great. I cannot recommend this steakhouse enough!

Oh em gee. I am impressed! This may have been the best meal I've eaten in my life. It's a super romantic restaurant, beautiful lighting, big plush chairs. The service from start to finish was impeccable. I started with the iceberg wedge salad, and the blue cheese was divine as was the bacon. I ordered the dry-aged bone in ribeye. It was absolutely huge, cooked perfectly, and came with three sauces. I'm a sauce girl so I was excited to see bernaise, au poivre, and soy ginger brought to the table with that marvelous piece of meat. The side dish I cannot stop thinking about.... the truffle mashed potatoes. They are a must have, and I salivate even thinking about them. Such heaven. I will definitely be going back.

came here for my birthday dinner with Justin B. and was impressed but not WOW-ed by the place...called in that morning to get reservations on a friday night and while we didnt get a window fountain seat, the water show is pretty much view-able from most of the restaurant. came in fairly dressed up for our dinner only to see other patrons wearing polo shirts, shorts and jeans - they are definitely not strict with their dress code. we were seated right away and the service was spot on.

we started off our meal with the Chilled Shellfish platter taht came with oysters, clams, mussels, king crab, lobster tail, and shrimp cocktail - we only ordered a serving for 1 person so you basically get 2 of each type of seafood which was plenty for us. everything was delicious and came with a great mustard dipping sauce!

next up was our main course - ordered the 8 oz. filet along with truffle mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese. while the filet was perfectly good and tasty, i think the side dishes really stole the show! the truffle mashed potatoes were sooo good! you could really taste the truffle and it was sweet but not overpowering by any means. the mac and cheese had a good burnt crust on the top of it and was delicious! the side dishes portions are perfect for 2 people to share.

overall great experience at Prime. nothing to complain about but i think i've just had better steaks in my life thats all (i.e. at CUT haha)....

Absolutely fabulous!!!  Quick Vegas trip with my 2 adult daughters last weekend to celebrate one of their birthdays, and Prime was as perfect as I had hoped.  We had an 8:00 Sunday evening reservation, arrived a few minutes early, the hostess was lovely, and we enjoyed our 10 minute wait at the bar taking in the beautiful restaurant decor.  We were then seated on the patio as requested with a "Prime" view of the fountain that made our dinner that much more enjoyable.  The wonderful breads brought out at the beginning were as described in reviews. We split a Caesar salad to start (nicely presented to us in 3 separate plates) and all 3 of us ordered filets with the steaks done to perfection.  We also split the yummy truffle mashed potatoes. I wish I could remember our excellent server's name, but he ended our fantastic meal with a birthday plate of pretty chocolates.  He also never rushed us which I greatly appreciated.  It's pricey, yes__with 4 drinks and 20% tip included, a little under $400___but so worth it and I would dine at Prime again in a heartbeat!

I was in Vegas this weekend and had reservations at Prime for myself and 5 friends. We showed up on time and were sat immediately. Our server was knowledgeable and very attentive.

The wine list was 24 pages long! I had a glass of Rhumbauer Chardonnay ($15), an 8 oz. Filet ($40), a side caesar salad ($14), and potatoes gratin daphinois ($8). The filet was hands down the BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER HAD. It was tender, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The caesar salad was a little lemony, but still very tasty. The potatoes were amazing. Basically potatoes au gratin, but with several different cheeses (Gruyere, Reggiano, etc.). However, one of my friends ordered a $150 Kobe ribeye, which was overcooked. He didn't send it back, but I'm positive if he had, it would have come out perfectly.

We had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain show and we weren't even directly by a window! This will go down as one of the best meals of my life.

A mixed bag: very tasty food, but at nosebleed prices without excellent service. You cannot beat the view: you are literally on the lake at Bellagio watching those famous fountain shows. And the food items we had - dry aged prime rib, filet mignon, broccoli, French onion soup and Caesar salad - were very good. But when you're paying a couple hundred bucks for dinner, you expect great service. We had ok service, and even got our food ridiculously fast from the kitchen - almost to the point where we were skeptical of it. It literally came within 10 minutes of our ordering. Seemed odd. Our waiter was distant, unwelcoming and fairly uninterested, and it ruined our experience. So between that and the price, it's just not a great place to spend a lot of money on a meal in Las Vegas.

Filet Mignon: This was so tender and juicy. It literally felt like it was melting in my mouth. 

28 oz Bone in Rib eye: This was so HUGE. It could fill up two people. So if you wanted to save a bit of money, ordering the 28 oz and sharing it with another person would be a good idea. This was a little bit tougher than the filet mignon but it's still soft and very flavorful.

Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes: This was the best mashed potato of my life! I just wanted to go back just for this. 

Mac and cheese: Very cheesy but it also had a soft taste and the cheese they used didn't overwhelm us. It was really delicious.


Steaks didn't come with sides. The sides were 12-18$ a piece.

Well I have seen a lot and done a lot and have eaten steak across the planet but really this one has it all. Perhaps it's the simplicity and the attention to detail or the professionalism of the service....ddi I mention the view from the patio? Lots of things to detail but at the end of the day if you're looking for a carnivore experience with a touch of class and romance then consider prime as the perfect stop in Vegas. I couldn't have asked for better and will be back! Choose the patio if you want he full experience.
